column3: 수집품 획득
column4: Mendapat Collection

column2: So you are the Revelator who dreamt of the dream of the goddesses.{nl}I am Uska, the Knight Commander in charge of both Siaulai and Klaipeda.
column3: 여신의 꿈을 꾼 계시자이십니까.{nl}저는 샤울레이와 클라페다를 담당하고 있는 기사단장, 우스카입니다.{nl}
column4: Apakah kau adalah tuan Savior yang memimpikan mimpi Goddess.{nl} Aku adalah Kapten Knight yang bertanggung jawab akan Syaullei dan Klaipeda, namaku Uska.{nl}

column2: The kingdom lost all hope.{nl}Without the will to stand up again.. calling at the name of the goddesses.{nl}
column3: 지금의 왕국은 모든 희망을 잃었습니다. {nl}다시 일어설 의지조차 꺾인 채로.. 여신의 이름만 부르짖고 있습니다.{nl}
column4: Kerajaan sekarang, telah kehilangan seluruh harapan. {nl} Sampai keinginan untuk bangkit kembali pun terputus.. Hanya meneriakkan nama Goddess saja.{nl}

column2: To tell you the truth, I can't just see you Revelators positively.{nl}Since I am in charge of one city..{nl}
column3: 솔직히 저는 계시자 여러분들을 희망적으로만 바라볼 수는 없습니다.{nl}한 도시를 짊어지고 있는 책임자이기에.. {nl}
column4: Sebenarnya aku tidak dapat menatap saudara sekalian yang merupakan Savior dengan optimis.{nl} Sebagai seorang yang bertanggung jawab akan satu kota ini.. {nl}

column2: We should not experience the depression again.
column3: 다시 절망을 겪을 순 없는 것 아니겠습니까.
column4: Bukankah kita tidak dapat menghadapi keputusasaan lagi.

column2: Anyways, the bishop also dreamt of the revelation.{nl}He told me that when the Revelator comes, he should go to Crystal Mine.{nl}
column3: 자.. 어쨌든, 주교님께서도 계시의 꿈을 꾸셨습니다.{nl}계시자가 오거든 수정광산으로 보내라고 하셨다는군요.{nl}
column4: Nah.. Bagaimanapun, Bishop pun juga telah memimpikan Revelation.{nl} Ia berkata jika Savior datang, maka harus dikirimkan ke Crystal Mine.{nl}

column2: But, since the mine village is fighting against Vubbes, we are restricting the entrance.{nl}The knight, Aras at the east forest is in charge so meet him.
column3: 하지만 현재 광산 마을은 부베와 교전중인지라 출입을 제한하고 있습니다.{nl}동쪽 숲에 있는 기사 아라스가 담당이니 그를 만나보십시오.
column4: Tetapi saat ini terjadi pertempuran dengan Vubbe di Crystal Mine, sehingga akses kesana dibatasi.{nl} Cobalah temui Aras, Knight yang berada di bagian timur hutan.

column2: The reason why the number of monsters increased in this forest was due to Vubbe fighters.{nl}Please find out how many Vubbes are here.{nl}
column3: 이 숲의 몬스터가 불어난 게 부베 투사의 짓이였군요.{nl}부베 투사가 얼마나 있는지 알아봐 주세요.{nl}
column4: Yang menyebabkan monster di hutan ini bertambah, adalah ulah dari Vubbe Fighter.{nl} Tolong carilah tahu seberapa banyak jumlah Vubbe Fighter.{nl}

column2: So you are the famous Revelator, right?{nl}Hmm... I have something to suggest to you. Why don't you work with me?{nl}
column3: 어라, 너는 그 유명한 계시자 맞지?{nl}흠.. 제안할 게 있는데 말야. 너. 나와 같이 일해보지 않을래?{nl}
column4: Oke, Kau adalah Savior yang terkenal itu kan?{nl}Hmm.. Aku memiliki sesuatu rekomendasi. Kau. Maukah coba bekerja sama dengan denganku?{nl}

column2: You know that Fortress of the Land was the last place where the Ruklys' army resisted, right?{nl}But, not only that. What I am going to tell you from now on is a secret... I have a question before that.{nl}
column3: 대지의 요새가 루클리스 군의 마지막 저항지였다는 건 알고 있지?{nl}하지만 그 뿐만이 아냐. 여기서부턴 비밀인데.. 그 전에 질문이 있어.{nl}
column4: kamu tahu bahwa daerah pertahanan terakhir dari pasukan Ruklys adalah Earth Castile kan?{nl} Tetapi bukan hanya itu saja. Nah bagian ini adalah rahasia.. Sebelumnya aku punya pertanyaan.{nl}

column2: Whose side are you on?{nl}The Royal Army or the Knights of Kaliss?{nl}If you don't want to answer, then just do what you are told.
column3: 자. 넌 누구 편이지?{nl}왕국군? 아니면 칼리스 기사단?{nl}대답하기 싫으면 그냥 볼 일 보시던가.
column4: Hmm. Kau ada di pihak mana?{nl}Kingdom army? Jika bukan apakah Knight of Kalis?{nl} Kalau malas menjawab, abaikanlah saja.

column2: Be careful not to get detected by kingdom soldiers.{nl}Even if you get caught, just laugh and pretend there's nothing.
column3: 왕국군 눈에 띄지 않게 조심해줘.{nl}들키더라도 적당히 웃으면서 넘어가라고.
column4: Berhati-hatilah agar tidak ketahuan Kingdom Army.{nl} Kalau ketahuan, tersenyumlah dan lewatilah saja.

column2: You've seen Gargoyle Sculpture at the gathering place right?{nl}That's the Gargoyle.{nl}
column3: 집결지에서 가고일 석상을 봤지?{nl}그게 그 가고일이야.{nl}
column4: Kau telah melihat Patung Gargoyle di Assembly Area kan?{nl} Itu adalah Gargoyle yang di maksud.{nl}

column2: Strangely, whenever I tried to enter the fortress, it suddenly moves and blocks the way.{nl}Without making a mess, it will be impossible to supress them with our force.
column3: 이상하게 내가 요새로 들어가려고 하면 갑자기 살아 움직이면서 막아서더라고.{nl}소란 피우지 않고서 우리 힘으로 제압하는 건 무리야.
column4: Sungguh aneh, ketika aku ingin kembali ke kastil terdapat sesuatu yang mendadak bergerak seperti hidup dan menghalangi.{nl} Mustahil untuk menghadapinya dengan kekuatan kami tanpa membuat keributan.

column2: Poata at the east forest of Siaulai are threatening the villagers.{nl}If you could eliminate them in the name of the goddesses, I will teach you my magic.
column3: 샤울레이 동쪽 숲에 있는 포아타가 주민들을 위협하고 있대.{nl}여신의 이름으로 그 몬스터를 없애 준다면 내 마법을 전수해 주겠어.
column4: Poata yang ada di hutan sebelah timur Syaullei, katanya sedang mengancan para penduduk.{nl} jika kamu menghabisi monster itu dengan nama Goddess, aku akan mengajarimu sihirku.

column2: When I saw you for the first time, you looked too awkward.. but.{nl}Now, you became more famous than me.{nl}
column3: 널 처음 보았을 땐 너무 어설프지 않나.. 싶었는데.{nl}지금은 나보다도 더 유명해진 것 같아.{nl}
column4: Sepertinya ketika aku melihatmu pertama kali... kemampuanmu kurang baik.{nl} Sekarang sepertinya kau lebih terkenal dibandingkan aku.{nl}

column2: Well done.{nl}When you gain some experiences and learn swordsmanship from me, you will become a good knight.
column3: 수고했다.{nl}앞으로도 실전 경험을 쌓고 내 밑에서 검을 배운다면 좋은 검사가 될 수 있을 것이다.
column4: Terima kasih.{nl} Ke depannya kumpulkanlah lebih banyak pengalaman praktik dan jika mempelajari ilmu pedang dariku, agar dapat menjadi Swordman yang baik.

column2: You've come here to learn the teaching of Rogue from me?{nl}It's good.{nl}There is a task that I can verify your skills as a Rogue and resolve my problem.{nl}
column3: 나에게 로그의 가르침을 받으러 온거야?{nl}마침 잘 됐어.{nl}너의 로그로서의 실력을 검증하면서 내 문제도 해결할 수 있는 일석이조의 일이 있거든.{nl}
column4: Kau datang untuk menerima pelajaran Rogue dariku?{nl}Kau melakukan hal tepat.{nl}  Sebagai rogue kau harus dapat memperlihatkan kemampuan dan menyelesaikan masalah dalam sekaligus.{nl}

column2: Scout Master and I used to be very good friends, but our relationship is somewhat awkward now.{nl}I want to restore the relationship by giving him a gift, but if I go, I am going to get spotted.{nl}Can you go there secretly and leave him a gift?
column3: 스카우트 마스터와 나는 한때는 둘도 없는 친구였지만 지금은 조금 어색해져서 말이야.{nl}뭔가 선물이라도 주면서 관계를 회복해보고 싶은데.. 내가 직접가는 건 역시 너무 눈에 띄거든.{nl}니가 대신해서 몰래 선물 좀 전해주고 오지 않겠어?
column4: Scout Master dan aku dahulu adalah teman yang dekat tiada bandingannya, tetapi sekarang hubungan kami sedikit aneh.{nl} Aku ingin mengembalikan hubungan dengan memberikan hadiah sesuatu.. tetapi jika aku pergi secara langsung, sungguh terlalu vulgar rasanya.{nl} Maukah kamu pergi menggantikanku diam-diam untuk memberikan hadiah?

column2: Good. But this also includes your test.{nl}Give him a gift, but you have to put it secretly so Scout Master doesn't notice you.{nl}To give you an advice, you do it from his back.
column3: 좋아. 하지만 이건 너의 시험도 겸하는 거니까.{nl}선물을 전해주되 스카우트 마스터가 눈치채지 못하게 몰래 넣어두고 와야해.{nl}조언을 해주자면 이런 일은 상대의 뒤를 잡는게 기본이야.
column4: Bagus. Tetapi ini dianggap sebagai ujianmu juga.{nl} Kau harus menaruh hadiah ini dengan diam-diam tanpa ketahuan oleh Scout Master.{nl} Yang ingin kuajarkan kepadamu dari hal ini adalah dasar dari menangkap lawan dari belakang.

column2: So you've come.{nl}He will be surprised when he checks it later.{nl}
column3: 잘 전해주고 왔나보네.{nl}나중에 확인하면 깜짝 놀라겠지?{nl}
column4: Kau telah berhasil mengantarkannya dengan baik ya.{nl} Setelah ia memeriksanya nanti, pasti akan sangat kaget bukan?{nl}

column2: It is now time to complete my work with you.{nl}I can see that you are more than average since you were able to put it secretly without Scout Master noticing it. You will learn fast.
column3: 이제 너와의 일을 마무리지을 차례군.{nl}스카우트 마스터 몰래 물건을 넣어두고 올 정도면 너도 보통은 아니니까 금방 배울 수 있을거야.
column4: Sekarang adalah waktunya menyelesaikan urusan denganmu.{nl} jika kamu bisa menaruh benda tanpa sepengetahuan Scout Master dan kembali kemari, maka kau bukanlah orang biasa, dalam sekejap dapat mempelajarinya.

column2: So you've come here to learn the skills of Fletcher.{nl}Remember, it would also cost you a lot.{nl}
column3: 플레쳐의 기술을 배우러 왔군.{nl}자네 수준에서 가르침을 받을만한 일이라면 그 대가도 쉽지 않다는 걸 각오해두게.{nl}
column4: kau datang untuk belajar teknik Fletcher rupanya.{nl} Jika levelmu layak untuk mendapatkan pengajaran, maka bersiaplah karena persiapannya pun tidaklah mudah.{nl}

column2: I've been looking for the arrows that were created by the first Fletcher Master from long time ago.{nl}Those arrows were to be given to Lydia Schaffen so I am sure the expertise that was put into those arrows are not normal.{nl}I've found the whereabouts of those arrows recently so someone who would be able to recognize the true value of those arrows should go there.
column3: 나는 예전부터 초대 플레쳐 마스터가 만든 화살을 찾아왔소.{nl}리디아 샤펜에게 선물해줄 정도의 화살이니 거기에 담긴 기술은 보통이 아니겠지.{nl}최근에 남아있는 화살의 소재에 대한 정보를 얻게 되었는데 이 일을 시키려면 그 화살의 가치를 알아볼 수 있는 사람이어야겠지.
column4: Aku sejak dahulu telah mencari panah yang dibuat oleh First Fletcher master.{nl} Karena merupakan panah yang dihadiahkan kepada Lidia Sharpen, maka teknik yang tersimpan disana bukanlah yang biasa bukan.{nl} Aku telah mendapatkan informasi mengenai material dari panah yang tersisa belakangan ini, tetapi untuk menjalankan hal ini, harus ada orang yang dapat mengetahui nilai dari panah itu bukan.

column2: According to the information I've obtained, it looks like I would be able to find it from 36_1 of the valley region.{nl}It was used to hunt for some violent monster so you better be careful.
column3: 내가 얻은 정보에 의하면 협곡지대 36_1에서 찾을 수 있을 것 같소.{nl}무언가 흉폭한 몬스터를 상대하는데 사용했었다고 하니 주의하는게 좋겠지.
column4: Melalui informasi yang kudapat, sepertinya bisa dicari pada Canyon Area 36_1.{nl} Katanya telah dipakai untuk menghadapi suatu monster ganas, alangkah baiknya jika berhati-hati.

column2: I can tell it's great by just looking at its appearances.{nl}I want to research on this arrow immediately, but my promise with you come first.{nl}I will show you my skill so pay attention.
column3: 오 겉으로만 봐도 굉장함을 알 수 있겠군.{nl}당장이라도 이 화살을 연구해보고 싶지만 자네와의 약속이 먼저겠지.{nl}자, 내가 가진 기술을 보여줄테니 눈 크게 뜨고 잘 보도록 하게.
column4: Oh melihat bentuknya saja, terasa sungguh luar biasa.{nl} Aku ingin segera meneliti panah ini, tetapi harus kutepati janjiku dulu padamu bukan.{nl}nah, sekarang perhatikanlah baik-baik, karena aku akan memperlihatkan teknik yang kumiliki.

column2: As a Falconer Master, I am looking for the ways to make Falconers stronger with diverse methods.{nl}One of the ideas that came to me was to use the aerial monsters instead of eagles.{nl}
column3: 응사 마스터로서 다양한 시도를 통해 응사들이 더욱 강해지는 방법을 찾고 있다.{nl}그 중 하나로 매를 대신해서 날아다니는 몬스터들을 써먹을 순 없을까 하는 생각을 했지.{nl}
column4: Sebagai Falconer Master aku sedang mencari cara untuk memperkuat para Falconer melalui berbagai percobaan.{nl} Diantaranya adalah, aku pernah berpikir apakah monster yang terbang tidak dapat dipakai menggantikan elang.{nl}

column2: Of course, I am satisfied with my partner, Rith, but I think these tries would help Falconer.
column3: 물론 내 파트너 리쓰에게 만족하고 있지만 이런 시도는 응사들에게 도움이 될 수 있다고 생각한다.
column4: Tentu saja aku puas akan kinerja Wreath sebagai partnerku, tetapi aku berpikir dengan percobaan ini dapat membantu para Falconer.

column2: Like when you are taming an eagle, how about feed it?{nl}I don't have high expectations so you better go there and try it first.{nl}I've put enough food so at least try on three different kinds of monsters.
column3: 매를 길들일 때 처럼 먹이라도 줘보면 되지 않을까?{nl}큰 기대는 하고 있지 않으니 일단 가서 시도라도 해보는게 좋겠군.{nl}먹이는 넉넉히 넣어두었으니 적어도 세 종류의 몬스터에게는 시도해보도록.
column4: Kukira hal itu bisa dilakukan dengan memberi makanan seperti saat melatih elang?{nl} Karena aku tidak terlalu banyak berharap, alangkah baiknya jika coba pergi dan melakukannya.{nl} Karena aku sudah mempersiapkan makanan dengan cukup, cobalah lakukan pada tiga jenis monster paling tidak.

column2: Did we fail. It's so bad, but I've expected it.{nl}Regardless of the outcomes, I will pay for your efforts.{nl}Good. I will teach you myself.
column3: 역시 실패했나. 아쉽지만 예상했던 바다.{nl}결과야 어찌되었든 그대의 노력에는 보답해야겠지.{nl}좋다, 내가 직접 지도해주도록 하지.
column4: Gagal rupanya. Sayang sekali, tetapi hal itu telah kuperkirakan.{nl} Apapun hasilnya aku harus menghargai upayamu kan.{nl} Bagus,  aku akan memperlihatkannya secara langsung.

column2: You want to learn more advanced skills?{nl}If you want to learn advanced skills of Schwaze Reiter, your should possess competent skills.{nl}The most important thing is to shoot enemies accurately.
column3: 더 고급기술을 배우고 싶다고?{nl}슈바르츠라이터의 고급 기술을 배우려면 그럴만한 실력이 뒷바침 되어야겠지.{nl}첫째도 둘째도 중요한건 확실하게 적을 쏘아 맞추는 일이다.
column4: Kau ingin mempelajari teknik yang lebih advance katamu?{nl} Jika ingin mempelajari teknik advance Schwarzer Reiter, maka kau harus memiliki kemampuan yang layak kan.{nl} Menembak dan mengenai musuh dengan tepat pertama dan kedua adalah hal yang penting.

column2: I like your confidence.{nl}But, I should check whether youa re really competent enough.{nl}I will acknowledge you if you succeed landing hits on enemies 200 times consecutively without any mistake.
column3: 자신감은 마음에 드는군.{nl}하지만 입만 산건 아닌 지 확인해보겠다.{nl}일반 몬스터에게 가서 실수없이 연속으로 200번 명중시키고 온다면 인정하도록 하지.
column4: Aku suka rasa percaya dirimu.{nl} Tetapi aku harus memeriksa apakah itu bukan cuman perkataan saja.{nl} lakukanlah serangan berurutan sebanyak 200 kali tanpa ada kesalahan pada monster biasa, jika berhasil maka akan kuakui kau.

column2: So you were not a bluff.{nl}I would be pleasant to teach you if your skills are like those.
column3: 과연 허세는 아니었군.{nl}그 정도 실력이라면 나도 가르치는 보람이 있지.
column4: Bukan gertakan rupanya.{nl} Dengan kemampuan seperti itu, aku merasa mampu mengajarimu.

column2: You've come here to learn the skills of Monk?{nl}That's good. I can trust you.{nl}There's something I need to request to you.{nl}
column3: 몽크의 기술을 배우러 왔소?{nl}그럼 마침 잘 됐군. 당신이라면 믿고 맡길 수 있지.{nl}부탁하고 싶은 일이 있소.{nl}
column4: Kau datang untuk mempelajari teknik Monk?{nl} Kau datang dengan tepat. Sepertinya kau dapat dipercaya untuk melakukannya.{nl} Ada pekerjaan yang ingin kumintai tolong.{nl}

column2: I still regret for what I did in the past.{nl}I am helping some peolpe as a result, but if it becomes known to other people, I will be in a trouble.{nl}You have to send them a gift, if you do it well, I will teach you some skills.
column3: 난 과거에 한 실수를 지금도 후회하고 있소.{nl}그에 대한 속죄겸 어떤 이들을 돕고 있는데 이게 알려지면 곤란한 일이라서 말이오.{nl}그들에게 물건을 하나 전하면 되는데, 잘 해낸다면 실력으로 인정하고 기술을 전수하리다.
column4: Sekarang pun aku sedang menyesali kesalahan yang kulakukan di masa lalu.{nl} mengenai hal itu, aku sedang menolong mereka ini agar perasaan bersalah itu terbayarkan, tetapi jika ini sampai ketahuan jadi sulit rasanya.{nl} Sebenarnya cukup dengan memberikan suatu benda kepada mereka, tetapi jika melakukannya dengan baik, akan kuakui kemampuanmu dan kuajarkan teknik itu.

column2: There are lots of people who blame me.{nl}But, I am not doing this task for those people.{nl}I am just taking my responsibility for my mistake.
column3: 그 일로 나를 원망하는 사람들도 많지.{nl}하지만 그런 사람들을 신경써서 하는 일은 아니오.{nl}다만 나 스스로의 실수에 대한 책임을 지는 것이지.
column4: Karena hal itu, banyak orang yang menyalahkanku ya.{nl} Tetapi bukan waktunya untuk mempedulikan orang-orang seperti itu.{nl} Hanya saja aku bertanggung jawab atas kesalahan yang kulakukan ya.

column2: Have you passed it well?{nl}Then, you just have to learn from me.
column3: 잘 전해주었소?{nl}그럼 이제 나아게 한 수 배우는 일만 남았군.
column4: Apakah kau telah memberikannya?{nl} Kalau begitu saat ini hanya tersisa pekerjaan untuk belajar dariku saja ya.

column2: You've come here to get acknowledged by me?{nl}But, I have some matter to take care of now so it's little hard at the moment.{nl}The book of transactions has been ripped off due to the monsters.{nl}{nl}Because of this, I can't concentrate on other works.{nl}If you are in a hurry, then I will tell you the location so please get me the preliminary book.{nl}This is a secret, but I am telling you because of our relationship and I trust you.
column3: 나에게 새로이 인정받기 위해 왔는가?{nl}하지만 지금은 내가 조금 곤란한 일이 있어서 힘들겠군.{nl}몬스터들 때문에 거래 장부가 찢어져버려서 말이네.{nl}{nl}이거 때문에 지금 다른 업무를 보는 일도 정신이 없네.{nl}정 급하다면 내가 장소를 알려줄테니 대신 예비 장부를 가져와주게.{nl}이런건 비밀이긴 하지만 자네와 그동안의 인연도 있고 믿을만한 사람이라고 생각하고 있으니 말이네.
column4: Apakah kau datang untuk mendapatkan pengakuan baru dariku?{nl} Tetapi saat ini ada suatu hal yang membuatku kesulitan sedikit.{nl} buku keuanganku tersobek-sobek oleh karena para monster.{nl}{nl} Karena hal ini aku tidak dapat berfokus melakukan pekerjaan lainnya.{nl} Jika kamu sungguh terburu-buru, tolonglah ambil kembali buku keuanganku karena aku akan beritahukan lokasinya.{nl} Hal ini adalah rahasia, tetapi selama ini kau telah banyak membantu dan terpercaya makanya aku meminta tolong.

column2: The preliminary book is at 35_3 at the monastery.{nl}In order to prevent other people from finding it, I've hid it inside a book and there are some fake books as well so find it well.
column3: 예비 장부는 수도원 35_3에 있네.{nl}다른 자들이 찾아내지 못하도록 책속에 숨겨두기도 했고 가짜 장부도 여럿 놓아두었으니 잘 찾아오게.
column4: Copy Ledger ada di Monastery 35_3.{nl} Aku telah menyembunyikan di dalam buku agar tidak dapat ditemukan oleh orang lainnya, dan juga aku telah menaruh beberapa yang palsu, coba carilah dengan baik.

column2: You've found it well.{nl}Now, since we've taken care of urgent matter, I will acknowledge you with this.
column3: 제대로 찾아왔군.{nl}급한 일은 처리했으니 자네는 이걸로 인정해주겠네.
column4: Kau telah menemukannya dengan baik.{nl} Karena kau telah menyelesaikan hal yang mendesak, aku akan mengakuimu dengan ini.

column2: In order to control the abilities of Druid well, you should know well about the plants you control.{nl}I am actually researching on the occurence which the over grown plants turned into monsters so you may learn something from it.{nl}If you help me with this, I will acknowledge it as your training.
column3: 드루이드의 능력을 잘 다루기 위해서는 자신이 다루는 식물에 대해서 잘 아는 것도 중요합니다.{nl}마침 제가 신수의 날 이후로 과성장한 식물들이 몬스터가 되어 날뛰는 문제를 조사하는 중이니 당신도 배울 점이 있겠지요.{nl}이 일을 돕는다면 그 부분을 수행으로 인정해드리겠습니다.
column4: Sangatlah penting untuk mengetahui mengenai tanaman yang dikontrol diri sendiri untuk dapat mengontrol kemampuan druid.{nl} Setelah hari Medzio Diena, para tanaman tumbuh pesat dan menjadi monster, dan aku sedang menyelidiki akan masalah tersebut, sehingga kamu juga dapat mempelajari poin itu.{nl} jika kamu membantu akan hal ini, akan kuakui bagian itu sebagai kinerjamu.

column2: Defeat the plants that turned into monsters and obtain some samples from them.{nl}You will be able to obtain more samples as the monsters get stronger.
column3: 몬스터가 된 식물들을 처치하고 표본을 구해와 주세요.{nl}강한 몬스터일수록 더 많은 표본을 얻을 수 있습니다.
column4: Hancurkan tanaman-tanaman yang menjadi monster, dan bawalah spesimen dari mereka.{nl} Kau bisa mendapatkan banyak spesimen dari monster yang lebih kuat.

column2: It seems that you are competent enough.{nl}As I promised to you, I will help you.
column3: 실력도 충분하신 것 같군요.{nl}수행으로 인정해드리기로 했으니 약속대로 당신을 돕도록 하죠.
column4: Sepertinya kemampuanmu cukup.{nl} Karena kemampuan kamu sudah diakui akan kubantu anda.

column2: It seems that you have some business with me, but there is more important thing to do at the moment.{nl}The demonic power which was created from a far place is becoming stronger and begins to influence the power of Oracle.{nl}As a result, what we see through Clairvoyance is getting vague.{nl}
column3: 저에게 용무가 있으신 거 같은데 지금은 더 중요한 일이 있습니다.{nl}먼 곳에서 발생한 마기가 점점 짙어지더니 오라클의 힘에 영향을 주기 시작했습니다.{nl}결국에는 클레어보이언스로 보는 영상이 흐려지고 있습니다.{nl}
column4: Sepertinya kau ada urusan denganku, tetapi sekarang ada hal yang lebih penting lagi.{nl} dari tempat yang jauh perlahan energy jahat yang muncul mulai menguat, dan telah mulai memberikan efek pada kekuatan Oracle.{nl} Akhirnya gambaran yang dilihat sebagai Clairvoyance menjadi kabur.{nl}

column2: We have to get rid of that demonic energy first.{nl}Why don't you try it first?{nl}Maybe, resolving this issue would verify your competence and can also be a test for you.
column3: 그 마기를 처리하는 게 지금 가장 우선시되어야 할 일입니다.{nl}당신이 한번 나서보지 않겠습니까?{nl}어쩌면 이 일을 해결하는 게 당신의 능력을 증명하면서 동시에 시험이 될 수도 있다는 생각이 듭니다.
column4: Melakukan pembersihan energi jahat itu adalah menjadi hal yang paling utama saat ini.{nl} Maukah kamu coba melakukannya?{nl} Kurasa menyelesaikan masalah ini dapat menjadi ujian dan juga kesempatan bagimu untuk menunjukkan kemampuan.

column2: The problem is occuring at Canyon Region 36_1.{nl}You just have to put the Romuva of Purification where the demonic energy is strong.
column3: 문제가 되고 있는 곳은 협곡지대 36_1입니다.{nl}제가 드린 정화의 로무바를 마기가 강한 곳에 세우면 됩니다.
column4: Tempat yang memiliki masalah adalah di Canyon Area 36_1.{nl} Semuanya akan beres jika kamu mendirikan Purification Romuva yang kuberikan di tempat yang memiliki energy demon kuat.

column2: It seems that you've done well.{nl}It was a good decision for me to give the task to you.{nl}Okay then, I will help you from now on.
column3: 잘 해내신 모양입니다.{nl}당신에게 맡기길 잘 했다는 생각이 듭니다.{nl}그럼 이제 제가 당신을 돕도록 하겠습니다.
column4: Sepertinya kau berhasil dengan baik.{nl} Aku merasa telah membuat keputusan tepat dengan mempercayakannya padamu.{nl} Kalau begitu sekarang giliran saya membantumu.

column2: Good. Take this object and go to Mochia Forest.{nl}When you find someone, talk naturally and you have to tell him the passwords.
column3: 좋소, 이 물건을 가지고 모치아 숲으로 가시오.{nl}그곳에서 접견인으로 보이는 사람을 발견하거든 일단 자연스럽게 대화를 하다가 그의 질문에 맞게 암구호를 말해야 하오.
column4: Bagus, bawalah benda ini, dan pergilah ke Mochia Forest.{nl} Temukanlah orang yang terlihat seperti pewawancara disana, dan setelah coba berbicara secara alami, kau harus menjawab dengan tepat sesuai pertanyaannya.

column2: Demon Svitrigaila
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라
column4: Demon Shetrigailla

column2: Finally... You have come.{nl}Someone else besides miss Giltine...{nl}
column3: 드디어.. 올 것이 왔군.{nl}날 길티네님의 곁으로 보내줄 이가..{nl}
column4: Akhirnya.. Datang juga.{nl} Kirimkanlah aku keluar dari Giltine..{nl}

column2: I have a request to you.{nl}Lead me to a death.
column3: 네게 부탁이 있다.{nl}날 죽음으로 이끌어 다오.
column4: Aku ada permintaan kepadamu.{nl} Bantulah aku untuk mencapai kematian.

column2: Writings on the Pillar
column3: 기둥에 적힌 글귀
column4: Tulisan yang tertulis di Pillar

column2: [The Life of Cleros]
column3: [클레로스 전기]
column4: [Chelorose's Electric]

column2: {nl}Cleros is the elder son of some landlord.{nl}He lost the right of succession to the child of stepmother and was expelled out of the land.{nl}
column3: {nl}클레로스는 어느 영주 가문의 장자로 태어났다.{nl}그러나 계모의 자식에게 계승권을 빼앗기고 영지 밖으로 쫓겨나게 되었다.{nl}
column4: {nl}Chelorose lahir sebagai anak lelaki sulung dari keluarga bangsawan.{nl}Tetapi hak ahli warisnya dirampas oleh ibu angkat dan ia menjadi terusir keluar tanahnya.{nl}

column2: His life which is full of failures started like that.{nl}He began to look for another job as a result of his friend's advice.
column3: 실패만으로 가득찬 그의 삶은 이렇게 시작되었다.{nl}방황하던 그는 지인의 권유로 일자리를 찾아 떠났다.{nl}
column4: Kehidupannya yang dipenuhi dengan kegagalan saja dimulai seperti ini.{nl} Ia yang berkelana, pergi mencari pekerjaan atas tawaran kenalan.{nl}

column2: But, that was the plan to sell Cleros.{nl}He became a slave that has to work till the death while being locked inside.{nl}
column3: 하지만 그건 클레로스를 팔아치우려는 계획이었다.{nl}그는 감금당한 채로 죽도록 일만 해야하는 노예로 전락하게 되었다.{nl}
column4: Tetapi itu adalah rencana untuk menukarkan Chelorose.{nl} Ia terjebak sebagai budak yang harus bekerja sampai mati dengan terpenjarakan.{nl}

column2: While he was locked inside, he received the salvation of Ruklys.{nl}His life as a slave was now over, but the peaceful days weren't going to last long.{nl}
column3: 그러던 도중 루클리스의 구원을 받아 노예의 삶에서 벗어날 수 있었다.{nl}하지만 평화로운 나날도 잠시 뿐이었다.{nl}
column4: Tetapi suatu hari ia mendapatkan penyelamatan dari Ruklys dan bisa terbebas dari kehidupan perbudakan.{nl} Tetapi hari-hari yang tenang tidak bertahan lama.{nl}

column2: When Ruklys was defeated, his rest turned into a disaster.
column3: 루클리스가 토벌되면서 그의 안식은 재난으로 변했던 것이다.
column4: Hidupnya berubah menjadi bencana  karena mengalami tekanan dari Ruklys.

column2: {nl}A long escape continued.{nl}He didn't succeed in anything in his life.{nl}
column3: {nl}기나긴 도주 생활은 계속되었다.{nl}일생에 성공한 일이라곤 하나도 없었다.{nl}
column4: {nl} Kehidupannya sebagai pelarian terlus berlanjut.{nl} Seumur hidup tidak pernah ada satu hal yang pernah berhasil baik.{nl}

column2: And he was caught and locked inside Kalejimas.{nl}It would've been good if there was any hope in that prison..{nl}
column3: 그 마저 결국엔 붙잡혀 칼레이마스에 수감되었다.{nl}그 악명높은 감옥에서 무언가 희망이 있었다면 좋았으리라..{nl}
column4: Sampai akhirnya tertangkap dan dipenjarakan di Kalejimas.{nl} Di penjara yang terkenal sadis itu alangkah baik jika ada secercah harapan saja..{nl}

column2: But, he experienced agony there and died.
column3: 하지만 그는 그곳에서 고초를 겪다 끝내 생을 마감하고 말았다.
column4: Tetapi ia mengalami masa sulit disana, dan menghabiskan hidupnya.

column2: [After the death of Cleros]
column3: [클레로스의 죽음, 그 이후]
column4: [Kematian Chelorose, setelah itu]

column2: {nl}If the story ends here, this will be the story of some person who failed his life.{nl}
column3: {nl}여기서 이야기가 끝난다면 그저그런 인생 실패자의 이야기일 뿐이다.{nl}
column4: {nl} Jika ceritanya berakhir disini, hanya akan menjadi cerita orang yang gagal di kehidupan seperit itu saja.{nl}

column2: But, according to some info, he is still being tortured by the demon.{nl}His spirit.{nl}
column3: 하지만 일설에 의하면 그는 지금도 마족에게 고문당하는 신세라고 한다.{nl}영혼인 채로 말이다.{nl}
column4: Tetapi melalui  ada yang berpendapat ia dalam kondisi mengalami siksaan dari demon hingga saat ini..{nl} jiwanya pun tersiksa.{nl}

column2: As a result, there are people who say there's some hidden story behind his life.{nl}But, no one knows what the story is.{nl}
column3: 때문에 그의 인생에 숨겨진 사연이 있을 것이라 말하는 사람들도 있다.{nl}그러나 어떤 사연인지 정확히 아는 사람은 아무도 없다.{nl}
column4: karena itu, ada orang yang berkata bahwa itu menjadi alasan tersembunyi dari kehidupannya.{nl} Tetapi tidak ada orang yang tahu dengan pasti apa alasannya.{nl}

column2: Writings on the Pillar
column3: 기둥에 새겨진 글귀
column4: Tulisan yang tertulis di Pillar

column2: [Rumpelstiltskin and the Moon]
column3: [럼펠스틸스킨과 달]
column4: [Rumple Steel Skin dan Bulan]

column2: {nl}{nl}Look for the small dot which goes after the night sky.{nl}That's Rumpelstiltskin flying towards the moon.{nl}
column3: {nl}{nl}밤 하늘의 달을 쫓는 조그만 점을 찾아 보세요.{nl}그건 달을 향해 날아가는 럼펠스틸스킨이랍니다.{nl}
column4: {nl}{nl} Cobalah mencari titik kecil yang mengejar bulan di langit malam.{nl} itu tidak lain adalah Rumple Steel Skin yang terbang menuju ke bulan.{nl}

column2: As we know, Rumpelstiltskin made a bet with Lydia Schaffen and flew to the moon.{nl}It took him ages and ages.{nl}
column3: 우리가 잘 아는 대로 럼펠스틸스킨은 리디아 샤펜과의 내기로 달을 향해 날아갔습니다.{nl}아주 오랜 세월을 말이지요.{nl}
column4: Yang kami ketahui adalah Rumple Steel Skin terbang ke bulan karena bertaruh dengan Lidia Sharpen.{nl} Walaupun ini adalah cerita lama sekali.{nl}

column2: About halfway there, Rumpelstiltskin was suddenly surprised beyond belief.{nl}The arrow he had been riding was almost completely destroyed.
column3: 달을 향해 중간 쯤 날아왔을 때, 럼펠스틸스킨은 소스라치게 놀랐습니다.{nl}자신이 타고 날아온 리디아 샤펜의 화살이 부숴지기 직전이었던 것이지요.
column4: Ketika terbang sudah setengah menuju ke bulan, Rumple Steel Skin sungguh kaget ketakutan.{nl} Itu terjadi segera sebelum panah milik Lidia Sharpen yang ia naiki hancur.

column2: [Rumpelstiltskin and Lydia Schaffen's Arrow]
column3: [럼펠스틸스킨과 리디아 샤펜의 화살]
column4: [Rumple Steel Skin dan Lidia Sharpen's Arrow]

column2: {nl}Rumpelstiltskin realized he had been tricked.{nl}Of course, the arrow could have disintegrated from flying for so long.{nl}
column3: {nl}럼펠스틸스킨은 자신이 속았다는 것을 알아챘습니다.{nl}물론 긴 시간이 흘렀으니 화살이 부숴질 만도 하겠지요.{nl}
column4: {nl} Rumple Steel Skin telah mengetahui bahwa dirinya ditipu.{nl} Tapi tentu saja karena waktu telah berlalu lama, maka anak panah pun hancur.{nl}

column2: However, it was Rumpelstiltskin's own magic that was at fault.{nl}You see, Lydia Schaffen's arrow had been made to possess power against demons.{nl}
column3: 하지만 그런 것 쯤이야 럼펠스틸스킨의 마법으로 해결할 수 있었습니다.{nl}순전히 화살이 그렇게 된 건 리디아 샤펜의 화살은 마족에게 저항하는 힘이 있었기 때문이었지요.{nl}
column4: Tetapi pada saat itu, Rumple Steel Skin dapat mengatasinya dengan Sihir miliknya.{nl} Panah dari Lidia Sharpen menjadi sepenuhnya seperti itu adalah karena adanya kekuatan yang menolak demon.{nl}

column2: That's right. Rumpelstiltskin was a demon.{nl}So when his power and the power of the arrow collided, it started to disintegrate.{nl}
column3: 그렇습니다. 럼펠스틸스킨은 마족이었던 것입니다.{nl}마족의 힘과 화살의 힘이 부딫히면서 천천히 바스라지기 시작한 것입니다.{nl}
column4: Begitulah. Rumple Steel Skin adalah seorang Demon.{nl} Jika kekuatan dari panah dan kekuatan demon saling bersentuhan, maka perlahan-lahan panah akan mulai hancur.{nl}

column2: Rumpelstiltskin, who has just realized that, was furious, but it was to no use.
column3: 그걸 이제서야 깨달은 럼펠스킬스킨은 마구 화가 났지만 달리 어찌 할 도리가 없었습니다.
column4: Rumple Steel Skin yang sekarang mengetahui hal ini sangatlah marah, tetapi tidak ada apapun yang bisa dilakukannya.

column2: [Rumpelstiltskin's Whereabouts]
column3: [럼펠스틸스킨은 어디에]
column4: [Rumple Steel Skin dimana]

column2: {nl}Rumpelstiltskin, unable to return to earth, is still flying towards the moon.{nl}Or, he could just as well be back already, searching for more of Lydia's arrows.{nl}
column3: {nl}럼펠스틸스킨은 땅으로 돌아오지 못한 채 지금도 달을 향해 날아가고 있습니다.{nl}어쩌면 벌써 돌아와서 리디아 샤펜이 남긴 다른 화살을 찾고 있을지도 모르지요.{nl}
column4: {nl} Rumple Steel  Skin sedang terbang mengarah ke bulan saat ini juga, karena tidak dapat kembali ke darat.{nl} Tetapi karena ia sudah kembali, entah apakah dia sedang mencari anak panah lainnya yang ditinggalkan Lidia Sharpen.{nl}

column2: This story can't be verified by humans, goddesses, nor demons.{nl}Of course, it would become apparent if we would be able to go to the moon.
column3: 이 이야기는 인간도, 여신도, 마족에게도 확인할 길은 없습니다.{nl}물론 달에 갈 수 있다면야 확실해지겠지만요.
column4: Cerita ini tidak ada cara untuk dikonfirmasi baik melalui manusia, Goddess, maupun demon.{nl} Tetapi yang jelas adalah pergi ke bulan adalah sesuatu yang mungkin.

column2: Leopoldas
column3: 레오폴다스
column4: Leopoldas

column2: What, aren't you the Revelator?{nl}It's so good to see you.{nl}
column3: 아니, 자네는 계시자 아니신가.{nl}반갑네, 반가워.{nl}
column4: Hmm, Apakah kau adalah Savior.{nl} Senang bertemu denganmu, senang rasanya.{nl}

column2: Of course, I know about you.{nl}We of the Kedoran Merchant Alliance know everything.{nl}
column3: 아아, 자네에 대해선 물론 알고 있지.{nl}우리 케도라 상단은 뭐든 알고 있거든.{nl}
column4: Ahhh, Aku tentu saja mengetahui tentangmu.{nl} Kami Kedora Merchant Alliance mengetahui segala hal.{nl}

column2: We're a distinguished alliance; we worked on the Astral Tower, the Great Cathedral and other major constructions.{nl}Will of the goddesses. I'd say we were a sort of driving force in history.{nl}
column3: 우린 별의 탑, 대성당 같은 대형 공사의 자재를 공급해 온 유서깊은 상단이야.{nl}전부 여신의 뜻이지. 역사를 뒤에서 보좌해왔다고나 할까? {nl}
column4: Kami adalah komite yang telah lama menyediakan material pembangunan skala besar, seperti Astral Tower dan Cathedral.{nl} Semua adalah kehendak Goddess. Bisa disebut kami mendukung dibalik sejarah? {nl}

column2: Oh, I'm in charge of the new members by the way.{nl}After Medzio Diena we had to use even the newcomers to help with reconstruction.{nl}
column3: 아, 난 상단의 신입 단원 관리를 맡고 있네.{nl}신수의 날에 막대한 피해를 입어서 신입들까지 동원해가며 피해를 복구하고 있지.{nl}
column4: Ah, Aku bertugas mengatur member baru dari Merchant Alliance.{nl} Karena ketika hari Medzio Diena telah terjadi kerusakan yang sangat parah, saat ini kami sampai menggerakan seluruh member baru dan melakukan restorasi kerusakan.{nl}

column2: How about we help each other out?{nl}He is the helper of our Kedoran Merchant Alliance.
column3: 어떤가. 같은 여신의 동지끼리 돕는 건?{nl}당당히 우리 케도라 상단의 조력자! 쯤이 되는 것 아니겠나.
column4: Bagaimana. Membantu sesama Goddess?{nl} Dengan gagah berani kami Kedora Merchant Alliance sebagai asisten! Cukup berpotensi bukan.

column2: Thank you so much.{nl}The newcomers are beside me.{nl}
column3: 거 정말 고맙네.{nl}일단 옆쪽엔 내 담당인 신입단원들이 있지.{nl}
column4: Sungguh terima kasih banyak.{nl} pertama-tama di sebelah terdapat para member baru yang berada dalam pengawasanku.{nl}

column2: I was going to be a little strict teaching you, but that's not really me.{nl}I was wondering if you could give us a hand.{nl}
column3: 좀 엄격하게 일을 가르치려고 했는데 내 마음이 사실 안 그래. {nl}자네가 살짝 도와줬으면 좋겠어.{nl}
column4: Aku bermaksud mengajarkan pekerjaan dengan sedikit lebih ketat, tetapi sebenarnya hatiku tidaklah begitu. {nl} Alangkah baiknya jika kamu juga membantu sedikit.{nl}

column2: If you go south you can help out Jurathena Margellius.{nl}The monsters around here are tough even for a veteran.
column3: 저 아래쪽으로 가면 유라테나 마르젤리유스의 일을 도울 수도 있네.{nl}아무리 베테랑이지만 이 동네 몬스터가 좀 거칠어야 말이지.
column4: jika kamu turun ke bawah sana, maka kau dapat membantu pekerjaan Yureta atau Marcellius.{nl} Walaupun kamu sudah berpengalaman, berhati-hatilah akan monster di daerah ini.

column2: Even in our group, though, we did have our rough times.{nl}It's actually a bit rough right now.{nl}
column3: 우리 상단이라고 해도 어려웠던 시절이 없으란 법은 없었지.{nl}지금이 살짝 그런 때라고 해도 되려나?{nl}
column4: Walaupun kami adalah Merchant Alliance tidak berarti kami tidak pernah mengalami masa sulit.{nl} Sekarang mungkin sedikit bisa dibilang saat itu?{nl}

column2: That's why we're focused here on Manahas right now.
column3: 그래서 이렇게 이 곳 마나하스에 주력하고 있는 것이고.
column4: Maka dari itu kami sedang memfokuskan pada tempat ini yaitu Manahas.

column2: Alright, go then.{nl}It shouldn't be too hard for someone of your fame.
column3: 그럼 잘 부탁하겠네.{nl}자네 명성이야 익히 들어 알고 있으니 어려운 일은 아닐 게야.
column4: Kalau begitu mohon bantuannya ya.{nl} Melihat reputasi kamu yang seperti itu, sepertinya ini bukanlah pekerjaan sulit.

column2: Ah, I think I know what sacred object is there.{nl}Instead of using a tool, first dig it with your hand.{nl}And be careful not to break the object and bring it to me.
column3: 아, 그 위치라면 어떤 성물인지 알 것 같네요.{nl}도구를 사용하는 것 보다 일단 손으로 한 번 파 보세요.{nl}그리고 나오는 건 깨지지 않게 조심해서 가져다 주세요.
column4: Ah, jika di lokasi itu sepertinya aku tahu benda suci seperti apa.{nl} Pertama-tama sebaiknya coba menggali dengan tangan dibandingkan menggunakan alat.{nl} Lalu benda yang kau temukan, bawalah kepadaku dengan berhati-hati jangan sampai pecah.

column2: It shouldn't be that hard.
column3: 별로 어렵지 않을 거예요.
column4: Tidak terlalu sulit.

column2: Be careful not to break it.
column3: 깨지지 않게 조심하세요.
column4: Waspadalah jangan sampai pecah.

column2: This is the bottle which contains the secret ink which was used to write important recordings or documents.{nl}It's used to hide records and the like.{nl}Thank you.
column3: 이건 중요한 기록이나 문서를 남기기 위해 사용하던 비밀잉크가 담긴 병이예요. {nl}기록을 숨겨야 할 필요가 있을 때 이 잉크를 사용했을 거라고 알려져 있어요.{nl}감사합니다.
column4: Ini adalah botol yang menyimpan tinta rahasia, yang dipakai untuk meninggalkan catatan atau dokumen rahasia. {nl} Diketahui tinta ini digunakan ketika harus menyembunyikan catatan.{nl} Terima kasih.

column2: Antanas
column3: 안타나스
column4: Antanas

column2: Greetings.{nl}I'm Antanas, from Nestospa. {nl}Have you ever seen Nestospa?{nl}Well, it doesn't matter if you haven't.
column3: 안녕하시오.{nl}난 네스토스파의 안타나스라고 하오.{nl}이전에 네스토스파를 본 적이 있소?{nl}뭐 없어도 별 상관은 없소.
column4: Halo.{nl}Namaku adalah Antanas dari Nestospa.{nl} Apakah kau perna melihat Nestospa sebelumnya?{nl} Kalau tidak pernah, juga tidak masalah.

column2: {nl}The people of Nestospa here are just quietly doing their work.{nl}Myself, I'm here making tombstones.{nl}The problem is I have no materials.{nl}Would you help me?
column3: {nl}이 곳에 있는 네스토스파 사람들은 조용히 자기 일만 한다오.{nl}난 지금 여기서 비석을 만들고 있소.{nl}그런데 영 재료들이 모이지 않네.{nl}좀 도와주시겠소?
column4: {nl}Orang-orang Nestopa yang ada di tempat ini, hanya mengerjakan pekerjaan masing-masing dengan tenang.{nl} Sekarang aku sedang membuat monumen di sini.{nl} Tetapi bahan yang dibutuhkan sulit kudapatkan.{nl} Maukah kamu membantu?

column2: There's two things we need.{nl}Listen closely. {nl}Get some lime powder from monsters, and then some flat stones for construction.
column3: 재료가 한 두가지여야지.{nl}잘 들으시오.{nl}몬스터에게서 횟가루도 얻어야 하고, 깔린 돌들에게서 석재용 돌도 구해야 하오.
column4: Materialnya ada satu atau dua jenis.{nl}Dengarkan baik baik.{nl} Kau harus mendapatkan White powder dari monster, dan harus mendapatkan batu untuk material dari batu-batu yang pecah .

column2: {nl}You'll be busy.
column3: {nl}많이 바쁠 거요.
column4: {nl} akan sangat sibuk ya.

column2: Good luck!
column3: 힘을 내시오!
column4: Semangat!

column2: Wow, you did great.
column3: 이야, 잘 해 주었소.
column4: Wah, kamu melakukannya dengan baik.

column2: Giedra
column3: 기에드라
column4: Giedra

column2: Antanas told you to go?{nl}I'm Giedra, from Nestospa.{nl}If you already met Antanas, you probably know what we do by now, so I'll keep it short.
column3: 안타나스가 가 보라고 하셨다구요?{nl}저는 네스토스파의 기에드라라고 합니다.{nl}안타나스를 만나고 오셨으면 저희가 하는 일에 대한 이야기는 들으셨을 테니 길게 말 하지 않을게요.
column4: Antanas telah menyuruh untuk melihatnya?{nl} Namaku adalah Giedra dari Nestopa.{nl} jika kamu datang setelah bertemu Antanas, Karena kamu telah mendengar tentang pekerjaan yang kami lakukan, maka aku tidak akan bicara panjang.

column2: {nl}I'm gathering materials to make scriptures of the goddesses.{nl}Regular paper gets yellow and falls apart too quickly... so I'm looking for a material that won't get wet or change color. {nl}Transparent monster shells are perfect for this, since they last a long time after they're carved.{nl}Will you gather some for me?
column3: {nl}저는 여기서 여신의 경전을 만들기 위한 재료를 모으고 있어요.{nl}일반 종이들은 금방 누래지고 부스러져서.. 이번에는 잘 젖지도 않고 변색도 없는 재료를 구하고있죠.{nl}몬스터들의 투명한 껍질이 딱 좋아요. 잘 다듬어서 글을 새기면 오래 가죠.{nl}그것들을 좀 구해 주시겠어요?
column4: {nl} Aku sedang mengumpulkan material untuk membuat Goddess Scripture disini.{nl} Kertas biasanya cepat rapuh dan hancur.. Kali ini aku mencari kertas yang tidak mudah sobek dan berubah warna.{nl} Kulit transparan monster sepertinya cocok dengan kriteria ini. Karena menyerap baik, sehingga jika dituliskan diatasnya akan bertahan lama.{nl} Maukan kau mencarikan bahan itu untukku?

column2: Those are easy to find.{nl}Okay, then I am counting on you.
column3: 흔한 재료라서 구하기는 쉬워요.
column4: Karena itu adalah material umum, sehingga mudah didapatkan.

column2: N/A
column3: 다 모아지면 제게 가져다 주세요.
column4: Jika telah terkumpul semua bawakanlah padaku.

column2: You're back faster than I thought.{nl}I'll use these shells to make the scriptures.{nl}Thank you.
column3: 생각보다 빨리 가져오셨네요.{nl}이 껍질은 이제 잘 다듬어서 경전이 될 거예요.{nl}감사합니다.
column4: Kau datang membawakannya lebih cepat dari dugaanku ya.{nl} Kulit ini sekarang akan menjadi Scripture.{nl} Terima kasih.

column2: Kestas
column3: 케스타스
column4: Kestas

column2: Oh, my sign... Without it there's no telling if I'm Nestospa or Anastospa...{nl}I lost everything... The monsters took everything...{nl}I'm done...{nl}I was going to Fasika Plateau after my pilgrimage but...
column3: 아 내 표식.. 그게 없으면 내가 네스토스인지 아나스토스인지 모르는데..{nl}다 잃어버렸어.. 몬스터들이 가져가 버렸어..{nl}난 끝났어..{nl}순례를 끝내고 파사카 협곡으로 가려고 했는데..
column4: Lambangku.. Jika tidak ada itu maka aku tidak tahu apakah Nestospa atau Anastos..{nl}Semuanya telah hilang.. Dibawa oleh para monster..{nl}Habislah aku..{nl} Padahal aku bermaksud pergi ke Fasika Plateau setelah selesai melakukan Pilgrim..

column2: Oooohh!{nl}Please help me!{nl}My Nestospa sign is gone!
column3: 오오오오!{nl}제발 저를 도와 주세요!{nl}네스토스의 표식이 없어졌어요!
column4: Ooohhh!{nl} Kumohon tolonglah saya!{nl} Nestopa's Sign telang hilang!

column2: {nl}It's gone, gone, gone!{nl}Please help me find it!{nl}The monsters must have taken it!
column3: {nl}그게 없어요 없어요 없어!{nl}찾아다 주세요!{nl}몬스터가 가져 간 게 분명해요!
column4: {nl} Benda itu tidak ada, hilang hilang hilang!{nl} Tolonglah carikan kembali!{nl} Sudah jelas diambil oleh monster!

column2: How could this happen...{nl}I'm  done... How am I going to face my Nestospa mentors...
column3: 어쩌지 어째..{nl}난 끝났어.. 네스토스파 선생님들 얼굴을 어떻게 봐..
column4: Bagaimana mungkin..{nl}Habislah aku.. Bagaimana aku bisa menatap wajar para guru di Nestospa..

column2: That's it!{nl}Wow, you found them all!{nl}Thank you!{nl}How can I ever repay you...
column3: 그거예요! 와 다 모으셨군요!{nl}감사합니다!{nl}이 은혜를 어찌 해야 할 지..
column4: Itu dia! Kau telah mengumpulkannya rupanya!{nl} Terima kasih!{nl} Bagaimana membalas budi ini..

column2: That.. is that from the monsters of the Fortress of the Land?{nl}Ruklys army used to have it in the past.{nl}
column3: 그건.. 대지의 요새의 몬스터에게서 나온 건가요?{nl}이건 과거 루클리스 부대 병사들이 가지고 있던 것입니다.{nl}
column4: Benda itu.. Apakah didapat dari monster yang berada di Earth Castile?{nl} Ini adalah sesuatu yang dimiliki oleh para pasukan Ruklys dahulu.{nl}

column2: The object that you've brought will aid us in our research.{nl}Can you get us some more?
column3: 가져오신 물건은 저희 기사단의 연구에 도움이 될 것 같습니다.{nl}더 구해주실 수 있나요?
column4: Benda yang dibawa sepertinya dapat membantu dalam penelitian para Knight.{nl} Bisakah kau mencarikannya lagi?

column2: I didn't expect the monsters at the Fortress of the Land have this..{nl}This is very interesting.
column3: 대지의 요새에 있는 몬스터들이 이런 걸 가지고 있다니..{nl}상당히 흥미롭군요.
column4: Para monster yang ada di Earth Castile membawa benda seperti ini katamu..{nl} Cukup menarik.

column2: This is enough. {nl}Thank you for helping our research.
column3: 이만하면 충분합니다. {nl}저희들의 연구에 도움을 주셔서 감사합니다.
column4: Sejumlah ini cukup sepertinya. {nl} Terima kasih telah membantu dalam p enelitian kami.

column2: What's up?{nl}Are you giving this to me?{nl}
column3: 무슨 일이시지요?{nl}이걸 제게 주신다는 건가요?{nl}
column4: Ada urusan apa ya?{nl} Apakah kamu berkata memberikan ini padaku?{nl}

column2: It is very surprising. What soldiers did in the past is written here. {nl}I am going to pass this document to the headquarters. {nl}
column3: 놀랍군요. 과거 병사들의 생활상이 적혀있어요. {nl}얼른 이 자료를 기사단 본부에 보내야겠습니다. {nl}
column4: Mengejutkan. Disini tertuliskan fase kehidupan para prajurit di masa lalu. {nl} Harus cepat mengirimkan material ini ke Knight Headquarter. {nl}

column2: I will give you a copy of the book as a token of my appreciation.{nl}It is written roughly, but our objective is to find out the truth in the past.
column3: 감사의 뜻으로 책 사본을 드리지요.{nl}조금 거친 언어로 쓰여 있지만 저희는 과거의 진상을 알리는 게 목적이니까요.
column4: Sebagai rasa terima kasih, kuberikan salinan dari buku itu.{nl} Walau bertuliskan dalam bahasa yang kasar, tetapi tujuannya adalah memberitahukan tentang kebenaran di masa lalu.

column2: No!{nl}Please don't take it away from me..
column3: 안돼!{nl}제발 그 반지만은 빼앗지 말아줘..
column4: Tidakk!{nl} Kumohon jangan ambil cincin itu..

column2: That's a bomb.. Is that a blind shell?{nl}Can I take a look at it?
column3: 그건 폭탄인데.. 불발탄인가?{nl}내가 좀 볼 수 있을까?
column4: Itu adalah bomb loh.. Bomb api mungkin?{nl} Bolehkah kulihat sebentar?

column2: This is very old!{nl}These kind of bombs can only be seen in the books.
column3: 이건 완전 구형이잖아!{nl}책에나 볼 수 있는 폭탄이야.
column4: Ini adalah model jaman dahulu kan!{nl} Bomb yang bisa dilihat hanya di buku.

column2: Ruklys Army Soldier's Spirit
column3: 루클리스 부대원의 영혼
column4: Ruklys Troop Member's Soul

column2: I wasn't able to send an order to retreat.{nl}I should have blew the horn...
column3: 부대원들에게 퇴각 명령을 내리지 못했습니다.{nl}나팔을 불어야 하는데..
column4: Aku belum bisa memberikan perintah mundur kepada para anggota pasukan.{nl} Padahal harus membunyikan terompet..

column2: If we don't make an order to retreat, they will all be annihilated.{nl}Please blow the horn..
column3: 퇴각시키지 않으면 전멸당하고 말 겁니다.{nl}반드시 나팔을..
column4: Jika tidak menyuruh mundur, maka akan terhabisi semuanya.{nl} Terompet..

column2: Thank you. Where do you belong to?{nl}I should get back to Ruklys now.
column3: 감사합니다. 당신은 어디 소속이십니까?{nl}저도 이제 루클리스님께 돌아가야겠습니다..
column4: Terima kasih. Dari pasukan manakah kamu berasal?{nl} Sekarang saya juga harus kembali pada tuan Ruklys..

column2: Wait! Listen to what he is saying.{nl}He's saying if I want to get our family treasure back, I should give him the blessed crystal.{nl}
column3: 잠시만요! 이 사람 말하는 것 좀 들어보세요.{nl}남의 집안 가보를 되돌려받고 싶으면 축복 받은 수정을 내놓으래요.{nl}
column4: Sebentar! Cobalah dengar sebentar yang orang ini bicarakan.{nl} Jika ingin mendapatkan kembali warisan keluarga milik lainnya, ia menyuruh untuk menaruh Blessed Crystal.{nl}

column2: He has given us fake crystals at first and took away one's life.{nl}And he is asking to call a dead person and ask him.{nl}
column3: 애초에 엉터리 수정을 줘서 사람 목숨까지 잃게 해 놓선 말이에요. {nl}하, 참. 그러더니 이젠 한술 더 떠서 죽은 사람까지 불러다 물어보래요.{nl}
column4: Awalnya ia sampai membuat orang kehilangan nyawa dengan memberikan rubbish crystal. {nl} Hah, aduh. Karena begitu sekarang sudah lebih bijaksana, ia menyuruh bertanya dengan memanggil orang yang sudah mati.{nl}

column2: So I asked him how I can call it out and he told me to use the scroll for the dead to him.{nl}So I asked him how much it would cost and he answered that I can pay him by giving him some Blue Paint.
column3: 그럼 어떻게 불러내냐니까 자기한테 망자 스크롤을 사라잖아요?{nl}그래서 얼마면 되냐고 물어보니까 몬스터를 잡아서 파란 도료를 대금으로 내래요.{nl}
column4: Karena bertanya bagaimana memanggilnya, maka disuru membeli Deadman Scroll pada dirinya bukan?{nl} Maka dari itu, ketika bertanya harus seberapa banyak, ia menyuruh menghabisi monster dan menyerahkan Blue Paint sebagai bayaran katanya.{nl}

column2: I'm sure this man will attempt to run away whilst I'm searching for Blue Paint!{nl}Can you help me?
column3: 분명 이 늙은 사기꾼이 제가 파란 도료를 구하러 간 사이에 도망치려는 게 분명해요!{nl}저를 도와주실 수 있나요?
column4: Sudah jelas si penipu tua ini bermaksud untuk melarikan diri ketika aku sedang pergi mencari Blue Paint!{nl} Bisakah kau membantu saya?

column2: Sorry. I guess I was too upset. I will tell you slowly. {nl}I'm a friend of Squire Master, Justina Legwyn.{nl}
column3: 흥분했더니 말에 두서가 없었네요. 차근차근 말씀드릴게요. {nl}저는 스콰이어 마스터인 유스티나 르귄의 친구 윌리야에요.{nl}
column4: Karena tercengang, pembicaraan jadi bertele-tele ya. Akan kuberitahukan perlahan. {nl} Aku adalah Willy teman dari Justina Legwyn yang adalah Squire Master.{nl}

column2: The dead person which the Pardoner is talking about is the father of my friend, Gailus Legwyn.{nl}It is ridiculous that missing Gailus Legwyn has passed away, and look at his attitude.{nl}
column3: 저 파드너가 말하는 죽은 사람은 제 친구의 아버지인 가일류스 르귄님이죠.{nl}실종된 가일류스 르귄님이 돌아가셨다는 것도 황당한데 저 태도좀 보세요.{nl}
column4: Orang mati yang dibicarakan oleh Pardoner itu adalah ayah dari teman saya, dan bernama Galius Legwyn.{nl} Cobalah lihat perilaku yang aneh dari Galius Legwyn setelah kembali dari menghilang.{nl}

column2: That old man only wants to satisfy his greed.{nl}Poor Justina...{nl}
column3: 저 늙은이가 르귄가의 가보를 유족에게 돌려주겠다면서 자기 사리사욕을 채우려 하잖아요.{nl}불쌍한 유스티나..{nl}
column4: Si tua itu berkata akan mengembalikan family crest dari keluarga Legwyn kepada keluarga yang ditinggalkan, itu hanya bermaksud untuk memuaskan dirinya sendiri saja kan.{nl}Yustina yang malang..{nl}

column2: You can find Blue Paint from the monsters at Apgaudin Crossroads.{nl}I'm counting on you.
column3: 파란 도료는 압가우딘 삼거리의 몬스터에게서 구하실 수 있을 거에요.{nl}꼭 부탁드릴게요.
column4: Blue paint bisa didapat dari monster pada Apgaudin Three Ways.{nl} Mohon bantuannya.

column2: Does she know the value of the Dead Scroll?{nl}Whatever... I don't care anymore.{nl}
column3: 저 당돌한 여자애는 그 망자 스크롤이 얼만 줄 알고 저러는 건지.{nl}아깝지만 이젠 상관 없어.{nl}
column4: Wanita gagah itu mengetahui seberapa bernilainya Dead Man Scroll itu, sehingga menjadi seperti itu.{nl}Sayang sekali, tetapi sekarang sudah tidak ada hubungan sama apapun.{nl}

column2: I'm experiencing this shame because of him. I can't stand it anymore.{nl}Find Gailus Legwyn with this and ask him yourself!{nl}
column3: 불쌍한 사람 도와줬다가 이런 치욕을 당해야 하다니, 참을 수 없단 말이다.{nl}이걸로 가일류스를 찾아서 직접 물어보라고!{nl}
column4: Setelah menolong orang yang malang malah dipermalukan jadi seperti ini, sungguh membuat kesal sekali.{nl} Pergilah bertanya langsung dengan menemukan Gailryus menggunakan ini!{nl}

column2: Look for the seal of Mires Grave{nl}I hear he died near there.
column3: 미레스 무덤가의 봉인을 찾아봐.{nl}그 친구, 그 근처에서 죽었다고 들었으니까.
column4: Cobalah mencari segel Mires Grave Field.{nl} Karena kudengar teman itu telah mati di sekitar sana.

column2: He doesn't want to back off until he receives the blessed crystal back.{nl}He is so tenacious.
column3: 이 사기꾼은 축복 받은 수정을 돌려받을 때까지 물러날 생각은 없는 것 같아요.{nl}정말 독하네요.
column4: Sampai penipu ini mengembalikan Blessed Crystal, maka aku tidak ada kepikiran untuk mundur.{nl} Sungguh bersikeras sekali.

column2: Oh my, goddess!{nl}I didn't expect that I would meet a human here..{nl}
column3: 세상에, 여신이시여!{nl}이런 곳에서 사람을 만나게 될 줄이야..{nl}
column4: Waduh, Goddessku!{nl} Bisa bertemu dengan orang di tempat seperti ini..{nl}

column2: Please help me.{nl}I'm being chased by the chasers and the demons from the tower of the stars.{nl}
column3: 제발 도와주십시오.{nl}전 별의 탑에서부터 추격자들과 마족들에게 쫓기고 있습니다.{nl}
column4: Kumohon bantulah saya.{nl} Saya sedang dikejar oleh para demon dan chaser di Astral Tower.{nl}

column2: Can you stand by me until I notify my other colleagues using a signal flare?{nl}I have to let the other two colleagues who came here know that I am still alive.
column3: 제가 신호탄으로 동료들에게 알리는 동안 잠시만 곁에 있어주실 수 있습니까?{nl}이 곳에 함께 온 두 명의 동료에게 제가 아직 살아있다는 걸 알려야 합니다.
column4: Mau kah kamu berada di sampingku sebentar saja, selama aku memberitahukan kepada kawan-kawanku dengan Flare?{nl} Aku harus memberitahukan kepada dua orang temanku lainnya yang datang kesini, bahwa aku masih hidup.

column2: Chasers came here..{nl}I might have been in danger if it wasn't for you.
column3: 추격자들이 여기까지..{nl}당신이 아니었다면 큰일날 뻔 했습니다.
column4: Para chaser sampai kesini..{nl} Jika bukan anda, hampir saja terjadi masalah besar.

column2: You.. It's like as if the goddesses are beside you.{nl}Okay. I am sure you are better than that Giltine.{nl}
column3: 너는.. 마치 여신들이 네 곁에 있는 것 같구나.{nl}그래. 그 가증스러운 길티네보단 낫겠지.{nl}
column4: Kau.. Sepertinya para Goddess berada di sampingmu.{nl} Baiklah. Aku yakin kamu lebih baik dibandingkan dengan Giltine.{nl}

column2: I am the Demon Lord Hauberk.{nl}Maybe you've already met me and my other piece.{nl}But, that piece is a different piece. I don't know who you are..{nl}
column3: 나는 마군주 하우벅이다.{nl}어쩌면 이미 너는 나의 다른 조각을 만났을 수도 있을 것이다.{nl}하지만 그 조각은 나와는 다른 조각일 뿐, 나는 네가 누군지 모른다..{nl}
column4: Aku adalah Demon Lord Hauberk.{nl} Sepertinya kau sudah bertemu dengan potongan diriku yang lain.{nl} Tetapi potongan Itu, adalah potongan yang berbeda dengan diriku, aku tidak mengetahui siapakah engkau..{nl}

column2: I was running away from the demons through a human called Agatas.{nl}But, Agatas is dying due to the paralysis needle of the demon.{nl}
column3: 나는 이 아가타스라는 인간을 통해 마족에게서 도망치고 있었다.{nl}하지만 아가타스가 마족의 마비독에 당해 이렇게 죽어가고 있구나.{nl}
column4: Aku sedang melarikan diri dari demon melalui manusia yang bernama Agatas.{nl} Tetapi Agatas sedang sekarat seperti ini, akibat terkena Paralyze poison milik Demon.{nl}

column2: I know that you don't trust me.{nl}But, please save this pilgrim.{nl}If you can find some Dark Blue Herbs, you can save him.
column3: 네가 나를 믿을 수 없다는 건 안다.{nl}하지만 이 선하디 선한 순례자만은 살려다오.{nl}네가 검푸른 허브를 구해온다면 그를 살릴 수 있다.
column4: Aku tahu bahwa kau tidak dapat mempercayaiku.{nl} Tetapi hanya Pilgrim yang baik saja yang bisa diselamatkan.{nl} jika kamu membawakan Dark Blue Herb, maka ia dapat diselamatkan.

column2: (Seems to be unconscious)
column3: (정신을 잃은 것 같다)
column4: (Sepertinya kehilangan kesadaran)

column2: You can save Agatas with this.{nl}There's nothing I can pay for your kindness.{nl}
column3: 이것이라면 아가타스를 살릴 수 있다.{nl}너의 선의에 보답할 만한 게 없구나.{nl}
column4: Dengan ini maka Agatas dapat diselamatkan.{nl} Entah bagaimana cara membalaskan kebaikanmu ini.{nl}

column2: I just look like a demon that should be eliminated in your eyes right?{nl}But, when Agatas wakes up, he will explain everything to you.
column3: 네 눈엔 나는 그저 없애야 할 마족으로만 보이겠지.{nl}하지만 아가타스가 깨어나면 모든 것을 설명해 줄 것이다.
column4: Aku pasti terlihat sebagai demon yang harus dihabisi menurut pandanganmu bukan.{nl} Tetapi jika Agatas terbangun, ia akan menjelaskan segalanya.

column2: The Knights of Kaliss? Good. {nl}The Fortress of the Land can't be entered since there are too many Royal Army guards.{nl}But, if you help me with the plan, I can take you with me.{nl}
column3: 칼리스 기사단이라고? 좋아. {nl}대지의 요새는 나라면 모를까, 왕국군이 많아서 그냥은 못들어가.{nl}하지만 내 계획을 도와준다면 함께 데려가 줄 순 있어.{nl}
column4: Kallis Knight katamu? Bagus. {nl} Tidak mungkin aku tidak tahu Earth Castile, karena disana terlalu banyak pasukan kerajaan, maka tidak dapat masuk begitu saja.{nl} Tetapi jika kamu membantu dalam rencanaku, maka aku bisa membawamu masuk.{nl}

column2: About the secret I told you a while ago...{nl}
column3: 자.. 아까 그 비밀 이야기 말인데..{nl}
column4: Nah.. Yang kumaksud adalah pembicaraan rahasia yang tadi itu..{nl}

column2: I heard some saying that the Fortress of the Land is to protect the treasure which was received from Ruklys.{nl}
column3: 대지의 요새는 루클리스가 여신께 받은 보물을 지키기 위한 것이라는 이야기도 있어.{nl}
column4: Terdapat cerita bahwa Earth Castile adalah untuk menjaga harta karun Ruklys yang didapat dari Goddess.{nl}

column2: Think about it. Isn't it strange?{nl}The Royal Army guards are protecting the hole which is digged like a ant hole.{nl}
column3: 생각해 봐. 이상하지 않아?{nl}개미굴 처럼 땅 속을 파서 만든 엄청난 곳을 왕국군이 철통같이 지키고 있다고.{nl}
column4: Coba pikirkan. Tidakkah itu aneh?{nl} Pasukan kerajaan sedang menjaga tempat ini sangat ketat, dan membuatnya ke dalam tanah seperti sarang semut.{nl}

column2: The revolt occurred 400 years ago and we don't have enough workforce due to Medzio Diena.{nl}This city too.. I know that it's historically meaningful, but I am not sure if we have to protect it that much.{nl}
column3: 반란은 400년 전의 일이고 지금은 신수의 날이다 뭐다 해서 병력도 부족하잖아.{nl}이 도시도 그렇고 아무리 역사적으로 의미가 있어도 그렇게까지 지켜야 할 필요가 있냐는 거야.{nl}
column4: Revolusi terjadi 400 tahun lalu dan kami tidak punya cukup pekerja karena Medzio Diena.{nl}Kota ini juga..Aku tahu sejarah itu sangat berarti, tapi aku tidak yakin kita dapat melindunginya.{nl}

column2: Maybe some black deals were going back and forth behind the kingdom.{nl}If that's not it, why are they protecting this?{nl}
column3: 뭔가 왕국의 뒤에서 시꺼먼 거래라도 오고간 게 아닐까 싶어.{nl}그런 게 아니라면 뭐하러 이런 돌덩이나 다름 없는 걸 지키겠어?{nl}
column4: Entah kenapa sepertinya transaksi yang datang dan berlalu di belakang kerajaan.{nl} Jika bukan seperti itu, untuk apa mereka menjaga tumpukan batu seperti ini?{nl}

column2: The Knights of Kaliss wants to know if something is there.{nl}They told us that if we investigate the Fortress of the Land, they won't say anything regardless of what we do.{nl}
column3: 칼리스 기사단은 거기에 주목해서 뭔가 있지 않을까 궁금한가봐.{nl}그들은 대지의 요새만 조사해 주면 마음대로 움직여도 못본 척 해주겠다고 했어.{nl}
column4: Kallis Knight sepertinya sedang penasaran karena berfokus pada sesuatu disana.{nl} Mereka berkata jika kita menyelidiki Earth Castile, maka mereka akan berpura-pura tidak melihat walaupun kita berkeliling semau hati.{nl}

column2: Ah, of course, I am going to go look for the treasure of Ruklys.{nl}The treasure is from the goddesses so it must be something amazing.{nl}
column3: 아, 물론 난 루클리스의 보물을 찾으러 갈 거야.{nl}분명 여신께 받은 것이니 엄청난 물건일 거라고.{nl}
column4: Ah, Tentunya aku akan pergi mencari harta karun Ruklys.{nl} Pastinya adalah sesuatu yang luar biasa karena diturunkan oleh Goddess.{nl}

column2: Anyways, you are going to be with me right?{nl}Please first gather the records from Ruklys Era at the gathering place.{nl}In order to break Gargoyle, we need that.
column3: 어쨌든 나와 함께 하는 거지?{nl}일단 집결지에 있는 루클리스 시대의 기록물들을 모아줘.{nl}저길 지키고 있는 가고일을 뚫을려면 그게 필요하거든.
column4: Bagaimanapun akan melakukannya bersama denganku kan?{nl}Pertama-tama kumpulkan benda-benda catatan dari jaman Ruklys yang ada di meeting point.{nl} Jika ingin menembus Gargoyle yang berjaga di sana, membutuhkan itu loh.

column2: Bokor Juta
column3: 보코르 유타
column4: Bokor Yuta

column2: I'm looking for Goddess Zemyna.{nl}Everyone knows the goddess is missing.{nl}
column3: 전 제미나 여신의 행방을 찾고 있어요.{nl}여신께서 행방불명되셨다는건 누구나 아는 이야기지요.{nl}
column4: Saya sedang mencari jejak dari Goddess Zemyna.{nl} Semua orang mengetahui cerita akan hilangnya jejak Goddess kan.{nl}

column2: I've come here after hearing that the goddesses blessed the Order of the Tree of Truth...{nl}I can only see the deads.{nl}
column3: 여신께서 진리의 나무 교단을 축복했단 소문을 듣고 여기까지 왔는데.. {nl}망자들만 가득하네요.{nl}
column4: Aku datang sampai kesini karena mendengar rumor tentang lembaga religius Tree of Truth yang diberkati Goddess.. {nl}Tetapi hanya dipenuhi oleh orang yang sudah mati rupanya.{nl}

column2: If you are going to stay in this chamber, can you help me?{nl}I can't do anything with my power and they come at me whenever they hear my prayers.{nl}
column3: 혹시 이 묘역에 계속 계실 거라면 절 좀 도와주시겠어요?{nl}이 망자들은 제 힘으로도 어떻게 안되고 기도 소리만 들으면 마구 달려들거든요.{nl}
column4: Jika kamu bermaksud untuk terus berada di Graveyard ini, maukah kamu sedikit membantu saya?{nl} Mereka yang sudah mati ini, sulit untuk diatasi hanya dengan kekuatan saja, dan menyerang dengan membabi buta hanya dengan mendengar suara saja.{nl}

column2: I should pray to the goddesses to check whether she is around here.
column3: 여신께 기도를 올려야 이 근처에 계시는지라도 확인이 될 텐데 말예요.
column4: Aku bermaksud untuk memanjatkan doa untuk mengetahui apakah Goddess berada di sekitar sini.

column2: Really? Thank you for your words.{nl}Prayers were hard to do alone.{nl}
column3: 정말요? 말 만으로도 감사하네요.{nl}사실 혼자서는 기도마저도 힘들었거든요.{nl}
column4: Sungguh? Terima kasih walau hanya dengan kata-kata.{nl} Sebenarnya sungguh sulit untuk berdoa sendirian loh.{nl}

column2: Then I am counting on you for the deads at the casket room.{nl}I will pray to the goddess in the meantime.
column3: 그럼 입관실의 망자들을 부탁드릴게요.{nl}그 동안 전 여신이 어디 계시는지 기도를 올려 보겠어요.
column4: Kalau begitu mohon bantuannya untuk mengatasi orang mati di peti mati ya.{nl} Aku bermaksud untuk memanjatkan doa untuk Goddess.

column2: I thought I would be able to find the whereabouts of Goddess Zemyna here, but this place is full of the dead..{nl}I've never seen this. We should look for Zemyna fast.
column3: 여기라면 제미나 여신의 행방을 찾을 수 있을까 했는데 망자들만 가득하다니..{nl}이런 건 처음 봐요. 어서 제미나님을 찾아야 할텐데요.
column4: Kupikir dapat menemukan jejak keberadaan dari Goddess Zemyna disini, tetapi hanya dipenuhi oleh yang mati saja..{nl}Pertama kalinya aku melihat yang seperti ini. Padahal harus bergegas menemukan Goddess Zemyna.

column2: Ah, so you've returned. {nl}Because of you, the deads didn't attack me while I was praying.{nl}
column3: 아, 돌아오셨군요. {nl}덕분에 기도를 올리는 동안은 시체들이 덤벼들진 않았어요.{nl}
column4: Ah, sudah kembali rupanya. {nl}Berkat anda, selama aku berdoa para mayat tidak datang menyerang.{nl}

column2: But, even here, the prayer didn't reach the goddess.
column3: 하지만 여기서도 여신께 기도는 닿지 않았나봐요.
column4: Tetapi doa sepertinya tidak tersampaikan kepada Goddess jika dilakukan di tempat ini.

column2: Druid Leya
column3: 드루이드 레야
column4: Druid Leya

column2: Hey, you.{nl}What are you doing here in this far off forest?{nl}Well, it doesn't matter. Whoever you are, can you give me a hand?
column3: 이봐요. 당신.{nl}누구길래 이렇게 인적 드문 숲을 찾아온거죠?{nl}아 됐어요. 누구라도 상관없어. 절 좀 도와주세요.{nl}
column4: Hei. Anda.{nl} Siapakah kamu, mengapa datang ke hutan yang jarang manusia seperti ini?{nl}Ah sudahlah. Tidak ada hubungannya siapapun itu. Bantulah saya sedikit.{nl}

column2: My name is Druid Leja and I live in this forest.{nl}I've reached here by chasing after the ferrets that ran away with the food from the village.{nl}I wasn't able to find the food, but instead was attacked by ferrets.{nl}
column3: 저는 이 숲에 사는 드루이드 레야라고 해요.{nl}페릿이 마을을 습격해서 식량을 훔쳐달아나는 걸 쫓다가 여기까지 왔죠.{nl}그런데 식량도 못찾고 오히려 페릿들에게 공격당해버렸네요.{nl}
column4: Aku adalah Druid yang tinggal di hutan ini, namaku adalah Leya.{nl} Saya datang sampai kemari karena mengejar para Ferret yang mencuri persediaan makanan dan menyerang desa.{nl} Tetapi aku tidak dapat menemukan persediaan makanan, dan malah diserang oleh para Ferret.{nl}

column2: I want to cure my wound before I go back to the village..{nl}When we go up there, there is a herb that works well on wounds. Please bring us those herbs.
column3: 마을로 돌아가기 전에 상처를 좀 추스려야할 것 같은데..{nl}저 위에 올라가면 상처에 잘 듣는 약초가 있어요. 그 약초를 좀 가져다주세요.
column4: Sebelum kembali ke desa, sepertinya luka ini harus ditangani dahulu..{nl} Jika naik ke atas sana, terdapat herb yang ampuh untuk menyembuhkan luka. Tolong bawakan herb itu ya.

column2: When we collect the herbs, the ferrets may attack us.{nl}They think everything in this forest belongs to them.
column3: 약초를 채집하다보면 페릿들이 공격해올지도 몰라요.{nl}언젠가부터 이 숲에서 나는 모든 게 자기꺼라고 생각하는 것 같더라구요.
column4: Ketika mengumpulkan Herb, mungkin saja Para Ferret datang menyerang.{nl} Entah sejak kapan aku sepertinya berpikir bahwa hutan ini telah menjadi milikku sendiri loh.

column2: Villager
column3: 마을 주민
column4: Villager

column2: Revelator, have you drank the red water before?{nl}If you had drank it before, I am sure you won't be able to talk to me now.{nl}Even if you are really thirsty, you shouldn't drink the red water. If you drink it, you will suffer from it.{nl}It is so toxic. The fruits that grew by consuming the water got huge and can't be edible.{nl}
column3: 계시자님 혹시 붉게 물든 물을 마셔보셨나요?{nl}아마 마셨으면 이 자리에 서서 저와 대화를 나누는 것 조차 불가능했을거에요.{nl}아무리 목이 마르셔도 붉게 물든 물은 마시면 안돼요. 마시면 죽을 만큼 괴롭거든요.{nl}얼마나 독한지 그 물을 먹고 자란 거대 과일도 먹을 수 없게 되버린답니다.{nl}하지만 페릿들은 어떻게 된 건지 거대 과일을 채집해서 과즙을 물 대신 마시더라고요.{nl}
column4: Tuan Savior, pernahkah kamu meminum air yang berwarna merah?{nl} Jika pernah mungkin kamu tidak mungkin berada di tempat ini dan berbicara denganku.{nl} Seberapa haus leher anda, janganlah pernah meminum air berwarna merah itu. Jika meminumnya maka akan merasakan sakit yang luar biasa.{nl} Sampai-sampai buah dari pohon yang tumbuh karena air itu, menjadi tidak dapat dimakan.{nl} Tetapi para Ferret mengumpulkan buah raksasa itu dan membuatnya jadi jus, lalu meminumnya sebagai ganti air.{nl}

column2: I was once lost in a forest and I was really thirsty at then.{nl}I found a container with fruit juice in it which the ferrets had accumulated.{nl}Dying from thirst or dying from the ferrets, dying is the same.{nl}So I drank the juice without the ferrets knowing and nothing happened to me.{nl}
column3: 예전에 숲에서 길을 잃고 헤맸던 적이 있는데 너무 목이 말라죽겠는 거에요.{nl}그때 과즙통을 들고 돌아다니던 페릿 한마리를 만나게 됐죠.{nl}목이 말라 죽든, 과일을 먹고 죽든, 페릿한테 물려죽든 어차피 죽는 건 매 한가지잖아요.{nl}그래서 억지로 페릿이 가지고 있던 과즙을 뺏어 마셨는데 아무 일도 없었답니다.{nl}
column4: Dulu aku pernah tersasar di hutan ini karena kehilangan arah, dan pada saat itu aku sungguh kehausan.{nl} Lalu pada saat itu aku bertemu dengan seekor Ferret yang berkeliling membawa Juice Bucket.{nl} Waktu itu pilihannya adalah mati kehausan, atau mati karena memakan buah, atau mati diserang oleh Ferret.{nl} Maka dari itu aku merebut secara paksa juice yang dibawa oleh Ferret, anehnya tidak terjadi hal apapun padaku.{nl}

column2: We're almost running out of the water we had collected, we need to find more.{nl}Could you get some fruit juice from the ferrets? Thank you.
column3: 이제 모아둔 식수도 바닥을 보이기 시작했는데 식수는 꼭 있어야하잖아요.{nl}페릿들로부터 거대과일 과즙을 모아주실 수 있을까요? 부탁드릴게요.
column4: Saat ini air yang kami miliki mulai habis, padahal hal ini tak boleh terjadi.{nl}Bisakah kamu mengumpulkan Giant Fruit dan Juice dari para Ferret? Mohon bantuannya.

column2: The taste of the fruit juice was way better than I expected...
column3: 깜짝 놀랐던 건 죽을 각오로 마신 과즙이 상상 이상으로 맛이 좋았다는 거에요..
column4: Yang mengejutkan adalah, ketika telah bersiap untuk mati ketika meminum Juice, tetapi ternyata rasanya enak diluar dugaan.

column2: Wow, thanks. We wouldn't have to worry about the drinkable water with this much amount.
column3: 와 감사해요. 이 정도 양이면 한동안 식수 걱정은 없겠어요.
column4: Wah terima kasih. Kalau segini banyak, saya tidak perlu khawatir untuk waktu cukup lumayan.

column2: Druid Benes
column3: 드루이드 베네스
column4: Druid Benes

column2: Ah.. I didn't expect I would see a human here..! Please help me!{nl}I am called Druid Benes. I am trying to find the reason why the ferrets are coopering with the demons.{nl}Recently, I found out that I will be able to talk to the ferrets using the spell of the Druids.{nl}
column3: 아.. 이런 곳에서 사람을 만날 줄이야..! 저 좀 도와주세요!{nl}저는 드루이드 베네스라고 합니다. 페릿들이 마족 편에 동조하는 이유를 찾아보고 있죠.{nl}드루이드 주술을 사용하면 페릿으로 모습을 바꿀 수 있어요. 물론 페릿과 대화를 나눌 수도 있구요.{nl}
column4: Ah.. Tak kusangka bisa bertemu orang di tempat seperti ini..! Tolonglah bantu saya sedikit!{nl} Nama saya adalah Druid benes. Saya sedang mencari alasan mengapa Para Ferret membantu pihak Demon.{nl} Jika menggunakan ilmu Druid maka dapat berubah bentuk menjadi Ferret. Pastinya dapat berkomunikasi dengan Ferret.{nl}

column2: The problem is, since I've been around them for so long, they already know my smell.{nl}Even when I turn into a ferret, they recognize me and refuse to talk to me.{nl}Would you turn into a ferret for me and try and find out what they're plotting?{nl}
column3: 문제는 변신하는 과정에서 페릿과 너무 많이 접촉을 해서 놈들이 제 냄새를 기억한다는 겁니다.{nl}페릿으로 변신해도 제가 인간인 걸 알고 저와 대화를 하지 않더라고요.{nl}제 대신 페릿으로 변신해서 녀석들의 속셈을 알아봐주실 수 있으실까요?{nl}
column4: Masalahnya adalah mereka telah mengingat bauku karena terlalu banyak melakukan kontak dengan mereka pada saat proses transformasi.{nl} Walaupun aku berubah menjadi Ferret, karena mereka tahu bahwa aku adalah manusia maka mereka tak akan bercerita apapun.{nl} Maukah kamu menggantikanku bertransformasi menjadi Ferret dan mencari tahu tujuan mereka?{nl}

column2: In order to turn into a Ferret, you should observe the behaviors of ferrets well.{nl}If we do something awkward, we will get discovered by ferrets.{nl}I am going to give you an empty scroll so please observe the behaviors of ferrets and record them here.
column3: 페릿으로 변신하기 위해서는 페릿들의 행동을 잘 관찰해야합니다.{nl}어색한 행동을 하면 페릿들에게 들킬테니까요.{nl}제가 빈 주문서를 드릴테니 여기에 페릿의 행동을 관찰하고 적어주세요.
column4: Untuk bertransformasi menjadi Ferret, maka harus mengamati perilaku mereka dengan baik.{nl} Jika melakukan perilaku aneh maka akan tertangkap oleh para Ferret.{nl} Karena Aku akan memberikan Scroll kosong, tolong tuliskan perilaku mereka setelah mengamatinya.

column2: From what you observed, I am going to make a Ferret Transformation Scroll.{nl}So please write in details as much as possible. So that even if it transforms, it doesn't look awkward.
column3: 관찰하신 내용을 토대로 페릿 변신 주문서를 만들어드릴 겁니다.{nl}그러니 최대한 상세하게 적어 주세요. 변신해도 어색하지 않도록 말이죠.
column4: Aku akan membuatkan Transformation Scroll untuk berubah menjadi Ferret sesuai hasil pengamatan.{nl} Maka dari itu tolong tulislah dengan semaksimal mungkin. Agar ketika berubah tidak terlihat mencurigakan.

column2: You've observed in details.{nl}You won't have a problem if you transform now.{nl}Please wait.
column3: 자세하게 관찰해오셨네요.{nl}이 정도면 변신해도 큰 문제 없겠어요.{nl}잠시만요.
column4: Kau telah datang setelah mengamatinya dengan detil ya.{nl} Jika seperti ini sepertinya tidak akan ada masalah.{nl} Tunggu sebentar.

column2: The crystal emanating the mysterious light is not fully repleted!{nl}Defeat nearby monsters to collect monster oil and make the crystal shine its light!

column3: 녹 제거

column2: Everything Intact (3)
column3: 모든 것이 제자리로(3)

column2: Feeding the aerial monsters
column3: 비행형 몬스터에게 먹이주기
column4: Memberi makan monster tipe Flying

column2: Falconer Master wants to test whether monsters can be used instead of eagles. Feed three kinds of aerial type monsters and try taming them.
column3: 응사 마스터는 몬스터들을 매 대신 쓸 수 있을 지 시험해보고자 합니다. 세 종류의 비행형 몬스터에게 먹이를 주고 길들이기를 시도해보세요.
column4: Falconer Master bermaksud untuk bereksperimen apakan dapat menggunakan monster lainnya untuk menggantikan elang. Cobalah beri makan dan latih monster jenis bird tipe flying.

column2: Report to Falconer Master
column3: 응사 마스터에게 보고
column4: Melapor kepada Falconer master

column2: You've failed to tame monsters. Go back to Falconer Master.
column3: 몬스터를 길들이는데 실패했습니다. 응사 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Telah gagal melatih Monster. Kembalilah kepada Falconer Master.

column2: Go meet Schwarzer Reiter Master at the Forest of Prayer.
column3: 기원의 숲에 있는 슈바르츠라이터 마스터를 찾아가세요.
column4: Pergilah mencari Schwaze Reiter Master yang ada di Forest of Prayer.

column2: Shoot normal monsters 200 times consecutively
column3: 일반 몬스터에게 연속 200회 명중
column4: Mengenai monster biasa secara berkelanjutan 200 kali

column2: Schwarzer Reiter Master told you that he will see your skills to shoot enemies accurately. Hit normal monsters 200 times accurately.
column3: 슈바르츠라이터 마스터는 노린적을 확실하게 맞추는 실력을 보겠다고 합니다. 일반 몬스터를 상대로 공격을 200회 연속 확실하게 명중시키세요.
column4: Schwaze Reiter Master berkata akan melihat kemampuan mengenai musuh dengan tepat. Cobalah serang monster biasa sebagai target sebanyak 200 kali secara berurutan.

column2: You've landed all attacks on enemies without any mistask. Go back to Schwarzer Reiter Master.
column3: 실수 없이 적에게 연속으로 공격을 모두 명중시켰습니다. 슈바르츠라이터 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Telah mengenai seluruh serangan secara berurutan pada musuh tanpa kesalahan. Kembalilah pada Schwaze Reiter Master.

column2: Find the hidden contact and hand over the object
column3: 숨어있는 접선자를 찾아 물건 건내기
column4: Mengeluarkan benda dengan mencari perantara yang bersembunyi

column2: Monk Master asked you to meet the person who Vail has sent and hand over the object to him which Monk Master has given you. The person you should meet is hidden so go to the place indicated on the memo which Monk Master gave to you and say the passwords. When a person appears after hearing the passwords, give him the object.
column3: 몽크 마스터는 바일이 보낸 사람을 만나 자신이 준 물건을 건내주라고 합니다. 접선해야 할 사람은 숨어 있다고 하니 몽크 마스터가 건내 준 쪽지에 적힌 장소로가서 접선 암호를 말하고 나타난 접선인에게 물건을 건내주세요.
column4: Monk Master menyuruh untuk mengeluarkan benda yang diberikan dengan menemui orang dikirimkan oleh Vail. Katanya orang yang harus ditemui itu sedang bersembunyi, maka keluarkan benda dan perlihatkan kepada perantara yang muncul lalu bicarakan kode rahasia yang tertulis pada catatan yang diberikan oleh Monk Master.

column2: Report to Monk Master
column3: 몽크 마스터에게 보고
column4: Melapor kepada Monk Master

column2: You've successfully handed over the object to the person. Go back to Monk Master.
column3: 무사히 접선자에게 물건을 전달했습니다. 몽크 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Telah menyampaikan barang kepada perantara dengan sukses. Kembalilah pada Monk Master.

column2: Search the book of Pardoner Master
column3: 파드너 마스터의 장부 수색
column4: Mencari Pardoner Master's Ledger

column2: Pardoner Master told you that his book is ripped off so it can't be used. Go find the premiminary book which Pardoner Master has hidden at 35_3 of the monastery.
column3: 파드너 마스터는 자신이 가진 장부가 찢어져서 쓸 수 없게 되었다고 합니다. 수도원 35_3에 파드너 마스터가 숨겨둔 예비장부를 찾아와 주세요.
column4: Pardoner Master berkata Ledger yang dimiliki dirinya telah tersobek sehingga tidak dapat dipakai. Cobalah carikan Spare Ledger yang disembunyikan Pardoner Master di Monastery 35_3.

column2: You've found the book of Pardoner Master. Go back to Pardoner Master.
column3: 파드너 마스터의 장부를 찾았습니다. 파드너 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Telah menemukan Ledger Pardoner master. Kembalilah pada Pardoner Master.

column2: Collect the samples of Plant-type monsters
column3: 식문 몬스터의 샘플 수집
column4: Mengumpulkan sample monster tipe Plant

column2: Druid Master is researching on the over grown plants after Medzio Diena. To help him the research, defeat Plant-type monsters and collect the samples. You can get more samples as the monsters become stronger.
column3: 드루이드 마스터는 신수의 날 이후 과성장한 식물들에 대해 조사하고 있다고 합니다. 연구를 돕기 위해 식물형 몬스터를 처치하고 샘플을 모아오세요. 강한 몬스터일수록 더 많은 샘플을 얻을 수 있습니다.
column4: Druid Master berkata sedang menyelidiki tentang tanaman yang bertumbuh pesat setelah hari Medzio Diena. Untuk membantu penelitian, bunuhlah monster tipe Plant dan kumpulkanlah Samplenya. Semakin kuat monster maka bisa mendapatkan sample lebih banyak.

column2: Hand them over to Druid Master
column3: 드루이드 마스터에게 전달
column4: Menyampaikan kepada Druid Master

column2: You've collected enough Plant-type monsters' samples. Go back to Druid Master.
column3: 식물형 몬스터의 샘플을 충분히 모았습니다. 드루이드 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Telah cukup mengumpulkan sample dari monster tipe Plant. Kembalilah pada Druid Master.

column2: Set Romuva of Purification at 36_1 of Canyon Region
column3: 협곡지대 36_1에 정화의 로무바 설치
column4: Memasang Romuva Purification pada Canyon Area 36_1

column2: Oracle Master told you that the demonic energy is becoming stronger lately so his abilities are being disturbed. Set Romuva of Purification on 36_1 of Canyon Region where the demonic energy is strong so there's lots of distubances.
column3: 오라클 마스터는 최근 마기가 강해져서 자신의 능력이 방해받고 있다고 합니다. 특히 마기가 강해 방해가 심한 협곡지대 36_1에 가서 정화의 로무바를 설치하세요.
column4: Oracle Master berkata bahwa kekuatannya belakangan ini tertanggu karena kekuatan Demon Energy. Terutama pada Canyon area 36_1 kekuatan Demon Energy sungguh luar biasa, maka pergilah dan pasang Romuva Purication.

column2: Report to Oracle Master
column3: 오라클 마스터에게 보고
column4: Melapor kepada Oracle Master

column2: You've set up all Romuvas of Purification. Return to the Oracle Master.
column3: 정화의 로무바를 모두 설치했습니다. 오라클 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Telah memasang seluruh Romuva Purification. Kembalilah pada Oracle Master.

column2: Open the treasure chest
column3: 보물상자 열어 보기
column4: Mencoba membuka Treasure Box

column2: Defeat the monsters by avoiding the Petrifying Frost
column3: 석화서리를 피해 몬스터 처치
column4: Kalahkan Monster dengan menghindari Petrification Frost.

column2: As you opened the box, faint Petrifying Frost came out and the monsters around are rushing in! Avoid the Petrifying Frost and defeat all monsters.
column3: 상자를 열자 미약한 석화서리가 나오면서 주변의 몬스터까지 달려 듭니다! 석화서리를 피해서 몬스터를 모두 처치하세요.
column4: Setelah membuka Box, muncullah Petrification Frost dan monster di sekitar datang mengepung! Bunuhlah semua monster setelah menghindari Petrification Frost.

column2: Look at the pillar
column3: 기둥 살펴 보기
column4: Memeriksa Pillar

column2: As you entered Galeed Plateau, you see a lot of pillars. There is one pillar that looks special, so go take a look at it.
column3: 갈르엣 평야에 들어서자마자 보이는 것은 엄청난 수의 기둥입니다. 인상 깊어 보이는 기둥이 있으니 다가가 살펴 보세요.
column4: Setelah memasuki Galeed Plateau terlihat banyak sekali jumlah dari Pillar. Karena terlihat suatu Pillar yang menarik perhatian, coba hampir dan periksalah.

column2: Protect the pillar
column3: 기둥 지키기
column4: Menjaga Pillar

column2: The monsters are coming to attack the pillar! Protect it.
column3: 몬스터들이 몰려와서 기둥을 공격합니다! 기둥을 지키세요.
column4: Para Monster datang menyergap dan menyerang Pillar! Lindungilah Pillar.

column2: Brush off the powders off from the pillar
column3: 기둥에서 가루 털어내기
column4: Menyebarkan Powder pada Pillar

column2: Does this black dust look like food to the monsters? Is that why they came running? Mow that they're gone we should dust off the rest of the pillar.
column3: 몬스터들이 몰려 들었던 이유는 이 검은 가루가 먹이처럼 보였기 때문이었을까요? 몬스터들을 모두 물리쳤으니 기둥에 붙어 있던 검은 가루들을 모두 털어내 봅시다.
column4: Alasan para monster datang menyergap apakah karena bubuk hitam ini terlihat seperti makanan? Karena parah monster datang menyerbu, mari sebarkan semua bubuk hitam yang menempel.

column2: It is likely that there are more pillars with someone's records. Look at the pillar. You would be able to read the writings on the pillar even if it's dark if you have the crystals that illuminates a mysterious ray.
column3: 누군가의 기록이 담긴 기둥이 더 있을 것 같습니다. 기둥을 살펴 보세요. 기둥의 글귀는 신비한 빛을 내는 결정이 있다면 어두워도 읽을 수 있을 것입니다.
column4: Sepertinya ada pillar yang menyimpan catatan milik seseorang. Cobalah periksa pillar. Tulisan pada Pilar dapat terbaca walau gelap, jika ada Crystal yang memancarkan cahaya misterius.

column2: Collect Monster Oil
column3: 몬스터 기름 구하기
column4: Mendapatkan Monster Oil

column2: The crystal emanating the mysterious light requires monster oil to shine. Hunt monsters and collect monster oil.
column3: 신비한 빛을 내는 결정 충분한 빛을 내려면 몬스터 기름이 있어야 할 것 같습니다. 몬스터를 사냥하여 몬스터 기름을 모으세요.
column4: Jika ingin Crystal yang mengeluarkan cahaya misterius untuk mengeluarkan cahaya cukup, maka membutuhkan Monster Oil sepertiny. Kumpulkanlah Monster oil dengan menghabisi monster.

column2: Read the writings on the pillar
column3: 기둥에 새겨진 글귀 읽기
column4: Membaca tulisan yang terukir pada Pillar

column2: You have obtained the monster oil. Go back to the pillar with the crystal and use its light to see the writings on it.
column3: 몬스터 기름을 모두 모았습니다. 기둥으로 가져 가서 신비한 빛을 내는 결정의 빛으로 기둥에 새겨진 글귀를 읽어 봅시다.
column4: Telah mengumpulkan seluruh Monster Oil. Mari coba membaca tulisan yang terukir pada pillar dengan sinar yang dikeluarkan Crystal dengan membawanya ke Pillar.

column2: Defeat monsters to obtain Monster Oil
column3: 몬스터를 처치하여 몬스터 기름 획득
column4: Coba dapatkan Monster Oil dengan mengalahkan Monster.

column2: It seems that someone's records are present on other pillars. Look at the pillars.
column3: 다른 기둥에 누군가의 기록이 더 있을 것 같습니다. 기둥들을 살펴 보세요.
column4: Sepertinya terdapat catatan lainnya milik seseorang pada Pillar lainnya. Cobalah periksa pillar lainnya.

column2: Speak out the numbers
column3: 숫자 말하기
column4: Mengatakan angka

column2: The instructions seem to day that, if you speak out the numbers obtained at the Galeed Plateau, the writings on the pillar will become visible. Stand near the pillar and enter the numbers into the chat window. Obtain hints from colored pillars.
column3: 갈르엣 평야의 어딘가에서 얻은 힌트 숫자를 말하면 기둥의 글귀를 읽을 수 있다고 씌여 있는 것 같습니다. 기둥 가까이에서 채팅창에 숫자를 입력하세요. 특정 색상의 기둥에서 힌트를 얻을 수 있습니다.
column4: Jika mengatakan angka hint yang didapat dari suatu tempat di Galeed Plateau, maka dikatakan dapat menggunakan untuk membaca tulisan pada Pillar. Inputlah angka pada Chatting Window di dekat Pillar. Bisa mendapatkan Hint pada Pillar dengan warna khusus.

column2: The writings on the pillar are beginning to appear! Read them!
column3: 기둥에 뭔가 새겨져 있는 것이 보이기 시작했습니다! 읽어 보세요!
column4: Mulai terlihat sesuatu yang terukir pada Pillar! Cobalah membacanya!

column2: A pillar has appeared! Go have a look at it.
column3: 기둥이 나타난 듯 합니다! 다가가 살펴 보세요.
column4: Sepertinya Pillar telah muncul! Hampiri dan periksalah.

column2: Repair the pillar
column3: 기둥 보수 하기
column4: Memperbaiki Pillar

column2: You seem to need shining moss to read the writings on the summoning pillar. Go and gather some. Note that, if you don't come back within 5 minutes, you'll have to wait until it appears again, so hurry.
column3: 소환 기둥에 글귀를 읽으려면 빛나는 이끼가 필요할 것 같습니다. 주변에서 구해 보세요. 단, 5분 안에 돌아오지 않으면 기둥은 다음번 나타날 때 까지 기다려야 하니 서두르세요.
column4: Jika ingin membaca tulisan pada Summon Pilar, maka memerlukan Moss yang mengeluarkan cahaya. Cobalah dapatkan dari sekitar. Tetapi, jika tidak kembali dalam 5 menit, maka harus menunggu hingga pillar muncul di lain waktu, bergegaslah.

column2: Read the writings on the pillar
column3: 기둥의 글귀 읽기
column4: Membaca tulisan pada Pillar

column2: You should be able to read the pillar now. Go near it and have a look.
column3: 이제 기둥의 글귀를 읽을 수 있을 것 같습니다. 기둥으로 가서 읽어 보세요.
column4: Sekarang sepertinya dapat membaca tulisan pada Pillar. Cobalah membaca dengan pergi pada Pillar.

column2: It seems that there is another record on the other pillar which continues from this story. Look at the pillar closely.
column3: 다른 기둥에는 이 이야기에 이어지는 다른 기록이 또 있을 것 같습니다. 기둥을 살펴 보세요.
column4: Pada Pillar lainnya, sepertinya terdapat catatan lainnya yang berhubungan dengan cerita ini. Cobalah periksa pilar lainnya.

column2: Obtain Sticky Liquid
column3: 점성 있는 액체 구해 오기
column4: Mendapatkan Cairan yang lengket

column2: The pillar collapsed without even being touched.{nl}Collect some viscous liquid from monsters to repair the pillar.

column4: Pillar roboh walaupun tidak disentuh. Sepertinya harus memperbaiki Pillar, maka pergilah mencari cairan yang lengket dari Monster biasa.

column2: It seems that the pieces would fit well. Try putting them in. But, if you give up on a quest, the piece will disappear. When you go to the pillars when the pieces disappear, you will be able to obtain the pieces.

column4: Jika menyelipkan potongan pola yang dimiliki, sepertinya akan cocok. Cobalah selipkan potongan itu. Tetapi, Jika menyerah pada Quest, maka potongan pola akan hilang. Ketika potongan pola telah menghilang, maka bisa mendapatkan potongan pola kembali dengan pergi kembali ke pillar-pillar tersebut.

column3: 마군주 마르녹스 처치

column2: You have collected the stones!
column3: 돌을 채취했습니다!

column2: You obtained nothing
column3: 아무것도 얻지 못했습니다
column4: Tidak mendapatkan apapun juga.

column2: Can you hand over the records to Wilhelmina?{nl}She told me that she will help us break Gargoyle so don't forget to get something from her when you return.
