column4: {nl} Karena saya sedang menunggu kawan-kawan cobalah temui Brophen yang ada di Area nomor 2.{nl} Ia akan memberitahu kemana Romanas Mayor telah pergi.

column2: After Medzio Diena, there were no special signs until recently.{nl}Except for the people that came from far away or the people who have gone further to the south and came back after reaching the seas..
column3: 신수의 날 이후, 얼마 전까진 마을엔 별다른 징후가 없었습니다.{nl}먼 곳에서 피난 오는 사람들이나 더 남쪽으로 도망치다가 바다에 다다라 다시 돌아오는 사람들 말곤요..
column4: Setelah hari Medzio Diena, tidak ada pertanda apapun yang berbeda di desa sampai beberapa waktu lalu.{nl} Orang yang menghindar dari tempat jauh, atau yang lari dari arah selatan lalu kembali lagi ke lautan..

column2: Thank you so much for helping me!{nl}I was almost buried here.
column3: 도와주셔서 정말 감사합니다!{nl}하마터면 여기에 묻힐뻔 했습니다.
column4: Terima kasih telah membantu!{nl} Hampir saja saya terkubur disini.

column2: {nl}How could he tell us to wait for the settlers in this dangerous place..{nl}When the families arrive, I guess I should move to another place..
column3: {nl}이런 위험한 곳에 이주민들을 기다리라고 하다니..{nl}가족들이 도착하면 다른 곳으로 이동해야 겠습니다..
column4: {nl}Menunggu para imigran di tempat berbahaya seperti ini..{nl} Jika anggota keluarga tiba, maka harus bergerak ke tempat lainnya..

column2: It seems that you've leveled up while fighting against Kepas.{nl}The ones who come from outside learn everything fast.{nl}I envy your pace of learning.
column3: 방금 케파들을 상대하시면서 레벨업을 하신 것 같습니다.{nl}외지에서 오신 분들은 뭐든지 빠르게 습득하시는군요.{nl}그렇게 빨리 강해지는 게 부럽습니다.
column4: Jika barusan kamu menghadapi Kepa, seharusnya telah naik level.{nl} Orang-orang yang datang dari area luar cepat mempelajari apapun rupanya.{nl} Iri rasanya melihat orang cepat menjadi kuat seperti itu.

column2: {nl}{nl}If you have leveled up, you can become stronger by selecting one of the status.{nl}Do you want to check it now?
column3: {nl}{nl}레벨 업을 했다면 한 가지 스테이터스를 선택해서 더욱 강해질 수 있습니다.{nl}지금 확인해 보시겠습니까?
column4: {nl}{nl}Jika telah naik level, pilihlah satu buah status, sehingga dapat menjadi lebih kuat.{nl} Maukah kamu coba memeriksanya sekarang?

column2: That was a good selection.{nl}You can select a status as you level up.{nl}I hope you make a cautious decision.
column3: 훌륭한 선택입니다.{nl}레벨업을 할 때마다 스테이터스를 선택하실 수 있을 겁니다.{nl}신중한 선택을 하시기 바랍니다.
column4: Pilihan yang luar biasa.{nl} Setiap naik level, maka dapat memilih Status.{nl} Semoga bijak dalam melakukan pemilihan.

column2: Are you looking for Romanas Elder?{nl}The elder has left to the camp direction with Reila.{nl}If you are gonna go to the camp, can you please pss this ointment?{nl}I almost died so I think I need to take some rest.
column3: 로마나스 촌장님을 찾고 계시다구요?{nl}촌장님이라면 아까 레일라와 함께 캠프 방향으로 가셨습니다.{nl}캠프로 가실 예정이라면 레일라에게 이 풀 잎 연고를 전해주실 수 있겠습니까?{nl}방금 죽을 고비를 넘겨서 다리가 후들거려서 저는 잠시 쉬어야할 것 같습니다.
column4: Kamu sedang mencari Romanas Mayor katamu?{nl} Mayor tadi pergi bersama dengan Layla ke arah Camp.{nl} Jika kamu berencana pergi ke Camp, bisakah kau menyampaikan Grass Leaf Cream kepada Layla?{nl} Karena saya masih bergetar setelah melewati krisis akan kematian, sepertinya saya harus beristirahat sebentar.

column2: I heard that the small village which is across the river turned into a ruin.{nl}If the lord didn't order us to move out, we would have been in danger as well.
column3: 이곳으로 오면서 들은 이야긴데 마을 강 건너편에 있던 작은 마을이 몬스터들 때문에 폐허가 되었다고 하더군요.{nl}영주님이 이주령을 내리지 않았다면 우리 마을도 위험했을 겁니다.
column4: Ketika datang ke tempat ini, cerita yang kudengar adalah desa kecil yang ada di seberang sungai desa hancur karena para monster.{nl} Jika Land Lord tidak memberikan perintah untuk berpindah, maka desa kami pun juga berada dalam bahaya.

column2: This is the ointment which Bropen was going to bring.{nl}Have you brought it on behalf of Bropen? Thank you so much.{nl}Romanas elder has left to the camp district.{nl}I was waiting for Bropen.
column3: 이건 브로펜이 가져다 주기로한 연고군요.{nl}브로펜 대신 가져다 주신건가요? 정말 감사합니다.{nl}로마나스 촌장님은 캠프지역으로 가셨어요.{nl}저는 브로펜을 기다리고 있었답니다.
column4: Ini adalah Grass Leaf Cream yang dijanjikan oleh Brophen.{nl} Maukah kamu membawakannya sebagai ganti dari Brophen? Terima kasih banyak.{nl} Romanas Mayor telah pergi ke Camp Area.{nl} Aku tadinya sedang menunggu Brophen.

column2: {nl}If you've leveled up, please use the skill points.{nl}When you use the skill points, you may obtain the new skills or enhance the existing skills!
column3: {nl}아참, 레벨업 하셨으면 스킬 포인트를 사용해 보세요.{nl}스킬 포인트를 사용하면 새로운 스킬을 얻거나 기존 스킬을 강화하실 수 있어요!
column4: {nl}Aduh, Kalau sudah naik level, cobalah gunakan Skill Point.{nl} Jika menggunakan Skill Point, dapat memperkuat skill yang ada atau mendapat skill baru!

column2: So you are coming? You've done well to help the villagers.{nl}I am gonna go to Orsha soon to meet the lord. Where are you going?{nl}There are no villages except for Orsha and Klaipeda which the adventurers are likely to visit at the southern part of the kingdom.{nl}If you are gonna go for a long journey, it would not be bad to stop by at Orsha and meet the lord.
column3: 이제 오는가? 마을 사람들을 도와주고 오느라 고생이 많았네.{nl}나는 곧 영주님을 만나러 오르샤로 들어간다네 자네는 어디로 가는가?{nl}왕국의 남부에 모험가들이 들릴만한 마을은 이제 저 오르샤와 클라페다 말곤 없다네{nl}먼 길을 여행할 예정이라면 오르샤에 들려서 영주님을 뵙고 가는 것도 나쁘지 않을 걸세
column4: Kau baru datang sekarang? Terima kasih banyak karena telah datang setelah membantu orang-orang desa.{nl} Aku akan kembali dari Orsha untuk untuk bertemu dengan Land Lord, kau akan pergi kemana?{nl} Tidak ada tempat di selatan kerajaan yang layak untuk para petualang, kecuali Orsha dan Klaipeda{nl} Jika ingin melakukan perjalanan panjang, sepertinya tidaklah buruk jika menemui Land Lord di Orsha

column2: {nl}I am sorry, but if you are not busy, I want you to help the settlers.
column3: {nl}누차 염치없이 말하네만, 자네가 바쁘지 않다면 이주민들을 좀 더 도와주면 좋겠네.
column4: {nl}Lagi lagi tanpa rasa bersalah berbicara, jika kamu tidak sibuk alangkah baiknya jika sedikit membantu para imigran.

column2: I heard someone is helping the settlers and it's you!{nl}On behalf of the elder, I really appreciate you.
column3: 이주민들을 도와주는 사람이 있다고 들었는데 바로 당신이군요!{nl}영주님을 대신하여 정말 감사드립니다.
column4: Aku mendengar ada orang yang membantu para imigran ini, ternyata itu adalah kau rupanya!{nl} Kuucapkan terima kasih banyak sebagai ganti dari Land Lord.

column2: {nl}Are you going to stop at Orsha?{nl}But, as you can see, I am little busy.{nl}If you can wait a bit, I will help you after helping these people.
column3: {nl}오르샤에 들리실 예정이신 거죠?{nl}하지만 보시는 것처럼 제가 조금 바쁘군요.{nl}잠시만 기다려주시면 이 사람들 수속을 마치고 바로 편의를 봐드리겠습니다.
column4: {nl}Kau berencana untuk pergi ke Orsha kan?{nl} Tetapi seperti yang kau lihat, saya sekarang sedikit sibuk.{nl} jika kamu menunggu sebentar, setelah prosedur orang-orang ini selesai, maka akan segera kubantu anda.

column2: The story that the villages across the rivers, the fields and the mountains were stepped on by the monsters spreaded quickly..{nl}I've persuaded people that the soldiers would come and help us from Orsha, but as the story that the village right beside was attacked by the monsters spreaded, I couldn't reduce people's agitation.
column3: 강 건너, 들 건너, 산 너머 마을들이 몬스터들에게 짓밟혔다는 이야기가 삽시간에 퍼졌다네..{nl}오르샤에서 군인들이 우릴 도우러 올거라고 사람들을 타일렀지만 바로 옆 마을이 몬스터들에게 당했다는 소식이 전해지자 사람들의 동요 억누를 수 없었다네.
column4: Cerita telah tersebar dalam sekejap kepada para monster  pada desa yang menyebrangi sungai, menyebrangi lapangan, melewati gunung ..{nl} Ada cerita bahwa para tentara akan datang membantu kami di Orsha, tetapi ketika berita bahwa desa yang berada sebelah mengalami serangan monster tersampaikan, sulit untuk mengatur gejolak orang-orang.

column2: {nl}I thought the goddesses abondoned us. I was going to move the people to Klaipeda.{nl}At then, they ordered people to move on the land where the lord survived..{nl}The damages were too severe. He should've called us sooner..
column3: {nl}여신이 우릴 버렸다고 생각했지. 나는 사람들을 클라페다로 피난시키려고 했다네{nl}그때 영주님이 살아남은 마을에 이주령을 내렸다네..{nl}너무 피해가 컸어 더 빨리 불러주셨어야 했는데..
column4: {nl}Goddess telah dianggap mengabaikan kita. Aku awalnya bermaksud untuk mengevakuasi orang-orang ke Klaipeda{nl} Pada saat itu Land Lord memberikan perintah untuk berpindah ke desa yang bertahan..{nl} Karena kerusakan sungguh parah, seharusnya memberitahukan lebih cepat ya..

column2: It's so hard for me to do this whole day.{nl}It may rather be better to follow the monsters like the soldiers.{nl}I want to help you... but, please also think about my situation.{nl}If I let you in first, they will be angry.{nl}
column3: 하루 종일 이 일을 하는 것도 꽤 힘듭니다.{nl}차라리 병사들처럼 몬스터나 좇아다니는 게 나을지도 모르겠어요.{nl}바로 편의를 봐드리고 싶지만.. 제 사정도 좀 봐주십시오.{nl}당신을 여기서 먼저 들여보내면 저 사람들이 불같이 화를 낼겁니다.{nl}
column4: Melakukan pekerjaan ini seharian cukup melelahkan.{nl} Entah apakah mungkin lebih baik seperti para pasukan yang mengejar monster seharian.{nl} aku ingin segera mengakomodasikannya.. tetapi coba lihatlah sedikit prosesnya.{nl} Jika aku memasukkan kamu terlebih dulu, maka orang-orang itu akan marah besar.{nl}

column2: I will cancel my words that I would follow the monsters like the soldiers a while ago.{nl}Even when we have more than 10 lives, it would not be enough.{nl}Because of you, I was able to block the monsters from going into Orsha.{nl}It was a substitution time, so I almost fell into danger.
column3: 제가 아까 병사들처럼 몬스터 좇아다니겠다고 한 말은 취소하겠습니다.{nl}목숨이 열 개라도 모자르겠군요.{nl}당신 덕에 오르샤로 몬스터가 몰려들어가는 걸 막을 수 있었습니다.{nl}교대 시간이라 병사들도 없었는 데, 큰일 날 뻔했군요.
column4: Saya membatalkan perkataan saya sebelumnya, yaitu akan mengear para monster berkeliling seperti pasukan.{nl} Sepertinya nyawa itu kurang walaupun memiliki 10 buah.{nl} Berkat anda, kita berhasil menghalangi para monster yang datang menyerbu ke Orsha.{nl} Hampir saja terjadi masalah besar, karena pada waktu pergantian Shift tidak ada pasukan sama sekali.

column2: The settlers who were registering all ran away.. we will be free for some time.{nl}You are welcomed to go into Orsha.{nl}The lord is very strong and cold.{nl}Please go in front of the lord castle at the central square of Orsha.
column3: 수속 중이던 이주민들도 모두 도망쳐버렸고.. 한동안 한가하겠군요.{nl}바로 오르샤로 들어가셔도 좋습니다.{nl}영주님은 강인하고 냉철한 분입니다.{nl}오르샤 중앙광장의 영주성 앞으로 가보십시오.
column4: Para imigran yang sedang dalam proses, telah melarikan diri semuanya.. Sehingga menjadi luang sementara waktu.{nl} Alangkah baiknya jika segera kembali ke Orsha.{nl} Land Lord adalah orang yang penyabar dan k uat.{nl} Cobalah pergi ke depan Mid Plaza Lord Castle di Orsha .

column2: The settlers who have travelled for many days are trembling in anxiety.{nl}Most of them didn't get to see Orsha.{nl}They must have thought that the castle fortress which they heard from a rumor would protect them safely..{nl}You would know when you enter it, it has changed a lot since Medzio Diena..
column3: 며칠 밤낮을 여행한 이주민들이 오르샤를 보고 불안에 떨고 있습니다.{nl}그들 대부분이 태어나서 오르샤를 볼 일이 없었습니다.{nl}소문으로만 듣던 으리으리한 성채가 자신들을 안전하게 보호해줄거라고 생각했을 탠데..{nl}들어가 보시면 알겠지만 신수의 날 이후로 많이 변했습니다..
column4: Para imigran yang berkelana pagi siang malam berhari-hari, gemetar tidak tenang melihat Orsha.{nl} Mereka sebagian besar terlahir dan tidak memiliki kesempatan datang ke Orsha.{nl} Mereka padahal telah berpikir seperti rumor yang terdengar, bahwa terdapat Castle besar yang dalam melindungi diri mereka dengan aman..{nl} Jika coba memasukinya maka akan mengetahui, bahwa banyak yang telah berubah setelah hari Medzio Diena.

column2: I am Innessa Hemandale who is controlling Orsha.{nl}Thank you for helping our citizens.
column3: 저는 이 오르샤를 다스리는 영주 이네사 해먼데일 입니다.{nl}제 영주민들을 도와주셔서 감사합니다.
column4: Saya adalah Inesa Hamondale, Land Lord yang memerintah Orsha.{nl} Terima kasih karena telah membantu para pendudukku.

column2: We are recovering Orsha as you can see.{nl}With the soldiers we have at the moment, it is hard for us to protect Orsha.{nl}That's why we are moving all setters who have survived to Orsha even if that means we are going to have hard time for several years.{nl}
column3: 오르샤는 보시는 것처럼 재건 중입니다.{nl}지금의 병력으로는 오르샤를 방어하기도 힘든 실정입니다.{nl}그래서 몇 년 고생할 대비를 하고 살아남은 영주민들을 모두 오르샤로 이주시키는 중입니다.{nl}
column4: Orsha sedang dalam rekonstruksi ulang seperti yang kamu lihat.{nl} Dengan kekuatan pasukan sekarang, sulit rasanya untuk mempertahankan Orsha.{nl} Maka dari itu saya sedang memindahkan seluruh penduduk yang tersisa ke Orsha untuk menghadapi kesulitan beberapa tahun ke depan.{nl}

column2: The world turned wild, but neither the military nor the king protected us.{nl}You are the one who are helping the settlers right?{nl}Although, I am not competent enough, I am sure the goddesses want me to help you as well.
column3: 세상이 험난해졌지만 군대도 왕도 우릴 지켜주지 않았어요{nl}이주민들을 도와주고 다니시는 분이 당신이시죠?{nl}보잘것 없는 실력이지만 여신께서도 당신을 돕길 바랄거에요
column4: Dunia menjadi semakin sulit, tetapi tentara dan rajapun tidaklah melindungi kami{nl} Orang yang berkeliling membantu para imigran adalah kamu bukan?{nl} Walaupun sepele, kuharap Goddess membantu kamu juga

column2: {nl}I want to make a medicine that would work well on your wounds.{nl}If you could collect Red Leaves from the 1st district, I will make the medicine using those!
column3: {nl}당신에게 상처에 잘 듣는 약을 만들어 주고 싶어요.{nl}1번 지역에서 연붉은 잎사귀를 모아와 주시면 그걸 사용해서 만들어 드릴게요!
column4: {nl}Aku ingin membuat obat yang ampuh untuk luka untuk anda.{nl} Kumpulkanlah Soft Red Leaf di area 1, maka akan kubuatkan obat menggunakan itu!

column2: I am not the settler who Romanas Elder has brought.{nl}I am a person from the village that turned into a ruin recently.{nl}The hunters told us that they've discovered the monsters, but the lord didn't send us the squad.{nl}When my family and I ran away from the village, a messenger of the lord came and told us to move to Orsha.
column3: 저는 로마나스 촌장님이 데리고 온 이주민이 아니에요.{nl}얼마 전에 폐허가된 건너마을 사람이죠.{nl}마을 사냥꾼들이 몬스터들을 발견했다고 했지만 영주님은 군대를 보내주지 않았어요.{nl}저와 제 가족들이 마을에서 도망쳐 나올 때 영주님의 연락병이 와서 오르샤로 이주하라고 하더군요.
column4: Saya bukan Immigran yang dibawa oleh Mayor Romanas.{nl} Saya adalah orang desa seberang yang dihancurkan beberapa waktu lalu.{nl} Para pemburu desa berkata telah menemukan monster-monster, tetapi Land Lord tidaklah mengirimkan pasukannya.{nl} Ketika saya dan anggota keluarga lari dari desa, pasukan Land Lord datang dan memerintahkan untuk berpindah ke Orsha.

column2: {nl}{nl}It would've been better if he had told us little sooner..{nl}We don't have any house, field or trees.{nl}What should we do to live on now..
column3: {nl}{nl}조금만 더 빨리 말해줬다면 좋았을 탠데..{nl}이제 집도 밭도 과일 나무 한 그루도 없어요.{nl}이제 우린 뭘 먹고 살아야할까요..
column4: {nl}{nl} Alangkah baiknya jika saja berbicara sedikit lebih cepat..{nl} Sekarang tidak tersisa apapun baik ladang maupun pohon buah.{nl} Bagaimana kami harus bertahan hidup sekarang..

column2: With this much amount, we would be able to make the medicine.
column3: 이정도면 충분히 치료약을 만들 수 있겠어요.
column4: Jika sebanyak ini, maka dapat membuat cukup banyak obat penyembuhan.

column2: {nl}Take it.{nl}Thank you for helping the settlers.
column3: {nl}자 가져가세요.{nl}이주민들을 도와주셔서 감사합니다.
column4: {nl}Nah bawalah ini.{nl} Terima kasih telah membantu para imigran.

column2: The settlers who've survived are coming here.{nl}They are all exhausted since they ran away for several days.{nl}I am making an invigorating drink for them.
column3: 살아남은 이주민들이 이곳으로 속속 모여들고 있어요.{nl}모두들 며칠 밤낮을 도망쳐오느라 많이 지쳐있어요.{nl}저는 그들을 위해서 피로 회복제를 만들어 주고 있어요.
column4: Para imigran yang bertahan hidup, sedang berkumpul perlahan lahan di tempat ini.{nl} Karena mereka semua melarikan diri siang dan malam beberapa hari, mereka sungguh kelelahan.{nl} Saya sedang membuat obat untuk memulihkan kelelahan bagi mereka itu.

column2: {nl}You would probably need it.{nl}If you could defeat the monsters at the 2nd district and get me Lempar mucus,{nl}I will make you an invigorating drink with that.
column3: {nl}당신도 아마 필요하실 거에요.{nl}2번 지역에서 몬스터들을 처치하고 렘파르 점액을 구해오시면{nl}그걸로 피로 회복제를 만들어 드릴게요.
column4: {nl}Mungkin kamu juga membutuhkannya.{nl} Jika kamu mencarikan Rampar Mucus dengan membunuh para monster di Area 2{nl} Akan kubuatkan fatigue recovery potion dengan itu.

column2: I guess the lord had some different idea, but I don't know why he didn't order to move out sooner..{nl}Maybe the messenger was not diligent enough.{nl}I have lots of things to ask if I meet the lord.
column3: 영주님도 생각이 있으셔서 그랬겠지만 왜 더 빨리 이주령을 전파하지 않으셨을까요..{nl}혹시 연락병이 게으름을 피운건 아닐까요?{nl}영주님을 뵙게되면 물어보고 싶은게 많아요.
column4: Land Lord pasti mempertimbangkan sesuatu, sehingga tidak menurunkan perintah untuk berpindah lebih cepat begitu saja kan..{nl} Apakah mungkin pasukan pembawa pesan bermalas-malasan waktu itu?{nl} Jika bertemu Land Lord, ada banyak hal yang ingin kutanyakan.

column2: I think we have enough Lempar muscus.
column3: 렘파르 점액은 이정도면 충분해요.
column4: Dengan Rampar Mucus sebanyak ini, sudah cukup rasanya.

column2: {nl}Okay. Please take this.{nl}May the goddesses protect you in your journey..
column3: {nl}자 이제 이걸 가지고 가세요.{nl}당신의 여정에 여신의 가호가 함께하길..
column4: {nl}Nah bawalah ini.{nl} Semoga berkat Goddess bersama dengan perjalanan anda..

column2: You haven't seen the people wander around this forest?{nl}Even after what the lord told us{nl}when the monsters intruded into our village, we all scattered to survive.
column3: 혹시 이주변 숲에서 사람들이 헤매는 걸 못 보셨나요?{nl}촌장님이 오르샤로 도망치라는 외마디 비명소리를 뒤로하고{nl}우리 마을 사람들은 몬스터들이 마을로 쳐들어온 그 순간 살기 위해 뿔뿔히 흩어졌어요.
column4: Apakah kamu melihat orang yang tersesat di sekitar hutan ini?{nl} Aku hanya mendengar Mayor berteriak menyuruh untuk melarikan diri ke Orsha{nl} Orang-orang desa kami terpencar masing-masing untuk menyelamatkan diri, saat para monster datang menyerbu ke desa.

column2: {nl}It is now time for everyone to come by now, but I think they lost their way in the forest.{nl}I am sorry, but can you light up the bonfire at the 3rd district to help the ones who lost their ways in the forest?{nl}
column3: {nl}아무리 늦어도 지금쯤이면 다들 올 때가 됐는데 아마도 숲 속에서 길을 잃은 것 같아요.{nl}죄송하지만 3번 지역에서 모닥불을 피워서 숲 속에서 길을 잃은 사람들이 모닥불의 연기를 보고 이 곳으로 올 수 있도록 도와주실 수 있으신가요?{nl}
column4: {nl}Seberapa telatpun sekarang ini seharusnya mereka sudah datang, mungkin juga mereka tersesat di dalam hutan.{nl} Mohon maaf, tetapi maukah kamu membantu untuk membakar bonfire di area 3, supaya asap yang dihasilkannya dapat mengarahkan mereka yang tersesat agar dapat datang ke tempat ini?{nl}

column2: I've met some people here. {nl}No one saw the elder.
column3: 몇 명은 이곳에서 만났어요. {nl}아무도 촌장님을 본 사람은 없더군요..
column4: Aku telah bertemu dengan beberapa orang di tempat ini. {nl} Tidak ada seorang pun yang melihat Mayor..

column2: Thank you so much!{nl}The people who you've guided through the bonfire are resting at the safe area.{nl}Thank you so much.
column3: 정말 감사합니다!{nl}당신이 모닥불로 인도해준 사람들은 지금 안전한 곳에서 쉬고 있어요.{nl}정말 감사합니다.
column4: Terima kasih banyak!{nl} Orang-orang yang kamu arahkan dengan Bonfire, sekarang sedang beristirahat di tempat yang aman.{nl} Terima kasih banyak.

column2: I am counting the number of people and it seems that not even half of them has arrived here.{nl}Lots of people are still wandering the forest.{nl}I think I should make a smoke with a bigger bonfire.
column3: 지금까지 사람들의 머릿수를 세어보니 채 반도 안 되는 사람들이 이곳에 도착한 것 같아요.{nl}아직도 많은 사람들이 숲 속에서 헤매고 있는 것 같아요.{nl}좀 더 커다란 모닥불로 연기를 내야할 것 같아요.
column4: Jika menghitung jumlah mereka yang sampai disini, tidak sampai setengah yang telah tiba.{nl} Sepertinya masih banyak orang masih tersesat di dalam hutan.{nl} Sepertinya perlu untuk membuat asap yang lebih besar lagi dengan Bonfire.

column2: {nl}For the settlers at the 4th district, I want you to light up the fire on the woods which Lutas prepared.{nl}With that, you would be able to see through the leaves.{nl}I am counting on you!
column3: {nl}4번 지역에 이주민들을 위해 류타스씨가 준비해둔 장작더미에 불을 붙여주세요.{nl}그거라면 숲의 어디에서건 나뭇잎사이로 볼 수 있을 거에요.{nl}부탁드립니다!
column4: {nl} Untuk para Imigran di area 4, tolong nyalakan api pada tumpukan kau bakar yang telah disiapkan oleh Lutas.{nl} Itu bisa kau temukan diantara pohon dan daun di hutan.{nl} Mohon bantuannya!

column2: According to what Lutas told us, we can't just let in lots of settlers into Orsha{nl}so we've set up various small camps around the outer wall of Orsha and supporting the settlers.{nl}The bonfires which you've lit up are to support the settlers.
column3: 관리관 류타스씨 말로는 많은 수의 이주민들을 오르샤로 무조건 들여보낼 수 없어서{nl}오르샤 외곽에 이렇게 자그마한 캠프를 여러개 조성해서 이주민들을 지원하고 있다고 해요.{nl}당신이 켜고 다닌 모닥불도 원래 그런 용도구요.
column4: Menurut kata Officer Lutas, tidak dapat mengirimkan para imigran dalam jumlah banyak ke Orsha{nl} Pada tembok perbatasan luar Orsha, katanya mereka menyediakan bantuan dengan mendirikan beberapa buah camp yang kecil.{nl} Sebenarnya fungsi awal dari Bonfire yang kamu nyalakan adalah seperti itu.

column2: There was a big disturbance. You are not hurt anywhere?{nl}I am sorry that I've put you in this mess.
column3: 큰 소란이 있던데 어디 다치신 곳은 없나요?{nl}이런 일이 휘말리게 해서 정말 죄송합니다.
column4: Katanya tadi terdapat keributan besar, apakah kamu baik-baik saja?{nl} Maaf telah membuat kamu turut campur pada hal seperti ini.

column2: {nl}This is so horrible. Those gigantic monsters are wandering in the forest.{nl}We have nothing that we can do to the settlers in the forest..
column3: {nl}정말 끔찍하네요. 저런 거대 괴물들이 숲 속에 돌아다니고 있는데{nl}우리가 숲 속의 이주민들에게 해줄 수 있는 게 없다니..
column4: {nl}Sungguh mengerikan. Para monster raksasa sebesar itu sedang berkeliling di dalam hutan{nl} Tiada yang bisa kita lakukan untuk para imigran di dalam hutan itu..

column2: I haven't seen you before. Are you the officer in Orsha?
column3: 못 보던 얼굴인데 당신도 오르샤 관리관이요?
column4: Muka kamu tidak pernah kulihat, apakah kamu juga petugas dari Orsha?

column2: {nl}Ah.. damn. I've made a big mistake.{nl}I am called Ibanayu from the southern coast.{nl}I heard that there are lots of supplies and we will be protected safely here so I've ran here without sleeping while leaving the village in the south..
column3: {nl}아 이런, 실례를 저질렀군요.{nl}저는 남쪽 해안가에서 올라온 이바나유라고 합니다.{nl}여기 오면 물자도 많고 우릴 안전하게 지켜줄거라고 해서 멀쩡한 남쪽 마을을 놔두고 밤낮으로 이곳으로 달려왔건만..
column4: {nl}Ah ini, telah berlaku kasar rupanya.{nl} Nama saya adalah Ivanayu yang datang dari Southern Shoreline.{nl} Disini katanya kami akan dilindungi dengan aman dan banyak tersedia barang persediaan, sehingga saya meninggalkan desa, dan berlari pagi siang malam untuk sampai kesini..

column2: {nl}As you can see, what's prepared for us is the bonfire and a few lumps of grass.{nl}Also we don't have enough officers who would protect us..
column3: {nl}보시다시피 우릴 위해 준비된거라곤 모닥불이랑 풀떼기 몇 줌이 전부 입니다.{nl}게다가 여기서 우릴 도와줄 병사도 관리도 턱없이 부족하지..
column4: {nl}Seperti yang kamu lihat, mereka telah menyiapkan bahan makanan dan bonfire untuk kami.{nl} Ditambah lagi disini kekurangan pasukan dan petugas untuk membantu kami..

column2: {nl}{nl}What we can do is that we can pick up the goods which the natives had used and left and use them to obtain the food.{nl}Can you collect those from the 5th district?{nl}I heard that if we leave this place, the monsters would go crazy so people like us can't walk around.
column3: {nl}{nl}별 수 없이 우리가 할 수 있는 거라곤 원주민들이 쓰다 버리고간 물건을 주워서 입에 풀칠이나 하는 겁니다.{nl}5번 지역에서 그것들을 좀 모아다 줄 수 있습니까?{nl}듣자하니 여길 벗어나면 몬스터들이 창궐해서 도무지 우리같은 사람들을 돌아다닐 수가 없다고 합니다.
column4: {nl}{nl} Tak terhitung jumlahnya, yang bisa kami lakukan adalah mengambil barang yang dipakai oleh penduduk setempat, lalu memasukkannya ke mulut.{nl} Bisakah kamu mengumpulkan benda-benda itu di area 5?{nl} Jadi orang-orang biasa seperti kami, tidak dapat pergi berkeliaran sembarangan karena banyak monster yang kuat di sekeliling.

column2: The south coast also received some damages.{nl}The fruits that came down from the river at the north destroyed all the fishing nets{nl}and due to the fruit juice that spurted out from the fruits, I've just kept seeing the sea which turned colorful.{nl}At least, the south was okay since there were no monsters there..
column3: 남쪽 해안도 피해가 있긴 마찮가지 입니다.{nl}북쪽 강가에서 떠내려오는 거대한 과일들이 어망을 모두 박살내 놨고{nl}그 과일에서 터진 과즙 때문에 알록달록해진 바닷가를 하염없이 바라만 봤습니다.{nl}그래도 남쪽은 몬스터가 없었으니 버틸만 했죠..
column4: Kerusakan di Southern Shoreline sama besarnya juga.{nl}Buah raksasa yang terjatuh dan mengalir dari Northern Riverside, menghantam seluruh jaring ikan{nl} Juice yang keluar dari buah yang meledak itu mengotori lautan, dan kami hanya bisa terbengong menatapi hal itu saja.{nl} Walau begitu karena di daerah selatan tidak ada monster, yang perlu dilakukan adalah bertahan saja kan..

column2: I will use them well. Since people are still coming up from the two villages at the southern coast,{nl}I will pass the story about you well if I meet the lord.
column3: 잘 쓰겠습니다. 아직 남쪽 해안 마을 두 곳에서 사람들이 올라오고 있으니{nl}우리 마을 촌장님을 만나면 당신 이야기도 해두겠습니다.
column4: Akan saya gunakan dengan baik. Karena masih banyak orang yang datang dari dua desa di Southern Shoreline{nl} Jika kami bertemu dengan Village mayor, kami akan membericarakan tentangmu juga.

column2: You look very different to be called as a settler..{nl}The people around Orsha do not wear clothes like that.{nl}Are you a traveler?
column3: 당신은 이주민이라고 보기엔 어딘가 많이 다르군요..{nl}오르샤 주변 사람들은 그런 옷 안 입고 다니거든요.{nl}혹시 여행자십니까?
column4: Kamu tidak tampak seperti Imigran..{nl} Orang-orang dari sekitar Orsha, tidak berpakaian seperti itu.{nl} Mungkinkah kamu seorang petualang?

column2: {nl}If that's so, why don't you pray in front of the statue of Zemyna Goddess at the 6th district?{nl}Zemyna Goddess controls the land and she also takes care of the travel roads of the travelers.{nl}But, the goddess is not responding to our prayer from sometime.
column3: {nl}그렇다면 6번 지역에 있는 제미나 여신상에게 경배를 올려보는 게 어떻습니까?{nl}제미나 여신은 땅을 관장하는 여신으로 여행자들의 여행길을 돌보는 자애로운 여신이십니다.{nl}물론 어느날 부터인가 우리 기도에 응답해주지 않으셨지만요.
column4: {nl}Kalau begitu, bagaimana jika kamu pergi ke area 6 dan melakukan penghormatan kepada Zemyna Goddess Statue?{nl} Zemyna Goddess dikenal sebagai Goddess yang memberkati perjalanan para penjelajah agar selamat sampai tujuan.{nl} Walaupun sejak suatu hari dahulu, Goddess  mulai mengabaikan doa kami.

column2: I don't know who has set up so many statues of the goddess.{nl}But, as I hear it, it's very old.{nl}So they either break up or become monsters' habitats..{nl}and there are also cases which monsters go into the statues of the goddesses.
column3: 여신상은 누가 그렇게 많이 세워뒀는지 저도 잘 모릅니다.{nl}듣기론 아주 오래되었다고 하더군요.{nl}그래서 망가지거나 몬스터들의 서식지가 되거나..{nl}혹은 몬스터가 여신상에 깃드는 일도 있다고 합니다.
column4: Entah siapa yang telah banyak mendirikan patung Goddess sebanyak itu.{nl} Yang kudengar itu sudah terjadi sejak lama.{nl} Maka dari itu ada kejadian dimana patung itu rusak, atau menjadi tempat habitat para monster..{nl} atau monster menyusupi patung tersebut katanya.

column2: {nl}Of course, you don't have to believe it..
column3: {nl}물론 믿거나 말거나입니다만..
column4: {nl}Tentu saja percaya atau tidak, itu terserah anda..

column2: Have you been to 7th district? The elder asked us to meet at the 7th district when we arrive at Lemprasa Pond, but we can't go due to the monsters..{nl}In order to prevent it from getting stolen from the settlers, we should go there first.{nl}But, I can't do that with my skills.
column3: 혹시 7번 지역에 가봤습니까? 마을을 떠나기 전에 촌장님이 렘파라사 연못에 도착하면 7번 지역에서 만나자고 했는데 몬스터 때문에 갈 수가 있어야지요..{nl}다른 마을 이주민들에게 빼앗기지 않으려면 우리가 먼저 가서 눌러 앉아야하는데{nl}제 실력으론 그럴 수가 없군요.
column4: Apakah kamu pernah pergi ke area 7? Sebelum meninggalkan desa, aku mengajak untuk bertemu di area 7 jika Mayor tiba di Lemprasa Pond, walaupun ada banyak monster disana..{nl} Seharusnya kami pergi terlebih dahulu menduduki desa lainnya, jika tidak ingin direbut dari para Imigran{nl} Tetapi rasanya tidak memungkinkan dengan kemampuan saya.

column2: {nl}If monsters appear around there, can you please defeat them?{nl}When the elder come, I will tell him about you for sure.
column3: {nl}혹시 그 근처에 몬스터가 있다면 좀 해치워 주실 수 있습니까?{nl}촌장님이 오시면 제가 꼭 당신 이야기를 해드리지요.
column4: {nl} Jika ada monster di sekitar situ, maukah kamu menghabisinya sekalian?{nl} Saya pasti akan membicarakan tentang kamu jika Mayor sudah tiba.

column2: Due to the order to move out, I abondoned my house and blamed a lot{nl}But, after I heard about the situation at the north, I stopped thinking about that.{nl}I hope the village would be safe until the order gets lifted.{nl}The elders left here since they said they can't leave the village.
column3: 이주령 때문에 집을 버리고 오면서 처음엔 원망도 많이 했지만{nl}여기 와서 북쪽 마을 상황을 들으니 그 생각이 접히더군요.{nl}이주령이 해제될 때까지 마을이 무사했으면 좋겠습니다.{nl}마을 원로들이 마을을 떠날 수 없다며 남아버렸거든요.
column4: Karena perintah untuk berpindah, aku membuang rumah dan awalnya ketika datang sungguh sakit hati sekali{nl} tetapi ketika sampai disini dan mendengar kondisi di Northern Village semua pikiran itu menghilang begitu saja.{nl} Alangkah baiknya jika desa tetap aman sampai perintah untuk berpindah dicabut.{nl} Para tetua desa tidak dapat meninggalkan desa, sehingga tetap berada disana.

column2: How can they ask us to gather at the place where monsters are going crazy.. {nl}The lord is asking us for too much.
column3: 그렇게 몬스터가 우글거리는 곳으로 우리 마을 사람들을 모이라고 했다니..{nl}영주님도 너무 하시는 군요.
column4: Karena disuru mengumpulkan orang-orang desa kami ke tempat yang dipenuhi oleh monster seperti itu..{nl} Land Lord sepertinya terlalu berlebihan.

column2: After the order to move out, we didn't move with the villagers.{nl}I think the people who have left before us would probably be at the 8th district by now.{nl}Can you bring those people back here?
column3: 이주령이 떨어진 뒤로 마을 사람들이 함께 이동한 게 아니라서{nl}저 보다 선두로 떠난 사람들은 이미 8번 지역에 있을 것 같습니다.{nl}그 사람들을 이곳으로 데려와 줄 수 있으시겠습니까?
column4: Setelah perintah untuk pindah turun, orang-orang desa tidak bergerak secara bersamaan{nl} sehingga orang yang pergi lebih dahulu, dibandingkan sayasepertinya sudah berada di area 8.{nl} Bisakan kita membawa orang-orang itu ke tempat ini?

column2: {nl}Even if we group together with the people of Romanas Elder,{nl}this place seems safer than the 8th district..
column3: {nl}아무래도 로마나스 촌장님네 사람들이랑 부대끼더라도{nl}여기가 8번 지역보단 안전한 것 같아서 말입니다..
column4: {nl} Bagaimanapun walau Romanas Mayor mengalami kesulitan bersama dengan orang-orang pun{nl} Sepertinya pasti lebih aman jika dibandingkan dengan area 8 ini..

column2: I know that this place has been prepared for us, but I didn't expect it to be this dangerous..
column3: 우릴 위해 준비된 곳이라지만 저렇게 위험해서야..
column4: Itu adalah tempat yang dipersiapkan untuk kita, tetapi kenapa sampai berbahaya seperti itu..

column2: Thank you. I should ask Romanas before our elder comes here that{nl}if I can be here.
column3: 감사합니다. 로마나스 촌장님껜 우리 촌장님이 오시기 전까진{nl}제가 따로 말씀드려서 함께 있어도 되냐고 물어봐야겠군요.
column4: Terima kasih. Sampai sebelum Mayor kami datang{nl} Aku akan berbicara secara terpisah, dan bertanya apakah boleh jika bersamanya.

column2: I've heard a lot that a mysterious man is helping my people.{nl}I heard that he is a person who receives lots of respect from others.{nl}It is well known that he helped them while the kingdom and the lord didn't do anything.{nl}He is like a hero sent by the goddesses.
column3: 미지의 인물이 내 영주민들을 도와주고 다닌다는 이야기는 익히 들었습니다.{nl}그 사람은 여러모로 선망의 대상이라고 하더군요.{nl}왕국도 영주도 구하지 못한 자신들을 도왔다고 소문이 자자합니다.{nl}여신이 보내준 영웅이라는 말도 있지요.
column4: Saya mendengar cukup cerita bahwa ada seorang yang tidak diketahui yang berkelilin dan membantu para pendudukku.{nl} Orang itu menjadi target akan rasa cemburu dari semua orang katanya.{nl} beredar rumor bahwa ia menyelamatkan orang orang yang bahkan tidak diselamatkan oleh kerajaan dan juga land lord.{nl} Ia adalah seorang pahwalan yang dikirimkan oleh Goddess bukan.

column2: {nl}I have a request for a hero like him.{nl}In Orsha, our residents have someone{nl}whom they rely on spiritually more than the lord.
column3: {nl}그런 영웅에게 긴이 부탁드릴 일이 있습니다.{nl}우리 오르샤엔 이 혼탁한 세상에 영주민들이 마음 속으로 부터 이 영주 보다 더{nl}의지하는 정신적 지주가 있습니다.
column4: {nl} Ada sesuatu yang mendesak ingin kuminta tolong kepada pahlawan itu.{nl} Kami di Orsha memiliki keinginan yang lebih logis dibandingkan Landlord,{nl} mulai dari hati terdalam para penduduk desa di dunia yang kotor ini.

column2: {nl}Urbonas is someone who we all need to recover Orsha which was torn in pieces.{nl}But, lately, I can't see him.{nl}He disappeared with his priests without any words.{nl}My informants are looking for the whereabouts of Urbonas.
column3: {nl}우르보나스님은 반파된 오르샤를 지지하는 없어선 안 될 인물 중 하납니다.{nl}그런데 얼마 전부터 우르보나스님이 보이지 않습니다.{nl}자신의 사제들을 데리고 갑자기 소리소문 없이 떠나버렸습니다.{nl}제 직속 정보대원들은 그런 우르보나스님의 행방을 찾고 있습니다.
column4: {nl}Tuan Urbonas tidak dapat mendukung Orsha yang melakukan perlawanan, dan merupakan salah seorang yang payah.{nl} Tetapi sejak beberapa waktu lalu tuan Urbonas tidak terlihat.{nl} Ia membawa para priest kenalannya dan tanpa ada berita apapun pergi begitu saja.{nl} Para informan yang berada di bawah kuasaku, sedang mencari keberadaan dari tuan Urbonas.

column2: {nl}I want to request to help finding the whereabouts of Urbonas.{nl}Without anybody knowing..
column3: {nl}당신에게도 우르보나스님의 행방을 찾는 일을 부탁드리고 싶습니다.{nl}아무도 모르게 말이죠..
column4: {nl} Saya ingin meminta tolong untuk melakukan pencarian jejak keberadaan tuan Urbonas kepada anda.{nl} Lakukan tanpa sepengetahuan yang lain maksudnya..

column2: A big chaos would result if the residents find out about this.{nl}The order to move out came down late already and various villages were attacked by the monsters.{nl}If they find out that Urbonas disappeared, it would be hard to control Orsha.
column3: 영주민들이 이 사실을 알면 큰 혼란이 찾아 올 것입니다.{nl}안 그래도 이주령이 늦어서 여러 마을이 몬스터들에게 당한 상태에서{nl}우르보나스님마저 사라진 사실을 알게된다면 오르샤를 통치하기 힘들어 질 것 입니다.
column4: Jika para penduduk mengetahui kebenaran ini, maka akan terjadi suatu keributan besar.{nl} Walau tidak begitu, sekarang karena perintah untuk pindah telat diberikan, sehingga beberapa desa dalam kondisi mengalami serangan monster{nl} ditambah lagi jika kebenaran akan tuan Urbonas yang menghilang diketahui, maka akan menjadi sulit untuk mengontrol Orsha.

column2: Lately, one of his disciples, Pranas came back.{nl}To listen for more details, I talked with him, but Pranas also doesn't know why.{nl}He is busy looking for whereabouts of Urbonas.{nl}My subordinates and the hired chasers are searching the Linked Bridges and Paupys Crossing.
column3: 얼마 전에 그의 제자 중 하나인 사제 프라나스님이 돌아오셨더군요.{nl}자초지종을 들어보려 면담했지만 프라나스님도 어찌된 영문인지 모르더군요.{nl}지금은 우르보나스님의 행방을 찾는데 앞장서고 있습니다.{nl}제 직속 부하들과 고용된 추적자들이 덧댄다리 숲과 파우피스 나루를 샅샅이 수색 중입니다.
column4: Beberapa waktu lalu, salah seorang muridnya yaitu Pranas telah kembali.{nl} aku telah bersabar untuk mendengarkan seluruh kisah lengkapnya, tetapi  tuan Pranas pun tidak mengetahui alasannya.{nl} Sekarang ia memimpin di depan untuk pencarian jejak dari tuan Urbonas.{nl} Ia sedang melakukan pencarian dengan anak buah saya dan para chaser yang direkrut di Woods of the Linked Bridges dan Paupys Crossing.

column2: {nl}But, there is no more progress due to the outrageous monsters.{nl}We need your help.
column3: {nl}하지만 강성하는 몬스터들 앞에서 더 이상의 진전은 없군요.{nl}당신의 도움이 필요합니다.
column4: {nl}Tetapi tidak ada perkembangan lebih lanjut di depan para monster yang kuat.{nl} Butuh bantuan dari anda.

column2: We must look for Urbonas.{nl}In this world, where even the goddesses do not answer, the only one we can rely on is Urbonas.
column3: 우린 우르보나스님을 반드시 찾아야합니다.{nl}여신 조차 응답하지 않는 이 세상에서 영주민들이 기댈 곳은 우르보나스님 뿐입니다.
column4: Kami pasti harus menemukan tuan Urbanas.{nl} Hanya ada tuan Urbonas yang bisa diharapkan oleh para penduduk di dunia dimana Goddess tidak merespon apapun.

column2: Urbonas is cooperating with my family.{nl}Recently, there are reports that demons are appearing from Linked Bridges and Paupys Crossing.{nl}I can't tell you for sure, but I don't have a good feeling on this.{nl}For Orsha and its residents, can you look for the whereabouts of Urbonas?
column3: 우르보나스님은 저의 영주 가문과 밀접한 협력관계에 있습니다.{nl}얼마 전부터 덧댄다리 숲과 파우피스 나루에서 마족들이 나타나고 있다는 보고가 있습니다.{nl}자세히 말씀드릴 순 없지만 느낌이 좋지 않습니다.{nl}오르샤와 영주민들을 위해 우르보나스님의 행방을 찾아주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Tuan Urbonas memiliki hubungan kerjama yang dekat dengan keluarga bangsawan land lord saya.{nl} Sejak beberapa waktu lalu, ada laporan bahwa muncul demon di Woods of the Linked Bridges dan Paupys Crossing.{nl} Walau aku tidak dapat memberitahukan dengan detil, tetapi perasaanku tidaklah enak.{nl} Maukah kamu mencari jejak keberadaan tuan urbonas untuk para penduduk dan Orsha?

column2: Thanks for helping us.{nl}Please visit the statue of the goddesses before you leave.{nl}The statues of the goddesses will be the guide that will be needed in your journeys.
column3: 도움을 주셔서 감사합니다.{nl}떠나기 전에 여신상에 들리십시오.{nl}여신상은 앞으로 당신의 여정에 없어선 안 될 길라잡이가 되어줄 것 입니다.
column4: Terima kasih telah memberikan bantuan.{nl} Sebelum pergi mampirlah sebentar kepada patung Goddess.{nl} Goddess akan menuntun kamu ke jalan yang benar ketika di dalam perjalanan ke depannya.

column2: {nl}And although not big, I've told the item merchant so you can receive some goods from the merchant.{nl}May the luck with you on your journey.
column3: {nl}그리고 적지만 잡화상인에게 말해두었으니 지원품을 받아서 가십시오.{nl}당신의 여정에 행운이 깃들길 기원하겠습니다.
column4: {nl} Lalu walaupun sedikit, tetapi karena telah kuberitahukan kepada retail merchant, pergilah setelah mendapatkan barang bantuan.{nl} Akan kudoakan agar perjalanan kamu dipenuhi dengan keberuntungan.

column2: You should never tell the residents that the bishop has disappeared.
column3: 절대 영주민들에게 주교가 사라졌다는 이야기는 해선 안 됩니다.
column4: Tidak boleh sampai menceritakan tentang hilangnya Bishop kepada para penduduk.

column2: Retail Merchant
column3: 잡화상인
column4: Retail Merchant

column2: I've heard from the bishop.{nl}You are telling others that you are the hero sent by the goddesses while helping the residents outside right?
column3: 영주님께 말씀들었어요.{nl}바깥 영주민들에게 호의를 배풀고 다니면서 여신이 보내준 영웅이라고 한다지요?
column4: Saya telah mendengar cerita dari Land Lord.{nl} Kamu adalah pahlawan yang dikirim Goddess dan berkeliling menolong para penduduk di luar tanpa pamrih kan?

column2: {nl}Please receive these goods!
column3: {nl}여기 물품을 받으세요!
column4: {nl}Terimalah barang ini!

column2: After the capital city has been destroyed, there are not many intact cities in this kingdom.{nl}Either Klaipeda or Fedimian..{nl}If you need any potions or tools in the future, you will meet me often.
column3: 수도가 파괴된 이후로 이 왕국엔 그다지 멀쩡한 도시가 몇개 없어요.{nl}클라페다라던가 페디미안이라던가..{nl}앞으로 포션이나 자잘한 도구가 필요하면 저와 자주 만나게 되실 거에요.
column4: Setelah ibukota terhancurkan, tidak banyak tersisa ibu kota yang dalam kondisi baik pada kerajaan ini.{nl} Antara Klaipeda atau Fermidian..{nl} Nanti ke depannya jika kamu membutuhkan peralatan yang bagus atau potion, kamu akan sering bertemu dengan saya.

column2: {nl}And it seems that the lord has requested something to the accessories merchant,{nl}so you better meet the accessories merchant.
column3: {nl}그리고 영주님이 악세서리 상인에게도 뭔가 부탁해두신 거 같으니{nl}악세서리 상인에게 가보세요.
column4: {nl}Lalu sepertinya Land lord meminta tolong sesuatu kepada Accessory merchant juga{nl} maka dari itu cobalah pergi kepada Accessory Merchant.

column2: Travellers are coming to Orsha since it is relatively safe.{nl}The world has collapsed, but I am making more money than before..{nl}Isn't it ironic?{nl}
column3: 여행자들이 비교적 안전한 오르샤로 모여들고 있어요.{nl}세상이 이렇게 망해버렸는데 제 주머니는 두둑해지고 있다니..{nl}참 짓궃은 일이지요?{nl}
column4: Para penjelajah sedang berkumpul ke Orsha yang aman.{nl} Padahal dunia sedang mengalami kehancuran sepreti ini, tetapi kantongku dipenuhi dengan uang..{nl}Sungguh hal yang menjengkelkan bukan?{nl}

column2: Hello! I really wanted to meet you.{nl}I've hard that you saved my friends.{nl}I haven't prepared a lot, but since the bishop also told me, I will give you this!
column3: 안녕하세요! 정말 만나보고 싶었어요.{nl}제 친구들을 구해주셨다고 들었어요.{nl}준비해둔 게 많지 않지만.. 영주님의 명령도 있었으니 이걸 드릴게요!
column4: Halo! Sungguh ingin bertemu rasanya.{nl} Kudengar kamu telah menyelamatkan teman-temanku.{nl} Walau tidak banyak yang telah kusiapkan.. Tetapi karena ada perintah dari tuan Land Lord, maka kuberikan ini!

column2: {nl}{nl}And it seems that the bishop is looking for you.{nl}Please hurry!
column3: {nl}{nl}그리고 영주님이 찾으시는 거 같아요.{nl}어서 가보세요!
column4: {nl}{nl}Lalu sepertinya tuan Land Lord sedang mencari anda.{nl} Cepatlah pergi menemuinya!

column2: Are you ready to leave? I've received a message from the informant that was searching at the Linked Bridges.{nl}It seems that he found some clues about the whereabouts of the bishop and his company.{nl}If you are ready, go meer Cherasia at the Linked Bridges.
column3: 떠날 채비는 하셨습니까? 방금 덧댄다리 숲에서 수색중이던 정보원에게 연락이 왔습니다.{nl}주교 일행의 행방을 좇을 단서를 찾았다는 군요.{nl}준비가 됐다면 덧댄다리 숲의 제 직속 정보대원인 체라시아에게 가보세요.
column4: Apakah kamu sudah bersiap untuk pergi? Barusan datang informasi dari informan yang sedang melakukan eksplorasi di Woods of the Linked Bridges.{nl} Katanya mereka telah menemukan petunjuk keberadaa dari perjalanan Bishop.{nl} Jika sudah selesai bersiap, cobalah pergi mencari Cherasia yang merupakan informasi di Woods of the Linked Bridges.

column2: You seem to be the one who the elder was talking about.{nl}Nice to meet you. I am called Cherasia.{nl}I am looking for whereabouts of Urbonas and the priests here.
column3: 영주님이 말씀하신 분이신것 같군요.{nl}반갑습니다. 저는 정보대원 체라시아입니다.{nl}여기서 우르보나스님과 사제님들의 행방을 뒤좇고 있습니다.
column4: Sepertinya kamu adalah orang yang dibicarakan oleh Lard Lord.{nl} Senang bertemu dengan anda. Saya adalah informan Cherasia.{nl} Kami sedang melacak jejak dari para Priest dan tuan Urbonas disini.

column2: I've told the residents that the informants were dispatched outside to protect the areas so I want you to also act as if you don't know anything so that the efforts of the informants do not end in vain.
column3: 정보대원들은 지금 지역 안전을 위해 파견 나가있는 것처럼 영주민들을 속이고 있으니 눈에 띄는 행동으로 그들의 노력을 물거품으로 만들지 마시기 바랍니다.
column4: Para informan sekarang sedang menipu para penduduk dengan berpura-pura sedang pergi bertugas untuk mencari daerah aman, maka jangan melakukan tindakan yang mencolok, sehingga yang mereka lakukan menjadi sia-sia.

column2: The search activities didn't end in vain.{nl}I am sure that you must have heard about Pranas from the elder.{nl}Pranas, the guy who had gone for trainings in the northern area and came back recently.
column3: 수색활동에 성과가 조금 있었습니다.{nl}영주님에게 프라나스님에 대해 들으셨을 겁니다.{nl}북부지역으로 수행을 떠났다가 얼마 전 돌아오신 프라나스님 말입니다.
column4: Ada sedikit hasil dari pencarian yang dilakukan.{nl} Kamu mungkin sudah mendengar mengenai tuan Pranas dari tuan Land Lord.{nl} Tuan Pranas yang beberapa waktu lalu telah kembali dari misi setelah pergi ke Northern area.

column2: {nl}We've found some traces of the Priest Irma who is one of the disciples of the bishop here.{nl}And from the traces that were discovered, the memo that looked beloging to Iruma was ripped in pieces.{nl}When you look at the shape how it was ripped off, it seems that the monsters bit them.
column3: {nl}우리는 이 곳에서 주교님의 제자 중 한 분인 사제 이르마님의 흔적을 발견했습니다.{nl}그리고 발견한 흔적에서 이르마님의 쪽지로 보이는 것이 갈갈이 찢겨져 있었습니다.{nl}찢겨진 모양을 보면 몬스터들이 물어뜯은 것 같습니다.
column4: {nl}Kami telah menemukan jejak dari Priest Irma yang merupakan salah satu murid dari Bishop di tempat ini.{nl} Lalu pada jejak yang ditemukan, terdapat sesuatu seperti surat milik Irma yang telah tersobek-sobek.{nl} Jika melihat bentuknya yang tersobek-sobek, sepertinya itu adalah ulah dari monster.

column2: {nl}That's why I've caught the monsters and retrieving the pages of the memo..{nl}But, that's too much work for me.{nl}Can you defeat the monsters at the 1st district and get me the pages of the Priest Irma?
column3: {nl}그래서 몬스터들을 잡아서 쪽지 낱장을 회수하던 중입니다만{nl}혼자선 역부족이군요.{nl}1번 지역에서 몬스터들을 잡아서 사제 이르마님의 쪽지 낱장을 구해주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl}Maka dari itu dengan menangkap para monster, sedang mengumpulkan halaman yang hilang dari pesan tersebut.{nl}Tetapi sulit untuk melakukan hal tersebut sendirian.{nl} Tangkaplah monster yang ada di area 1, lalu maukah kamu mencarikan potongan surat milik Priest Irma?

column2: Pranas has left first to look for the traces of Urbonas with other officers.
column3: 프라나스님의 다른 대원들과 우르보나스님의 흔적을 찾기 위해 먼저 가셨습니다.
column4: Telah pergi terlebih dahulu untuk mencari jejak tuan Urbanas dan para anggota dari tuan Pranas.

column2: It has been stained due to the body fluid of the mosnters so its hard to recognize it, but{nl}As I read it, it's about being chansed by something.{nl}We better hurry up.
column3: 몬스터들의 타액에 얼룩져서 알아보기 힘들지만{nl}대강의 내용은 뭔가에 좇기고 있다는 내용이군요.{nl}아무래도 서두르는 게 좋겠습니다.
column4: Sulit untuk mencari tahu isinya karena ternodai dengan liur dari monster lainnya,{nl} tetapi kesimpulan isinya adalah mereka sedang mengejar akan sesuatu.{nl} Bagaimanapun alangkah baiknya jika kita bergegas.

column2: {nl}Take this and meet Pranas at the northen region.{nl}I will look for the other traces here.
column3: {nl}이걸 가지고 북부 지역으로 프라나스님을 찾아가보세요.{nl}저는 여기서 나머지 흔적들을 찾아보겠습니다.
column4: {nl}Pergilah mencari tuan Pranas ke Northern area dengan membawa ini.{nl} Aku akan mencari jejak-jejak tersisa disini.

column2: I am an Informant, Moren.{nl}So you are the one who the bishop talked about.{nl}If Iruma is being chased after, that means the bishop is also being chased after right?{nl}I am looking for the place where the bishop and his company stayed.
column3: 저는 정보대원 모렌입니다.{nl}영주님께서 말씀하신 분이군요.{nl}이르마님이 좇기고 있다는 건 역시 주교님도 좇기고 있다는 뜻이겠죠?{nl}저는 이곳에서 주교님 일행이 머물렀던 곳을 찾고 있습니다.
column4: Saya adalah Informer Moren.{nl} Rupanya kamu adalah orang yang dibicarakan oleh Land Lord.{nl} Yang dimaksud Irma sedang dikejar oleh sesuatu, sudah pasti adalah Bishop juga sedang dikejar juga bukan?{nl} Saya sedang mencari tempat kelompok Bishop tinggal di tempat ini.

column2: {nl}But, due to the monsters nearby, I can't investigate exactly.{nl}While I am checking the bonfire here, can you defeat the monsters that are disturbing us around here?{nl}
column3: {nl}하지만 주변 몬스터들 때문에 정확한 정확하게 조사할 수 없군요.{nl}제가 이 모닥불을 확인하는 동안 주변에서 귀찮게 구는 몬스터들을 처리해 주실 수 있겠습니까?{nl}
column4: {nl}Tetapi karena para monster di sekitar, tidak dapat melakukan penyelidikan yang tepat.{nl} Bisakah kamu menghabisi monster pengganggu yang ada di sekitar, selama saya melakukan pengecekan pada Bonfire ini?{nl}

column2: The investigation has not been done yet.
column3: 아직 조사가 끝나지 않았습니다.
column4: Penyelidikan masih belum selesai.

column2: You found a sheet of paper that looks blackened by something.{nl}So this is the memo.. How come they burnt it like this?{nl}It seems that the travelers here didn't do this.{nl}Someone extinguished the bonfire and covered it with the lump of grass..
column3: 뭔가에 그을린 종이를 발견했습니다.{nl}이건 쪽지군요... 왜 이렇게 불태워 둔 것일까요?{nl}이 근처 여행자들이 그런건 아닌 것 같습니다.{nl}모닥불을 끄고 그걸 풀더미로 덮어놨군요..
column4: Telah menemukan suatu kertas yang terbakar.{nl}Ini sebuat surat rupanya... Kenapa terbakar seperti ini ya?{nl} Sepertinya bukan miliki dari para petualang yang ada di sekitar sini.{nl} Ini ditaruh diatas tumpukan rumput setelah mematikan Bonfire..

column2: {nl}What if it catches the fire..
column3: {nl}이러다 불이라도 나면 어쩌려고 이렇게 해놨는지..
column4: {nl}Jika menaruhnya pada api seperti itu, bagaimana bisa jadi seperti ini..

column2: You told me that the Priest Irma is being chased after by something right?{nl}Then, this blackened paper is to hide something from the chasers.{nl}No matter what the reason is, we need to collect these.
column3: 사제 이르마님이 뭔가에 좇기고 있다고 하셨죠?{nl}그렇다면 이 불태운 종이는 추격자들로부터 뭔가 숨기기 위해 태워버린 것이로군요.{nl}뭐가 되었건 지푸라기라도 잡는 심정으로 이것들을 수집할 필요가 있을 것 같습니다.
column4: Priest Irma berkata sedang dikejar oleh sesuatu bukan?{nl}Kalau begitu sepertinya kertas yang terbakar ini, sepertinya dibakar untuk menyembunyikan sesuatu dari yang mengejarnya.{nl} Entah apa yang terjadi, sepertinya perlu mengumpulkan benda-benda ini dengan sepenuh hati dengan mengambil Straw.

column2: {nl}As I am looking at the memo here, please look through the lumps of grass that have smoke on them{nl}and collect the memos that are half burnt.{nl}If you could collect them, I will analyze them for you.
column3: {nl}제가 여기서 이 쪽지를 살펴보는 동안 이 주변에서 연기나는 풀더미들을 들춰서{nl}반쯤 타버린 쪽지를 수집해 주시지 않겠습니까?{nl}모아오시면 제가 분석해 드리겠습니다.
column4: {nl}Maukah kamu mengumpulkan surat yang terbakar sebagian dengan menggali tumpukan rumput yang terkena asap di sekitar,{nl} selama saya memeriksa surat ini disini?{nl} Jika telah mengumpulkannya, maka Aku akan coba mengartikannya.

column2: I am sure that they didn't light them up since they were being chased after..{nl}Are they lit up to deceive someone?
column3: 좇기고 있는 사람들이 태평하게 모닥불이나 사방에 피워 뒀을리는 없고..{nl}위장인가?
column4: Orang-orang yang sedang dikejar, tidak mungkin bisa duduk dengan tenang menyalakan Bonfire..{nl}Kamuflase kah?

column2: Good. Let's analyze them now.
column3: 좋습니다. 이제 이것들을 분석해 보도록 합시다.
column4: Bagus.  Mari kita coba artikan ini sekarang.

column2: {nl}Folklore...{nl}The Hamondale familly...{nl}The Revelator...
column3: {nl}전승.. {nl}헤먼대일 가문.. {nl}계시자..
column4: {nl}Legenda.. {nl}Hamondale Royal family.. {nl}Savior..

column2: {nl}The Revelator? what is the Revelator doing anyways?{nl}We better go meet Pranas fast.{nl}Please go to the northern area.{nl}I will continue the rest of the search here.
column3: {nl}계시자? 계시자라니 대체 무슨일을 벌이고 있는 걸까요?{nl}아무래도 프라나스님께 빨리 찾아가보는 게 좋겠습니다.{nl}북쪽 지역으로 가보십시오.{nl}저는 여기서 나머지 수색을 계속 하겠습니다.
column4: {nl}Savior? Entah apa yang akan terjadi sampai Savior pun disebutkan?{nl} Bagaimanapun alangkah baiknya jika segera mencari tuan Pranas.{nl} Cobalah pergi ke Northern Area.{nl} Aku akan terus melakukan pencarian sisanya disini.

column2: You are looking for Pranas? Pranas has left to Paupys Crossing.{nl}He told me to look for the traces of the priests from the 5th district.{nl}There is some camp located there, but there are so many monsters which I can't face alone.{nl}I tried to defeat some of them, but since they all rushed into me after that, it is so hard for me to go there again.
column3: 프라나스님을 찾고 계시다구요? 프라나스님은 파우피스 나루로 가셨습니다.{nl}제게 5번 지역에서 사제분들의 흔적을 찾아달라고 하시더군요.{nl}확실히 거기에 캠프 같은게 있긴 했지만 제가 감당할 수 없는 수의 몬스터들이 있더군요.{nl}몇 녀석 혼내 줬더니 단체로 달려들어서 제가 다시 그곳으로 가긴 힘들것 같습니다.
column4: Kamu sedang mencari tuan Pranas? Tuan Pranas telah pergi ke Paupys Crossing.{nl} Saya diminta untuk mencari jejak keberadaan para priest yang ada di area 5.{nl} Pastinya disana terdapat suatu Camp, tetapi karena banyak sekali jumlah monster disini, sehingga saya tidak dapat mengatasinya.{nl} Beberapa orang telah kumarahi, sehingga mereka melarikan diri berkelompok, tetapi sepertinya sulitbagi saya untuk pergi ke tempat itu lagi.

column2: {nl}{nl}If you are okay, can you search the 5th district?
column3: {nl}{nl}괜찮으시다면 5번 지역을 수색해 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl}{nl}Jika boleh, bisakah kamu melakukan pencarian di area 5?

column2: If what Moren is thinking is true, that means this place is full of monsters by now.{nl}Do you believe the Revelator really exists even when the goddesses disappeared?{nl}I don't think so.
column3: 모렌의 추측대로 라면 여긴 지금 마족 소굴이라는 이야기가 됩니다.{nl}여신들이 자취를 감췄는데 계시자라뇨.. 그런 옛날 이야기를 믿는단 말입니까?{nl}제 어머니가 자장가로 들려주시던 노래에나 나올 법한 이야기입니다.
column4: Menurut perkiraan Moren, terdapat cerita bahwa tempat ini sekarang menjadi markas Demon.{nl} Para Goddess telah menyembunyikan jejaknya, dan Savior.. Apakah kamu percaya akan cerita lama seperti itu?{nl} Itu adalah cerita yang muncul dan pada lagu yang dinyanyikan oleh ibu saya menjelang tidur.

column2: {nl}The informants have too many worries.{nl}Orsha is very far away from the place where demons are appearing...{nl}Don't worry.{nl}The bishop must have went somewhere since he is bored.
column3: {nl}정보원들은 너무 걱정이 많아요.{nl}마족들이 출몰하는 곳에서 오르샤가 얼마나 멀리 떨어져있는데요..{nl}걱정하지 마십시오. {nl}주교라는 사람도 항상 교단에만 있어야하니 지루해서 어디 잠깐 놀러간거 겠지요.
column4: {nl}Para informan sungguh khawatir sekali.{nl} Betapa jauhnya Orsha dari tempat kemunculan para demon..{nl} Janganlah khawatir. {nl} Mungkin Bishop sedang merasa bosan karena harus berada di lembaga religius terus, sehingga ia sedang pergi berkeliling sejenak.

column2: Contents of Urbonas' journal (metaphorical content){nl}- A turbulent era was approaching and it was time to face the destiny our order had been preparing for centuries.{nl}- I can only hope Orsha remains safe until my priests and I can complete this task.{nl}- That sent by the goddesses... (end of content)
column3: 우르보나스의 일지 내용(은유적인 내용으로){nl}- 세상이 크게 혼탁해지는 시기가 도래했고 수백년을 준비해온 우리 교단의 숙명을 마무리 할 때가 되었다.{nl}- 나와 내 사제들이 이 일을 마무리 할 때까지 오르샤가 무사하길 바란다.{nl}- 여신이 보내준..(내용 끊김)
column4: Isi jurnal milik Urbonas(Isi yang Metafora){nl}- Telah tiba waktunya bagi lembaga religius kami yang telah bersiap sejak ratusan tahun lamanya, akan zaman dimana dunia ini menjadi terkorup.{nl}- Semoga Orsha selamat sampai waktunya aku dan para Priestku menyelesaikan pekerjaan ini.{nl}- Goddess yang mengirimkan..(Isinya terputus)

column2: I've seen the flame roaring to the sky. Are you saying the demons really appeared?{nl}What's wrong with the diary of the bishop? It's too confusing.{nl}We better go back to Pranas.{nl}Go back to Paupys Crossing at the north!
column3: 저도 치솟는 불길을 보았습니다. 정말로 마족이 나타났다는 말입니까?{nl}주교님의 일지는 또 무슨 말입니까? 혼란 스럽군요.{nl}당장 프라나스님께 가보시는 게 좋겠습니다.{nl}북쪽의 파우피스 나루로 가십시오!
column4: Saya juga telah melihat kobaran api yang meluap. Apakah itu benar kalau demon telah muncul?{nl} Lalu apa yang dimaksud dengan Jurnal Bishop? Membingungkan yah.{nl} Alanagkah baiknya jika coba pergi segera kepada tuan Pranas.{nl} Cobalah pergi ke Paupys Crossing di utara!

column2: I think he's almost here by now.{nl}I've heard about it from the informant of the lord.{nl}
column3: 지금쯤 올 때가 되었다고 생각하고 있었습니다.{nl}영주님의 연락병에게 이야기 들었습니다.{nl}
column4: Kupikir sekarang waktunya telah tiba.{nl} Saya telah mendengar cerita dari pasukan pembawa pesan Land Lord.{nl}

column2: I should have just stayed in my hometown and live by hunting.{nl}Demons!{nl}My mother would faint out if she finds out that I am chasing after demons.
column3: 고향에서 사냥이나 하면서 살걸 그랬습니다.{nl}몬스터도 아니고 마족이라뇨!{nl}제가 마족을 추적하고 있다는 걸 알면 어머니가 기절하실 겁니다..
column4: Di kampung halaman melakukan perburuan untuk dapat hidup.{nl} Bukan juga monster, tetapi Demon!{nl} Ibu pasti akan pingsan, jika mengetahui bahwa saya sedang melacak keberadaan Demon..

column2: I am helping the informants here so they can carry out their duties.{nl}If you get a chance to go to the 1st district, I want you to defeat the monsters there,{nl}so that the activities of the officers there would not get disturbed.
column3: 저는 여기서 정보원들이 원활한 활동을 할 수 있도록 돕고 있습니다.{nl}혹시 1번 지역에 갈 일이 있다면 다른 대원들의 활동이 몬스터들에게 방해받지 않도록{nl}그 지역 몬스터들을 처리해 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Aku disini sedang membantu agar para informan dapat melakukan kegiatan dengan lancar.{nl} Jika ada rencana untuk pergi ke area 1, maka maukah kamu menghabisi para monster di area itu{nl} agar kegiatan para informan yang ada disana tidak terganggu oleh monster?

column2: I was actually working here for a different mission.{nl}Recently, many problems occurred including the disappearance of the priests,{nl}so my task to find out why the monsters were heading to Orsha got delayed.
column3: 저는 원래 다른 임무를 받고 여기서 활동하고 있었습니다.{nl}최근 사라진 사제들 수색을 포함해서 여러 가지로 문제가 터지는 바람에{nl}몬스터들이 오르샤로 향하는 이유를 조사하던 일이 미뤄졌습니다.
column4: Saya sebenarnya mendapatkan tugas lain, sehingga melakukan aktivitas di tempat ini.{nl} Akibat terjadi berbagai masalah dan termasuk melakukan pencarian para priest yang hilang belakangan ini{nl} Pekerjaan menyelidiki alasan para monster mengarah ke Orsha pun menjadi tertunda.

column2: We want monsters not to group together.{nl}Thanks.
column3: 몬스터들은 셋 보단 둘이, 둘 보단 하나가 돌아다니는 게 인간들 입장에선 덜 부담스럽지요.{nl}고생하셨습니다.
column4: Jika jumlah monster yang berkeliling berkurang, maka rasa tidak nyaman manusia pun jadi berkurang.{nl} Terima kasih banyak.

column2: Recently, the monsters are coming near Orsha.{nl}So to find out what happened to them,{nl}they put all the monsters into a wagon and put them at the 2nd district.
column3: 얼마 전부터 몬스터들이 오르샤 인근으로 몰려들고 있습니다.{nl}그래서 정보대원들은 녀석들에게 무슨일이 생긴건지 조사하려고{nl}몬스터들을 수레 한 가득 담아서 2번 지역에 몰아 두었지요.
column4: Sampai beberapa waktu lalu, para monster datang mengepung ke sekitar Orsha.{nl} Maka dari itu para Informan bermaksud untuk memeriksa apa yang terjadi dengan mereka{nl} Para monster dikumpulkan dalam satu keranjang penuh, dan dipindahkan ke area 2.

column2: {nl}But, due to another matter, the wagon was abondoned and it is spreading the bad odor.{nl}Because of that, the monsters are going even more crazy.
column3: {nl}그런데 다른 일이 터지는 바람에 수레가 방치 되었고 결국 악취만 풍기고 있습니다.{nl}그것 때문에 몬스터들이 더 날뛰는 것 같군요.{nl}혹시 2번 지역에 가실 일이 있다면 수레를 좀 태워 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl} Tetapi karena terjadi hal lainnya, gerobak itu terabaikan dan hanya muncul bau busuk saja akhirnya.{nl} Karena itu para monster sepertinya berkeliaran lebih bebas.{nl} Mungkin jika kamu ada keperluan di area 2, bisakah kamu membantu untuk membakar gerobak tersebut?

column2: One of the principles of the informants is that they check it with their hands and their tongues.{nl}That's why we know a lot of poison water and monsters.
column3: 정보대원들의 철칙 중 하나는 그게 뭐가 되었건 눈으로 손으로 혀로 확인해보는 것 입니다.{nl}그래서인지 우린 독극물이나 몬스터 정보엔 빠삭합니다.
column4: Salah satu peraturan ketat dari para informan adalah apapun itu, mereka pasti melakukan pengecekan dengan mata, tangan bahkan lidah.{nl} Maka dari itu kami sudah mengetahui dengan baik informasi akan benda beracun atau monster.

column2: The monsters don't usually rush into the place where the fire started so we don't have to worry about this place.{nl}Thank you for helping me.
column3: 몬스터들이 굳이 불이난 곳으로 달려들진 않으니 한 동안 이 주변은 걱정하지 않아도 되겠군요.{nl}도와주셔서 감사합니다.
column4: Karena para monster tidak berani mendekat ke tempat api dinyalakan, maka tidak perlu terlalu mengkhawatirkan kondisi sekitar sini selama beberapa waktu.{nl} Terima kasih karena telah membantu.

column2: Lots of chasers came to hometown after getting hired.{nl}I never thought Orsha would be big like this.{nl}So I've brought a funny good from my hometown.
column3: 고향에서 꽤 많은 추적자들이 오르샤에 고용되서 왔습니다만{nl}오르샤 주변이 이렇게 넓은 줄은 생각도 못 했습니다.{nl}그래서 말인데 제가 고향에서 재미난 물건을 가져왔습니다.
column4: Para chaser yang banyak dari kampung halaman direkrut di Orsha telah datang{nl} Tetapi tidak disangka bahwa sekeliling Orsha seluas ini.{nl} Sehingga saya membawa mainan yang menarik dari kampung halaman saya.

column2: {nl}Do you want to use this monster stimulant?{nl}It seems that you are receiving requests from lots of people,{nl}so if you use this, you would be able to do some of those tasks easier.
column3: {nl}이 몬스터 자극제를 사용해 보시겠습니까?{nl}보아하니 당신도 이 사람 저 사람에게 부탁받고 있는 것 같은데{nl}이걸 써보시면 귀찮은 일들을 좀 쉽게 처리할 수 있을 겁니다.
column4: {nl}Maukah kamu coba memakai Monster Stimulant ini?{nl} Kulihat kamu sedang membantu akan permintaan orang-orang{nl} Jika kamu coba menggunakan ini, maka dapat menyelesaikan pekerjaan yang menyebalkan dengan mudah.

column2: When you sprinkle this monster stimulant to the monsters, the monsters may attack my allies,{nl}but, if there are no allies around, they may attack humans.
column3: 이 몬스터 자극제를 몬스터에게 뿌리면 몬스터들이 제 동족을 공격하게 되는데{nl}주변에 동족이 없으면 사람을 공격할지도 모릅니다.
column4: Jika menuangkan Monster Stimulant ini kepada monster, maka ia akan jadi menyerang sesama temannya sendiri{nl} Entah apakah ia akan menyerang orang jika di sekelilingnya tidak ada sesama jenisnya.

column2: How was it? If the effects are good, I should make some of them and sell them at Orsha.{nl}I've worked as a merchant before the world turned out like this so I know what's worth of making money.
column3: 어땠나요? 효과가 좋으면 고향에서 몇 개 만들어서 오르샤에서 팔아야겠군요.{nl}제가 세상이 이렇게 변해버리기 전엔 상인일을 해서 돈 냄새 하나는 기가막히게 잘 맡거든요.
column4: Bagaimana? Jika efeknya bagus, aku akan coba membawa beberapa dari kampung halaman dan menjualnya di Orsha.{nl} Sebelum dunia berubah seperti ini, saya melakukan banyak perdagangan dan pandai mencari uang loh.

column2: The informants have left for the another task so they want me to do the investigation on their behalf.{nl}They want me to investigate the Linked Bridges Forest.{nl}I think they are trying to hide the refugees from the north around here..{nl}I guess they don't have enough force.
column3: 정보대원들이 다른 일로 나가면서 그들이 하던 조사 활동을 제게 맡겼습니다.{nl}덧댄다리 숲을 전부 조사하고 몬스터들이 몰려있는 곳을 조사하라고 하더군요.{nl}아마도 북쪽 피난민들을 여기 어딘가에 피신시키려고 하는 거 같은데{nl}군병력이 부족해서 그렇겠죠?
column4: Para informan pergi keluar melakukan pekerjaan lainnya, dan menitipkan kegiatan penyelidikan mereka kepada saya.{nl} Mereka menyuruh untuk menyelidiki seluruh Woods of the Linked Bridges dan tempat para monster berkumpul loh.{nl} Mungkin juga pengungsi dari utara, juga datang kesini di suatu tempat bermaksud mengungsi{nl} Tetapi pasukan tentara kekurangan bukan?

column2: According to what the informant told me who handed over the task to me, the most suspicious area is the 5th district.{nl}It seems that they also handed over some task to you.. if you are going to the 5th district, can you get rid of the monsters and their habitats?
column3: {nl}제게 이 일을 떠맡긴 정보대원의 말에 의하면 5번 지역이 제일 의심 스럽다고 하더군요.{nl}당신도 그들이 뭔가 떠맡긴거 같은데.. 혹시 5번 지역에 가는 길이라면 몬스터들이랑 그들의 군락지를 좀 처리해 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl}Menurut informan yang menitipkan pekerjaan ini kepadaku, ia bilang area 5 adalah yang paling mencurigakan.{nl} Sepertinya ia ingin menitipkan sesuatu juga kepada anda.. Jika kamu bermaksud pergi ke area 5, bisakah kamu menghabisi habitat para monster yang ada disana?

column2: I am getting paid for doing this.. Why are you doing this for?{nl}Well.. if you want to just have some experiences, I guess that's not that bad after all..
column3: 저야 보수를 받고 일하는 건데 당신은 뭘 받고 일하시는 겁니까?{nl}그저 경험을 쌓는 중이라면 크게 손해볼 일은 아니겠습니다만..
column4: Kalau saya itu bekerja untuk mendapatkan imbalan, bagaimana dengan anda?{nl} Jjika kamu memang sedang menumpuk pengalaman, maka tidak ada ruginya yah..

column2: Damn... the monsters set up their nests in this normal looking forest too..{nl}This is.. difficult..
column3: 이런 멀쩡해 보이는 숲까지 몬스터들이 제 둥지를 치고 있었단 말입니까?{nl}이거 참 난감한 곳이군요.
column4: Para monster mengacak-ngacak hutan yang terlihat megah seperti ini ya?{nl} Tempat ini sungguh tidak ada harapan rupanya.

column2: Pranas has left to the northern region with other informants first.{nl}I am looking for the traces of the Priest, Gelliya who was discovered here.{nl}But, its so hard for me to search here due to the attributes of the monsters since they are different from the ones in our hometown.{nl}Can you help me getting the pages of Gelliya's memo by defeating the monsters?
column3: 프라나스님은 다른 정보원들과 함께 북쪽 지역으로 먼저 떠났습니다.{nl}저는 여기서 발견된 사제 겔리야님의 흔적을 확인 중 입니다.{nl}하지만 제 고향과 다른 몬스터들의 특성 때문에 제대로 수색하기 힘들 군요.{nl}겔리야님의 쪽지 낱장을 몬스터들을 잡아서 구해와 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Tuan Pranas telah pergi dahulu ke Northern Area bersama dengan para Informan lainnya.{nl} Saya sedang memeriksa jejak keberadaan dari Priest Priest Gelija yang ditemukan disini.{nl} Tetapi karena karakteristik dari para monster yang lain dan kampung halaman saya, maka sulit untuk melakukan pencarian.{nl} Bisakah kamu mencarikan potongan pesan yang milik Gelija dengan menangkap Monster-monster yang berkeliaran?

column2: {nl}This memo should possess some decisive evidence.{nl}The traces that are being left by the ones who run away since they want others to find them.
column3: {nl}분명 이 쪽지에 결정적인 단서가 있을 겁니다.{nl}도망치는 사람들이 남긴 흔적은 자신을 찾아달라고 남기는 경우가 많으니까요.
column4: {nl}Sudah pasti terdapat petunjuk yang penting pada surat ini.{nl} Karena banyak kejadian dimana orang-orang yang melarikan diri meninggalkan jejak, agar dirinya ditemukan.

column2: I was not going to think too much about the safety of Orsha if I can continue to get paid.. {nl}But, after seeing the demons that are appearing here, I remember my hometown.
column3: 고용된 입장에서 보수만 받을 수 있다면 오르샤의 안위는 크게 신경쓰지 않으려 했습니다..{nl}하지만 여기 출몰하는 마족들을 보니 제 고향 생각이 나는 군요.
column4: Bagi orang yang dipekerjakan maka jika ada imbalan yang bisa didapat, maka mereka tidak terlalu mempedulikan akan keselamatan Orsha..{nl} Tetapi aku teringat akan kampung halamanku, setelah melihat para Demon yang muncul disini.

column2: Thanks. Because it is ripped in pieces, I can't check exactly what's written..{nl}It seems that a few disciples went missing while running away.{nl}It is written that the disciples of the bishop are feeling uneasy.{nl}More than anything, it seems that the demons were hiding various places in the forest and they were going after them.
column3: 수고하셨습니다. 찢어져서 정확한 내용은 확인하기 힘들지만..{nl}도망치던 중에 몇몇 사제들이 행방불명 된거 같군요.{nl}주교님의 사제들이 크게 불안해 한다고 적혀있습니다.{nl}무엇보다 마족들이 숲 곳곳에 숨어서 그들을 노리고 있던 것 같군요.
column4: Terima kasih banyak. Walaupun sulit untuk memeriksa isi tepatnya karena sudah tercabik-cabik..{nl} sepertinya beberapa priest menghilang ketika sedang melarikan diri.{nl} Disini tertulis bahwa Priest Bishop sedang tidak tenang sekali.{nl} Para demon bersembunyi di beberapa tempat dalam hutan, dan sedang mengincar mereka sepertinya.

column2: We better let Pranas know about it. Go to the 3rd district.{nl}While going there, please also stop by at the camp in the 2nd district and check whether there are other traces.{nl}
column3: 프라나스님께 알리는 게 좋겠군요. 3번 지역으로 가십시오.{nl}가시는 길에 2번 지역의 캠프에도 들려서 다른 단서가 없는 지 확인해 보십시오.{nl}
column4: Alangkah baik jika memberitahukan kepada tuan Pranas. Cobalah pergi ke area 3.{nl} Dalam perjalanan cobalah periksa apakah ada petunjuk lain, dengan mampir ke Camp di area 2.{nl}

column2: If he went missing at the place where the demons are located..{nl}It is so unfortunate, but you won't see those priests again..
column3: 마족들이 있는 곳에서 행방불명 됐다면..{nl}안타깝지만 그 사제들은 다시 보긴 힘들 것 같습니다..
column4: Jika hilang di tempat para demon berada..{nl} Sayang sekali tetapi sepertinya sulit untuk bertemu dengan para priest itu lagi.

column2: So you are the one who the lord talked about. I am telling about you to the informants here.{nl}I was actually going to see Pranas, but I was taking a rest since Jali got too tired.{nl}It seems that Jali got too excited since there is some place here where the bishop and his company used to stay.
column3: 영주님이 말씀하신 분이군요. 제가 이 곳의 정보대원들에게 당신 소식을 전하고 있었습니다.{nl}프라나스님에게 가는 길이었는데 잘리가 너무 지쳐서 쉬는 중이었습니다.{nl}이 근처에 사라진 주교님의 일행이 머무른 곳이 있는 것 같아서 잘리가 너무 흥분한 것 같군요.
column4: Orang yang dibicarakan Land Lord rupanya. Saya sedang menyampaikan kabar mengenai kamu kepada para informan di tempat ini.{nl} Kami sedang pergi menuju ke tuan Pranas, tetapi karena Jolly merasa sangat kelelahan, sehingga kami beristirahat dahulu.{nl} Karena di sekitar sini sepertinya ada tempat tinggal dari kelompok Bishop yang menghilang, Jolly sepertinya menjadi sungguh bersemangat.

column2: {nl}Jali was the dog that was being raised by Urbonas.{nl}I thought I would find it quicker if I use the olfactory sense of Jali.{nl}If you are looking for the bishop's company, why don't you take Jali with you?{nl}For Pranas, he would need even slightest clues.
column3: {nl}잘리는 우르보나스님이 기르시던 강아지입니다.{nl}아무래도 냄새로 찾으면 빨리 찾을 것 같아서 데려왔지요.{nl}주교님 일행을 찾으러 가시는 길이라면 잘리를 데리고 가보시지 않겠습니까?{nl}프라나스님에겐 작은 단서라도 꼭 필요 할 겁니다.
column4: {nl} Jolly adalah anjing yang dipelihara oleh tuan Urbonas.{nl} Kami membawanya, karena sepertinya akan lebih cepat jika mencarinya dengan melacak baunya.{nl} Jika kamu sedang dalam perjalanan untuk pergi mencari kelompok Bishop, maukah kamu membawa Jolly bersamamu?{nl} Tuan Pranas membutuhkan petunjuk sekecil apapun itu.

column2: I hope there's a dog like Jali at the informants' camp as well.{nl}It is cute, it follows people's orders well and most of all, it searches really well.
column3: 영주 직속 정보대에도 잘리같은 강아지가 있었으면 좋겠어요.{nl}귀엽고 말도 잘 따르고 무엇보다 수색을 정말 잘 하는 것 같아요.
column4: Pasukan Informan Land Lord pun sebaiknya juga memiliki anjing seperti Zali.{nl} Ia lucu dan penurut, sepertinya sungguh pandai melakukan pencarian dibanding siapa pun.

column2: Did Jali find something?{nl}It is certain that there were lots of people around here.
column3: 잘리가 뭔가 찾아냈나요?{nl}이 근방에 사람들이 많았던 게 분명하군요.
column4: Apakah Jolly telah menemukan sesuatu?{nl} Sudah pasti ada banyak orang di sekitar sini.

column2: I am worried because I heard some screaming sound from the north side of the trails.{nl}Can you first go to the 8th district?
column3: 오솔길 북쪽에서 비명소리가 들려서 걱정됩니다.{nl}8번 지역으로 일단 가주시겠습니까?
column4: Saya khawatir karena terdengar suara raungan monster di jalur Utara.{nl} Maukah kamu pergi ke area 8?

column2: If I find Pranas, I would have to go back to Orsha and be prepared.{nl}Informants usually spend the time by wandering around..
column3: 프라나스님만 찾으면 전 다시 오르샤로 돌아가서 대기 해야합니다.{nl}연락병이라는 게 돌아다니다가 하루가 끝나는 직책이라서요..
column4: Jika menemukan tuan Pranas, Aku akan kembali ke Orsha lagi dan harus menunggu.{nl} Merupakan suatu keharusan dalam keseharian seorang pasukan pembawa pesan untuk berkeliling..

column2: What are you doing here, Run away!
column3: 여기서 뭐하는 거야, 도망쳐!
column4: Apa yang kamu lakukan disini, Kabur!

column2: What? You've come here to look for Pranas?{nl}Then, we are too late. Pranas was attacked by the demons at the 5th district.{nl}I should've brought the informants.
column3: 뭐요? 프라나스님을 찾으러 왔단말이오?{nl}그럼 너무 늦었습니다. 프라나스님은 5번 지역에서 마족들에게 당하셨습니다.{nl}정보대원들을 데리고 왔어야 했습니다.{nl}여신께 맹세코 신수의 날 이후로 그렇게 강한 마족은 처음봤습니다.
column4: Apa? Kamu datang untuk mencari tuan Pranas katamu?{nl} Sungguh telat sekali. Tuan Pranas diserang oleh para Demon di area 5.{nl} Seharusnya ia membawa para informan bersamanya.{nl} Aku bersumpah atas nama Goddess, Ini pertama kalinya aku melihat Demon yang kuat seperti itu setelah hari Medzio Diena.

column2: {nl}When I met his eyes, all we can do was to run away.{nl}Pranas will be in danger if it continues like this!{nl}Help us!
column3: {nl}녀석과 눈을 마주치는 순간 우리가 할 수 있는 건 도망치는 것 밖에 없었습니다.{nl}이대로는 프라나스님이 위험합니다!{nl}도와주세요!
column4: {nl} Setelah berpapasan muka dengan mereka, tiada yang bisa kami lakukan selain melarikan diri.{nl} Jika begini terus maka tuan Pranas dalam bahaya besar!{nl} Tolonglah!

column2: There's nothing we can do.{nl}If Pranas gets attacked, the bishop's disappearance will go into mystery forever...
column3: 우리가 할 수 있는 일이 없습니다.{nl}프라나스님이 당하시면 주교님의 실종은 영영 미궁 속으로 빠질 겁니다..
column4: Tidak ada yang kami dapat lakukan.{nl} Jika sampai tuan Pranas terbunuh, maka kasus hilangnya Bishop akan mencapai kebuntuan..

column2: Damn..{nl}Who are you? You've saved me.{nl}One or two demons were wandering around so I was going to search the camp, but{nl}the boss suddenly appeared..
column3: 으..{nl}누구십니까? 저를 구해주셨군요.{nl}마족 한 두마리가 어슬렁거리기에 처리하고 캠프를 수색하려 했는데{nl}갑자기 우두머리가 나타났습니다..
column4: Eh..{nl}Siapa itu? Kamu telah menyelamatkan saya rupanya.{nl} Ketika bermaksud menghabisi satu dua ekor demon yang berkeliaran dan mencari Camp{nl} Mendadak boss mereka muncul..

column2: So the elder sent you?{nl}Then you must know that the bishop has already disappeared..{nl}I can't even control myself so it's hard for me to continue the search activities.{nl}Can you look around here on behalf of me?
column3: 영주님이 보내셨단 말인가요?{nl}그럼 주교님이 사라졌다는 건 이미 알고 계시겠군요..{nl}저는 제 몸하나 가누기 힘들어서 더 이상 수색활동을 하기 힘들 것 같습니다.{nl}제 대신 이 주변을 좀 확인해 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Apakah itu maksudnya Land Lord yang mengirimmu?{nl} Kalau begitu kamu pasti sudah tahu bahwa Bishop telah menghilang ya..{nl} Karena saya kesulitan mengontrol badan saya ini, maka sulit pula untuk melakukan pencarian lebih lanjut.{nl} Maukah kamu menggantikan saya untuk memeriksa di sekitar sini?

column2: {nl}If this place doesn't exist, we may have to go to the forest in the north that turned into a ruin.{nl}I am worried since there are more dangerous monsters out there..
column3: {nl}이제 여기도 없으면 우린 북쪽 폐허가 된 숲으로 가야할지도 모릅니다.{nl}거긴 더 위험한 몬스터들이 우글거리고 있어서 걱정이 됩니다만..
column4: {nl} Jika tidak ada disini juga, entah apakah kita harus pergi ke hutan yang menjadi reruntuhan di utara.{nl} Disana banyak berkeliaran monster yang berbahaya, sungguh mengkhawatirkan..

column2: If you find something, please come look for me at Orsha.{nl}I am counting on you..
column3: 뭔가 찾으시면 오르샤로 절 찾아 오십시오.{nl}뒤를 부탁드립니다..
column4: Jika mencari sesuatu, datanglah mencari saya di Orsha.{nl} Mohon bantuannya..

column2: I took some rest and as a result, I got better.{nl}Have you found something?
column3: 좀 쉬었더니 많이 나아졌습니다.{nl}뭔가 찾아오셨습니까?
column4: Aku sudah lebih baikan setelah sedikit beristirahat.{nl} Apakah yang telah kamu temukan?

column2: With the informants, I am helping the chasers who were hired to search Paupys Crossing and do the investigation.{nl}But, it's too hard for me to do it alone.{nl}If you get a chance to cross the 1st district, please tell me after defeating the monsters there.{nl}Then, I will pass your good intentions to the elder.
column3: 저는 여기서 정보원들과 고용된 추적자들이 파우피스 나루를 원활히 수색하고 조사할 수 있도록 도와주고 있습니다.{nl}하지만 혼자선 역부족이군요.{nl}1번 지역을 지날일이 있다면 그 곳에서 몬스터들을 처치하고 제게 말씀해주시면{nl}제가 영주님께 당신의 선의를 전달하겠습니다.
column4: Saya sedang membantu para informan dan chaser yang direkrut agar dapat melakukan penyelidikan dan pencarian dengan lancar di Paupys Crossing.{nl} Tetapi rasanya sulit jika melakukan sendirian saja.{nl} Jika kamu ada urusan melewati area 1, tolong bunuhlah monster yang ada di tempat itu dan jika memberitahukannya kepada saya{nl} Maka akan saya sampaikan itikad baik kamu kepada Land Lord.

column2: I was called here during my vacation so I don't know what's going on.
column3: 휴가 중에 여기 불려와서 저도 뭐가 어떻게 돌아가는 지 정확히 모르겠습니다.
column4: Entah bagaimana aku dapat kembali karena saya dipanggil kesini ketika sedang liburan.

column2: You've defeated that many?{nl}Are the ones from the outside all strong like you?
column3: 그렇게 많이 처리해 주셨습니까?{nl}외지에서 오신 분들은 모두 당신처럼 강한가요?
column4: Kau telah menghabisinya sebanyak itu?{nl} Apakah orang yang berasal dari area luar, semuanya kuat seperti anda?

column2: I haven't found out exactly why the demons are wandering around here, but..{nl}there are many magic circles wihch the demons have set up at the 2nd district.{nl}If you get a chance to visit the 2nd district, can you get rid of those?
column3: 여기에 왜 마족들이 돌아다니는 지 아직 정확한 원인은 파악하지 못 했습니다만{nl}2번 지역에 마족들이 설치한 마법진들이 많이 있더군요.{nl}2번 지역에 가실일이 있다면 그걸 좀 정리해주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Masih belum diketahui alasan kenapa di sini para demon banyak berkeliaran seperti itu{nl} Terdapat banyak magic circle yang dipasang oleh para Demon di area 2.{nl} Jika kamu memiliki urusan di area 2, maukah kamu menghabisi mereka sedikit?

column2: When I came here last time due to the problem of the settlers.. there were nothing like this..{nl}What's going on?
column3: 이주민들 문제로 제가 마지막으로 여기 왔을 땐 이런것들이 없었는데..{nl}무슨일이 벌어지고 있는 걸까요?
column4: Ketika saya datang terakhir kali kesini atas masalah Imigran, tidak ada hal-hal yang seperti ini loh..{nl} Ada hal apa yang sedang terjadi ya?

column2: I don't understand why they set this up.{nl}It doesn't seem to have any damages.. It is stragne.
column3: 대체 무슨 용도로 설치한 걸까요?{nl}별다른 피해도 없는 것 같고.. 이상한 일이군요.
column4: Omong-omong itu dipasang dengan fungsi apa ya?{nl} Sepertinya tidak ada kerusakan apa pun terjadi.. Hal yang aneh.

column2: The villagers in the north would start to emigrate soon.{nl}The lord is thinking about making them stay near the 4th district.{nl}The villagers in the north are aggressive and there are elders who were once mercenaries so if there is a camp for them{nl}they think they can protect themselves.
column3: 북쪽의 마을 사람들이 곧 이주를 시작할 겁니다.{nl}영주님께선 아마 4번 지역 주변에 머물게 하실 생각이신거 같습니다.{nl}북쪽 마을 사람들은 호전적이고 용병출신 원로들도 있어서 캠프만 마련해주면{nl}스스로 지킬 수 있을거라고 생각하시는 거 같아요.
column4: Orang-orang desa utara, mulai melakukan migrasi.{nl} Land Lord sepertinya berpikir untuk tinggal di sekitar area 4.{nl} Mungkin Land Lord berpikir bahwa Orang-orang desa utara cukup agresif dan sebagian tetuanya merupakan mantan tentara{nl} Sehingga jika menyiapkan tenda saja, maka mereka akan menjagainya masing-masing.

column2: {nl}So they told me to check whether those monsters are the ones we can handle ourselves{nl}I am a person who actually write documents and putting stamps on the documents instead of doing investigations so this is too much task for me.{nl}I heard that you are very strong. Can you check 4/5 districts?
column3: {nl}그래서 저 보고 그들이 감당할 수 있을 정도의 몬스터들인지 확인해보라고 했는데{nl}저는 원래 이런 조사활동보단 책상에서 문서나 쓰고 도장이나 찍어주던 일을 하던 사람이라 도무지 감당이 안 되는 군요.{nl}당신은 꽤 강한 사람이라고 들었습니다. 4/5번 지역을 좀 확인해주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl}Maka dari itu ia menyuruh saya untuk memeriksa apakah monster-monster yang ada dapat ditangani oleh mereka atau tidak{nl} tetapi karena saya adalah orang yang biasa bekerja di kantor, maka saya tidak dapat mengatasi situasi seperti ini.{nl} Kudengar kamu adalah orang yang cukup kuat.  Bisakah kamu memeriksa area 4/5?

column2: I never held a sword except for when I joind the squad so I don't understand why they are sending us to this kind of place..{nl}The lord is asking too much.
column3: 입대 할때 빼곤 칼자루라곤 잡아본 적도 없는데 이런곳으로 보내다니..{nl}영주님은 정말 너무 하십니다.
column4: Selain ketika memasuki tentara, aku tidak pernah menggenggam sesuatu yang bernama pisau militer, tetapi malah dikirimkan ke tempat seperti ini..{nl} Land Lord sungguh keterlaluan sekali.

column2: Are you saying that a gigantic monster appeared at the camp?{nl}I haven't seen with my own eyes, but I can't tell others to stay theree.{nl}You agree right? I will count on you and report.
column3: 캠프에서 그런 거대한 녀석이 나타났단 말입니까?{nl}제 눈으로 본건 아니지만 그런 곳에 사람들더러 지내라곤 할 수 없겠지요?{nl}그렇지요? 당신만 믿고 저는 보고하겠습니다.
column4: Maksudmu telah muncul mahluk sebesar itu di Camp?{nl} Walaupun aku tidak melihatnya sendiri, tetapi tempat itu tidak bisa ditinggali orang-orang ya?{nl} Begitu ya?  Saya percaya pada kamu saja, dan Aku akan melaporkannya.

column2: We are facing a difficult situation.{nl}The demons which I saw in the books may appear at the place where I was dispatched..{nl}This is too much for me.{nl}And due to the demons that I haven't seen, the monsters may have gone violent..{nl}How can they ask me to extract the blood from the monsters...
column3: 정말 난감합니다.{nl}책에서나 보던 마족들이 하필 제가 파견나와 있는 곳에 나타날지도 모른다니..{nl}저는 이런거 절대로 무리입니다.{nl}게다가 아직 보지도 못한 마족들 때문에 몬스터들이 흉포해 졌을지도 모르니{nl}몬스터들에게서 피를 뽑아오라뇨..
column4: Sungguh tidak ada harapan.{nl} Entah apakah para demon yang kulihat di buku, muncul di tempat saya bertugas atau tidak..{nl} Saya menganggap hal seperti ini mustahil.{nl} Ditambah lagi karena para demon yang belum terlihat, entah apakah para monster pun menjadi lebih ganas{nl} Tolong dapatkan darah dari para monster itu..

column2: If you get a chance to visit 5th district, could you defeat the monsters there and collect their blood?
column3: 5번지역에 가실 일이 있으면 그 근방의 몬스터들을 처리하시고 피를 좀 모와주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Jika ada urusan melewati area 5, maukah kamu mengumpulkan sedikit darah monster dengan menghabisi monster yang ada disana?

column2: I am not a coward.{nl}I just know my place.{nl}I don't fight with a sword or a spear, but rather with pens and stamps..
column3: 저는 겁쟁이가 아닙니다.{nl}제 분수를 아는 것이죠.{nl}애초에 저는 칼이나 창이 아니라 만연필과 도장으로 싸운단 말입니다..
column4: Saya bukanlah penakut.{nl} Saya hanya mengetahui batasan kemampuan diri saya saja.{nl} Karena sejak awal saya bukanlah bertarung menggunakan pisau dan tombak, melainkan menggunakan pena dan stempel..

column2: What is this disgusting odor?{nl}I don't know why he ordered me to collect these.{nl}He knows well..
column3: 으, 이 역겨운 냄새는 뭐죠?{nl}이런걸 저더러 어떻게 모아오라고 시킨건지 모르겠습니다.{nl}잘 알면서..
column4: Eh, bau menjijikkan apa ini?{nl} Entah bagaimana aku bisa menyuruh kamu untuk mengumpulkan sesuatu yang seperti ini.{nl} Kalau tahu..

column2: It's too hard for me to survive by just hunting these days so I came down this far.{nl}We should live on.{nl}In this place, we won't survive even if we have more than 10 lives.
column3: 요즘같은 시기에 사냥만으론 먹고 살기 힘들어서 여기까지 흘러왔습니다만{nl}일단 목숨이 붙어 있어야 먹고 살거 아닙니까?{nl}여기 있다간 목숨이 열 개라도 모자르겠습니다.
column4: Pada jaman seperti ini karena sulit untuk makan dan hidup dari melakukan perburuan saja, saya datang sampai ke sini{nl} tetapi bukankah kita butuh nyawa ini, untuk melakukan makan dan hidup?{nl} Jika berada di sini, walau memiliki 10 nyawa pun rasanya kurang.

column2: {nl}We were injured and we don't know when the monsters and the demons would go after us.{nl}While we are recovering, can you defeat the monsters around?{nl}Since we don't have any one who is okay, I have no one to request other than you.
column3: {nl}우린 부상당했고 언제 또 몬스터나 마족들이 우릴 노릴 지 알 수 없습니다.{nl}우리가 기운을 차릴 동안 주변 몬스터들을 처리해 주실 수 있겠습니까?{nl}멀쩡한 사람이 없으니 당신말곤 부탁할 사람이 없습니다.
column4: {nl} Kami telah mengalami luka, dan tidak diketahui kapan para demon atau monster mengincar kita.{nl} Selama kami memulihkan energi, maukah kamu menghabisi monster yang ada di sekitar?{nl} Karena tidak ada orang yang sehat, maka tiada orang lain yang bisa dimintai bantuan selain anda.

column2: I want to swear to the ones who took me here.
column3: 절 여기 데려온 사람들에게 욕이라도 하고 싶군요.
column4: Aku ingin memaki orang-orang yang telah membawaku ke tempat ini.

column2: I think I have some problem on my legs or ankles.{nl}If you didn't help me, I am sure that I would have been attacked.{nl}Thank you.
column3: 아무래도 다리나 발목에 문제가 있는 것 같습니다.{nl}당신이 도와주지 않았다면 여기서 발이나 질질끌다가 당해버렸을 겁니다.{nl}감사합니다.
