column4: Bagaimanapun sepertinya kaki atau pergelangan kakiku memiliki masalah.{nl} Jika kamu tadi tidak membantu, maka pasti kami sudah terbunuh di sini.{nl} Terima kasih.

column2: Have you seen any bags or luggages around here?{nl}While we were away, the monsters took the goods of the chasers and the informants{nl}and ran away.
column3: 주변에서 혹시 가방이나 봇짐을 못 보셨습니까?{nl}우리가 잠시 여기서 자리를 비운 사이에 몬스터들 추적자들과 정보대원들의 물건을{nl}가지고 도망쳐 버렸습니다.
column4: Apakah  kamu melihat tas atau barang bawaan di sekitar sini?{nl} Selama kami tidak berada di tempat ini, para monster telah mengambil barang mili para informan dan chaser{nl} lalu pergi melarikan diri.

column2: {nl}If you get a chance to go to 8th district, can you look for our luggages?
column3: {nl}8번 지역에 가실 일이 있다면 저희 짐을 찾아주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl}Jika kamu pergi ke area 8, maka bisakah kamu mau mencarikan barang bawaan kami?

column2: I am hurt and lost my luggages..{nl}Before you asked me to help me, I didn't have any excuses so I didn't know what to do.
column3: 부상도 심한데 짐까지 잃어버리다니..{nl}당신이 도와준다고 하기 전까진 변명거리도 없어서 머리 속이 새하옜습니다.
column4: Sudah terluka parah, ditambah lagi kehilangan barang bawaan juga..{nl} Tiada hal yang kuingat, karena semua di kepala hanya warna putih saja, sampai kamu berkata akan membantu.

column2: Thank you so much! Althugh I haven't retrived them all, I think I now have something to say!
column3: 정말 감사합니다! 다 되찾은건 아니지만 이 정도면 저도 할말은 생기겠군요!
column4: Terima kasih banyak! Walaupun tidak semuanya terambil kembali, tetapi ini cukup untukku!

column2: I can now barely manage ourselves.{nl}This is all because of your help.{nl}Although I am not good, I translated the diary of the bishop so do you want to listen to it?
column3: 겨우 몸을 가눌 수 있게 되었군요.{nl}이 모든게 당신이 구해주신 덕분입니다.{nl}제가 미약하지만 주교님의 일지를 해석을 해보았으니 들어주시겠습니까?
column4: Sudah hampir dapat menguasai tubuh ini.{nl} Semua ini adalah berkat kamu yang menyelamatkan saya.{nl} Walaupun saya lemah, tetapi karena saya sudah menafsirkan jurnal dari Bishop, maukah kamu mendengarnya?

column2: When I translate the diary of the bishop, I can read something like this.
column3: 주교님의 일지를 해석해보면 이런 내용이 나옵니다.
column4: Jika menafsirkan isi jurnal Bishop, maka isinya adalah sebagai berikut.

column2: {nl}{nl}If the world goes into a chaos, an outsider who was assigned by the goddesses would visit Orsha.{nl}But, that outsider would come in with other outsiders.{nl}It is our destiny to find and guide him.{nl}Among many outsiders, we should look for the one who we are looking for.
column3: {nl}{nl}세상이 혼란해 지면 여신께서 안배하신 이방인이 오르샤에 방문할 것이다.{nl}하지만 이 이방인은 다른 이방인들과 뒤섞여 들어올 것이다.{nl}그를 찾아내어 인도하는 것이 우리 교단의 숙명이다.{nl}수 많은 이방인 중에 우리가 찾는 오직 한 명을 찾아야 한다.
column4: {nl}{nl}Jika dunia menjadi kacau, maka seorang asing yang ditugaskan oleh Goddess akan mengunjungi Orsha.{nl} Tetapi orang asing ini, akan masuk dengan bercampur dengan orang aisng lainnya.{nl} Itu adalah takdir lembaga religius kami untuk mengarahkan dan menemukan dirinya.{nl} Diantara banyak orang asing, kami hanya harus mencari satu orang saja.

column2: {nl}Before we are even ready, the demons are chasing after the right.{nl}I am heading to the Ashaq Underground Prison with my priests.{nl}There, I will wait for the Revelator.
column3: {nl}우리가 준비를 채 마치기도 전에 마족들이 우를 좇고 있다.{nl}나는 내 사제들과 아샤크 지하 감옥으로 향한다.{nl}그곳에서 여신께서 안배해주신 오직 한 명, 계시자를 기다릴 것이다.
column4: {nl} Sebelum kami dapat selesai bersiap, para demon mengejar kami.{nl} Saya sedang menuju ke Ashaq Underground Prison dan para Priestku.{nl} Disana Aku akan menunggu Savior, seorang yang diutus oleh Goddess.

column2: {nl}{nl}We didn't have enough time to pass it to Inessa and the priests who went outside.{nl}If someone discovers this diary, please hand it over to Inesa Hamondale.
column3: {nl}{nl}이네사와 외지에 나가있는 제자들에게 전달하기엔 시간이 너무도 촉박했다.{nl}이 일지를 누군가 발견한다면 이네사 헤먼대일, 오르샤 영주에게 전달해다오.
column4: {nl}{nl}Sepertinya waktu terlalu sempit untuk menyampaikan kepada para murid yang keluar ke remote area dan Inesia.{nl} Jika seseorang menemukan Jurnal ini, tolong sampaikan kepada Orsha Land Lord, Inesia Hamondale.

column2: {nl}{nl}I understand now.{nl}Being chased after the demons! That's a big problem.{nl}We better let the lord know this!
column3: {nl}{nl}이런 내용이군요.{nl}마족에게 좇기고 있다니! 큰일입니다.{nl}이 사실을 어서 영주님께 말씀드려야 합니다!
column4: {nl}{nl}Begitulah isinya.{nl} Ia sedang dikejar oleh Demon! Masalah besar.{nl} Segeralah beritahukan kebenaran ini kepada Land Lord!

column2: Urbonas was being chased after the demons!{nl}Ashaq Underground Prison was closed for a long time.{nl}I don't know what they are trying to do..
column3: 우르보나스님이 마족에게 좇기고 있다니요!{nl}아샤크 지하 감옥이라면 아주 먼 옛날부터 폐쇄된 곳 입니다.{nl}그런 곳으로 숨으셔서 뭘 어쩌시려는 건지 모르겠군요..
column4: Tuan Urbonas sedang dikejar oleh Demon katanya!{nl} Ashaq Underground Prison adalah tempat yang telah ditutup sejak dahulu kala.{nl} Entah apa yang akan terjadi jika bersembunyi di tempat semacam itu..

column2: {nl}Someone must go there now!
column3: {nl}당장 그곳으로 누군가 가야합니다!
column4: {nl}Segera seseorang harus pergi ke tempat itu!

column2: I will get ready to go to Ashaq Underground Prison.{nl}I want you to tell this to the lord fast!
column3: 저는 아샤크 지하 감옥으로 떠날 준비를 하겠습니다.{nl}당신은 어서 빨리 영주님께 이 사실을 전달해 주십시오!
column4: Aku akan bersiap untuk pergi ke Ashaq Underground Prison.{nl} Kamu juga segeralah bergegas beritahukan kebenaran ini kepada Land Lord!

column2: It would take long time to send my subordinates there.{nl}I am sorry, but can you go to Ashaq Underground Prison where Pranas and Urbonas are located?{nl}I can't move so I feel stuffy..
column3: 제 직속 부하들을 그곳으로 보내려면 시간이 한참 걸릴겁니다.{nl}죄송하지만 당신이 프라나스님과 우르보나스님이 계신 아샤크 지하 감옥으로 가주실 수 있겠습니까?{nl}영주인 제가 움직일 수도 없는 노릇이고 답답하군요..
column4: Jika ingin mengirimkan para anak buahku ke tempat itu, maka akan memakan waktu.{nl} Mohon maaf, tetapi bisakah kamu pergi ke tempat tuan Pranas dan Urbonas berada di Ashaq Underground Prison?{nl} Saya pun cukup kecewa karena tidak dapat melakukan apapun sebagai Land Lord..

column2: If you are the Revelator which Urbonas talked about, we better go meet Urbonas fast.{nl}However, even if you are busy, you should be well prepared so go meet the item merchant.{nl}I've prepared goods which you would be able to use well.
column3: 당신이 우르보나스님이 말씀하신 여신이 안배해주신 계시자라면 한시 바삐 우르보나스님께 가야합니다.{nl}하지만 아무리 바빠도 준비는 철저히 하셔야하니 잡화상인에게 가보십시오.{nl}제가 당신이 요긴하게 쓰실 보급품을 준비해 두었습니다.
column4: Jika kamu adalah Savior yang dikirimkan Goddess seperti yang diberitahukan oleh Urbonas, maka harus pergi kepada tuan Urbonas sesegera mungkin.{nl} Tetapi seberapa sibuk pun, karena harus bersiap dengan baik maka pergilah kepada Retail Merchant terlebih dulu.{nl} Saya telah menyiapkan persediaan barang untuk dipakai kamu secara praktis.

column2: {nl}If your preparation gets completed, don't come to me, but please rather meet Pranas and head to Ashaq Underground Prison!
column3: {nl}준비가 끝나면 제게 오지 마시고 바로 프라나스님과 만나서 아샤크 지하 감옥으로 향해 주십시오!
column4: {nl}Jika persiapan telah selesai, janganlah datang kepadaku tetapi temuilah tuan Pranas dan pergilah mengarah ke Ashaq Underground Prison!

column2: I've prepared it fast since the lord sent the people.{nl}I should give you a better good, but since we are in a hurry, please use it.{nl}When you use an anvil, you would be able to enhance your weapon.
column3: 영주님이 사람을 보내셔서 급하게 준비했어요.{nl}좀 더 좋은 물건을 드려야하는 데 급한데로 이거라도 써보세요.{nl}모루를 사용하시면 무기를 강화하실 수 있어요.
column4: Land Lord telah bersiap dengan terburu-buru dengan mengirimkan orang.{nl} Sebenarnya saya ingin memberikan benda yang lebih bagus, tetapi karena terburu-buru tolong gunakanlah ini.{nl} Jika menggunakan Anvil maka dapat memperkuat senjata.

column2: If the demons hurt Urbonas, then the next target will be Orsha.{nl}We should do our best to save Urbonas!
column3: 마족들이 우르보나스님을 해친다면 그 다음은 당연히 인근의 오르샤겠지요.{nl}무슨 수를 써서든 우르보나스님을 구해야합니다!
column4: Jika para Demon menghabisi tuan Urbonas, maka selanjutnya yang menjadi target adalah Orsha.{nl} Apapun yang terjadi tuan Urbonas harus diselamatkan!

column2: Your words are correct.{nl}The northern region where I used to stay became a ruin due to the demons.{nl}Probably, the next location will be the southern region.
column3: 영주님의 말이 맞습니다.{nl}제가 있었던 북부 지방은 마족들에 의해 폐허가 된지 오랩니다.{nl}아마 다음은 남부 지방이겠지요.
column4: Perkataan Land Lord adalah benar.{nl} Area Utara tempat saya berada dulu, telah lama hancur akibat para Demon.{nl} Mungkin selanjutnya adalah daerah selatan.

column2: {nl}Orsha is the base of the southern part of the kingdom.{nl}I am sure that the demons would do something.{nl}Please go to Ashaq Underground Prison with me to save Urbonas!
column3: {nl}오르샤는 왕국 남부의 거점입니다.{nl}우르보나스님을 잡은 마족들이 손을 뻗을 게 분명합니다.{nl}저와 함께 우르보나스님을 구하러 아샤크 지하 감옥으로 가주십시오!
column4: {nl}Orsha adalah markas dari kerajaan selatan.{nl} Para Demon yang menangkap tuan Urbonas, sudah jelas campur tangan dalam hal ini.{nl} Tolong pergilah menyelamatkan Tuan Urbonas di Ashaq Underground Prison bersama dengan saya!

column2: I am gonna go to ask for help to the chasers.{nl}If you are ready, please come to xx region that leads to Ashaq Underground Prison at Paupys Crossing.
column3: 저는 이길로 추적자들에게 도움을 요청하러 가겠습니다.{nl}당신도 준비가 되면 파우피스 나루의 아샤크 지하 감옥으로 가는 xx 지역으로 와 주십시오.
column4: Aku akan pergi untuk meminta bantuan kepada para chaser di jalan ini.{nl} Jika kamu juga telah siap, tolong datanglah ke area XX yang mengarah ke Ashaq Underground Prison di Paupys Crossing.

column2: They are all experienced chasers who would help me.{nl}But, it's not going to enough do it just by us.{nl}It is so fortunate that you came with us.{nl}
column3: 여긴 저를 도와줄 제일 노련한 추적자들입니다.{nl}하지만 우리들만으론 부족할 것 입니다.{nl}당신이 함께 와주셔서 다행입니다.{nl}
column4: Ini adalah para chaser yang paling berpengalaman yang akan membantu saya.{nl} Tetapi tetap saja jumlah kami kurang jika segini saja.{nl} Untungnya kamu juga ada bersama kami.{nl}

column2: I can feel some ominous energy coming from the direction of the Underground Prison.{nl}If you are ready, let's head to Ashaq Underground Prison.
column3: 지하 감옥 방향에서 불긴한 기운이 뿜어져 나오는 게 느껴집니다.{nl}준비가 되시면 아샤크 지하 감옥으로 출발합시다.
column4: Terasa suatu energi tidak baik yang mengalir keluar dari arah Basement Prison.{nl} Jika telah siap mari berangkat ke Ashaq Underground Prison.

column2: I will first leave with the chasers.{nl}Please follow us right away.
column3: 저는 추적자들과 먼저 출발하겠습니다.{nl}바로 따라와 주십시오.
column4: Aku akan berangkat terlebih dahulu dengan para Chaser.{nl} Tolong ikuti langsung.

column2: It feels like something unknown is suffocating me.{nl}I can't even breathe.{nl}By the way, are you okay?
column3: 알 수 없는 뭔가가 목을 조여오는 것 같습니다.{nl}숨조차 쉬기 힘들군요.{nl}그런데 당신은 괜찮으십니까?
column4: Sepertinya ada sesuatu yang terasa berat di leher dan tidak dapat diketahui.{nl} Sampai sulit untuk bernapas rasanya.{nl} Tetapi apakah kamu tidak apa-apa?

column2: {nl}By seeing that you are free inside, I guess the goddesses really take care of you.
column3: {nl}당신만이 이 안에서 자유로운 걸 보니 정말 여신이 보살피고 있는 것 같군요.
column4: {nl} Melihat kebebasan yang ada pada diri anda, sepertinya Goddess sungguh sedang memperhatikan kita.

column2: I've been to this place a few times when I was doing training in the past.{nl}But, I never felt like something is suffocating me.{nl}Same with that ominous fog.
column3: 이곳은 수련사제로 지낼때 몇 번 와본적이 있었습니다.{nl}하지만 이런 숨을 죄여오는 느낌을 받은 적은 없습니다.{nl}저 불긴한 안개도 마찬가지구요.
column4: Aku pernah datang ke tempat ini beberapa kali ketika masih berlatih menjadi Priest.{nl} Tetapi aku tidak pernah menrasakan kesulitan bernapas seperti ini.{nl} Sampa seperti kabut yang tidak enak itu.

column2: {nl}Since you seem safe, can you go to the 2nd district and{nl}check what's going on?
column3: {nl}당신은 자유로우신것 같으니 2번 지역으로 가셔서 주변에서 무슨일이 있는지{nl}확인해주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl} Karena kamu terlihat bebas, maka pergilah ke area nomor 2 dan cobalah periksa{nl} ada hal apa yang terjadi disana?

column2: This feeling is like a curse.
column3: 이 느낌은 흡사 저주같군요.
column4: Perasaan ini sama seperti terkena kutukan rupanya.

column2: I've never seen an icon with a shape like that.{nl}I think the demons have some other objective.{nl}I can't do anything at the moment so I am very grateful{nl}that you've destroyed the icon for me.
column3: 그런 모양의 우상은 본적도 들은 적도 없습니다.{nl}아무래도 마족들이 뭔가 수작을 부린게 분명합니다.{nl}손가락 하나 까딱할 수 없었는데 당신이 그 우상을 파괴하니{nl}이제 좀 편해졌습니다.
column4: Aku belum pernah melihat dan mendengar akan berhala yang berbentuk seperti itu.{nl} Bagaimanapun para Demon sepertinya sedang merencanakan suatu hal.{nl}  Kami merasa tenang, karena kamu telah menghancurkan berhala tersebut{nl} Padahal kami bahkan tidak dapat menyentuhnya satu jemari pun.

column2: {nl}There is a possibility that the bishop and his brothers are hiding in the hidden room.{nl}Since we can't do anything, you should go there alone.{nl}Are you going to be okay?
column3: {nl}주교님과 그 형제들은 아마 이 곳의 숨겨진 방에 숨어있을 가능성이 있습니다.{nl}우린 아무 것도 할 수 없으니 당신 혼자서 그곳으로 가주셔야 합니다.{nl}괜찮으시겠습니까?
column4: {nl}Sekarang ada kemungkinan bahwa Bishop ada bersama dengan saudara-saudara itu di dalam ruang tersembunyi di tempat ini.{nl} Karena kami tidak dapat melakukan apapun, tolonglah kamu pergi ke tempat itu sendirian.{nl} Apakah tidak apa-apa?

column2: If possible, I want you to eliminate all the icons.{nl}If they remain, we can't run away even if our brothers are alive.
column3: 가능하면 방금 처리하신 우상들을 모두 제거 해주십시오.{nl}그게 남아있는 한 형제들이 살아있더라도 도망칠 수 없습니다.
column4: Jika memungkinkan, tolong habisi semua patung berhala yang baru saja kamu hancurkan.{nl} Jika ada benda itu, maka saudara-saudara yang selamat pun tidak dapat melarikan diri.

column2: This place is old and mazed so if we go into a wrong way, we may not be able to go up.{nl}Please be careful.
column3: 이 곳은 오래된대다 복잡하여 길을 잘 못 들면 다시는 지상으로 나갈 수 없을 수도 있습니다.{nl}조심하십시오.
column4: Tempat ini sungguh rumit dan sudah tua, jika memasuki jalan yang salah maka ada kemungkinan tidak dapat keluar ke permukaan tanah kembali.{nl} waspadalah.

column2: So you've come here with Pranas?{nl}You've entered into a deadly place in order to save me.. I am too sorry to see my dead disciples.{nl}Recently, when my disciple, Iruma was doing training, he found a sheet of order.{nl}It contained the plans of the demons to annihilate Orsha.
column3: 프라나스와 여기 왔단 말입니까?{nl}스승을 구하기 위해 사지로 뛰어들다니.. 죽은 제자들을 볼 면목이 없습니다.{nl}얼마 전 제 제자인 이르마가 수행하던 중 마족녀석을 처리하면서 명령서를 발견했습니다.{nl}오르샤 지역을 멸망시킬 마족들의 계획이 담긴 문서였지요.
column4: Apakah maksud kamu datang kemari dengan Pranas?{nl} Membahayakan diri sendiri demi menyelamatkan guru.. Aku tidak memiliki muka untuk melihat para muridku yang telah mati.{nl} Beberapa waktu lalu, murid ku Irma yang sedang menjalankan misi, menghabisi para demon dan menemukan surat perintah.{nl} Itu adalah dokumen yang menyimpan rencana para demon untuk menghancurkan area Orsha.

column2: {nl}I gathered my disciples and met with Irma to try and analyze the document.{nl}But since then we've been constantly under attack by the demons.{nl}The document says that Demon Goddess Giltine is trying to kill all Revelators. {nl}So our order came here to hide and prepare to meet and guide the destined Revelator.
column3: {nl}저는 제 제자들을 불러 한 밤중에 이르마와 만나서 그 문서를 분석해 보았습니다.{nl}그 뒤로 우린 계속 마족들의 추격을 받게되었습니다.{nl}문서의 내용을 해석해 보니 마신 길티네가 모든 계시자들을 죽이라는 내용이 있더군요.{nl}그래서 우리 교단이 준비해온 계시자를 맞이하고 인도하기 위해 우린 이곳으로 숨었습니다.
column4: {nl} Saya memanggil para muridku di suatu malam dan bertemu dengan Irma, lalu mencoba menafsirkan dokumen itu.{nl} Setelah itu kami terus dikejar oleh para Demon.{nl} Setelah melihat isi tafsiran dokumen tersebut, isinya adalah Demon Giltine menyuruh untuk menghabisi seluruh Savior yang ada.{nl} Maka dari itu agar lembaga religius kami dapat menemui Savior yang terpilih dan mengarahkannya, maka kami bersembunyi di tempat ini.

column2: {nl}{nl}We had no way of telling Lord Inesa, however.{nl}If we left any traces the demons would find us and we thought that would be the end of us.{nl}My disciples and I ended up hiding here, trying to avoid the demons.{nl}But there was something we missed.
column3: {nl}{nl}하지만 영주인 이네사에게 전달할 방법이 없었습니다.{nl}흔적을 남기면 마족들에게 추격을 받게 될 것이고 그렇게되면 우린 그걸로 끝장이라고 생각했습니다.{nl}그 후 저와 제자들은 마족의 추격을 피해 이곳까지 몰래 숨어들었습니다.{nl}하지만 간과하고 있는 게 있었습니다.
column4: {nl}{nl}Tetapi tidak ada cara untuk menyampaikannya kepada Land Lord Inesia.{nl} Jika meninggalkan jejak, maka akan dikejar oleh para demon dan kupikir itu akan menjadi akhir dari segalanya.{nl} Setelah itu, saya dan para murid bersembunyi secara diam-diam di tempat ini dengan menghindari kejaran demon.{nl} Tetapi ternyata hal itu telah membawa hasil.

column2: {nl}We were being chased by no ordinary demon, but a Demon Lord.{nl}This Demon Lord, Marnox, set up statues of himself to control the prison{nl} and had his vassals close in on us to keep us from escaping.{nl}We thought soon it would be over for us.
column3: {nl}우리를 뒤좇는 건 일반적인 마족이 아니라 마군주였습니다.{nl}마르녹스라는 이 마군주는 우리가 여기서 빠져나갈 수 없게 자신의 우상을 통해{nl}이 감옥을 지배하고 자신의 부하들을 풀어서 우리를 구석으로 몰아넣었습니다.{nl}이제 끝이라고 생각하고 있었습니다.
column4: {nl}Yang mengejar kami adalah bukan demon biasa, melainkan Demon Lord.{nl} Demon Lord yang bernama Marnox membuat kami tidak dapat keluar dari tempat ini, dengan menguasai penjara ini,{nl} melalui patung berhala dirinya ia melepaskan anak buahnya dan memojokkan kami.{nl} Saya telah berpikir bahwa itu semua adalah akhir dari segalanya.

column2: {nl}The priests are hiding in levels 2F and 3F.{nl}A few priests went missing, and Irma and I met Marnox trying to escape from the hidden room where we hid the Demon Orders.{nl}Irma was caught by Marnox, while I managed to escape and was ready to die by now.
column3: {nl}제 사제들은 지하 2층과 3층에 숨어있습니다.{nl}몇몇 사제들은 행방불명 되었고 이르마는 저와 마족 문서를 지하 3층의 숨겨진 방에 숨겨두고 이곳을 탈출하려다가 마르녹스와 마주쳤습니다.{nl}이르마는 마르녹스에게 붙잡혔고 저는 여기로 도망쳐서 죽을 준비를 하고 있었습니다.
column4: {nl}Para Priestku sedang bersembunyi di lantai 2 dan 3.{nl} Beberapa Priest telah hilang, lalu Irma dan Saya yang membawa dokumen itu bersembunyi di ruangan bawah tanah lantai 3, tetapi ketika bermaksud melarikan diri secara tidak sengaja bertemu dengan Marnox.{nl} Irma tertangkap oleh Marnox, dan  saya melarikan diri ke tempat ini dan tadinya sedang bersiap untuk menghadapi kematian.

column2: {nl}But if Inesa sent you here, there is still hope.{nl}There is no doubt you are the Revelator we have been waiting for.
column3: {nl}하지만 이네사가 당신을 보낸걸 보니 아직 희망이 있군요.{nl}당신은 우리가 기다려온 계시자인게 분명합니다.
column4: {nl} Tetapi melihat kamu yang dikirimkan oleh Inesia, sepertinya masih ada harapan akan segalanya.{nl} Sudah jelas bahwa kamu adalah Savior yang kami semua sedang tunggu.

column2: If you are a Revelator, step onto our magic circle.{nl}If your status is confirmed, then you can face the Demon Lord.
column3: 당신이 계시자라면 우리가 준비해둔 마법진에 올라서십시오.{nl}계시자가 맞다면 마군주와 맞설 수 있을 겁니다.
column4: Jika kamu adalah sang Savior, maka silahkan naik pada Magic Circle yang kami telah siapkan.{nl} Jika benar kamu adalah Savior, maka ada pasti bisa menghadapi Demon Lord.

column2: Don't be afraid.{nl}The goddesses will lead your way.
column3: 두려워 마십시오.{nl}여신께서 당신을 이끄실 겁니다.
column4: Jangalah takut.{nl} Goddesslah yang akan mengarahkan anda.

column2: The efforts of our order were not in vain.{nl}Revelator...
column3: 우리 교단의 노력이 헛되지 않았습니다.{nl}계시자시여..
column4: Usaha yang lembaga religius kami lakukan tidaklah sia-sia.{nl} Wahai Savior..

column2: {nl}Only you can face Demon Lord Marnox now.{nl}Please, save our priests and the people of Orsha.
column3: {nl}마군주 마르녹스와 대적할 사람은 이제 당신 밖에 없습니다.{nl}부디 제 사제들과 오르샤를 구해주십시오.
column4: {nl} Tiada orang yang dapat menghadapai Demon Lord Marnox selain anda.{nl} Tolong selamatkan Orsha dan Para Priestku.

column2: Revelator, thanks to you destroying the statues Pranas is now able to move.{nl}I'm old and will be nothing but a burden to you; go with Pranas and Irma and save the priests.{nl}Please.
column3: 계시자여 당신이 우상들을 제거한 덕분에 이제 프라나스가 움직일 수 있을 겁니다.{nl}저는 노쇄하여 방해만 되태니 프라나스와 함께 이르마와 제 사제들을 구해주십시오.{nl}부탁드립니다.
column4: Wahai Savior berkat kamu yang telah menghabisi para berhala, sekarang Pranas akan dapat bergerak kembali.{nl} Karena saya yang tua ini hanya menghambat saja, maka pergilah bersama Pranas untuk menyelamatkan Irma dan Para Priestku.{nl} Mohon bantuanmu.

column2: I can't escape on my own and leave the priests behind.{nl}We need to find the Demon Orders. {nl}We need to analyze it and figure out the demons' invasion plans.
column3: 사제들을 놔두고 저 혼자 도망칠 순 없습니다.{nl}마족 명령서를 꼭 회수해야합니다.{nl}거기에 해석하지 못 한 부분을 해석하여 마족들의 침공계획을 확인해야 합니다.
column4: Saya tidak dapat melarikan diri sendiri dengan meninggalkan para Priest itu.{nl} Kami harus mengambil kembali Demon Command Scroll.{nl} Harus memeriksa rencana penyerbuan para demon dengan menafsirkan bagian yang masih belum ditafsirkan di dokumen itu.

column2: The bishop is alive!{nl}I'm so glad to hear that.{nl}And you really are a Revelator.{nl}The goddesses are on our side.
column3: 주교님이 살아계셨군요!{nl}정말 다행입니다.{nl}그리고 역시 당신이 계시자였군요.{nl}여신이 우릴 돕고 계십니다.
column4: Bishop masih hidup rupanya!{nl} Sungguh beruntung sekali.{nl} Kamu pasti adalah sang Savior.{nl} Goddess sedang membantu kita.

column2: There's a sinister energy hanging over this place.{nl}Still, I want to be useful to our employer...{nl}I know you must be busy, but if you're headed to region 1, will you{nl}defeat some demons there and get something for me?{nl}Something safe.
column3: 여기 들어오니 오싹한 기운이 감도는 군요.{nl}그래도 보수를 받고 하는 일이니 좀 더 고용주에게 도움이 되는 일을 하고 싶은데..{nl}바쁘시겠지만 1번 지역에 갈 일이 있다면 그곳에서 마족들을 처치해서{nl}뭔가 모아다 주실 수 있겠습니까?{nl}안전해보이는 걸로 부탁드립니다.
column4: Aku merasakan energi yang tidak baik setelah masuk kesini.{nl} Maka dari itu setelah mendapat imbalan, aku sedikit ingin melakukan pekerjaan lain membantu seorang perekrut pekerjaan..{nl} Walaupun sibuk, jika kamu berencana melewati area 1, tolong habisi para demon yang ada di tempat itu{nl} Dan cobalah kumpulkan sesuatu?{nl} Mohon bantuannya akan sesuatu yang terlihat aman.

column2: You seem to be in better condition than us.
column3: 당신은 우리들과 다르게 멀쩡해 보이는 군요.
column4: Kamu terlihat sehat dan kuat berbeda dengan kami.

column2: I don't know what they'll do with this but at least it won't look like I'm slacking off on the job.{nl}Thank you.
column3: 이걸로 그들이 뭘 할지는 모르지만 적어도 제가 쉬엄쉬엄 일을 했다는 인상은 주지 않을 것 같습니다.{nl}감사합니다.
column4: Entah apa yang akan mereka lakukan dengan ini, paling tidak saya seperti sudah melakukan pekerjaan perlahan-lahan walau sedikit, dan memberikan impresi pada mereka.{nl} Terima kasih.

column2: All the agents outside asked me to get something for them.{nl}Honestly I have no interest in these things...{nl}But since they asked I guess I'll have to do it.
column3: 바깥에서 만난 정보원들이 하나같이 뭔가 찾게되면 가져와달라고 하더군요.{nl}전 솔직히 그런것들엔 관심이 없습니다만..{nl}그래도 부탁받은 일이니 하긴 해야할 것 같습니다.
column4: Para informan yang kutemui di luar, memiliki pikiran yang sama yaitu jika menemukan sesuatu meminta agar dibawakan kepada mereka katanya.{nl} Saya jujur saja tidak ada rasa tertarik pada hal-hal seperti itu..{nl} Tetapi karena hal itu adalah permintaan tolong, sepertinya harus dilakukan.

column2: {nl}I'm going to look for what I can; if you happen to face some demons in region 2{nl}will you get something from them, too?
column3: {nl}저도 제 나름 찾아볼태니 당신도 2번 지역에서 마족들을 상대할 일이 있다면{nl}녀석들에게 뭔가 구해다 주시지 않겠습니까?
column4: {nl} Karena Aku akan berusaha semampu saya, jika kamu juga memiliki urusan untuk menghadapi para demon yang ada di area 2{nl} Maukah kamu membawakan sesuatu yang muncul dari mereka?

column2: Isn't it better to capture the demons instead, though?{nl}That is, assuming you can catch them, of course.
column3: 그런데 마족들이 사용하던 것보단 마족을 생포하는 게 더 좋지 않을까요?{nl}물론 생포할 수 있다는 전제하에 말이죠.
column4: Tetapi dibandingkan menggunakan para Demon, apakah tidak lebih baik jika menangkap mereka hidup-hidup?{nl}Tentu dengan dasar jika mereka dapat ditangkap hidup-hidup.

column2: A wooden piece.{nl}Is it an amulet? I wonder what they can do with this...{nl}Well, it's better than nothing.
column3: 나무 조각이군요.{nl}부적같은 건가? 이런거로 그들이 뭘 할 수 있을지 조금 궁금하긴 합니다만..{nl}뭐 없는 것보단 낫겠죠.
column4: Potongan kayu rupanya.{nl} Apakah ini semacam jimat? Sebenarnya saya sedikit penasaran apakah yang mereka bisa lakukan dengan benda ini..{nl} Yah paling tidak lebih baik daripada tidak ada apapun.

column2: I hear from the agents that the demons have a kind of sack they carry around with them.{nl}I wonder if these sacks don't have something to do with how they can live in these terrible conditions.{nl}If you go to region 3, get some after you defeat the demons and try and use the sacks.{nl}Who knows, they could be useful for yourself, too.
column3: 정보대원들에게 들은 건데 마족 녀석들이 품속에 넣고 다니는 이상한 꾸러미가 있다고 합니다.{nl}저녀석들이 이런 불쾌한 환경에서도 멀쩡히 돌아다니는 건 어쩌면 그 꾸러미에 뭔가 있는 게 아닐까요?{nl}3번 지역에 들리실 일이 있다면 녀석들을 처치하고 그 꾸러미를 충분히 모아서 사용해 보십시오.{nl}어쩌면 당신에게도 쓸모있을지 누가 압니까?
column4: Kudengar dari para informasi bahwa para demon memiliki semacam paket aneh yang mereka taruh di dalam dada mereka.{nl} Entah sepertinya ada sesuatu di dalam paket itu, karena mereka berkeliaran dengan santai di lingkungan yang menyenangkan seperti ini?{nl} Jika kamu memiliki urusan di area 3, tolong habisi mereka dan coba kumpulkan paket itu lalu coba gunakanlah.{nl} Bagaimanapun siapa yang tahu sapa tahu itu berguna juga untuk anda?

column2: I came to help with the maintenance work but look at what almost happened.{nl}You really can't trust anyone outside the church.
column3: 보수를 열 배로 쳐준다기에 따라 들어왔다가 하마터면 큰일날뻔 했군요.{nl}사제들 말은 성당 밖에선 믿어선 안 되겠습니다.
column4: Saya datang karena mendengar imbalan yang diberikan naik sepuluh kali lipat, tetapi hampir saja saya terlibat dalam masalah besar.{nl} Kita tidak dapat mempercayai perkataan Priest diluar gereja.

column2: This could be very useful.{nl}I ought to show it to the agents as soon as I get outside.
column3: 이거 꽤 요긴하게 쓰이겠군요.{nl}바깥에 나가거든 추적자들에게 보여줘야겠습니다.
column4: Ini bisa digunakan dengan cukup praktis.{nl} Harus diperlihatkan kepada para chaser yang berada diluar.

column2: So the brothers are all hiding in the level below.{nl}Let's go, then.
column3: 형제들이 모두 아래층에 숨어있다는 말이군요.{nl}그럼 아래층으로 바로 가시죠.
column4: Saudara-saudara sedang bersembunyi di lantai bawah semuanya.{nl} Kalau begitu bergegaslah pergi ke lantai bawah.

column2: If Draznie and Auranas are safe, that means the other brothers can still be alive.{nl}But it's the same thing here.{nl}There's cursed idols everywhere.{nl}We really need to get rid of them as soon as we can...{nl}
column3: 드라즈니에와 아우라나스가 무사한걸 보니 다른 형제들도 아직 살아있을 수 있겠군요.{nl}하지만 여기도 마찬가지군요.{nl}사방에 저주의 우상들이 심어져있는 것 같습니다.{nl}이걸 빨리 없애야할 탠데..{nl}
column4: Melihat Draznie dan Auranas yang selamat, sepertinya saudara lainnya pun juga masih hidup rupanya.{nl} Tetapi disini pun juga sama.{nl} Sepertinya para patung berhala kutukan sedang ditanamkan di segala arah.{nl} Benda ini harus segera dimusnahkan seharusnya..{nl}

column2: According to Draznie, there's a cursed totem in region 2.{nl}Will you take it down?{nl}It will be easier to look for Irma in region 3 after that.
column3: 드라즈니에의 말에 의하면 2번 지역에 저주 토템이 있다고 합니다.{nl}그걸 제거해 주실 수 있겠습니까?{nl}그러면 3번 지역에서 실종된 이르마를 찾기 수월할 겁니다.
column4: Menurut perkataan Draznie, Totem kutukan berada di area 2 katanya.{nl} Maukah kamu menghancurkannya?{nl} Dengan begitu pencarian akan Irma yang hilang di area 3 akan menjadi lancar.

column2: The bishop is very fond of Irma.{nl}She needs to be alive...
column3: 이르마는 주교님이 특별히 아끼는 아이였습니다.{nl}꼭 살아있으면 좋겠군요..
column4: Irma adalah anak yang paling disayang oleh Bishop.{nl} Alangkah baiknya jika ia masih hidup..

column2: You destroyed the statue?{nl}It's such a relief to hear that.
column3: 우상을 파괴하셨습니까?{nl}몸이 조금 가벼워 지는 게 느껴집니다.
column4: Apakah kamu telah menghancurkan berhala?{nl} Karena tubuh ini terasa sedikit lebih ringan.

column2: Now please look for traces of Irma in region 3.{nl}Let us hope she's still alive...
column3: 이제 3번 구역에서 이르마의 흔적을 찾아주십시오.{nl}꼭 살아있으면 좋겠군요..
column4: Sekarang tolong carilah jejak Irma di area 3.{nl} Alangkah baiknya jika ia masih hidup..

column2: Revelator, you are the only one our order can depend on.{nl}The same goes for the Lord and the residents of Orsha.
column3: 여기서 계시자인 당신 말고는 우리 교단이 의지할 사람이 없습니다.{nl}그건 바깥의 영주님과 영주민들도 마찬가지구요.
column4: Disini selain kamu yang merupakan Savior, tidak ada orang lagi di lembaga religius kami yang berkeinginan kuat.{nl} Hal itu sama dengan Land Lord dan penduduk desa di luar sana.

column2: What happened...?{nl}I thought the Demon Lord had killed me...{nl}Where are we?
column3: 어떻게 된 일인가요..{nl}전 분명 마군주에게 붙잡혀서 죽었다고 생각했는데..{nl}그나저나 여긴 어디죠?
column4: Bagaimana bisa begini..{nl} Saya tadinya berpikir akan mati karena tertangkap oleh Demon Lord..{nl} omong-omong ini dimana?

column2: So the statues were the reason why we couldn't move.{nl}I saw them in regions 4 and 5 when the bishop and I were trying to avoid the Demon Lord.{nl}The ones I saw looked a little different, but it seems like Marnox set them up to spy on us.
column3: 우릴 옴짝달싹 못 하게 만드는 게 그 우상 때문이었군요.{nl}주교님과 제가 마군주를 피해 달아나다가 4번과 5번 지역에서 그 우상들을 보았습니다.{nl}제가 본건 조금 다르게 생긴 우상이었는데 아무래도 그게 마르녹스가 우릴 감시하기 위해 설치해 둔 것 같습니다
column4: Yang membuat kami tidak dapat bergerak dengan bebas adalah para patung berhala itu rupanya.{nl} Ketika saya dan Bishop lari menghindari Demon Lord, saya telah melihat berhala itu di area 4 dan 5.{nl} Yang saya lihat itu adalah berhala yang memilik bentuk lain, bagaimanapun benda itu dipasang sepertinya oleh Marnox untuk mengawasi kita

column2: {nl}Will you take down the statues in regions 4 and 5?{nl}If we don't, no matter where we go we will never escape from Marnox's grip...
column3: {nl}4번과 5번 지역에서 그 우상들을 처리해 주실 수 있겠습니까?{nl}그걸 처리 못 하면 우리는 어딜 가건 마르녹스의 손아귀에서 벗어날 수 없을 겁니다..
column4: {nl}Apakah kamu bisa menghabisi para berhala itu di area 4 dan 5?{nl} Jika tidak dapat menghabisinya, maka pergi kemanapun kita tidak dapat terlepas dari genggaman Marnox..

column2: Before I was caught by the Demon Lord, the bishop told me all about the fate of our order.{nl}Revelator, I am truly glad to have met you.
column3: 이곳에 도착하여 제가 마군주에게 붙잡히기 전 까지, 주교님은 우리 교단의 숙명을 상세하게 알려주셨습니다.{nl}계시자님, 당신과 만나게 되어 정말 다행입니다.
column4: Ketika tiba di tempat ini, sampai waktu sebelum saya tertangkap oleh Demon Lord, Bishop telah memberitahukan dengan detil nasib dari lembaga religius kami.{nl} Tuan Savior, sungguh beruntung rasanya bisa bertemu dengan anda.

column2: Irma went down to the third floor.{nl}She told me to send you there when you came back.
column3: 이르마는 3층으로 내려갔습니다.{nl}당신이 돌아오면 그곳으로 보내달라고 하더군요.
column4: Irma telah turun ke lantai 3.{nl} Jika kamu kembali maka akan dimintai untuk dikirim ke tempat itu.

column2: {nl}I don't think I can move from here.{nl}I'm afraid you'll have to go on your own.
column3: {nl}저는 여기서 더 못 움직일 것 같습니다.{nl}아무래도 당신 혼자 가야할 것 같군요.
column4: {nl}Saya sepertinya lebih tidak dapat bergerak di sini.{nl} Bagaimanapun kamu sepertinya harus pergi sendirian.

column2: Irma said she was going to the third floor to find Gelija.{nl}She's Irma's sister so I couldn't even try to stop her.{nl}She knows we can't do anything without you here,{nl}I don't know why she's acting like this.
column3: 이르마는 3층에서 헤어진 겔리야를 찾으러 간다고 했습니다.{nl}겔리야와 이르마는 친자매이기 때문에 제가 말릴 수가 없었습니다.{nl}계시자인 당신 없이는 우리가 할 수 있는 건 고작 숨쉬는 것 정도인데{nl}무슨 생각으로 그러는 지 모르겠군요.
column4: Irma berkata pergi untuk mencari Galia yang terpisah dengannya di lantai 3.{nl} Karena Irma dan Galia adalah kakak beradik, maka saya pun tidak dapat tinggal diam.{nl} Jika tanpa kamu sebagai Savior, maka yang bisa kami lakukan tidak lain hanyalah bernapas saja{nl} Entah apa yang kami pikirkan.

column2: {nl}Find Irma before the Demon Lord finds her again.
column3: {nl}이르마가 또 마군주에게 붙잡히기 전에 그녀를 찾아 주십시오.
column4: {nl}Pergilah mencari Irma sebelum ia ditangkap oleh Demon Lord lagi.

column2: Irma told me.{nl}That you came all the way here from Orsha to find us.{nl}I'm not afraid now that I know a Revelator is with us.
column3: 이르마에게 이야기는 들었습니다.{nl}오르샤부터 우리를 찾아 여기까지 와주셨군요.{nl}계시자와 함께라니 이제 무섭지 않습니다.
column4: Telah mendengarkan cerita Irma.{nl} Kamu datang sampai kesini untuk mencari kami dari Orsha rupanya.{nl}karena sekarang berada bersama Savior, saya merasa tidak takut.

column2: Irma is too reckless and that's a problem.
column3: 이르마는 너무 당돌해서 문제에요.
column4: Irma yang terlalu pemberani adalah sebuah masalah.

column2: The bishop was very worried.{nl}There were of course many places to meet with a Revelator other than here.{nl}Draznie and I were in charge of this prison so we made a lot of preparations for a future crisis here.
column3: 주교님은 걱정이 많으신 분이셨습니다.{nl}계시자를 맞이할 준비를 한 곳은 여기 말고도 많았죠.{nl}그 중에서 아샤크 지하 감옥은 저와 드라즈니에가 맡아서 이곳에서 위기에 쳐할 때를 대비해서 많은 준비를 해두었습니다.
column4: Bishop adalah orang yang banyak memiliki kekhawatiran.{nl} Sebenarnya banyak tempat lain yang disiapkan untuk bertemu dengan Savior, selain disini.{nl} Diantaranya adalah Ashaq Underground Prison, saya dan Draznie yang ditugaskan untuk hal ini telah banyak menghadapi masalah dan banyak melakukan persiapan.

column2: {nl}Originally we simply planned to avoid any difficult enemies, but since you're here{nl}we should make use of our hidden tools.{nl}I left some bags of pearl powder in region 1.{nl}If you collect this powder we can use it against the demons.{nl}I'll tell you how after you bring back the powder.
column3: {nl}원래라면 상대하기 힘든 적들은 피해서 숨어있을 생각이었지만 계시자님이 오셨으니{nl}숨겨둔 도구들을 적극적으로 활용해야겠습니다.{nl}1번 지역에 비축해둔 포대엔 반짝이는 진주가루가 담겨 있습니다.{nl}이걸 잘 모으면 마족들에게 요긴하게 쓸 수 있죠.{nl}자세한 설명은 다 모아오시면 드리겠습니다.
column4: {nl} Sebenarnya saya bermaksud untuk bersembunyi dari para musuh yang sulit dihadapi, tetapi karena saat ini ada tuan Savior{nl} maka kami harus menggunakan peralatan yang disembunyikan dengan lebih aktif.{nl} Pada kantong kain yang ditumpuk di area 1, tersimpan bubuk mutiara yang berkilauan.{nl} Jika dapat mengumpulkannya dengan baik, maka bisa dipakai secara efektif kepada para demon.{nl} Penjelasan lebih lanjut akan kuberikan setelah kamu mengumpulkannya.

column2: Once again I'm in awe with our bishop's sense of foresight.{nl}If he hadn't prepared this we would have been left at the hands of the demons.{nl}I hope the missing brothers are at the other hideouts we prepared.
column3: 다시 한 번 주교님의 선견지명에 감탄했습니다.{nl}이런 준비가 없었다면 우린 여기서 아무것도 못하고 마족들 손에 당하고 말았겠죠.{nl}아마 실종된 형제들도 저희가 준비해둔 은신처에 숨어있을 겁니다.
column4: Sekali lagi saya kagum pada penglihatan masa depan milik Bishop.{nl} Jika tidak ada persiapa nseperti ini, maka kami tidak dapat melakukan apapun disini mungkin juga sudah mati terbunuh oleh para Demon yah.{nl} Mungkin para saudara-saudara yang hilang sedang bersembunyi di persembunyian yang telah kami siapkan.

column2: This is more than enough.{nl}Thank you.
column3: 이정도면 충분히 사용하고도 남을 양이군요.{nl}고생하셨습니다.
column4: Jika jumlahnya sebanyak ini, maka masih akan tersisa jika digunakan.{nl} Terima kasih atas kerja kerasmu.

column2: The demons aren't simple monsters; they seem to have a command hierarchy.{nl}The stronger ones commanding the weaker ones.{nl}I wonder if defeating the strong ones won't make it easier to take down the rest.
column3: 마족들은 단순한 몬스터가 아니라 저마다의 지휘체계를 가지고 있는 것 같습니다.{nl}좀 더 강한 녀석이 약한 녀석을 지휘하는 것 같더군요.{nl}아마 강한 녀석들을 처치하면 나머지 녀석들도 쉽게 처리할 수 있을 겁니다.
column4: Para Demon adalah bukan monster sederhana yang biasa, tetapi masing-masing dari mereka memiliki sistem komando sepertinya.{nl} Mereka yang lebih kuat memerintah mereka yang lebih lemah sepertinya.{nl} Jika membunuh mereka yang lebih kuat, mungkin dapat lebih mudah menghabisi sisanya.

column2: {nl}Take this pearl powder and use it whenever you see a demon.{nl}The light coming from the power will point to the strongest demon monsters so you can tell who they are.
column3: {nl}이제 이 진주가루를 가지고 다니시다가 멀리서 마족을 발견하면 사용해 보십시오.{nl}진주가루에서 나온 빛이 강한 마족 몬스터에게 날아가서 발견하기 쉽게 해줄 겁니다.
column4: {nl} Sekarang jika pergi dengan membawa bubuk mutiara ini, kalau menemukan demon dari jauh, maka cobalah menggunakannya.{nl} Cahaya yang muncul dari bubuk mutiara akan terbang kepada monster demon yang kuat, sehingga ia akan mudah ditemukan.

column2: We still don't know if someone's leading the demons{nl}but if we take them down one by one won't the world become safe again?
column3: 마족들의 배후에 누가 있는진 아직 알 수 없습니다만{nl}하나씩 처리하면 예전처럼 안전한 세상이 되지 않을까요?
column4: Masih belum dapat diketahui siapa yang berada di belakang para demon{nl} Jika menghabisi satu persatu apakah dunia ini tidak akan kembali menjadi damai seperti dulu?

column2: Thank you.{nl}Did you deal well with the demons?{nl}There are many other things prepared but this is all I have...{nl}Draznie will have to take care of the rest.
column3: 수고하셨습니다.{nl}마족들은 잘 처리하셨나요?{nl}이것 말고도 준비해 둔게 많은데 제가 준비한 건 이거 말곤 없군요..{nl}나머지는 저와 드라즈니에가 어떻게든 해보겠습니다.
column4: Terima kasih atas kerja kerasnya.{nl} Apakah kamu telah menghabisi para Demon?{nl} Selain ini, banyak hal lain yang telah kami persiapkan, tetapi yang saya persiapkan tidak ada selain ini..{nl} Sisanya akan saya bereskan bersama dengan Drazeni.

column2: Auranas and I found several safe spots around this prison.{nl}Of course the one where we are now is not one of them.{nl}I was hiding in region 3 but the Demon Lord came with his vassals to look around the area.{nl}I had to leave all my things behind and escape.
column3: 저와 아우라나스는 이곳 지하 감옥의 여러곳에 안전한 장소를 물색해 두었습니다.{nl}물론 지금 우리가 서 있는 이곳은 아닙니다.{nl}3번 지역에서 숨어있었는데 마군주가 부하들을 이끌고 그곳을 수색하더군요.{nl}가지고 있던 것들은 모두 내팽개치고 간신히 몸만 빠져나왔습니다.
column4: Saya dan Auranas telah mencari tempat yang aman di berbagai tempat di Basement Prison ini.{nl} Tentu saja bukan tempat kita berdiri saat ini.{nl} Tadinya saya bersembunyi di area 3, tetapi Demon lord memimpin anak buahnya dan melakukan pencarian ke tempat itu.{nl} Semua benda yang dibawa kemari kuabaikan, hanya pergi dengan membawa tubuh begitu saja.

column2: {nl}We should find that spot again if we're going to stay here a little longer...{nl}But as you can see all we can do is run.{nl}If that's fine with you, will you clear out region 3?
column3: {nl}이곳에 좀 더 오래 머무르려면 그곳을 다시 되찾는 게 좋을 것 같은데..{nl}보시는 것처럼 저희가 할 수 있는 건 도망치는 것 밖에 없군요.{nl}괜찮으시다면 3번 지역을 정리해주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl} Jika berada sedikit lebih lama di tempat ini, alangkah baiknya jika kembali mencari tempat itu sepertinya..{nl} Seperti yang ada lihat, yang bisa kami lakukan tidak lain hanyalah melarikan diri saja.{nl} Jika boleh maukah kamu membereskan area 3?

column2: I guess the demons didn't expect us to be hiding there...
column3: 마족 녀석들도 우리가 설마 그런곳에 숨어있을 거라고 생각도 못 했겠죠..
column4: Para Demon pun tidak dapat berpikir bahwa kami bersembunyi di tempat seperti itu bukan..

column2: {nl}The problem is we didn't expect them to go all the way there either.
column3: {nl}문제는 우리도 녀석들이 거기까지 올거라고 생각은 못 했던거죠.
column4: {nl}Masalahnya kami juga tidak memikirkan bahwa mereka pun akan datang sampai kesana.

column2: Thank you.{nl}I should have a look around and hide in region 3 again.
column3: 감사합니다.{nl}주위를 살펴보다가 3번 지역에 다시 숨어야겠군요.
column4: Terima kasih.{nl} Setelah memeriksa kondisi sekitar, maka Aku akan kembali bersembunyi di area 3.

column2: In region 4 there are several small rooms.{nl}I made traps in them with the technique I learned while working in the northern region. {nl}The have an image of me to lure the enemy.
column3: 4번 구역에 가면 작은 방들이 있을 겁니다.{nl}거기에 제가 북쪽 지역에서 수행할때 배운 기술로 함정을 만들었습니다.{nl}저와 흡사하게 생긴 환영을 만들어서 적을 유인하는 함정입니다.
column4: Jika pergi ke area 4, maka terdapat beberapa ruangan kecil.{nl} Saya membuat beberapa jebakan disana, yang saya pelajari ketika menjalankan tugas di daerah utara.{nl} Jebakan yang berbentuk sama seperti rupa saya, dan memancing musuh.

column2: {nl}But I can't go all the way there.{nl}If it's fine with you, will you go there and activate the traps?
column3: {nl}하지만 제가 거기까지 갈 수 있는 여력이 없습니다.{nl}괜찮으시다면 계시자님께서 그곳에서 함정들을 발동시켜 주시지 않겠습니까?
column4: {nl} Tetapi saya tidak memiliki kemampuan untuk dapat pergi sampai ke tempat itu.{nl} Jika boleh maukah tuan Savior mengaktifkan jebakan yang ada di tempat itu?

column2: I have several other traps and hideouts outside this prison.{nl}I prepared enough for everyone in case something happens to Orsha.
column3: 지하 감옥 말고도 함정과 은신처를 준비해둔 곳이 많습니다.{nl}오르샤가 무너지면 사람들을 대피시킬 수 있을만큼 많은 곳을 준비해 두었지요.
column4: Selain Basement Prison, banyak tempat yang dipersiapkan dengan perangkap dan persembunyian.{nl} Jika Orsha hancur, kami telah menyiapkan banyak tempat untuk mengevakuasi orang-orang.

column2: Did it work well on the demons?{nl}I had never used it on demons before, so I was worried.{nl}But I'm glad to hear it went well.
column3: 마족들이 잘 걸려들었나요?{nl}마족을 상대로는 한 번도 써본적이 없어서 걱정했었습니다.{nl}아무튼 성공했다니 다행이군요.
column4: Apakah para Demon terpancing dengan baik?{nl} Karena tidak pernah digunakan untuk menghadapi Demon, aku sedikit khawatir sebenarnya.{nl} Omong-omong untunglha perangkap itu dapat berhasil.

column2: Go see Irma now.{nl}She's preparing to take back the Demon Orders.
column3: 이르마에게 가보십시오.{nl}그녀가 마족 명령서를 회수하기 위해 준비하고 있습니다.
column4: Pergilah kepada Irma.{nl} Ia sedang bersiap untuk mengambil kembali Demon Command Scroll.

column2: I'm sorry for disappearing without notice.{nl}It was urgent. While you were destroying the surveillance statue{nl}I managed to escape without Marnox noticing.{nl}But it seems he has more statues here, too.
column3: 말도 없이 사라져서 죄송합니다.{nl}하지만 한 시가 급한 일이고 당신이 감시 우상을 파괴하는 동안{nl}제가 마르녹스의 눈을 피해 안전하게 올 수 있었습니다.{nl}하지만 여기도 그의 우상이 곳곳에 설치되어 있군요.
column4: Mohon maaf karena menghilang tanpa berkata apapun.{nl} Tetapi karena kondisinya mendesak, selama kamu sedang menhancurkan berhala pengawas{nl} Saya dapat datang dengan menghindari pantauan mata dari Marnox.{nl} Tetapi disini juga telah dipasang berhala itu di beberapa tempat.

column2: Many brothers were sacrificed to reach where we are.{nl}Because this is the only path we can take.{nl}Please, stop the demons.
column3: 여기에 오기 까지 많은 형제들이 희생당했습니다.{nl}우리에게 길은 이 것 밖에 없기 때문이었죠.{nl}마족의 음모를 막아 주십시오.
column4: Untuk sampai ke tempat ini, beberapa saudara kami telah menjadi korban.{nl} Karena tidak ada jalan lain selain hal ini untuk kami.{nl} Tolong halangilah rencana konspirasi demon.

column2: To enter the hidden room and get the orders, you'll have to destroy the statue in region 2. {nl}But remember not to use a transport device in its range or Marnox will catch you.{nl}Can you do it?
column3: 숨겨진 방에 들어가서 마족 명령서를 회수하려면 2번 지역의 우상을 제거 해야합니다.{nl}인접한 곳에서 이동장치를 사용하면 분명 마르녹스에게 덜미를 잡힐 겁니다.{nl}2번 지역의 우상을 처치해 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Jika ingin mengambil kembali Demon Command Scroll dengan masuk ke ruangan tersembunyi, maka harus menghancur berhala yang ada di area 2.{nl} Jika menggunakan moving device yang ada di tempat terdekat, maka sudah pasti akan tertangkap oleh Marnox.{nl} Bisakah kamu menghabisi berhala yang ada di area 2?

column2: This is strange, he should be here any minute now...{nl}Are you afraid?
column3: 이상하군요 슬슬 나타날때가 되었는데..{nl}계시자님이 무서운 걸까요?
column4: Aneh rupanya, padahal sudah waktunya untuk muncul..{nl} Apakah tuan Savior takut?

column2: This is very strange.{nl}Why isn't Marnox here?{nl}From his behaviour so far, I would assume he'd come...
column3: 정말 이상하군요.{nl}어째서 마르녹스가 나타나지 않는 걸까요?{nl}여태까지의 그의 행태를 보면 그럴리가 없는데..
column4: Sungguh aneh.{nl} Entah kenapa Marnox tidak muncul?{nl} Jika melihat ia sampai saat ini pun, hal ini tidak masuk akal..

column2: If Marnox doesn't come, there's nothing we can do.{nl}Just in case, I think it would be good to destroy the statue in region 3 to provoke him.{nl}As long as he lives we will never be able to open the door to the hidden room.
column3: 마르녹스가 나타나지 않는다면 어쩔 수 없지요.{nl}혹시 모르는 일이니 3번 구역의 감시 우상을 파괴해서 그를 자극해 보는 게 좋겠습니다.{nl}그가 살아있는 상태론 숨겨진 방으로 통하는 문을 열 수 없습니다.
column4: Jika Marnox tidak muncul, apa boleh buat kan.{nl} Cobalah hancurkan berhala pengawas di area 3, untuk mengetes reaksinya.{nl} Kita tidak dapat membuka pintu untuk ke ruang tersembunyi jika ia masih dalam keadaan hidup.

column2: The bishop can't have been found, can he? {nl}I remember he acted so brazen when he had me caught, nothing like now.{nl}I remember how lowly he regarded priests like me...{nl}Revelator, are you afraid?
column3: 혹시 주교님이 발각당하신 건 아닐까요?{nl}저를 붙잡았을 때 그의 자신만만한 행동과 비겁한 언행이 생각나는 군요.{nl}계시자가 아니면 우리 같은 사제들은 아무것도 아니라고 했어요..{nl}역시 계시자님이 무서운 걸까요?
column4: Apakah Bishop telah mendeteksi sesuatu?{nl} Ketika saya tertangkap, aku teringat ia melakukan tindakan yang pengecut dan hanya memikirkan diri sendiri saja.{nl} Ia berkata jika bukan Savior, para Priest seperti kami bukanlah apa-apa katanya..{nl} Apakah tuan Savior takut?

column2: He might have sent his vassals and escaped, he could be making other plans.{nl}We can't waste any more time, let's open the door.
column3: 자신의 부하를 보내고 도망쳐서 후일을 도모하는 걸지도 모르겠습니다.{nl}여기서 시간을 지체할 수 없으니 문을 열도록 하지요.
column4: Setelah kabur dengan megirimkan para anak buahnya, entah apakah ia merencanakan sesuatu kedepannya.{nl} Karena kita tidak dapat menghabiskan waktu disini, mari kita coba buka pinter tersebut.

column2: I'll open the door and you'll enter the room. {nl}Let's get the orders and go back to the bishop immediately.
column3: 제가 문을 열면 바로 따라 들어와 주십시오.{nl}마족 명령서를 회수하고 바로 주교님께 돌아갑시다.
column4: Jika saya membuka pintu, tolong segera masuk mengikuti dari belakang.{nl} Setelah mengambil Demon Command Scroll, mari segera kembali pada Bishop.

column2: You defeated Marnox...{nl}I don't think I will be able to move for a while.
column3: 마르녹스를 처치하셨군요..{nl}저는 당분간 움직이기 힘들 것 같습니다.
column4: Kamu telah membunuh Marnox..{nl} Saya sepertinya akan kesulitan untuk bergerak sementara waktu.

column2: It was an honor defending the fate of our order until the end.{nl}It was all thanks to you.{nl}I'm going to hide here and recover, you take the orders and go see the bishop.
column3: 교단의 숙명을 마지막까지 지켜볼 수 있어서 영광이었습니다.{nl}계시자님 모두 당신 덕입니다.{nl}저는 이곳에서 잠시 숨어서 몸을 돌볼태니 마족 명령서를 가지고 주교님께 가주세요.
column4: Sungguh kehormatan karena dapat menjaga takdir dari lembaga religius sampai akhir.{nl} Ini semua adalah berkat tuan Savior.{nl} Aku akan bersembunyi di tempat ini sebentar untuk beristirahat, maka dari itu tolong bawakanlah Demon Command Scroll ini kepada Bishop.

column2: Do you mean you defeated Marnox?{nl}A Demon Lord... You truly have the power of a Revelator.{nl}I'm glad the priests are safe...{nl}I will talk to Inesa and make sure those who are missing return to their homes.
column3: 마르녹스를 해치웠단 말인가!{nl}마군주를 해치우다니.. 계시자란 참으로 놀라운 힘을 가졌군요.{nl}내 사제들이 무사 하다니 다행입니다..{nl}행방불명된 사제들은 이네사에게 부탁해서 꼭 고향으로 돌려보낼 수 있도록 하겠습니다.
column4: Apakah itu berarti kamu telah menghabisi Marnox!{nl} Menghabisi Demon Lord katamu.. Orang yang disebut Savior sungguh memiliki kekuatan yang menakjubkan.{nl} Lalu sungguh beruntung rasanya karena para Priestku dalam kondisi selamat..{nl} Para Priest yang hilang akan kumintai tolong pada Inesia, agar dapat dikirim kembali ke kampung halamannya.

column2: People will remember you when Orsha prospers once again...
column3: 오르샤가 다시 번영한 다면 후세 사람들은 당신을 꼭 기억 할 겁니다..
column4: Jika Orsha kembali berjaya, maka orang-orang di masa depan pasti akan mengingat anda..

column2: I'm going to return to Orsha and work on the Demon Orders analysis.{nl}You go see the Lord and tell her about Marnox and us.{nl}My disciples are staying here to make sure there's no traces of Marnox left and to find the missing priests.
column3: 저는 이대로 오르샤로 돌아가서 마족 명령서를 해석하겠습니다.{nl}계시자님은 영주에게 가서 마군주를 물리치고 우릴 구해냈다고 말씀해 주십시오.{nl}제 제자들은 여기 남아서 마르녹스의 잔재를 지우고 행방불명된 사제들을 찾도록 지시해 두겠습니다.
column4: Aku akan kembali ke Orsha seperti ini saja, dan akan menafsirkan Demon Command Scroll.{nl} Tuan Savior beritahukanlah kepada Land Lord bahwa telah berhasil menghalahkan Demon Lord dan menyelamatkan kami.{nl} Aku akan memerintahkan kepada para murid kami untuk berada disini, dan membersihkan yang tersisa dari Marnox, lalu mencari para Priest yang hilang.

column2: So the demons reached the areas surrounding Orsha.{nl}We were always wary of demon invasions, but we never thought we'd have to face a Demon Lord.{nl}If only I could praise your feat to the people...
column3: 오르샤 근방까지 마족들이 침범했다는 말이군요.{nl}그들의 침공은 항상 대비하고 있었지만 마군주가 함께 올 거라곤 생각지도 못 했습니다.{nl}당신의 놀라운 업적을 모두에게 말하여 기리고 싶지만..
column4: Para Demon telah menguasai sampai ke daerah terdekat dengan Orsha rupanya.{nl} Serangan mereka selalu kami dapat antisipasi, tetapi kami tidak pernah menyangka bahwa mereka akan datang bersama dengan Demon Lord.{nl} Sebenarnya saya ingin merayakan pencapaian kamu yang mengejutkan, dengan memberitahukan kepada semuanya... tetapi..

column2: {nl}I'm sorry. If I told everyone about it, it would only scare the residents.
column3: {nl}미안합니다. 사실을 말해버리면 영주민들에게 공포심만 심어줄 것 입니다.
column4: {nl}Maaf. Jika kebenaran ini diberitahukan, maka para penduduk hanya akan dipenuhi rasa takut saja.

column2: I heard about what happened.{nl}Urbonas confirmed you are a Revelator sent by the goddesses.{nl}It is an honor to meet the hero of the legend passed down in our family.{nl}It seems the goddesses haven't left us yet.{nl}What are your plans now?
column3: 대부분의 이야기를 전달 받았습니다.{nl}우르보나스님께서 여신이 보내주신 계시자가 맞다고 하더군요.{nl}우리 헤먼대일 가문에 내려오는 전승의 주인공을 이렇게 뵙게되어 영광입니다.{nl}여신들이 우릴 버리지 않으셨군요.{nl}앞으로 어떻게 하실 예정이신지요?
column4: Saya telah mendapatkan sebagian besar cerita tersebut.{nl} Kamu sungguh Savior yang telah dikirimkan Goddess seperti kata tuan Urbonas rupanya.{nl} Kami Hamondale  Royal Family sangat tersanjung dapat bertemu dengan pahlawan yang ada di dalam legenda.{nl} Ternyata para Goddess belum melupakan kami.{nl} Bagaimana rencana kamu kedepannya?

column2: {nl}For now, you should go see Urbonas.{nl}He's looking for you.
column3: {nl}우선은 우르보나스님에게 가십시오.{nl}당신을 찾고 계십니다.
column4: {nl}Pertama-tama pergilah kepada tuan Urbonas.{nl} Beliau sedang mencari Anda.

column2: Please think of Orsha as your second home.{nl}I and the residents of Orsha are always glad to welcome you.
column3: 이 오르샤를 마음의 고향이라고 생각해 주십시오.{nl}저와 오르샤 영주민들은 언제나 당신을 환영하겠습니다.
column4: Tolong anggaplah Orsha ini sebagai kampung halaman anda.{nl} Saya dan para penduduk Orsha akan selalu menyambut kamu kapanpun.

column2: Welcome. We were just finishing the analysis. {nl}There's a few parts here and there we can't agree on, but here's what we have.
column3: 어서오십시오. 해석을 막 끝낸 참입니다.{nl}제자들과 해석이 조금 엇갈린 부분이 있습니다만 대부분 동의하는 부분을 말씀드리겠습니다.
column4: Selamat datang. Pekerjaan penafsiran sudah mencapai tahap akhir.{nl} Walaupun ada beberapa bagian penafsiran yang tidak disetujui oleh murid-muridku, tetapi akan kuberitahukan sebagian besar yang sudah selesai.

column2: {nl}{nl}(Demon Orders analysis)
column3: {nl}{nl}(여기서부터는 마족 지령서 해석내용)
column4: {nl}{nl}(Mulai dari sini adalah isi tafsiran Demon Command Scroll)

column2: We mustn't assume all the missing brothers are dead.{nl}But to find them we need to destroy Marnox's statues.{nl}Would you take care of that?
column3: 행방불명된 형제들이 모두 죽었다고 말할 순 없습니다.{nl}그들을 찾으려면 마르녹스의 우상을 모두 제거해야할 겁니다.{nl}그것들을 처리해 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: Saya tidak dapat mengatakan bahwa para saudara yang hilang telah mati semuanya.{nl} Jika ingin mencari mereka, maka harus membereskan seluruh berhala Marnox.{nl} Maukah kamu untuk membereskan itu semua?

column2: Someone has to be alive...
column3: 살아남은 형제들이 분명 있을 겁니다..
column4: Sudah pasti ada saudara-saudara yang masih selamat..

column2: Thank you.{nl}I'll go find them as soon as I recover from my injuries.
column3: 감사합니다.{nl}부상에서 회복되면 바로 그들을 찾아 나서야겠습니다.
column4: Terima kasih.{nl} Jika telah pulih dari luka, Aku akan segera pergi untuk mencari mereka.

column2: There's no way to know where the brothers are hiding in this prison...{nl}And there'll be priests that won't be able to return to their families even after all of this is over...{nl}I wish I could bring them their belongings at least.
column3: 형제들이 이 넓은 지하 감옥의 어디에 숨어있는지 알 방법이 없군요..{nl}이 일이 끝난 뒤에도 가족들에게 돌아가지 못 하는 사제들이 있을탠데..{nl}그들의 가족들에게 사제들이 사용하던 물품이라도 전달해주고 싶군요.
column4: Tidak ada cara untuk mengetahui dimana para saudara  bersembunyi di Basement Prison yang luas seperti ini..{nl} Setelah pekerjaan ini selesai pun, pasti terdapat para Priest yang tidak dapat kembali pada keluarganya..{nl} Saya ingin menyampaikan benda yang dimiliki oleh para Priest kepada keluarga mereka.

column2: {nl}Several priests went missing in region 2.{nl}Will you look for their bags there?
column3: {nl}2번 지역에서 많은 사제들이 사라졌습니다.{nl}그 곳에서 그들의 가방을 찾아다 주실 수 있겠습니까?
column4: {nl} Banyak Priest yang telah menghilang di area 2.{nl} Bisakah kamu mencari tas milik mereka di tempat itu?

column2: Not all of the bags will belong to missing people.{nl}I lost mine too, after all...
column3: 발견된 가방의 주인들이 모두 행방불명된건 아닙니다.{nl}저도 제 가방을 잃어버렸거든요..
column4: Para pemilik dari tas yang ditemukan bukanlah orang hilang seluruhnya.{nl} Saya juga telah kehilangan tasku loh..

column2: Thank you. You found my bag that was lost, too.{nl}Seeing the diaries inside the bags makes me think many of the brothers are still alive. {nl}We need to find them before it's too late.
column3: 감사합니다. 제 잃어버린 가방도 찾아주셨군요.{nl}그들이 가방 안에 남겨준 일지를 보니 살아 있는 형제들이 꽤 있는 것 같습니다.{nl}늦기 전에 그들을 찾아야겠군요.
column4: Terima kasih. Tasku yang hilang pun telah ditemukan rupanya.{nl} Melihat jurnal yang tersisa di dalam tas mereka, sepertinya masi terdapat beberapa saudaraku yang masih selamat.{nl} Sebelum telat, aku harus mencari mereka semua.

column2: There's a reason you cover your hands when you throw away something dirty.{nl}Priest Irma destroyed Marnox's cursed idols when she was running away from him.{nl}But now their remains are spread aroun all overd.{nl}Their energy could still come back and hurt us.
column3: 더러운 물건을 버릴땐 손이 더럽혀 지지 않게 뭔가로 감싸곤 하죠.{nl}이르마와 주교님이 마르녹스의 추격에서 도망칠때 그의 우상을 파괴하며 다녔어요.{nl}하지만 그 잔해들이 남아서 여기저기 흩어져있어요.{nl}그 잔해들을 처리하지 않으면 언제 그 기운이 엄습해서 우릴 곤란하게 할 지 몰라요.
column4: Ketika harus membuang benda kotor, maka harus membungkusnya menggunakan sesuatu agar tidak mengotori tangan.{nl} Ketika Irma dan Bishop melarikan diri dari Marnox, berhalanya telah dihancurkan.{nl} tetapi pecahan yang tersisa itu masih ada dan berserakan dimana-mana.{nl} Jika sisa pecahan itu tidak dibereskan, maka mungkin suatu hari energi itu akan menyerang dan dapat menyulitkan kami ke depannya.

column2: {nl}Here's a cloth soaked in holy water. Use it to get rid of what remains of the statue.{nl}Cover the fragments with the cloth and the power of the holy water will make them disappear.
column3: {nl}제게 성수에 적신 붕대가 있습니다. 이걸로 그 잔해들을 감싸서 처리해주실 수 있으십니까?{nl}그냥 잔해에 덮으시면 성수의 힘 때문에 자연스럽게 잔해들이 사라져버릴 거에요.
column4: {nl} Saya memiliki perban yang dibasahi Holy Water. Menggunakan ini pecahan maka pecahan tersisa dapat dibereskan dengan membungkusnya bukan?{nl} Jika membalut pecahan itu begitu saja maka pecahan itu akan menghilang secara alami karena kekuatan dari Holy Water.

column2: Rushing anything is bound to end in trouble eventually.
column3: 다급하게 처리한 일은 언제나 뒤탈을 일으키는 법이군요.
column4: Pekerjaan yang diselesaikan dengan tergesa-gesa biasanya akan menjadi masalah.

column2: That's one less thing to worry about. {nl}Although, with how the demons left this place, it's going be a while before it can be back to normal.
column3: 걱정거리가 하나 줄어들었군요.{nl}하지만 마족들이 어지럽혀둔 이 공간은 앞으로 적지 않은 시간을 공들여야 할 거에요.
column4: Hal yang kukhawatirkan telah berkurang satu rupanya.{nl} Tetapi ruang ini tidak akan mendapat masalah dari Demon beberapa waktu kedepan.

column2: I will prepare the magic with the memories of the spirits so you go to Ataka Side Road.{nl}Bring everything you can.{nl}
column3: 난 영혼의 기억으로 마법을 준비할 테니 자네는 아타카 샛길 쪽으로 가 보게나.{nl}떼어낼 수 있는 건 닥치는 대로 가져오게.{nl}
column4: Aku akan menyipakan sihir dengan ingatan jiwaku, maka kau pergilah ke arah Ataka Side Road.{nl} Bawalah apapun yang bisa kau bawa kemari.{nl}

column2: I've seen the magic circles were activating. You are okay right? {nl}How about Eminent?{nl}
column3: 마법진들이 작동되는걸 봤어. 너 괜찮은 거 맞지? {nl}에미넌트는 어떻게 됐어?{nl}
column4: Aku sudah melihat Magic Circle yang teraktifkan. Kau benar tidak apa-apa kan? {nl} Bagaimana jadinya dengan Eminent?{nl}

column2: The space which the tyrant who you've asked threw away is probably.. {nl}It is the prison that was made in the era of Kadumel era. {nl}
column3: 네가 묻는 폭군이 벼려낸 참혹한 공간이라는 건 아마.. {nl}카듀멜 시대에 만들어진 감옥을 말하는 걸 거야. {nl}
column4: Mungkin ruangan menyeramkan tirani yang kau tanyakan adalah.. {nl} Penjara yang dibuat pada jaman Kadumel. {nl}

column2: Restoring the magic circle was the duty of Higgs, but we have no other way since he is injured.{nl}Also everyone is getting tired due to the coldness.. I want to lend your power.
column3: 그 마법진을 보수하는 것이 힉스의 임무였소만, 부상을 입었으니 어쩔 도리가 없지 않겠소.{nl}게다가 다들 추위에 지쳐가니.. 당신의 힘을 빌리고 싶소.
column4: Memperbaiki Magic Circle itu merupakan kewajiban dari Hix, tetapi karena ia terluka maka tidak ada pilihan lainnya.{nl} Ditambah lagi yang lainnya kelelahan karena rasa dingin.. Ingin rasanya meminjam kekuatan anda.

column2: You are better than Higgs.{nl}I want to ask you one more time.{nl}
column3: 우리 힉스보다 더 능숙하게 해내는군.{nl}이왕 이렇게 된 것, 한 번만 더 부탁하리다.{nl}
column4: Kamu berhasil melakukannya lebih baik dibandingkan kami para Hix.{nl} Karena sudah jadi seperti ini, Mohon bantuannya satu kali lagi.{nl}

column2: Would you go to the Uzali Crossroads and hunt some Green Lepusbunny Assassins?{nl}We could use their warm fur.
column3: 그러니, 우즈알리 사거리의 초록 레푸스버니 암살자를 사냥해 주실 수 있을까요?{nl}털가죽이 아주 따스하거든요.
column4: Maka itu, Bisakah kamu menghabisi Green Lepusbunny Assassins yang ada di Uzali Crossroads?{nl} Kulitnya sungguh hangat sekali.

column2: I met the monsters while returning with the message.{nl}I think I can move if I take little more rest, but this message should be delivered fast..{nl}
column3: 서신을 가지고 복귀하던 도중 몬스터 무리를 만났죠.{nl}조금만 쉬면 금방 움직일 수 있을 것 같은데, 이 서신은 좀 급한 거라서요..{nl}
column4: Ketika sedang kembali membawa surat, saya bertemu dengan sekumpulan monster.{nl} Kondisi saya sepertinya akan segera membaik setelah istirahat sebentar, Tetapi surat ini sedikit mendesak..{nl}

column2: Around here there are Blue Siaulav Mages that carry emergency food.{nl}Horace probably told you their food is surprisingly edible. Could you get some for me?
column3: 이 근처의 푸른 샤울라브 메이지라는 몬스터들은 저들 먹을 비상식량을 챙겨 다닙니다.{nl}의외로 제법 먹을 만 하다고 호라스님께서 알려주셨죠. 그것이라도 구해 주십시오.
column4: Monster yang bernama Blue Siaulav Mage di sekitar sini, berkeliling membawa makanan darurat.{nl} Tuan Horas memberitahukan bahwa itu cukup layak dimakan diluar dugaan. Tolong dapatkanlah itu.

column2: It's funny, if it weren't for them I would have starved by now.{nl}Because of the cold, the only thing that grows around here are potatoes.
column3: 이상한 상황이긴 합니다만, 녀석들이 아니었으면 쫄쫄 굶었을 겁니다.{nl}여긴 너무 추워서 감자 말곤 아무것도 자라지 않거든요.
column4: Ini adalah situasi yang aneh, tetapi kalau bukan mereka saya pasti sudah kelaparan berat.{nl} Disini sangat dingin, sehingga selain kentang yang lain tidak dapat tumbuh.

column2: First we need to do something about the heat.{nl}Horace once said that Blue Lapasape mushrooms generate heat; I want to test them.
column3: 우선은 저 열부터 해결해야 할 것 같습니다.{nl}예전에 호라스님께서 푸른 라프세이프의 버섯이 열을 내린다 하셨으니 시험해 보지요.
column4: Pertama-tama panas itu harus dibereskan terlebih dahulu.{nl} Dulu tuan Horas berkata bahwa Blue Lapasape Mushroom dapat menurunkan panas, mari kita coba.

column2: You seem competent as a swordsman.{nl}Do you have any plans to reach a higher stage?
column3: 보아하니 자네도 나름 소드맨으로서 실력을 쌓은 모양이군.{nl}더 높은 경지로 가볼 생각은 없는가?
column4: Sejauh ini kulihat kau memiliki kemampuan yang bagus sebagai Swordman.{nl} Apakah kamu tidak ada kepikiran untuk pergi ke tingkatan lebih tinggi?

column2: Let's see if you're skilled, then.{nl}Go to Paupys Crossing and take down ten Lapflammers and ten Lapemans.
column3: 일단 자네의 실력을 보여주게.{nl}파우피스 나루에서 라플래머와 라페먼을 각각 10마리 씩 해치우고 오게나.
column4: Pertama-tama tolong perlihatkan kemampuanmu.{nl} Tolong habisi Lapflammer dan Lapeman masing-masing 10 ekor di Paupys Crossing.

column2: If you train hard, it won't be that hard.
column3: 꾸준히 훈련을 쌓아 왔다면 어려운 과제는 아닐 것일세.
column4: Jika sudah memiliki banyak pengalaman berlatih, ini bukanlah tugas yang sulit.

column2: Good.{nl}You look competent enough to progress to the next level.
column3: 수고했네.{nl}자네라면 다음 단계로 나갈 자격이 충분해 보이는군.
column4: Terima kasih banyak ya.{nl} Kamu terlihat memiliki kelayakan untuk melanjutkan tahapan berikutnya.

column2: Are you the one who wants to walk the way of Highlander?{nl}Then, you should pass the test.{nl}I don't have time to waste on someone who is not worthy enough.
column3: 하이랜더의 길을 걸으시려는 분이 당신이신가요?{nl}그렇다면 약간의 시험을 통과하셔야 합니다.{nl}소질없는 자에게 허비할 시간은 없거든요.
column4: Apakah kamu adalah orang yang akan berjalan di jalan Highlander?{nl} Jika begitu, maka kamu harus lulus menjalani sedikit Tes.{nl} Saya tidak ada waktu untuk mereka yang tidak memiliki kriteria.

column2: The main weapon of the Highlander are the two handed swords. They are strong, but you should possess enough power to hold the swords.{nl}Attack the practice pole near it and I will test how strong you are.
column3: 하이랜더의 주무기는 양손검입니다. 강력한 대신 그만큼 검을 들 힘이 필요하지요.{nl}근처의 검 연습대를 공격해서 당신의 힘이 어느 정도 수준인지 가늠해 보겠습니다.
column4: Senjata utama utama Highlander adalah Two Handed Sword. Butuh kekuatan untuk mengangkat pedang itu sebagai ganti atas kekuatan yang kuat.{nl} Cobalah serang pasukan latihan pedang di sekitar, dan akan kuperhatikan seberapa kuatnya kekuatan anda.

column2: Attack the practice pole near me.{nl}I will evaluate how strong you are.
column3: 제 근처의 검 연습대를 공격해보세요.{nl}판가름은 제가 하겠습니다.
column4: Cobalah serang pasukan latihan pedang di sekitar saya.{nl} Sehingg saya bisa memberikan penilaian.

column2: Hmm... It seems that you won't have a big problem.{nl}If you pass one more test, I will teach the skills of Highlander.
column3: 흠... 그 정도시라면 크게 무리는 없을 듯 하군요.{nl}하나의 시험만 더 통과하신다면 하이랜더의 기술을 전수해 드리지요.
column4: Hmm... Jika dengan kemampuan itu, sepertinya tidak akan ada masalah besar ya.{nl} Jika kamu berhasil lulus akan satu tes lagi, maka akan kuajarkan teknik dari Highlander.

column2: You seem strong enough already.{nl}I just need to check how well you're able to use that strength of yours.
column3: 가지고 계신 완력은 충분해 보이는군요.{nl}이제 그 힘을 얼마나 잘 사용하실 수 있는지 확인해보겠습니다.
column4: Kekuatan fisik yang kamu miliki terlihat cukup rupanya.{nl} Sekarang Aku akan coba memeriksa seberapa baik kekuatan itu dapat digunakan.

column2: With you skills, Lapflammers at Paupys Dock won't be hard.{nl}When you come back after defeating 10 of them, I will open the way of Highlander to you.
column3: 당신의 수준이라면 파우피스 나루의 라플래머 정도는 어렵지 않을 것 같군요.{nl}녀석들을 10마리 사냥하고 돌아오시면 하이랜더의 길을 열어 드리겠습니다.
column4: Dengan kemampuan selevel anda, maka sepertinya tidak sulit untuk menghadapai Lapflammer yang ada di Paupys Crossing.{nl} Bunuhlah 10 ekor dari mereka, dan akan kubukakan jalan Highlander jika kamu kembali.

column2: Come back after defeating Lapflammers at Paupys Dock.
column3: 파우피스 나루의 라플래머를 처치하고 오세요.
column4: Kembalilah setelah membunuh lapflammer di Paupys Crossing.

column2: Your competence won't do any harm to Highlanders' fame.{nl}My father who is a master would say the same thing.{nl}On behalf of the master, I will teach you the skills of Highlander.
column3: 당신이라면 하이랜더의 명성을 더럽히지 않을 것 같군요.{nl}마스터이신 제 아버지도 저와 같은 의견이실 겁니다.{nl}마스터를 대신하여 당신에게 하이랜더의 기술을 전수하겠습니다.
column4: Sepertinya kamu tidak akan mengotori reputasi dari Highlander.{nl} Ayah saya yang merupakan masterpun pasti akan berpendapat sama.{nl} Akan kuturunkan teknik milik Highlander kepada kamu menggantikan Master.

column2: You want to become a Peltasta? That's a wise decision.{nl}Let me ask one question to you. Do you hate the demons?
column3: 펠타스타가 되고 싶으십니까? 현명한 선택입니다.{nl}우선 하나만 묻죠. 마족을 증오하십니까?
column4: Apakah kamu ingin menjadi Peltasta? Pilihan yang bijaksana.{nl} Pertama-tama akan kutanyakan satu hal. Apakah kamu membenci Demon?

column2: Good. You have fulfilled the most basic condition.{nl}Us Peltasta are a class that uses the shield actively against our opponents. {nl)As such, you're required to have a basic understanding of it.
column3: 좋습니다. 가장 기본적인 요건은 충족되었군요.{nl}우리 펠타스타는 방패를 적극적으로 사용해 적을 상대하는 클래스입니다.{nl}따라서 방패에 대한 기본적인 이해가 있어야겠지요.
column4: Bagus. Syarat yang paling dasar telah terpenuhi.{nl} Kami Peltasta adalah class yang menghadapi musuh dengan menggunakan perisai secara aktif.{nl} Maka dari itu harus memiliki pengertian dasar mengenai perisai.

column2: I'm going to ask you for some materials for your shield.{nl}First you can go to Paupys Crossing and collect metal decorations from Lapemans.{nl}Also, gather some dry wood from an isolated worshop there.
column3: 당신에게 방패에 쓸만한 재료를 부탁드리겠습니다.{nl}파우피스 나루의 라페먼으로부터 얻을 수 있는 쇠장식을 가져오세요.{nl}그리고 같은 지역의 외딴 작업장에서 젖지 않은 목재를 모아 오시기 바랍니다.
column4: Aku akan meminta tolong kepada kamu untuk mencari material yang layak dijadikan perisai.{nl} Bawakanlah Metal Part yang bisa didapat dari Lapeman di Paupys Crossing.{nl} Lalu pada tempat kerja terpojok di area yang sana, tolong kumpulkanlah material kayu yang  tidak basah.

column2: The Lapeman metal decorations are used for the frame, the wood for the body.{nl}You'll find both in Paupys Crossing.
column3: 라페먼의 쇠장식은 방패의 틀 대용으로, 나무는 방패의 몸체를 만들기 위함입니다.{nl}둘 다 파우피스 나루에서 얻으실 수 있습니다.
column4: Metal Part Lapeman adalah sebagai alternatif molding untuk shield, dan kayu adalah untuk membuat bagian utama tameng.{nl} Keduanya bisa didapatkan di Paupys Crossing.

column2: You did well.{nl}Now gather all the materials you need and craft your own shield.
column3: 수고하셨습니다.{nl}추후 재료를 모아 자신만의 방패를 직접 만들어보시기 바랍니다.
column4: Terima kasih banyak.{nl} nantinya, cobalah membuat secara langsung shield untuk diri sendiri dengan mengumpulkan material.

column2: Welcome to the world of Peltastas.{nl}Let's do our best until we defeat all the demons!
column3: 펠타스타 동지가 되신 것을 환영합니다.{nl}함께 마족들을 한 놈도 남김없이 물리칠 때까지 힘냅시다!
column4: Selamat atas keberhasilannya menjadi Peltasta.{nl} Mari bersemangat untuk menghabisi para Demon bersama, sampai tidak tersisa!

column2: It's always good to see new brothers and sisters.{nl}Can you help the villagers here with me?
column3: 새로운 형제자매를 뵙는 것은 언제나 기쁜 일이지요.{nl}부디 저와 함께 이곳 주민들을 도와주실 수 있을까요?
column4: Bertemu dengan saudara saudari baru selalu menjadi pekerjaan yang menyenangkan kapanpun itu.{nl} Maukah kamu membantu para penduduk di tempat ini bersama saya?

column2: It's not good since Lapemans are keep giving the villagers pain at Linked Bridges.{nl}In fact, I want to punish them myself.{nl}But, Rosaliya... told me that I should not leave Orsha.
column3: 덧댄다리 숲의 라페들이 인근 주민들에게 계속적으로 피해를 주는 것 같아 큰일이에요.{nl}사실 제가 직접 녀석들을 혼내주고 싶어요.{nl}하지만 로잘리야... 마스터께서 제게 오르샤를 벗어나지 말라고 신신당부를 하셨지 뭐에요.
column4: Para Lape di Woods of the Linked Bridges, merupakan masalah besar karena sepertinya terus memberikan kerusakan bagi para penduduk di sekitar.{nl} Sebenarnya aku ingin pergi langsung untuk menghukum mereka itu.{nl} Tetapi Rozalia... Master berkata meminta saya untuk jangan meninggalkan Orsha.

column2: On behalf of me, please correct the bad habit of Lapezards and Lapemiter.
column3: 제 대신 라페자드와 라페마이터녀석들의 버릇을 단단히 고쳐주고 오세요.
column4: Tolong gantikan saya untuk memberi pelajaran kepada para Lapezard dan Lapemiter.

column2: I'm simply following the Master's important orders.{nl}That doesn't mean I'm jealous of you for being a traveler!
column3: 저는 마스터로부터 받은 중요한 임무를 수행할 뿐입니다.{nl}딱히 당신처럼 여행을 다니지 못하는 게 부러운 건 아니에요!
column4: Saya hanya menjalankan misi penting yang didapat dari Master.{nl} Bukanlah berarti saya iri karena tidak dapat berpetualang seperti anda!

column2: Have you completed the mission?{nl}You would be able to become a higher level Cleric.
column3: 임무는 완수 하셨나요?{nl}당신이라면 보다 깊은 단계의 클레릭으로 거듭날 수 있을 것 같네요.
column4: Apakah kamu telah menyelesaikan misi tersebut?{nl} Sepertinya kamu bisa berubah menjadi Cleric dengan tingkatan lebih tinggi.

column2: I welcome any brothers or sisters who would walk the way of Krivi.{nl}My name is Mellinda.{nl}I am going to give you a simple test if you are qualified to become a Krivi. Are you okay?
column3: 크리비의 길을 걸으시려는 형제자매님은 언제나 환영합니다.{nl}저는 이 곳에서 마스터를 대행하고 있는 멀린다라고 합니다.{nl}그대가 크리비에 적합한지를 판단하기 위해 간단한 시험을 해 볼텐데 괜찮으시겠습니까?
column4: Kami selalu menyambut saudara baru yang ingin berjalan di jalan Krivi.{nl} Saya adalah Mellinda, orang yang bertindak sebagai Master di tempat ini.{nl} Untuk mengetahui apakah kamu layak untuk menjadi Krivi, maukah kamu menjalankan beberapa tes?

column2: Good. The test is simple.{nl}Receive this crystal jewel.
column3: 좋습니다. 시험은 간단합니다.{nl}이 수정보석을 받으세요.
column4: Bagus. Ujiannya sederhana.{nl} Terimalah Crystal Gem ini.

column2: This absorbs the monster's vitalities and possess them as the energy of the flame.{nl}Hunt for the monsters outside the city and put the energies into the jewel.
column3: 이것은 몬스터의 생명력을 흡수해 성화의 기운으로 간직하는 보석입니다.{nl}도시 밖에서 몬스터를 사냥해 보석에 기운을 채우도록 하세요.
column4: Ini adalah Jewel yang menyimpan kekuatan Sacred Fire dengan menyerap vitalitas monster disini.{nl} Isilah energi pada Jewel ini dengan berburu monster yang ada diluar kota.

column2: When the jewel gets big, use the jewel to light up the torch beside me.{nl}With that, I will test to see if you would be able to use the energies of the torch well.
column3: 보석이 충만해지면 제 옆의 성화대에 보석을 사용해 불을 붙여 보세요.{nl}그것으로 당신이 성화의 기운을 활용할 수 있는지 판별해보겠습니다.
column4: Jika jewel telah penuh, maka nyalakanlah api dari Sacred Fire di sebelah saya dengan menggunakan jewel itu.{nl} Aku akan menilai apakah kamu dapat menggunakan energi Sacred Fire menggunakan itu.

column2: Defeat the monsters and fill in the energies of the jewel.{nl}And when you light up the torch with the jewel, the test will be over.
column3: 몬스터를 처치하여 보석의 기운을 채우세요.{nl}그리고 충만해진 보석으로 제 옆 성화대에 불을 붙이시면 시험은 끝납니다.
column4: Isilah energi Jewel dengan mengalahkan monster.{nl} Lalu jika kamu berhasil menyalakan api Sacred Fire di sebelahku dengan jewel itu, maka ujian berakhir.

column2: I think you would be able to use the energy of the torch efficiently.{nl}Welcome to the way of Krivi.
column3: 당신이라면 성화의 기운을 효과적으로 사용할 수 있을 것 같군요.{nl}크리비의 길에 들어서신 것을 환영합니다.
column4: Sepertinya kamu akan bisa menggunakan energi Sacred Fire dengan Efektif.{nl} Selamat datang di jalan Krivi.

column2: You want to walk the way of the Priest.{nl}I recognized it at once. Your competence is enough to become a Priest.{nl}It's just... to pray that your journey would be alright, we need some preparations.
column3: 프리스트의 길을 걷고자 하시는군요.{nl}한 눈에 알 수 있었습니다. 그대는 프리스트로서의 재능이 충분합니다.{nl}단지... 그대가 갈 여정이 무사하길 빌기 위해서 약간의 준비가 필요하답니다.
column4: Ternyata kamu bermaksud untuk berjalan di jalan Priest rupanya.{nl} Hal itu bisa diketahui dalam sekilas pandangan saja. Kamu memiliki cukup talenta sebagai Priest.{nl} Tetapi... Kamu membutuhkan sedikit persiapan untuk mendoakan agar selamat dalam perjalanan yang akan ditempuh.

column2: Please receive this divine water.{nl}And you just have to receive blessing from the other priests here in Orsha.{nl}Ask for the blessing to Clerik, Krivi and Bokor sub-masters.
column3: 이 성수를 받으세요.{nl}그리고 이 곳 오르샤에 계시는 다른 성직자 분들께 축복을 받아오시면 됩니다.{nl}각각 클레릭, 크리비, 보코르 서브 마스터들께 부탁드리세요.
column4: Terimalah Holy Water ini.{nl} lalu kamu cukup mendapat berkat dari para orang suci lainnya yang ada di Orsha ini.{nl} Mintalah bantuan masing-masing yaitu Cleric, Krivi, Bokor Sub Master.

column2: Ask for the blessing to Cleric, Krivi and Bokor sub-masters.
column3: 클레릭, 크리비, 보코르 서브 마스터들을 찾아 축복을 간청드려보세요.
column4: Mintalah berkat dengan mencari Cleric, Kiriv, Bokor Sub Master.

column2: Good. Blessing from the four priests including me would help your journey.{nl}From now on, I want you to concentrate on the roles of Priest and responsibilities.
column3: 좋습니다. 저를 포함해 네 성직자의 축복이라면 그대의 앞길도 문제없을 겁니다.{nl}앞으로 프리스트의 역할과 책임에 성실히 임해 주시기를 바라겠습니다.
column4: Bagus. Dengan berkat para orang suci dan saya, maka jalan kamu kedepannya tidak akan ada masalah.{nl} Kuharap kamu melakukan tugas Priest dengan rajin dan bertanggung jawab ke depannya.

column2: You want to step into a higher level?{nl}It's going to be a tough way. Are you still going to go? To look for the strength?
column3: 보다 상급단계에 발을 내딛고 싶다고?{nl}험난한 길이 될걸세. 그럼에도 불구하고 가겠는가? 강함을 찾아서?
column4: Kamu ingin melangkahkan kaki ke tingkat lebih  tinggi katamu?{nl} Ini akan menjadi jalan yang sulit. Walaupun begitu kau masih tetap ingin menjalaninya? Mencari kekuatan?

column2: Good. If that's so I would have to check whether you are ready.{nl}Defeat Yognomes at 63_3 of Bracken Forest.
column3: 좋아. 그렇다면 그럴만한 준비가 되었는지 봐야겠군.{nl}고사리 숲 63_3에서 요노움이란 몬스터를 쓸어버리게.
column4: Bagus. Kalau begitu harus kulihat apa persiapan yang seperti itu sudah atau belum.{nl} Habisi monster yang bernama Yonome di Bracken Forest 63_3.

column2: If you could defeat 30 of them, I would acknowledge your strength.
column3: 30마리정도면 자네의 강함을 인정해 주지.
column4: Akan kuakui kekuatanmu jika menghabisi 30 ekor dari mereka.

column2: You are not just bluffing, but you surely possess competence.{nl}On behalf of the master, I will teach you everything about the Swordsman.
column3: 말뿐이 아니라 실력까지 갖춘 능력자였군.{nl}마스터를 대신해 자네에게 소드맨의 모든 것을 전수해 주겠네.
column4: Kau sungguh seseorang yang berkemampuan rupanya, bukan hanya bicara saja.{nl}Sebagai ganti Master, akan kuajarkan semua hal mengenai Swordman kepadamu.

column2: Did you get used to two handed swords?{nl}Now, I will teach you how you can use two handed swords well.
column3: 양손검은 손에 좀 익으셨나요?{nl}이제 양손검을 제대로 사용하는 법을 가르쳐 드릴게요.
column4: Apakah kamu sudah sedikit terbiasa dengan Two Handed Sword?{nl} Sekarang akan kuajarkan cara untuk memakai Two Handed Sword dengan benar.

column2: But, I want to check how much you've grown up as a Highlander.{nl}Yognomes at 63_3 of Bracken Forest would fit you well. I will teach you the skills after that.
column3: 그 전에 하이랜더로서 얼마나 성장하셨는지 확인해 보고 싶네요.{nl}지금 실력에는 고사리 숲 63_3에서 요노움이 적당하겠군요. 기술 전수는 그 이후입니다.
column4: Saya ingin memeriksa seberapa banyak kamu telah berkembang sebagai Highlander sebelumnya.{nl} Dengan kemampuan yang sekarang, seharusnya cukup untuk melawan Yonome di Bracken Forest 63_3. Transfer ilmu adalah setelah itu.

column2: Defeat 30 Yognomes at 63_3 of Bracken Forest.
column3: 고사리 숲 63_3에 있는 요노움 30마리가 목표입니다.
column4: Targetnya adalah 30 ekor Yonome yang ada di Bracken Forest 63_3.

column2: Well done. As I promised to you, I will teach you high level skills that can be used with two handed swords.
column3: 훌륭하시군요. 약속대로 양손검으로 할 수 있는 보다 상위의 기술을 가르쳐 드리죠.
column4: Luar biasa. Sesuai janji akan kuajarkan teknik tingkat atas yang dapat dilakukan dengan Two Handed Sword.

column2: Have you become familiar with using shields in battles?{nl}Okay then I will teach you the skills of Peltasta now.
column3: 방패를 전투에 활용하는 법은 이제 숙달 되셨나요?{nl}그럼 본격적으로 펠타스타의 기술을 가르쳐 드리지요.
column4: Apakah kamu telah terbiasa dengan penggunaan Tameng pada pertempuran?{nl} Kalau begitu akan kuajarkan teknik Peltasta secara sepenuhnya.

column2: Of course, first you'll have to prove you can handle advanced techniques.
column3: 물론 그 전에 상급 기술을 소화하실 수 있는지 확인하는 것이 먼저겠지요.
column4: Tentu saja akan kuperiksa terlebih dahulu apakan kamu dapat menerima teknik tingkat atas atau tidak.

column2: Take this and defeat the monsters in Bracken Forest 63_3.{nl}You'll see the numbers here go up the more enemies you defeat.{nl}Demons are worth twice the points.
column3: 이 물건을 받으시고 고사리 숲 63_3에서 몬스터들을 해치우세요.{nl}당신이 적을 쓰러뜨릴 수록 이것의 숫자가 올라갈 겁니다.{nl}마족들은 특별히 두 배로 계산됩니다.
column4: Terimalah benda ini, dan habisilah monster yang ada di Bracken Forest 63_3.{nl} Semakin banyak kamu menghabisi musuh, maka angka ini akan semakin meningkat.{nl} Terutama para demon, akan dihitung dua kali lipat.

column2: There are a few conditions, though.{nl}One, you must defeat the enemy with a shield equipped. {nl}Two, if you become incapable of combat, the enemies you defeated until then will not count.
column3: 단, 제약사항이 있습니다.{nl}첫째, 어디까지나 방패를 착용한 상태에서 적을 쓰러뜨린 것만 인정됩니다.{nl}둘째, 전투 불능 상태가 되시면 그 동안 쓰러뜨린 적의 숫자는 인정하지 않습니다.
column4: Hanya saja, ada batas kondisinya.{nl}Pertama, Dimana hanya diakui mengalahkan musuh ketika dalam kondisi menggunakan Shield saja.{nl}Kedua, Jika mengalami dalam kondisi tidak dapat melakukan pertempuran, maka jumlah musuh yang dikalahkan selama itu menjadi tidak diakui.

column2: {nl}Finally, you have to defeat the monsters without any help from your allies.
column3: {nl}마지막으로 동료가 해치운 몬스터는 인정되지 않습니다.
column4: {nl}Terakhir monster yang dihabisi oleh kawan tidak diakui.

column2: Defeat monsters with your shield equipped. {nl}This will prove your survival skills.{nl}Note that catching demons will be more effective.
column3: 방패를 착용한 상태에서 몬스터를 처치하세요.{nl}이는 당신의 생존능력을 확인하기 위함입니다.{nl}참고로 마족을 잡는 쪽이 효율이 좋을 겁니다.
column4: Habisilah monster dalam kondisi menggunakan Shield.{nl} Ini adalah untuk memeriksa kemampuan bertahan anda.{nl} Sebagai refrensi akan lebih efektif jika menghabisi demon.

column2: You seem competent enough as a Peltasta.{nl}Congratulations. As I promised to you, I will teach you skills that are one level higher.
column3: 그 정도라면 적어도 펠타스타의 이름을 대도 부끄럽지 않은 실력은 되시는 듯 하군요.{nl}축하드립니다. 약속대로 한 단계 위의 기술들을 가르쳐 드리지요.
column4: Dengan kemampuan seperti itu, maka tidaklah memalukan jika disebut sebagai Peltasta.{nl}Selamat. Sesuai janji akan kuajarkan teknik tingkat atas.

column2: Teaching you how to use the spear is easy, what's important is your attitude.{nl}There's a place that's just right for learners like you.
column3: 창을 가르쳐 드리는 거야 쉽습니다만, 어떤 마음으로 임하는지가 중요합니다.{nl}마침 당신같은 지원자들을 시험하기 위한 적당한 장소가 있습니다.
column4: Mengajarkan cara menggunakan tombak adalah hal yang mudah, tetapi lebih penting dengan hati yang seperti apa bertarung.{nl} Akhirnya ada tempat yang tepat untuk melakukan pengetesan para pelamar seperti anda.

column2: Come back after defeating 30 Yognomes from Bracken Forest 63_3.{nl}If you do so, I will acknowledge your skills.{nl}In my feelings, you would pass the test easily.
column3: 고사리 숲 63_3에서 요노움 30마리를 처치하고 오세요.{nl}그렇다면 그 손에 창을 쥘 자격이 있음을 인정해 드리지요.{nl}제 느낌 상 당신이라면 무난하게 통과할 수 있을 겁니다.
column4: Bunuhlah 30 ekor Yonome di Bracken Forest 63_3.{nl} Maka akan kuakui kemampuan kamu untuk menggenggam tombak dengan tangan itu.{nl} Menurut perasaanku, sepertinya kamu dapat melewati hal ini tanpa masalah.

column2: If you have a trouble with Yognomes, then it wouldn't be that bad to look for another way.
column3: 요노움정도에 애를 먹으신다면 다른 길을 찾아 보시는 것도 나쁘지 않을 겁니다.
column4: Jika takut akan Yonome, maka tidaklah jelek jika coba memilih jalan yang lainnya.

column2: You want to become a Barbarian? Can you endure the training?{nl}Good. I will test you to see whether you can at least imitate some fightings.{nl}If this was our hometown, they would have passed the test. Do you want to receive it?
column3: 바바리안이 되고 싶다고? 약해빠진 이곳 사람이 과연 적응할 수 있을까?{nl}좋아. 적어도 싸움 비슷한 흉내라도 가능한지 간단한 시험을 해보겠다.{nl}우리 고향이라면 애들도 통과하겠지만 말이지. 받아보겠나?
column4: Kamu ingin menjadi Barbarian? Apakah orang dapat beradapatasi dengan tempat ini ketika melemah?{nl}Bagus. Cobalah lewati ujian sederhana ini, apakah kamu mampu mampu bertarung atau tidak walau sedikit.{nl} Kalau di desa kami, anak kecil pun dapat melewati ujian seperti ini. Mau mencobanya?

column2: The most important virtue of a warrior is their sense of combat.{nl}That means attacking anything that's hostile to what you're trying to protect.{nl}Give it a try; defeat the Yognomes in Bracken Forest 63_3.
column3: 전사에게 있어서 가장 중요한 덕목은 호전성이다.{nl}너와 네가 지켜야 할 것에 적의를 보이는 것들은 일단 공격하고 보는 것이다.{nl}고사리 숲 63_3의 요노움들이 네 사명의 방해물이라고 생각하고 쓸어버리고 와봐라.
column4: Sifat baik yang paling penting yang dimiliki satria adalah kemampuan bertempur.{nl} Yang terlihat dari musuh adalah sesuatu yang kau perlu jaga, pertama cobalah menyerang dan Aku akan memperhatikannya.{nl} Cobalah anggap para Yonome yang ada di Bracken Forest 63_3 sebagai penghalang, dan habisilah mereka, lalu kembali.

column2: I thought you are wiry since you told me that you wanted to become a Barbarian... Are you going to give up?
column3: 바바리안이 되겠다길래 조금 강단있는 녀석인가 싶었는데... 포기할 셈이냐?
column4: Karena ingin menjadi Barbarian, harusnya orang yang memiliki tekad yang kuat loh... Apakah kau menyerah?

column2: There are some useful people here even in this place.{nl}Good. On behalf of Walter at Klaipeda, I will teach you the skills of Barbarian.
column3: 이 곳에도 그럭저럭 쓸만한 인재는 있었군.{nl}좋아. 클라페다에 계신 월터 형님을 대신해 내가 바바리안의 기술을 전수해주마.
column4: Di tempat ini ternyata banyak manusia yang memiliki kemampuan bagus ya.{nl} Baiklah. Sebagai ganti kakak Walter yang ada di Klaipeda, akan kuajarkan teknik Barbarian kepadamu.

column2: Did you hear?{nl}Some of the refugees that were coming to Orsha got hurt around the Lemprasa Pond and were left behind.{nl}They need to be rescued!
column3: 소식 들으셨나요?{nl}오르샤로 오던 피난민 중 일부가 렘파라사 연못에서 상처를 입고 고립되어 있는 것 같아요.{nl}어서 그들을 구해야 해요!
