column4: Apakah kamu telah mendengar kabar?{nl} Diantara para pengungsi yang datang ke Orsha, sebagian terluka di dan terisolasi di Lemprasa Pond.{nl} Segeralah selamatkan mereka!

column2: I've endowed the blessing onto this special ointment.{nl}Use this ointment to cure the refugees who are laid near Lemprasa Pond.{nl}After curing all refugees, I will acknowledge you as a true cleric.
column3: 이것은 오르샤 특제 연고에 제가 축복을 걸어놓은 것이에요.{nl}이 연고를 사용해서 렘파라사 연못에 쓰러져 있는 피난민들을 치료해 주세요.{nl}선행을 마치시면 당신을 진정한 클레릭으로 인정해 드리겠어요.
column4: Orsha Special Cream akan saya berikan pemberkatan.{nl} Tolong gunakan Krim ini untuk menyembuhkan para pengungsi yang terkapar di Lepmrasa Pond.{nl} Jika misi ini selesai, maka akan kuakui dirimu sebagai Cleric.

column2: If it was not the order of the master, I would have gone there.{nl}I have no one to trust except for you.
column3: 마스터의 엄명만 아니었어도 제가 갔을텐데요.{nl}지금은 당신밖에 믿을 사람이 없네요.
column4: Walau tanpa perintah dari Master pun, saya padahal akan pergi loh.{nl} Sekarang tiada orang yang dapat dipercaya selain anda.

column2: I'm glad nothing worse happened to them.{nl}It was all thanks to your help.{nl}I think it's clear you're ready to move on to the final level of Cleric.
column3: 그 분들께 더 큰 문제가 생기지 않아서 불행 중 다행이에요.{nl}당신의 빠른 도움 덕분입니다.{nl}당신이라면 클레릭의 마지막 단계로 나아가기에 손색이 없어 보이네요.
column4: Karena tidak muncul masalah pada mereka, sungguh untung sekali ditengah kemalangan.{nl} Ini adalah berkat bantuan cepat anda.{nl} Sepertinya tidak ada masalah jika kamu mencapai tahap akhir dari Cleric.

column2: I think the time has come to tell your religious belief to the goddesses and receive the blessings.{nl}Pray to the goddesses near Orsha and dedicate these goods.
column3: 당신의 신심을 여신께 고하고 그 은총을 내려받을 단계가 온 것 같군요.{nl}오르샤 주변의 여신상을 참배하고 이 봉헌품을 공양하세요.
column4: Tubuh dan pikiran kamu dipersiapkan untuk Goddess, sepertinya tahapan menerima berkat sudah tiba.{nl} Berilah penghormatan beberapa patung Goddess di sekitar Orsha, berikanlah persembahan.

column2: Go to the statues of the goddesses at Lemprasa Pond, Linked Bridges, and Paupys Dock.{nl}Return after dedicating the goods to all statues.
column3: 렘파라사 연못과 덧댄다리 숲, 그리고 파우피스 나루에 있는 여신상을 찾아가세요.{nl}세 지역의 네 여신상 모두에 공양을 마친 다음 돌아오시기 바랍니다.
column4: Temukanlah patung Goddess yang ada di Paupys Crossing, Lemprasa Pond dan Woods of the Linked Bridges.{nl} Setelah memberi penghormatan pada empat patung Goddess di tiga daerah itu, kembalilah lagi.

column2: There are no official steps when it comes to offerings.{nl}They're something you do when you want to repent of past mistakes.
column3: 그저 봉헌품을 올리는 형식적인 단계가 아닙니다.{nl}진심을 담아 과거 과오가 있다면 여신 앞에서 뉘우치시기 바랍니다.
column4: Tahapan untuk melakukan persembangan bukanlah yang formal.{nl} Kamu harus menyesali kesalahan di masa lalu dengan hati tulus jika ada, di depan patung Goddess.

column2: Well done. Aren't there any broken parts of the statues of the goddesses?{nl}You now have reached a higher stage.
column3: 수고하셨습니다. 여신상에 어디 부서진 곳은 없어 보이던가요?{nl}이제 당신은 한 단계 높은 경지에 다다르게 되었습니다.
column4: Maaf sudah merepotkan. Tidak ada yang terlihat rusak pada patung Goddess bukan?{nl} Sekarang kamu telah berada satu tingkatan lebih tinggi.

column2: I am taking care of the refugees of Orsha with other priests.{nl}But, the herbs that should be used for the ointment has run out.{nl}The time has come to test for your advancement so I will give you a small assignment.
column3: 저는 다른 성직자분들과 함께 오르샤의 난민들을 계속 돌보고 있습니다.{nl}그런데 고약에 쓸 약재가 떨어졌군요.{nl}마침 그대의 승급을 시험해 볼 시기도 되었으니 작은 숙제를 드리겠습니다.
column4: Saya sedang memperhatikan terus menerus para pengungsi dari Orsha bersama dengan orang suci lainnya.{nl} Tetapi kami kehabisan bahan untuk membuat Krim.{nl} Karena sekarang waktunya telah tiba untuk kamu menjalani ujian kenaikan tingkatan, maka akan kuberikan ujian kecil.

column2: I am looking for three kinds of herbs.{nl}Obtain the herbs from 63_1, 63_2 and 63_3 of Bracken Forest.
column3: 제가 구하는 약재는 총 세 종류입니다.{nl}고사리숲 63_1과 63_2, 그리고 63_3에서 각각 약초를 구해오세요.
column4: Material obat yang saya butuhkan, totalnya ada 3 buah.{nl} Dapatkanlah masing-masing di BrackenForest 63_1 dan 63_2, lalu 63_3.

column2: The first herbs you will find in the XXX region under piles of leaves.{nl}The second herbs grow in the YY region.{nl}The third are blooming yellow flowers in region ZZ; they should be the easiest to find.
column3: 첫번째 약초는 XX지역 근처 나뭇잎더미를 헤치면 발견하실 수 있습니다.{nl}두번째 약초는 YY지역에서 자라고 있습니다.{nl}세번째 약초는 ZZ지역에서 노란 꽃을 피우고 있으므로 가장 찾기 쉬우실 겁니다.
column4: Herb yang pertama bisa didapatkan jika membereskan tumpukan daun pohon di sekitar area XX.{nl} Herb yang kedua tumbuh di area YY.{nl} 세번째 약초는 ZZ지역에서 노란 꽃을 피우고 있으므로 가장 찾기 쉬우실 겁니다.

column2: The effects of the three herbs are not that different from each other.{nl}As I told you, don't forget this also tests for your advancement.
column3: 엄밀히 말해 세 약초의 효능은 크게 다르지 않습니다.{nl}말씀드렸듯이 이건 그대의 승급시험을 겸하고 있다는 것을 잊지 마세요.
column4: Sesungguhnya efek dari ketiga herb itu tidak memiliki perbedaan besar.{nl} Seperti yang telah saya beritahukan, itu menjadi penilaian ujian kenaikan tingkat anda, jadi janganlah lupa.

column2: Let's see... It surely is.{nl}When your good deeds accumulate like this, you will feel that your religious belief gets deeper.{nl}You've passed the test. From now on, you will be learning higher level Priest skills.
column3: 어디 보자... 음. 틀림 없군요.{nl}이런 선행이 쌓여가면 그대의 신심이 깊어지는 것을 느끼게 될 겁니다.{nl}시험은 통과입니다. 앞으로는 보다 높은 단계의 프리스트 기술을 배우시게 될 겁니다.
column4: Coba kulihat… Hmm. Tidak salah rupanya.{nl} Jika kamu terus menumpuk pengalaman seperti ini, aku dapat merasakan tubuh dan pikiran kamu yang semakin mendalam.{nl} Kamu lulus ujian. Ke depannya kamu akan mempelajari teknik Priest dengan tingkatan lebih tinggi.

column2: Are you the one who wants to become a Bokor?{nl}Welcome. In order to become a Bokor, there is a test you must pass.{nl}Have you heard about it?{nl}
column3: 혹시 보코르가 되기를 희망하시는 분인가요?{nl}환영합니다. 보코르가 되기 위해서는 반드시 통과해야 하는 시험이 있지요.{nl}혹시 들어보셨나요?{nl}
column4: Apakah kamu orang yang bermaksud untuk menjadi Bokor?{nl} Selamat datang. Untuk menjadi Bokor, ada ujian yang harus dilewati terlebih dahulu.{nl} Mungkin kamu pernah mendengarnya?{nl}

column2: Yes! You should have made Bokor dolls in order for you to be called a Bokor.{nl}Make the doll with this manual.
column3: 네! 보코르 인형을 만들어봐야 보코르라고 할 수 있죠.{nl}자, 이 제작서를 가지고 직접 인형을 만들어보세요.
column4: Ya!Harus coba membuat boneka Bokor untuk dapat disebut sebagai Bokor.{nl}Nah, bawahlah resep pembuatan ini dan buatlah langsung boneka.

column2: The master herself, too, got in after making her own Bokor doll.{nl}I guess you can say it's part of our history and tradition.
column3: 저는 물론이거니와 마스터 역시 옛날에는 보코르 인형을 만들고 입문하셨다고 하더라고요.{nl}나름 역사와 전통이 있는 의식이랍니다.
column4: Karena saya dan master juga pastinya bergabung dahulu kala, setelah membuat boneka Bokor.{nl} Ini adalah salah satu ritual yang memiliki tradisi dan sejarah.

column2: I would say this is a very high quality Bokor doll!{nl}It really seems like you're a natural. {nl}Now you too are a Bokor. Welcome!
column3: 이 정도면 제가 본 보코르 인형 중에서도 상급품에 속하네요!{nl}보코르의 소질이 있으신 것 같아요.{nl}이로써 당신도 보코르랍니다. 환영합니다!
column4: Ini merupakan salah satu Bokor Doll yang terbaik diantara yang pernah kulihat ya!{nl} Sepertinya kamu memiliki kelayakan sebagai Bokor.{nl} Dengan begin kamu pun juga telah menjadi Bokor. Selamat!

column2: You want to become a Dievdirbys? Of course, I welcome you.{nl}The way of Dievdirbys is open to everyone.{nl}Just... If you could listen to one of my little requests.
column3: 딥디르비가 되시길 희망한다고요? 물론 환영합니다.{nl}딥디르비의 길은 누구에게나 열려 있는 걸요.{nl}단지... 제 사소한 부탁 하나만 들어주신다면 말이죠.
column4: Apakah kamu bermaksud untuk menjadi Dievdirbys? Tentu saja kami menyambutnya dengan baik.{nl} Jalan dari Dievdirbys terbuka untuk siapapun.{nl}Tetapi... Itu jika kamu mau mendengarkan sedikit permintaan kecil milikku.

column2: The end of the graving chisel has run out.{nl}I guess we should ask the blacksmith in Orsha.{nl}Tell him that it is my request and get the new graving chisel.
column3: 제 조각용 끌이 다 닳아버렸지 뭐에요.{nl}일단 아쉬운대로 근처 오르샤에서 대장장이언니에게 부탁을 해야할 것 같아요.{nl}그 분께 제 부탁이라고 말씀하시고 새로운 조각용 끌을 받아 가져다 주세요.
column4: Chisel yang saya pakai untuk memahat mulai tumpul.{nl} Pertama-tama sepertinya perlu meminta tolong kepada Blacksmith yang ada di sekitar Orsha.{nl} Beritahukanlah padanya bahwa ini adalah permintaanku, dan kembalilah dengan membawa Chisel untuk pahat yang baru.

column2: I am sorry. I am counting on you until Orsha.{nl}I have matters to do here.
column3: 죄송합니다. 오르샤까지 수고 좀 부탁 드릴게요.{nl}전 저대로 이 곳에서 할 일이 있어서요.
column4: Maaf. Mohon bantuannya asedikit untuk pergi sampai ke Orsha.{nl} Saya ada hal yang harus dilakukan di tempat ini.

column2: What is it?
column3: 무슨일이시죠?
column4: Ada urusan apa ya?

column2: Oh... if you mean a strong-willed Dievdirbys, yes, I know her.{nl}But I'm afraid I'm at a loss here. I have no chisel or any materials to make one.
column3: 아... 그 당찬 딥디르비 소녀라면 기억하고 있습니다.{nl}하지만 이걸 어쩌지요. 마침 만들어놓은 끌도, 새로 만들 재료도 모두 떨어진 상황이네요.
column4: Ah... Aku ingat akan gadis muda Dievdirbys yang bersemangat itu.{nl}Tetapi ini bagaimana ya. Material yang dibutuhkan untuk membuat Chisel baru saat ini sedang kosong.

column2: I hope you can get the materials.
column3: 아쉬운대로 그쪽이 재료를 좀 구해주시면 좋겠네요.
column4: Walau merepotkan, tetapi tolong carikan material itu.

column2: There will be times when you discover the chunks that are accumulated with metals from Yognomes at 63_3 of Bracken Forest.{nl}If you could bring those, I will make an useful graving chisel for you.
column3: 고사리숲 63_3의 요노움들에게서 금속이 축적된 덩어리를 발견하실 때가 있을 겁니다.{nl}그걸 모아 가져다 주시면 쓸만한 조각용 끌을 만들어 보죠.
column4: Tolong temukan gumpalan metal dari Yonome di Bracken Forest 63_3.{nl} jika kamu membawakannya maka akan kubuatkan Chisel untuk memahat yang bagus.

column2: The metals that are accumulated in the bodies of the monsters get crumpled together at 63_3 of Bracken Forest.{nl}Defeat Yognomes and collect the metal chunks.
column3: 고사리숲 63_3은 근처 광산이 있는 탓인지 몬스터 체내에 축적된 금속이 뭉치기도 하죠.{nl}요노움을 잡고 금속 덩어리를 모아오세요.
column4: Karena di sekitar Bracken Forest 63_3 terdapat tambang, maka di dalam tubuh monster terkumpullah gumpalan metal.{nl} Kumpulkanlah Metal Lump dengan menangkap Yonome.

column2: Yes. This would be enough.{nl}Crafting is not that hard so if you wait a bit, I will make it for you.
column3: 네. 이정도면 충분히 쓸만하군요.{nl}제작이 어려운 것은 아니니 잠시만 기다리시면 만들어드리지요.
column4: Ya. Jika sebanyak ini maka dapat cukup membuatnya.{nl} Karena pembuatannya tidaklah sulit, tunggulah sebentar hingga selesai ya.

column2: It is almost done.
column3: 거의 다 되어 갑니다.
column4: Sudah hampir selesai.

column2: It is a decent object so you would be able to stand for some time.{nl}Give it to him.
column3: 자, 꽤 괜찮은 물건이니 한 동안은 버틸 수 있을 겁니다.{nl}이걸 건네 주세요.
column4: Nah, karena ini benda yang cukup bagus, maka dapat bertahan cukup lama.{nl} Berikanlah ini kepadanya.

column2: Ask him to come by Orsha sometimes.
column3: 가끔은 오르샤에도 들르라고 전해 주세요.
column4: Sampaikanlah untuk sering mampir ke Orsha.

column2: Damn... I knew that it was taking longer than expected, but I didn't know that you made such efforts.{nl}Thank you. Of course, you are a Dievdirbys from now on.
column3: 어머... 생각보다 오래 걸리신다 싶었더니 그런 수고를 하셨군요.{nl}감사합니다. 물론 지금부터 당신도 딥디르비랍니다.
column4: Wahh... Ternyata ini memakan waktu yang lama dibandingkan dugaan ya, maaf merepotkan.{nl}Terima kasih. Tentu saja mulai sekarang kamu adalah seorang Dievdirbys.

column2: You've improved a lot! Everyone would acknowledge your skills.{nl}It's just.. you fall little short according to my father's standards.{nl}I will help you to reach a higher stage.
column3: 정말 실력이 많이 느셨군요! 누구에게 보여주더라도 손색이 없을 실력입니다.{nl}단지 저희 아버지의 기준으로는 아직도 부족하지 않을까 싶네요.{nl}한 단계 더 높은 경지에 다다를 수 있도록 제가 도와드리죠.
column4: Kemampuan kamu sungguh berkembang pesat rupanya! Kemampuan yang tidak ada tandingannya walau diperlihatkan kepada siapapun.{nl} Hanya saja, entah apa masih kurang menurut standar ayah saya ya.{nl} Akan saya bantu agar dapat mencapai satu tingkatan lebih tinggi lagi.

column2: Alright. Then prove you're ready to learn some advanced techniques.{nl}Show me how much you've mastered the basics.
column3: 좋습니다. 상급 기술을 배울 수 있는 실력이 되는지 한번 더 검증해보죠.{nl}기존의 기술을 얼마나 잘 다룰 수 있는지를 보겠습니다.
column4: Bagus. Mari coba kita cek sekali lagi, apakah kemampuanmu telah layak untuk dapat mempelajari teknik tingkat tinggi.{nl} Aku akan melihat seberapa baik kamu dapat mengontrol teknik saat ini.

column2: Any monster is fine, as long as you use your Highlander techniques to defeat them.{nl}Do this without the help of your colleagues.
column3: 아무 몬스터라도 좋으니 하이랜더의 기술을 써서 몬스터를 처치해보세요.{nl}동료 하이랜더의 도움은 받으실 수 없습니다.
column4: Gunakanlah Skill Highlander untuk mengalahkan monster apapun.{nl} Kamu tidak dapat menerima bantuan dari teman Highlander.

column2: Defeating monsters with the skills of Highlander. I think it's easy for the last assignment.
column3: 하이랜더의 기술로 몬스터를 처치. 마지막 과제치고는 쉬운 편이라 생각되는데요?
column4: Kalahkan monster dengan Skill Highlander. Sebagai PR terakhir, ini termasuk gampang bukan?

column2: I've seen you use the skills which you previously learned really well.{nl}You won't have a problem learning higher level skills without any problem.{nl}I think I can say to anyone proudly that I am the one who taught you the skills.
column3: 기존에 익혔던 기술들을 능숙하게 사용하시는 걸 보았습니다.{nl}상급 기술도 무리없이 배울 수 있겠군요.{nl}당신에게 기술을 전수한 것이 바로 저라고 누구에게든 자랑할 수 있을 것 같습니다.
column4: Saya telah melihat pemakaian skill yang telah kamu dikuasai dengan baik saat ini.{nl} Skill tingkat tinggi dapat dipelajari tanpa kesulitan apapun.{nl} Sepertinya saya dapat membanggakan kepada siapapun, bahwa yang mengajarkan teknik kepada kamu adalah saya.

column2: Looks like you have no problems in defeating demons.{nl}But you still need some practice for the more vicious ones.{nl}I can show you the way of a true Peltasta.
column3: 그 정도면 왠만한 마족들은 손쉽게 해치울 수 있겠네요.{nl}하지만 진짜 흉악한 녀석들을 없애기 위해서는 좀 더 정진하실 필요가 있습니다.{nl}제가 당신께 진정한 펠타스타의 길을 열어드리죠.
column4: Dengan kemampuan seperti itu, maka dapat menghabisi para demon yang kuat dengan mudah ya.{nl} Tetapi untuk menghabisi demon yang sangat kuat, memerlukan sedikit lebih banyak dedikasi lagi.{nl} Aku akan membukakan jalan Peltasta yang sebenarnya kepada anda.

column2: If you meet the requirements, that is.
column3: 하지만 최소한의 조건은 통과하셔야 합니다.
column4: Tetapi kamu harus melewati syarat minimum yang ada.

column2: I once was asked to get rid of the Chapparition in Karolis Springs.{nl}I couldn't finish the job at the time but now I think it could be a good test for you.{nl}Go to Karolis Springs and defeat the Chapparition there.
column3: 과거 카롤리스 샘터에 나타난 채퍼리션을 없애달라는 부탁을 받았었습니다.{nl}당시에는 미처 처리하지 못했는데 지금보니 당신의 시험상대로 적당한 듯 싶네요.{nl}카롤리스 샘터에서 채퍼리션을 해치우고 오세요.
column4: Saya mendapatkan permintaan untuk menghabisi Chapparition yang muncul di Karolis Fountain masa lalu.{nl} Pada waktu itu saya tidak dapat membereskannya, tetapi sepertinya ia layak dijadikan subjek ujian anda.{nl} Tolong habisi Chapparition di Karolis Fountain.

column2: Chapparitions are not hard if we think about the courage that you've shown us so far.{nl}Don't worry too much.
column3: 여태까지 보여주신 용맹을 생각하면 채퍼리션 정도는 손쉬운 상대일 것입니다.{nl}너무 걱정 마세요.
column4: Jika melihat keberanian yang kamu miliki hingga saat ini, sepertinya Chapparation bukanlah lawan yang sulit.{nl} Janganlah terlalu khawatir.

column2: Very good! I can now acknowledge you as a fellow soldier.{nl}I should report to the master individually.{nl}I will show you the true power of Peltastas with my authority.
column3: 훌륭합니다! 그 정도 실력이라면 제가 전우로 인정해드릴만하군요.{nl}마스터께는 따로 보고를 드려야겠군요.{nl}우선 저의 권한으로 당신께 펠타스타의 진정한 힘을 알려드리겠습니다.
column4: Luar biasa! Dengan kemampuan seperti itu, maka akan kuakui sebagai sesama kami yang layak.{nl} Saya harus melaporkan secara terpisah kepada master.{nl} Pertama-tama dengan wewenang yang saya miliki, akan kuberitahukan kekuatan yang sebenarnya dari Peltasta kepada anda.

column2: I'm surprised by how much you improved.{nl}I can tell you're different from other Hoplites. {nl}You'll have no problems in becoming even stronger. So, are you ready for the next stage?
column3: 당신의 성장은 놀라울 정도로군요.{nl}다른 하플라이트들과는 무언가 다른 것이 느껴집니다.{nl}당신이라면 좀 더 강해질 수 있을 겁니다. 다음단계로 나아갈 준비는 되셨습니까?
column4: Perkembangan kamu sungguh mengejutkan rupanya.{nl} Terasa suatu perbedaan dibandingkan dengan Hoplite lainnya.{nl} Kamu akan dapat menjadi lebih kuat lagi. Apakah kamu sudah siap untuk tahap yang berikutnya?

column2: There is a monster which I faced long time ago.{nl}It ran away and I was worried that it may hurt the other people.
column3: 제가 과거 상대하던 몬스터가 하나 있습니다.{nl}도중에 녀석은 도망쳐버렸고 저는 사람들이 피해를 입지 않을지 전전긍긍했지요.
column4: Ada satu monster yang pernah kuhadapi di masa lalu.{nl} Ditengah-tengah ia melarikan diri, saya khawatir apakah ia telah melukai orang-orang di sekitar atau tidak.

column2: There is a rumor that he appeared again.{nl}Please kill it on behalf of me.{nl}And as a proof, please bring me the chisel that is on the body of the monster.
column3: 최근 그 녀석이 다시 나타났다는 소문이 있습니다.{nl}제 대신 녀석의 숨통을 끊어 주시기 바랍니다.{nl}그리고 그 증표로 아직도 녀석의 몸에 박혀있을 제 창 끝을 가져다 주십시오.
column4: Belakangan muncul rumor bahwa ia kembali muncul lagi.{nl} Tolong gantikan saya untuk menghabisi dirinya.{nl} Lalu tolong bawakan ujung tombakku yang masih tertancap pada tubuhnya sebagai tanda akan hal itu.

column2: Defeat Sparnasman at 64_2 of Bracken Monastery and bring me the tip of my spear.
column3: 고사리 수도원64_2에서 스파나스맨을 처치하시고 제 창 끝을 가져다 주세요.
column4: Bunuhlah Sparnasman di Bracken Monastery64_2 dan bawalah ujung tombak milikku.

column2: Yes, that's the end of the spear I used to attack it back then.{nl}Now we can finally say it was us the Hoplites who defeated the beast.
column3: 확실히 그것은 제가 과거 녀석의 몸에 박아넣었던 창의 끝부분이 맞군요.{nl}녀석은 우리 유능한 하플라이트가 쓰러뜨렸노라고 여기저기 자랑할 수 있겠습니다.
column4: Itu adalah benar merupakan ujung tombak milikku yang tertancap pada tubuhnya di masa lalu.{nl} Ia telah menghabisi Hoplite berbakat kami, dan membanggakan dirinya disana sini.

column2: Hmm... You've become very strong.{nl}I didn't know that you've completed the training that hard. You will be able to learn the skills of the next stage.
column3: 흠... 제법 강해졌구만?{nl}그 정도까지 수련을 해내다니, 다음 단계의 기술도 배울만 하겠어.
column4: Hmm... Cukup bertambah kuat rupanya?{nl} Jika melakukan latihan hingga setingkat itu, maka kamu layak untuk belajar skill tingkat berikutnya.

column2: Of course, I can't just teach you for free. Prove the strength you have!{nl}Without any enhancement effects on your body, come back after defeating the monsters at Feretory Hills.
column3: 물론 그저 가르쳐 줄 수는 없지. 자네가 가진 힘을 증명해보게!{nl}신체에 아무런 강화효과를 받지 않는 상태에서 페레토리 구릉의 몬스터들을 처치하고 오게.
column4: Tentu, saya tidak bisa mengajarkan hanya begitu saja. Buktikanlan kemampuan yang kau miliki!{nl} Kembalilah setelah membunuh para monster di Feretory Hills dalam kondisi tidak menggunakan efek enhancement apapun pada tubuh.

column2: And of course, don't ask your friends to help you with this.
column3: 물론 동료의 도움따위를 받아서야 의미 없지.
column4: Tentu saja jika kamu mendapatkan bantuan dari kawan, maka ini semua tidak ada artinya.

column2: Prove the strength of the sword.
column3: 순수하게 그 검의 위력만을 증명해 보게.
column4: Tolong buktikan kekuatan dari pedang itu secara murni.

column2: You are way more useful than I expected.{nl}My brother would be glad to know that a competant lad like you became a Barbarian.
column3: 자네 생각 이상으로 쓸만한 것 같군.{nl}이런 인재가 바바리안으로 들어온 것을 알면 형님도 기뻐하시겠어.
column4: Kau hebat melebihi dugaanku rupanya.{nl} Kakak pasti senang jika mengetahui bahwa orang seperti ini kembali sebagai Barbarian.

column2: You know well about the structure of the shield.{nl}You can come to me anyime to learn.
column3: 방패의 구조에 대해 제법 아는 친구로군.{nl}내게 배우러 얼마든지 찾아 와도 좋아.
column4: Kamu cukup mengetahui tentang struktur perisai rupanya.{nl} Sangat baik kapanpun kamu datang mencariku untuk belajar.

column2: Cataphract. {nl}I don't know if it would fit you well.
column3: 캐터프랙트라. {nl}자네에게 어울릴지는 잘 모르겠는데.
column4: Cataphract. {nl} Entah apakah ini akan cocok denganmu atau tidak.

column2: I like your guts.{nl}Do me a favor and defeat the demons in Feretory Hills.
column3: 패기는 마음에 드는군.{nl}그렇다면 페레토리 구릉의 마족들을 처치해보게.
column4: Saya suka akan ambisimu.{nl} Kalau begitu bunuhlah para demon di Feretory Hills.

column2: After Medzio Diena, Feretory Hills has been crawling with demons.{nl}Go and defeat the demons there.
column3: 신수의 날 이후 페레토리 구릉은 어느샌가 마족들이 들끓는 곳이 되어 버렸지.{nl}그 곳의 마족들을 처치하게.
column4: Setelah hari Medzio Diena, Feretory Hills menjadi tempat bermukim para demon.{nl} Bunuhlah para demon di tempat itu.

column2: I think you would be able to reach a higher level Krivis.{nl}Do you want to receive the test?
column3: 당신의 실력이라면 좀 더 높은 경지의 크리비가 되실 수 있을 것 같군요.{nl}시험을 받아 보시겠습니까?
column4: Dengan kemampuan anda, sepertinya bisa menjadi Krivi dengan tingkatan lebih tinggi rupanya.{nl} Maukah kamu menjalankan ujian?

column2: Take this gem and go to Feretory Hills.{nl}After you injure the monsters, use the power of the gem to purify them.{nl}Then, bring back their ashes.
column3: 이 보석을 가지고 페레토리 구릉으로 가세요.{nl}몬스터들에게 상처를 입힌 다음 보석의 힘으로 몬스터를 정화하시기 바랍니다.{nl}그러면 재가 남을텐데 그것을 가져오세요.
column4: Bawalah Gem ini, dan pergilah ke Feretory Hills.{nl} Murnikanlah monster dengan kekuatan Gem setelah melukai mereka terlebih dahulu.{nl} Kalau begitu tolong bawakan itu kepadaku ya.

column2: Don't worry. It is the sacred flame so it would not harm you.
column3: 안심하세요. 성스러운 불꽃의 기운이니 당신에게는 해가 없을 겁니다.
column4: Tenang saja. Karena itu adalah kekuatan suci firework, maka tidak akan melukai anda.

column2: This effectively proves your skills. {nl}Congratulations on reaching the last level of Krivis.{nl}I hope you will keep using your power to help those in need.
column3: 이것으로 당신의 실력이 입증되었군요.{nl}크리비로서 마지막 단계에 들어서신 것을 축하드립니다.{nl}앞으로도 그 힘으로 어려운 이들에게 도움을 주시기 바랍니다.
column4: Dengan ini kemampuan kamu telah diakui.{nl} Saya ucapkan selamt karena telah melewati tahapan terakhir Krivi.{nl} Ke depannya pun, semoga kekuatan itu dapat membantu mereka yang kesulitan.

column2: Now, it is time to leave for a far place and spread the blessing of the goddesses.{nl}But, we never know what kind of dangers are ahead of us.{nl}Especially the times like nowadays.
column3: 이제 먼 곳으로 떠나 여신의 은총을 퍼뜨리셔야 할 때가 온 것 같군요.{nl}하지만 여행길에는 어떤 위험이 도사리고 있는지 모르는 법.{nl}지금같은 시기에는 더욱 그렇지요.
column4: Sekarang sepertinya adalah waktu untuk menyebarkan berkat Goddess dengan pergi ke tempat jauh.{nl} Tetapi tidak ada yang tahu bahaya apa yang akan menghadang di perjalanan nanti.{nl} Apalagi di saat seperti sekarang ini.

column2: Please show us that at least you can protect yourself.
column3: 그대가 최소한 스스로는 지킬 수 있는지 보여주시기 바랍니다.
column4: Kamu harus memperlihatkan masing-masing apakah dapat menjaga diri sendiri paling tidak.

column2: The monsters at Feretory Hills would be enough.{nl}Come back after defeating them.
column3: 페레토리 구릉의 몬스터 정도면 적당하겠군요.{nl}그들을 소탕하고 돌아오시기 바랍니다.
column4: Monster di Feretory Hills sepertinya cukup.{nl} Kembalilah setelah menghabisi mereka.

column2: We can't save other people by just relying on the divinity.{nl}There are times that we need to use some force.
column3: 신성에 기대어서만은 사람들을 구제할 수 없는 법이지요.{nl}때로는 무력을 필요로 할 때도 있습니다.
column4: Kita tidak dapat menolong orang-orang hanya dengan berharap pada kesucian saja.{nl} Terkadang ada waktunya membutuhkan kekuatan juga.

column2: You won't have any trouble travelling far away.{nl}As a priest, please keep your mind and do your duties with all your heart.
column3: 그 정도라면 먼 여행을 떠나셔도 무리는 없겠군요.{nl}프리스트로서의 마음가짐을 항상 가슴에 새기고 그대의 사명을 다 하십시오.
column4: Jika dengan kemampuan itu, maka tidak akan ada kesulitan jika pergi berkelana jauh pun.{nl} Pergilah melakukan tugas dengan teringat bahwa kamu adalah seorang Priest.

column2: Now is the time to proceed to the next level of Bokor.{nl}I want to forecast your future as one of your collegues.{nl}Face the violent monsters and please bring me the cards that they drop.
column3: 보코르의 다음 단계로 나아가실 때가 되었군요.{nl}이제 입문자가 아닌, 같은 길을 걸어나가는 동료로서 당신의 미래를 점쳐보고 싶네요.{nl}흉포한 몬스터를 상대하시고 그들이 떨구는 카드를 가져다 주세요.
column4: Waktunya telah datang untuk melanjutkan ke tingkat selanjutnya dari Bokor.{nl} Sekarang sebagai kawan yang berjalan berjalan di jalan sama, bukan sebagai pendatang baru, aku ingin meramalkan masa depan anda.{nl} Hadapilah monster yang brutal, dan bawakanlah kartu yang mereka jatuhkan.

column2: The master told me that it is already decided that who and what cards will be brought.{nl}However, with my skills, I don't know what cards you would bring.
column3: 마스터께서는 누가 어떤 카드를 가져오게 될지는 모두 정해져 있다고 하시지요.{nl}하지만 제 능력으로는 당신이 어떤 카드를 가져오실지 알 수가 없네요.
column4: Master berkata ia dapat mengetahui kartu apa yang dimiliki oleh seseorang, karena semua telah ditentukan.{nl} Tetapi dengan kemampuan saya, saya tidak tahu kartu apa yang kamu miliki.

column2: The light, the salavation, the vice and the cursed jewel..? These are the everything I can read.{nl}They are all rarely written. Especially the last word is significant.
column3: 빛과 구원, 징악. 저주받은 보석...? 제가 읽어낼 수 있는 단어는 이 정도로군요.{nl}모두 좀처럼 나오지 읽히지 않는 단어들입니다. 특히 마지막 단어가 의미심장하네요.
column4: Cahaya dan keselamatan, Hukuman atas kejahatan. Gem yang terkutuk...? Kata-kata yang dapat terbaca olehku hanya sejauh ini saja.{nl} Semua  yang muncul adalah kata-kata yang tidak terbaca dan sangat jarang. Terutama kata terakhir sungguh signifikan ya.

column2: It's your duty to interpret them.{nl}But, you look like someone with the abnormal destiny unlike other people.{nl}I hope that you can fulfill all your duties.
column3: 해석은 당신의 몫입니다.{nl}하지만 당신은 다른 사람들과는 다른, 커다란 운명을 짊어진 분 같군요.{nl}부디 당신에게 내려진 사명을 다하실 수 있기를 바라겠습니다.
column4: Tafsiran itu adalah jiwa anda.{nl} Tetapi kamu sepertinya adalah orang yang memiliki nasib besar, yang berbeda dengan orang lainnya.{nl} Kuharapkan kamu dapat melakukan semua tugas yang diberikan kepada anda.

column2: When I was parted with Tesla, he gave me an assignment.{nl}I have to carve some special sculpture, but the materials are hard to obtain.{nl}He told me to request to someone who can be relied on and I think you are the right person.
column3: 테슬라님과 마지막으로 헤어지던 때, 제게 숙제를 내 주신 것이 있지요.{nl}특별한 조각을 깎아내야 하는 과제인데 재료부터가 만만치가 않아요.{nl}믿을만한 사람에게 부탁하라고 말씀하셨는데 마침 당신이 계시네요.
column4: Ketika berpisah terakhir kalinya dengan tuan Tesla, ada sebuah PR yang diberikan kepada saya.{nl} PR untuk memotong potongan yang spesial, tetapi bahannya tidaklah mudah.{nl} Ia menyuruhku untuk meminta tolong pada orang untuk mencari bahan itu, dan kurasa kamu adalah orang yang tepat.

column2: Go to Braken Monastery 64_2 and you will see Sparnasman monsters.{nl}Defeat them in the XXX region and bring me their horns.
column3: 고사리 수도원64_2에서 스파나스맨이란 몬스터를 마주치실 수 있을 거에요.{nl}XX지역에서 녀석을 쓰러뜨리고 녀석의 머리에 난 그 뿔을 가져다 주세요.
column4: Kamu akan bertemu dengan monster yang bernama Sparnasman di Bracken Monastery 64_2.{nl} Tolong bawakanlah tanduknya kepadaku, setelah mengalahkannya di area XX.

column2: He didn't ask me to save him myself, but he wants me to ask someone who can be relied on...{nl}I think he is also testing my benevolence.
column3: 직접 구하라고 하시지 않고 믿을만한 사람에게 부탁하라고 하시다니...{nl}제 인망도 같이 시험하시려는 게 아닐까요.
column4: Ia tidak menyuruh untuk mencari secara langsung, tetapi meminta tolong kepada orang yang bisa dipercaya...{nl} Sepertinya ia juga mengetes kepopularitasan diriku juga.

column2: You brought them well. I can tell they are the materials that I asked you.{nl}As I promised, I will teach you high level skills of Dievdirbys.
column3: 가져 오셨군요. 제가 부탁드린 재료가 틀림 없네요.{nl}약속대로 딥디르비의 상위 기술을 가르쳐 드릴게요.
column4: Kau telah membawakannya rupanya. Tidak salah lagi ini material yang kuminta tolong padamu.{nl} Sesuai janji akan kuajarkan skill tingkat atas Dievdirbys.

column2: You want to enter the way of Sadhu?{nl}Okay. Although it's hard for me to take the official test since only my spirit is here...{nl}I will test you with my method.
column3: 사두의 길에 입문하시겠습니까?{nl}좋습니다. 비록 저는 유체만이 이곳에 있어 정식 시험을 치루기는 무리입니다만...{nl}나름의 방식으로 당신을 시험해 보겠습니다.
column4: Apakah kamu mau berjalan di jalan Sadhu?{nl} Baiklah. Karena Spirit Form berada disini, sulit untuk melakukan ujian...{nl} Akan kutes kamu dengan cara tertentu.

column2: I'm going to give you my energy.{nl}Use the energy at Feretory Hills and it will blend in with part of the monsters' spirits.
column3: 저의 기운을 당신에게 전달해 드릴 것입니다.{nl}페레토리 구릉에서 그 기운을 사용하시면 몬스터의 영혼 일부가 섞이게 됩니다.
column4: Aku akan memberikan energiku kepada anda.{nl} Jika menggunakan energi itu di Feretory Hills, maka akan bercampur sebagian dengan jiwa monster.

column2: Defeat the monsters with my energy imparted to collect their spirits, then bring them to me. {nl}Do this without the help of anyone.
column3: 영혼이 섞인 몬스터를 처치하시고 영혼을 흡수한 다음 돌아오세요.{nl}단, 이 시험은 동료의 도움은 받으실 수 없습니다.
column4: Bunuhlah monster yang bercampur jiwanya, dan kembalilah setelah menyerah jiwa itu.{nl}Tetapi, Ujian ini tidak bisa dilakukan dengan mendapat bantuan dari teman.

column2: It seems that the spirits of the monsters are not enough yet.{nl}I can't open the way of Sadhu yet.
column3: 아직 몬스터의 영혼이 충분치 않은 것 같군요.{nl}아직은 사두의 길을 열어드릴 수 없습니다.
column4: Sepertinya jiwa monster masih belum cukup.{nl} Saya masih belum bisa membukakan jalan dari Shadu.

column2: I can feel the great power of the spirit in you...{nl}I can tell how great is your competence. Congratulations on your entrance to the way of Sadhu.{nl}I will teach you the skills of Sadhu although only my spirit is here.
column3: 당신에게 충만한 영혼의 힘이 느껴집니다...{nl}당신의 능력은 잘 알겠습니다. 사두로의 입문을 축하드리겠습니다.{nl}유체로나마 당신에게 사두의 기술을 알려드리지요.
column4: Terasa kekuatan dari jiwa yang penuh pada diri Anda...{nl}  Ketahuilah dengan baik kekuatan anda. Selamat atas keberhasilan menjadi Shadu.{nl} Tinggalkan Spirit Form, maka akan kuajarkan teknik Shadu kepada anda.

column2: You want to enter the way of Paladin?{nl}It is different from other priestsl. In order to become a Paladin, you have to possess strong power.
column3: 팔라딘에 입문하시려는 건가요?{nl}다른 성직과는 다릅니다. 팔라딘이 되려면 그만큼 강한 힘이 뒷받침 되어야합니다.
column4: Apakah kamu bermaksud bergabung dengan Paladin?{nl} Kami berbeda dengan class suci lainnya. Jika ingin menjadi Paladin, maka harus diikuti dnegan kekuatan kuat.

column2: Good. You're skilled.{nl}Okay then, shall I test you? Come back after defeating monsters at Feretory Hills.
column3: 좋습니다. 자신만만하시군요.{nl}그럼 시험해볼까요? 페레토리 구릉의 몬스터들을 처치하고 오세요.
column4: Bagus. Penuh percaya diri rupanya.{nl} Kalau begitu mari coba kutes ya? Kembalilah setelah membunuh para Monster di Feretory Hilss.

column2: We, Paladins stand at the front line when we fight against the demons.{nl}With the uncertain skills you have, you would soon experience something unfortunate.
column3: 우리 팔라딘은 마족과의 싸움에서 최전선에 서 있는 자들입니다.{nl}어중간한 실력으로는 뜻이 좋더라도 금방 불행한 일을 당하고 말겁니다.
column4: Kami Paladin, adalah orang yang berdiri di baris paling depan pada pertempuran dengan Demon.{nl} Dengan kemampuan yang tanggung, dapat menimbulkan kemalangan sekejap.

column2: You've done well way better than I expected.{nl}As I promised, I will appoint you as a Paladin on behalf of the Master.
column3: 기대 이상으로 잘 해 주셨네요.{nl}약속대로 마스터를 대신해서 당신을 팔라딘으로 임명하겠습니다.
column4: Kamu melakukan lebih baik diluar dugaan.{nl} Sesuai janji,saya menggantikan Master akan mengangkat kamu sebagai Paladin.

column2: I can now call you a Rodelero.{nl}However, in order to become stronger, sometimes you should know your strength as well.
column3: 그 정도면 어엿한 로델레로라 할 수 있겠어.{nl}그러나 진정 강해지기 위해서는 때로는 자신의 강점을 포기할 줄도 알아야지.
column4: Dengan kemampuan itu, bisa disebut sebagai Rodelero yang terhormat.{nl} Tetapi untuk menjadi sangat kuat, terkadang harus mengetahui cara menyerah akan kelebihan diri sendiri.

column2: You seem ready.{nl}If so, go to the Apsimesti Crossroads without your shield and defeat the monsters there.
column3: 준비는 된 것 같군.{nl}그렇다면 방패를 착용하지 않은 상태에서 압시메스티 교차로의 몬스터를 해치우고 와.
column4: Sepertinya telah selesai bersiap.{nl} Kalau begitu, kembalilah setelah menghabisi monster di Apsimesti Crossroad dalam keadaan tidak menggunakan perisai.

column2: You know you need to do this on your own, right?
column3: 물론 혼자서 해내야 한다는 정도는 알겠지?
column4: Kau sudah tahu harus melakukannya sendirian bukan?

column2: The shields are the most reliable colleague of Rodelero.{nl}But, a Swordsman should be strong himself.
column3: 방패는 로델레로의 가장 듬직한 전우지.{nl}하지만 전사라면 스스로 강해야할 필요가 있다.
column4: Perisai merupakan kawan yang paling terpercaya miliki Rodelero.{nl} Tetapi seorang ksatria perlu untuk memperkuat dirinya sendiri.

column2: I was able to check the potential again.{nl}As you know, my teaching is very strict so you should be well prepared.
column3: 다시 한 번 그 가능성을 확인할 수 있었다.{nl}알다시피 내 가르침은 엄격하니까 단단히 각오해야 할 거야.
column4: Dapat memeriksa kemungkinan itu sekali lagi.{nl} Seperti yang diketahui, kamu harus bersiap dengan baik karena saya mengajar dengan ketat.

column2: Are you any good with the spear now?{nl}If so, ger ready to become a true Cataphract.{nl}How's you companion's condition?
column3: 어때, 이제 찌른다는 게 뭔지 알겠나?{nl}그럼 진정한 캐터프랙트로 거듭나기 위한 준비를 해보세.{nl}자네 컴패니언의 상태는 양호한가?
column4: Bagaimana, Apakah kamu tahu apakah yang mencolok?{nl} Maka bersiaplah untuk menjadi Cataphract yang sebenarnya.{nl} Apakah kondisi dari Companion kamu baik?

column2: Good. Imagine your arms are the spear that'll strike your opponents.{nl}And your legs are the companion that moves you around.{nl}Go to the Apsimesti Crossroads and defeat your enemies while mounted on your companion.
column3: 좋아. 어떤 적도 꿰뚫을 수 있는 창이 자네의 팔이라고 치지.{nl}그렇다면 다리는 단연 기동력을 제공해주는 자네의 컴패니언이라고 할 수 있을걸세.{nl}컴패니언에 올라탄 채로 압시메스티 교차로의 적들을 토벌하고 오게.
column4: Bagus. Tanganmu bisa disebut sebagai tombak yang dapat menembus musuh seperti apapun.{nl} Jika begitu, kaki kamu bisa disebut sebagai companion yang menjadi pilar penyanggah anda.{nl} Hukumlah para musuh di Apsimesti Crossroad dengan menaiki Companion.

column2: If you don't get used to fighting agaist the others while mounted on a companion, give up on Cataphract.{nl}You don't have travel sickness right?
column3: 컴패니언을 타고 싸우는 전투에 익숙해지지 않는다면 캐터프랙트는 포기하게.{nl}설마 멀미하는 것은 아니겠지?
column4: Naiki Companion dan jika tidak terbiasa pada pertempuran, menyerahlah untuk menjadi Cataphract.{nl} Jangan bilang kamu mabuk kan?

column2: You are going to become a good cavalry after the kingdom gets reconstructed in the future.{nl}Of course, until then, use the skills that I will teach you and do your duties at your best.
column3: 자네라면 추후 왕국이 재건된 후에 훌륭한 기병이 될 수 있겠어.{nl}물론 그때까지 내가 가르쳐 주는 기술을 이용해서 자네의 사명을 다하게.
column4: Kamu dapat menjadi pasukan kavalry hebat setelah kerajaan dibangun kembali.{nl} Tentu saja, sampai saat itu kamu harus melakukan misi kamu dengan menggunakan skill yang saya ajarkan.

column2: You've passed all previous assignements and your growth rate is also amazing.{nl}You won't have any problem enetering the last stage of Bokor!
column3: 지난 과제들도 무난히 통과한데다 성장속도도 무시못할 수준이군요.{nl}당신이라면 보코르의 마지막 단계에 들어서도 괜찮을 것 같아요!
column4: PR yang ada sebelumnya pun walau dapat dilewati dengan mudah, merupakan sesuatu yang tidak dapat diabaikan begitu saja karena kecepatan pertumbuhannya.{nl} Sepertinya kamu bisa memasuki tahap terakhir dari Bokor!

column2: No no. You shouldn't be satisfied too soon.{nl}Now, it is your turn to utilize the skills you've learned so far.{nl}Defeat the monsters at Apsimesti Crossroads.
column3: 아니아니, 너무 미리부터 좋아하진 마세요.{nl}이제는 그간 배운 기술을 응용해 보는 시험을 치룰 차례랍니다.{nl}압시메스티 교차로에서 몬스터들을 처치해 보세요.
column4: Bukan bukan, Janganlah menyukainya terlalu awal.{nl} Sekarang adalah persiapan melakukan ujian dengan mencoba menggunakan skill yang dipelajarin selama ini.{nl} Periglah ke Apsimesti Crossroad dan bunuhlah para monster disana.

column2: The skills which you've learned will be used effectively in the battles.{nl}It wouldn't be that dangerous in Apsimesti Crossroads.
column3: 배우신 기술들은 전투에 매우 유용하게 쓰이곤 하죠.{nl}압시메스티 교차로라면 크게 위험하진 않을 거에요.
column4: Skill-skill yang dipelajari dapat digunakan dengan sangat baik pada pertempuran.{nl} Apsimesti Crossroad tidaklah terlalu berbahaya.

column2: Well done!{nl}Now your journey as a Bokor has really started.
column3: 수고하셨어요!{nl}이제 보코르로서의 진짜 여정이 시작되었군요.
column4: Terima kasih banyak!{nl} Sekarang perjalanan sebagai Bokor sungguh telah dimulai.

column2: I received a letter from Tesla!{nl}From what he wrote he seems to expect great things from you.{nl}Let's see if you've improved enough to live up to his expectations.
column3: 간신히 테슬라님과 연락이 닿았어요!{nl}당신에 대해서 편지에 적었더니 기대되는 인재라고 하시더군요.{nl}지금 당신의 실력은 그 기대에 걸맞게 성장했을지 시험해보죠.
column4: Kami berhasil membuat kontak dengan tuan Tesla!{nl} Katanya kamu adalah orang yang diharapkan, karena kami menuliskan tentang kamu pada surat itu.{nl} Sekarang kekuatan kamu akan diuji apakah sudah berkembang dengan baik atau belum.

column2: By completing the request that was sent to us, I will treat that as your advancement test.{nl}The request is to repair the statue of the goddesses, but we need the materials for the perfumed oil that will be used for the repair.{nl}Please gather the lumps of oil from Ashrongs at Aqueduct region.
column3: 그럼 저희에게 들어온 청원을 수행하는 것으로 승급시험을 대신하도록 해보죠.{nl}여신상을 보수해 달라는 청원인데 여기에 쓰일 향유의 재료가 필요하답니다.{nl}수로교 지역에서 아슈롱의 기름덩어리를 모아다 주세요.
column4: Kalau begitu, tolong lakukan petisi yang kami terima sebagai ganti dari ujian kenaikan tingkat.{nl} ini adalah petisi meminta perbaikan patung Goddess, dan membutuhkan material Balm yang dipakai disini.{nl} Pergilah ke Aqueduct Bridge Area dan kumpulkan Ashurong Fat Lump.

column2: When you gather the lumps of oil from Ashrongs, I will refine it and make it into the perfumed oil.
column3: 아슈롱의 기름덩어리를 모아다 주시면 제가 정제하여 향유로 만들거에요.
column4: Jika akan mengumpulkan Ashurong Fat Lump, maka akan kusaring dan buatkan Balm.

column2: We've completed the preparation stage.{nl}If you wait a bit, I will make you perfumed oil.
column3: 일단 준비단계는 마쳤네요.{nl}잠시만 기다리시면 제가 향유를 만들어드릴게요.
column4: Pertama-tama tahap persiapan telah selesai ya.{nl} Jika menunggu sebentar maka akan kubuatkan Balm.

column2: The perfumed oil has been completed.{nl}With this perfumed oil, please repair Vakarine Statue at Orsha and Fedimian.
column3: 향유가 다 만들어졌어요.{nl}이제 이 향유를 가지고 오르샤와 페디미안에 있는 바카리네 여신상을 보수해주세요.
column4: Balm telah selesai dibuat.{nl} Sekarang bawalah Balm ini, dan perbaikilah patung Goddess Vakarine yang ada di Fedimian dan Orsha.

column2: The cities may be far from each other but there's always a fast way.{nl}Good luck.
column3: 두 도시 간 거리가 멀긴 하지만 언제나 빠른 방법은 있는 법이랍니다.{nl}수고해 주세요.
column4: Walau jarak kedua kota jauh, tetapi selalu ada cara untuk itu.{nl} Selamat berusaha.

column2: I think the citizens at the two cities will have hope by just looking at the clean statues.
column3: 깨끗한 여신상을 보는 것만으로도 두 도시 시민들에게 희망이 샘솟지 않을까요?
column4: Melihat patung Goddess yang bersih, sepertinya apakah ada harapan bagi para penduduk kedua kota?

column2: You've come back from a long way. Tesla would compliment for sure.{nl}You would become great from now on.{nl}I guess I have a rival now.
column3: 먼 길 다녀오느라 고생하셨어요. 테슬라님도 분명 칭찬하실거에요.{nl}당신은 앞으로도 굉장해지실 것 같아요.{nl}이거, 딥디르비로서 라이벌이 생겼는걸요?
column4: Sudah merepotkan karena pergi sampai ke tempat jauh. Tuan Tesla pasti akan memuji anda.{nl} Kamu pun kedepannya akan menjadi lebih baik.{nl} Ini, mungkin serasa muncul rival sebagai Dievdirbys?

column2: You've come at the right time.{nl}I've heard that the number of Red Triamublos has increased a lot at Apsimesti Crossroads and they are threatening the villagers.{nl}If you want to step forward as a true Sadhu, please share your abilities.
column3: 마침 잘 오셨습니다.{nl}압시메스티 교차로의 붉은 트리암불로가 크게 불어나 주민들을 위협하고 있다고 합니다.{nl}당신이 진정한 사두로서 한 걸음 더 내딛고 싶다면 당신의 능력을 베푸십시오.
column4: Kau datang dengan selamat ya.{nl} Red Triambulo sedang mengamuk di Aptimesti Crossroad dan mengancam para penduduk desa.{nl} Kamu sebagai Shadu yang sebenarnya, jika ingin melangkah lebih jauh, maka perlihatkanlah kemampuan kamu .

column2: For the next test, face against stronger monsters.{nl}Are you ready?
column3: 다음 시험은 보다 강한 몬스터들을 상대해보죠.{nl}준비는 되셨습니까?
column4: Ujian selanjutnya adalah menghadapi monster yang kuat.{nl} Apakah persiapan sudah selesai?

column2: Thake this relic and go to Starving Demon's Way.{nl}Activate it at the Abandoned Altar in Hyth Cliff and the monsters will appear.{nl}I assume you know what to do next?
column3: 이 오래된 성물을 가지고 큰아귀 길로 가세요.{nl}히스 절벽에 있는 버려진 제단에 성물을 반응시키면 몬스터들이 나올 겁니다.{nl}그 다음은 말씀드리지 않아도 아시겠지요?
column4: Bawalah relic tua ini, dan pergilah ke Starving Demon's Way.{nl} jika membuat relic di Abandoned altar yang ada di Hyth Cliff bereaksi, maka para monster akan muncul.{nl} Selanjutnya kamu tahu harus berbuat apa kan?

column2: The Abandoned Altar is by Hith Cliff in Starving Demon's Way.
column3: 버려진 제단은 큰아귀 길의 히스 절벽에 있습니다.
column4: Abandoned Altar ada di Hyth Cliff pada Starving Demon's Way.

column2: Good job. You're one step closer to the next level.{nl}I would be glad to introduce your talent to my uncle; he's busy working as a Master.
column3: 수고하셨어요. 보다 높은 경지로 또 한 발을 내딛으셨군요.{nl}마스터로써 중요한 일로 바쁘신 저희 삼촌께도 보여드렸으면 싶은 실력이시네요.
column4: Sudah merepotkan ya. Kamu telah melangkah satu tingkat lebih tinggi rupanya.{nl} Kemampuan kamu ingin saya perlihatkan kepada pamanku yang sibuk karena urusan penting sebagai Master.

column2: At last, you're a true Rodelero now.{nl}But do you have what it takes to be a leader?{nl}Why don't you give it a try on the Colimencias at the Greene Manor?
column3: 드디어 자네도 한 명의 어엿한 로델레로군.{nl}하지만 자네가 과연 남들을 이끌만한 능력이 있는가?{nl}그린가의 장원에 있는 콜리멘시아로 시험해보지.
column4: Akhirnya kau pun adalah salah satu dari Redelero yang terhormat.{nl} Tetapi apakah kamu sungguh memiliki kemampuan untuk mengarahkan orang lain?{nl} Cobalah ujian Colimencia yang ada di Greene Manor.

column2: You're going to feel overwhelmed.{nl}But you need to know your weaknesses before you can reach the next Rodelero level.
column3: 분명 버거움을 느낄 거야.{nl}하지만 자신의 부족함을 알아야 더 높은 경지의 로델레로가 될 수 있는 것이지.
column4: Pastinya akan merasakan sesuatu yang sungguh tak tertandingi.{nl}Tetapi harus mengetahui kekurangan diri sendiri, agar dapat menjadi Redelero dengan tingkatan lebih tinggi.

column2: What was it like fighting such a strong opponent? Do you feel fit for a Rodelero?{nl}You're already a true Rodelero if you ask me.{nl}Keep up the good work.{nl}
column3: 강적과 싸워보니 어떻던가? 스스로 로델레로에 걸맞다고 생각하는가?{nl}자네가 어떻게 생각하든 내가 보기에 자네는 이미 어엿한 로델레로일세.{nl}앞으로 함께 정진해 나가세.{nl}
column4: Bagaimana setelah mencoba melawan musuh yang kuat? Apakah kamu merasa cocok sebagai Rodelero?{nl} Apapun yang kau pikirkan, menurutku kau telah menjadi Rodelero yang terhormat.{nl} Mari mengabdilah bersama ke depannya.{nl}

column2: To become the best Cataphract you need a worthy opponent.{nl}The Gaigalas in Tenants' Farm and known for being the fiercest and most savage.{nl}Go there and defeat some.
column3: 최강의 캐터프랙트를 꿈꾼다면 그에 걸맞는 상대를 꺾어봐야지.{nl}테넌츠 농장의 가이갈라스의 흉폭함은 널리 알려져 있다네. 피해자도 헤아릴 수 없다던가?{nl}냉큼 가서 녀석을 해치우고 오게.
column4: Jika bermimpi menjadi Cataphract yang terkuat, maka harus coba menghadapi lawan yang tepat.{nl} Terdapat kabar bahwa Gaigalas yang buas mengamuk di Tenants Farm. Jumlah korban pun tidak terhitung?{nl} Segera pergi dan habisi ia.

column2: What you did was very impressive.{nl}As a Sadhu Master I look forward to your progress.
column3: 정말 훌륭한 일을 해 주셨습니다.{nl}사두 마스터로서 당신의 성장을 기대하겠습니다.
column4: Kamu sungguh telah melakukan hal yang luar biasa ya.{nl} Saya mengharapkan perkembangan kamu sebagai Shadu Master.

column2: You've improved quite a bit.{nl}It's time for you to be tested for the final stage.{nl}We need a way to prove your skills.
column3: 그 사이 실력이 또 일취월장하셨군요.{nl}아무래도 마지막 단계로 나아가기 위한 시험을 치르셔야겠어요.{nl}그 실력을 증명할 방법이 필요하겠군요.
column4: Selama itu kemampuanmu telah berkembang perlahan rupanya.{nl} Bagaimanapun untuk mencapai tahapan terakhir, kamu harus menjalani ujian.{nl} Butuh cara untuk membuktikan kemampuan itu.

column2: And I think I know just the one.{nl}They say the Gaigalas in Tenants' Farm are some of the most unruly.{nl}Go there and defeat some to make sure they don't harm anyone else.
column3: 마침 적당한 상대를 알고 있지요.{nl}테넌츠 농장에서 가이갈라스라는 몬스터가 날뛰는 모양이에요.{nl}녀석이 더 이상 사람들을 해치지 못하도록 처리해 주세요.
column4: Akhirnya mengetahui lawan yang layak ya.{nl} Monster yang bernama Gaigalas sedang berkeliaran di Tenants Farm.{nl} Tolong habisi dia, agar ia tidak mengganggu orang-orang lebih jauh lagi.

column2: I can see how great you are.{nl}But, in order to advance, we need more clear verification.
column3: 보여주신 행적만으로도 그 실력은 짐작이 가네요.{nl}하지만 승급을 위해서는 보다 명확한 확인이 필요해서요.
column4: Dengan hasil yang diperlihatkan saja, dapat diketahui bahwa kemampuan kamu luar biasa ya.{nl} Tetapi untuk naik tingkat, membutuhkan pengecekan yang lebih detil lagi.

column2: I wondered if it wasn't too dangerous, but it seems I underestimated you.{nl}You're very impressive.{nl}I don't think anyone would doubt you're fit to become a high-level Paladin.
column3: 솔직히 좀 위험하지 않을까 싶었는데 제가 당신의 실력을 오판한 모양이군요.{nl}대단하세요.{nl}누구든지 당신이라면 높은 경지의 팔라딘이 될 수 있는 자격이 있음을 인정할 겁니다.
column4: Sebenarnya kupikir apakah ini tidak berbahaya ya, tapi ternyata saya salah memperhitungkan kemampuan kamu rupanya.{nl}Luar biasa.{nl} Siapapun pasti akan mengakui bahwa kamu memiliki kriteria untuk menjadi paladin dengan tingkatan tinggi.

column2: Stop.
column3: 끝
column4: Selesai

column2: Start!
column3: 진행!
column4: Laksanakan!

column2: Start!
column3: 진행?
column4: Laksanakan?

column2: Stop?
column3: 끝?
column4: Selesai?

column2: I am looking for the whereabouts of Goddess Zemyna.{nl}Everyone knows that the goddess has disappeared.{nl}
column3: 전 제미나 여신의 행방을 찾고 있어요.{nl}여신께서 행방불명되셨다는 건 누구나 다 아는 이야기지요.{nl}
column4: Saya sedang mencari jejak keberadaan Goddess Zemyna.{nl} Cerita tentan Goddess yang menghilang diketahui oleh siapapun juga.{nl}

column2: I thought we might find Goddess Zemyna here but all I see are the dead...{nl}I've never seen anything like this. We need to find Zemyna.
column3: 여기라면 제미나 여신의 행방을 찾을 수 있을까 했는데 망자들만 가득하다니..{nl}이런 건 처음 봐요. 어서 제미나님을 찾아야 할 텐데요.
column4: Disini, kukira sepertinya dapat mencari jejak dari Goddess Zemyna, tetapi hanya dipenuhi oleh mereka yang telah mati..{nl} Ini pertama kalinya melihat hal itu. Harus bergegas mencari Goddess Zemyna.

column2: So we can't get near the relic...{nl}I understand keeping monsters and demons away, but why it's protected against people I don't know.
column3: 가까이 가지도 못하게 막아 놓은 성물이라..{nl}몬스터나 마족은 이해한다 쳐도, 사람까지 막아놓는 건 이해가 안되네요.
column4: Relic yang ditaruh untuk menghalangi agar tidak dapat datang mendekat..{nl} Walaupun mengerti tentang monster atau demon pun, tidak mengerti mengapa sampai menghalangi manusia ya.

column2: What was that?{nl}It's so good to be safe again. I nearly returned to the goddess.{nl}
column3: 그건 도대체 뭐였죠? {nl}무사해서 정말 다행이에요. 하마터면 여신의 품으로 갈 뻔 했네요.{nl}
column4: Omong-omong itu apa ya? {nl} Sungguh beruntung karena bisa selamat. Hampir saja kembali ke pangkuan Goddess.{nl}

column2: I should've known... it wasn't a relic of the goddess at all.{nl}
column3: 역시.. 그게 여신의 성물이라는 건 거짓말이었나봐요.{nl}
column4: Hmmm..sudah kuduga relic dari Goddess itu adalah kebohongan rupanya.{nl}

column2: Those relics belong to the goddesses.{nl}You shouldn't insult the dead by joking in the name of the goddess.{nl}
column3: 역시 그 성물은 여신의 성물이 아니었구나.{nl}여신의 이름을 팔아서 이런 장난을 치다니 고인을 모욕하는 것도 정도껏 해야지.{nl}
column4: Tentu saja relic itu bukan relic milik Goddess rupanya.{nl} Melakukan pembohongan seperti ini dengan menjual nama Goddess, sama saja seperti menghina yang telah mati bukan.{nl}

column2: I'm going to give you my records.{nl}Take them and destroy them; only then can I finally be at peace.
column3: 내 이 기록을 자네에게 주겠네.{nl}자네가 책임지고 이 기록을 없애준다면 다시 편히 잠들 수 있을 것 같아.
column4: Aku akan memberikan catatan ini kepadamu.{nl} jika kamu bertanggung jawab dan menghancurkan catatan ini, sepertinya saya dapat kembali tertidur dengan tenang.

column2: I don't think... I've seen you before.{nl}
column3: 처음 보는 분.. 이네요.{nl}
column4: Orang yang baru pernah.. Kulihat ya.{nl}

column2: Hm... That's good.{nl}If you can, will you please help me?{nl}
column3: 윽.. 그건 아무래도 좋아요. {nl}괜찮다면 절 도와주시겠어요?{nl}
column4: Eukhh.. Bagaimanapun itu bagus. {nl} Jika memungkinkan, maukah kamu membantuku?{nl}

column2: I came running after the ferrets who stole our food and ended up here.{nl}But the ferrets attacked me and I couldn't get the food.{nl}
column3: 페릿이 마을의 식량을 훔쳐 달아나는 걸 쫓다가 여기까지 와버렸어요.{nl}그런데 식량을 되찾긴 커녕 오히려 페릿들에게 공격당해버렸네요.{nl}
column4: Saya sampai disini karena pergi mengejar Ferret yang mencuri persediaan makanan di desa.{nl} Tetapi ketika bermaksud mengambil kembali persediaan makanan, malah diserang oleh Para Ferret.{nl}

column2: I need some first aid for my wounds...{nl}There's a herb at the Luvda Cliff that helps stop bleeding. Will you get some for me?
column3: 어떻게든 응급처치라도 하고 싶은데..{nl}르브다 절벽 쪽에 지혈에 잘 듣는 약초가 있어요. 그걸 부탁드려도 될까요?
column4: Bagaimanapun ingin melakukan tindakan darurat..{nl} di Luvda Cliff terdapat herb yang efektif untuk pendarahan. Kalau begitu bisakah saya meminta tolong?

column2: The ferrets might attack again.{nl}These days it's like they think everything in the forest belongs to them.
column3: 어쩌면 페릿들이 공격해올지도 몰라요.{nl}언젠가부터 이 숲에서 나는 모든 게 자기들 거라고 생각하는 것 같더라고요.
column4: Mungkin juga para Ferret akan datang menyerang.{nl} Entah sejak kapan, sepertinya aku merasa yang ada di hutan ini adalah milikku semuanya.

column2: Thank you so much for this favor.{nl}I'm going to get some rest and then go back to the workshop where the other people are.{nl}
column3: 정말 감사해요. 제대로 구해 오셨네요.{nl}조금만 쉬었다가 마을 사람들이 있는 작업장으로 돌아 가야겠어요.{nl}
column4: Terima kasih. Karena telah menyelamatkan saya.{nl} Setelah beristirahat sebentar, Aku akan kembali ke tempat kerja dimana orang-orang berada.{nl}

column2: You're telling me you saw a girl being chased by a demon with an axe?{nl}That demon is probably Zaura; the girl I don't know.{nl}
column3: 웬 소녀가 거대한 도끼를 든 마족에 쫓기는 걸 보셨다고요?{nl}마족은 마군주 자우라 같은데, 그 소녀는 저도 잘 모르겠네요.{nl}
column4: Apakah kamu melihat seorang gadis muda yang dikejar oleh para demon yang membawa kampak raksasa?{nl}  Demon itu sepertinya adalah Demon Lord Zaura, gadis itu aku juga tidak mengetahuinya dengan baik.{nl}

column2: And he wants to stop the girl from meeting the Revelator...?{nl}
column3: 게다가 그 소녀가 계시자와 만나게 해선 안된다니.. {nl}
column4: Ditambah lagi gadis itu berkata janganlah sampai bertemu dengan Savior.. {nl}

column2: That sounds suspicious.{nl}I need to tell the village about this.{nl}
column3: 느낌이 안 좋아요.{nl}이건 마을 사람들에게 알려야 할 것 같아요.{nl}
column4: Perasaanku tidak baik.{nl} Hal ini harus diberitahukan kepada orang-orang desa.{nl}

column2: What?{nl}You're a Revelator?{nl}
column3: 네?{nl}당신이 계시자라고요?{nl}
column4: Ya?{nl} Kamu adalah sang Savior katamu?{nl}

column2: Did you come here after dreaming about a calamity?{nl}
column3: 그렇다면 혹시 재앙의 꿈을 꾸고 이 곳으로 오신 건가요?{nl}
column4: Kalau begitu, apakah kamu bermimpi akan bencana, dan datang ke tempat ini?{nl}

column2: I wonder if...?{nl}I think you might just be the Revelator told in the story of our village.{nl}
column3: 설마, 이번에야말로.. {nl}우리 마을에 내려 오는 이야기 속의 진짜 계시자가 당신일지도 모르겠어요.{nl}
column4: Tidak mungkin, apakah kali ini.. {nl} Kamu apakah benar seorang Savior yang ada di dalam cerita yang turun ke desa kami.{nl}

column2: The story says... that when chaos takes over our village, a Revelator will dream of a calamity and come.{nl}They and their divine light will chase away evil and save the village.{nl}
column3: 마을이 위기에 처했을 때, 재앙의 꿈을 쫓아온 계시자가 나타날 것이다.{nl}성스러운 빛과 함께 사악한 기운을 물리치고 마을을 구원하리라.. 라고요.{nl}
column4: Ketika desa mengalami krisis, muncul seorang Savior yang mengejar mimpi akan bencana.{nl} Mengalahkan energi jahat bersama dengan cahaya suci  dan menyelamatkan desa… katanya.{nl}

column2: Those are the words of Goddess Laima that have been passed down.{nl}But... um...{nl}
column3: 오래 전부터 마을에 전해져 오는 라이마 여신의 예지이지요.{nl}하지만.. 음..{nl}
column4: Itu adalah ramalan akan Goddess Laima yang sudah disampaikan di desa ini sejak lama.{nl}Tetapi.. Emm..{nl}

column2: This isn't the right time.{nl}First I'm going to ask our village chief about this story.{nl}
column3: 이럴 때가 아니에요.{nl}저는 일단 촌장님께 전승에 대해 자세히 알아보고 있을게요.{nl}
column4: Ini bukan waktunya untuk hal itu.{nl} Pertama-tama Aku akan mencari tahu secara detil mengenai legenda dari Mayor.{nl}

column2: Meanwhile, please take back our food from the ferrets who stole it.{nl}You can bring it to our village chief at the Bellai Forest Workshop.{nl}
column3: 그 동안 계시자님께선 페릿들이 훔쳐간 식량을 되찾아 주세요.{nl}벨라이 숲 작업장에 계시는 촌장님께 가져다 주시면 돼요.{nl}
column4: Savior, tolong ambil kembali persediaan makanan yang dicuri oleh para Ferret.{nl} Kau bisa membawakannya kepada Mayor yang berada di Bellai Forest Workshop.{nl}

column2: Our people don't really trust outsiders but...{nl}We can't turn our back on help.
column3: 마을 사람들이 예전 일 때문에 외지인을 꺼리긴 하지만..{nl}도와 준 사람을 외면하진 않을 거예요.
column4: Orang-orang desa menghindari orang luar karena ramalan..{nl} Mereka tidak akan memandang pada orang yang telah membantu.

column2: Are you the Revelator Leja talked about?{nl}And that is... our stolen food.{nl}
column3: 당신이 레야가 말한 계시자인가요?{nl}그리고 이건.. 저희가 도둑맞은 식량이군요.{nl}
column4: Apakah kamu adalah Savior yang dibicarakan oleh Leja?{nl} Lalu ini.. Adalah persediaan makanan kami yang dicuri.{nl}

column2: Thank you for taking back our food but...{nl}I don't think I can trust you just yet.{nl}
column3: 저희 식량을 되찾아 준 건 고맙지만.. {nl}그렇다고 해서 무작정 믿을 순 없어요.{nl}
column4: Terima kasih telah mengambil kembali persediaan makanan kami.. {nl} tetapi walau begitu, saya tidak dapat percaya begitu saja.{nl}

column2: Please understand.{nl}We were tricked by the demons once before, you see.
column3: 이해해 주세요. {nl}우린 마족에게 한 번 속은 적이 있었으니까요.
column4: Tolong mengertilah. {nl} Karena kami pernah ditipu oleh demon sekali waktu.

column2: Leja said she had somewhere else to be and left.{nl}I can't tell you where she is going, though.{nl}
column3: 레야는 따로 볼 일이 있다며 다른 곳으로 갔어요.{nl}하지만 어디로 갔는지는 말해줄 순 없지요.{nl}
column4: Leja berkata ia ada urusan lainnya, sehingga ia pergi ke tempat lain.{nl} Tetapi saya tidak dapat memberitahukan kemana ia pergi.{nl}

column2: Like I said, we can't trust you just yet.{nl}
column3: 아까도 말했다시피, 우린 당신을 무작정 믿을 수는 없으니까요.{nl}
column4: Seperti yang dibicarakan tadi, Kami tidak dapat mempercayai kamu begitu saja.{nl}

column2: We once had someone come to our village calling himself a Revelator.{nl}It was a man with a pale face and long hair.{nl}
column3: 예전에 자신이 계시자라며 이 곳에 찾아 온 사람이 있었죠.{nl}창백한 얼굴에 긴 머리의 남자였어요.{nl}
column4: Dahulu ada seorang yang datang ke tempat ini, dan mengaku dirinya adalah Savior.{nl} Seorang lelaki berambut panjang dengan wajah pucat.{nl}

column2: We thought our Revelator had finally arrived and did as the man said.{nl}Truth is, in reality... he was a demon.{nl}
column3: 우리는 드디어 전승 속의 계시자가 나타났다고 믿었기에 그 남자가 시키는 대로 따랐어요.{nl}하지만 그의 정체는.. 마족이었지요.{nl}
column4: Kami pun mempercayai bahwa ia adalah Savior yang muncul di dalam legenda, sehingga kami melakukan apapun yang disuruh oleh lelaki itu.{nl}Tetapi identitas ia yang sebenarnya.. Adalah seorang Demon.{nl}

column2: We believed the demon and because of that Goddess Lada was taken away...{nl}Even the ferrets turned violent.{nl}
column3: 우리가 그 마족에게 놀아난 덕분에 라다 여신은 납치되었고.. {nl}온순했던 페릿 부족까지 난폭하게 돌변했어요.{nl}
column4: Karena kami dipermainkan oleh demon itu, Goddess Lada telah diculik.. {nl}Suku Ferret yang terkenal ramah pun, berubah menjadi ganas.{nl}

column2: We think it was because of the totem the demon made us set up.{nl}We all want to join forces and rescue Goddess Lada, but we're worried about the ferret attacks.{nl}
column3: 아마 우리가 그 마족에게 속아서 세운 마족 토템 때문이겠지요.{nl}힘을 합쳐 라다 여신을 구하고 싶지만 페릿 부족의 공격 때문에 어쩌질 못하고 있어요.{nl}
column4: Mungkin penyebab hal ini adalah patung demon yang didirikan oleh kami karena tertipu oleh demon itu.{nl} Kami ingin menyelamatkan Goddess Lada dengan menggabungkan kekuatan, tetapi karena serangan dari Ferret, kami pun menjadi tidak berdaya.{nl}

column2: We can't even go near the totem because of its evil energy.{nl}But if you really are a Revelator, I'm sure you can use your divine power to destroy the totem.{nl}
column3: 그 토템 또한 사악한 기운 때문에 가까이 갈 엄두도 못 내고 있어요.{nl}하지만 당신이 진정 계시자라면 신성한 힘으로 그 토템을 부술 수 있겠지요.{nl}
column4: Karena energy jahat dari totem itu, sulit sekali rasanya untuk datang menghampiri totem tersebut.{nl} Tetapi jika kamu adalah Savior yang sebenarnya, maka kamu pasti dapat menghancurkan totem itu dengan kekuatan suci.{nl}

column2: Show us.{nl}If you really are a Revelator...
column3: 보여주세요. {nl}당신이 진짜 계시자라는 것을..
column4: Perlihatkanlah. {nl} Bahwa kamu memang Savior yang sesungguhnya..

column2: Please understand.{nl}I know Leja is glad the Revelator is finally here but...{nl}
column3: 이해해 주세요.{nl}레야는 드디어 진짜 계시자가 왔다고 좋아하지만..{nl}
column4: Tolong mengertilah.{nl} Leja menyukai jika Savior yang sebenarnya telah datang, tetapi..{nl}

column2: We've been fooled before, we can't help but be suspicious.
column3: 이미 한 번 속은 우리는 신중해 질 수 밖에 없어요.
column4: Kami yang telah tertipu sekali, tidak ada cara selain berhati-hati.

column2: You... you're a true Revelator, there's no doubt about it.{nl}I feel so sorry for how I treated you earlier... Please forgive this old man.{nl}
column3: 당신은.. 전승 속의 계시자임이 틀림 없군요.{nl}아까의 실례는 어떻게 해야 할지.. 이 늙은이의 안목 없음을 부디 용서해 주세요.{nl}
column4: Anda.. Tidak salah lagi merupakan Savior yang ada di dalam legenda.{nl} Bagaimiana cara saya membalas jasa anda.. Tolong maafkan si tua ini yang tidak tahu diri.{nl}

column2: Leja went to Zeraha to try and find something to help you.{nl}She said Goddess Laima will have left something prepared for the Revelator.{nl}
column3: 레야는 당신에게 도움이 될 것을 찾겠다며 먼저 제라하로 갔어요.{nl}라이마 여신께서 계시자를 위한 준비를 해 뒀을 거라면서요.{nl}
column4: Mungkin Leja membutuhkan bantuan dari anda, ia telah pergi ke Zeraha terlebih dahulu.{nl} Ia berkata Goddess Laima akan bersiap-siap untuk Savior.{nl}

column2: There is a big statue of Goddess Laima there. {nl}It was sculpted a long time ago when She was still at our village.{nl}
column3: 거기엔 라이마 여신의 거대 조각상이 있거든요.{nl}아주 예전에, 라이마 여신께서 우리 마을에 계셨을 때 세운 것이지요.{nl}
column4: Disana terdapat patung raksasa Goddess Laima.{nl} Dahulu sekali, patung itu didirikan di desa kami ketika masih ada Goddess Laima.{nl}

column2: Oh, by the way... the girl came.{nl}Can I tell you about what happened in our village?{nl}
column3: 참, 그리고.. 그 소녀가 왔었어요.{nl}잠시, 우리 마을에 있었던 이야기를 들어줄 수 있을까요?{nl}
column4: Wah, Lalu.. Gadis itu telah datang.{nl}Sebentar, maukah kamu mendengar cerita yang ada di desa kami?{nl}

column2: Our village has always worshiped Goddess Laima.{nl}One day, She had a vision of a calamity that would strike the kingdom in a future far away.{nl}
column3: 먼 옛날부터 우리 마을은 라이마 여신을 섬겼습니다.{nl}어느 날, 라이마 여신께서는 먼 미래에 왕국에 재앙이 내릴 것을 보셨어요.{nl}
column4: Sejak dahulu kala, desa kami selalu menghormati Goddess Laima.{nl}Suatu hari, Goddess Laima melihat bahwa akan turun bencana pada Kerajaan di masa depan.{nl}

column2: So, to stop this calamity, She decided to leave the village.{nl}Maybe She was worried about leaving us behind, so she had Goddess Lada look after us instead.{nl}
column3: 그래서 그 재앙을 막고자 우리 마을을 떠나기로 결심하셨지요.{nl}남은 우리들이 걱정스러우셨는지, 라다 여신께 전승과 함께 우리 마을을 부탁했습니다.{nl}
column4: Maka dari itu, ia memutuskan untuk pergi dari desa kami demi menghentikan bencana itu.{nl} Kami yang tersisa disini hanya dipenuhi dengan rasa khawatir saja, Goddess Lada meminta tolong pada kami untuk menjaga desa dan Legenda itu.{nl}

column2: But unlike what Goddess Laima predicted, our village remained peaceful.{nl}
column3: 하지만 라이마 여신의 걱정과는 달리, 마을은 평화로웠어요.{nl}
column4: Tetapi berbeda dengan rasa khawatir Goddess Laima, Desa sungguh damai.{nl}

column2: Then, unexpectedly, Medzio Diena happened.{nl}It was the calamity in Goddess Laima's vision.{nl}
column3: 그러던 도중, 신수의 날이 오고야 말았습니다.{nl}라이마 여신께서 보셨던 재앙이 바로 이것이었지요.{nl}
column4: Pada saat itu, mendadak datang hari Medzio Diena.{nl} Bencana yang dilihat oleh Goddess Laima pada saat itu adalah hari ini.{nl}

column2: We weren't too affected by Medzio Diena, but that wasn't the end of it.{nl}Not long after, the river turned red.{nl}
column3: 신수의 날로 인한 피해는 적었지만, 그게 끝은 아니었습니다.{nl}얼마 지나지 않아 강물이 붉게 물들어 버렸지요.{nl}
column4: Hanya kerusakan kecil yang terjadi akibat hari Medzio Diena, tetapi itu bukanlah akhirnya.{nl} Setelah beberapa saat berlalu, air sungai berubah menjadi merah.{nl}

column2: The river water caused terrible pain to everyone who drank it, and it made the fruit grow to an abnormal size.{nl}The fruit, just like the red water, was inedible.{nl}
column3: 강물을 마신 사람은 알 수 없는 복통에 시달렸고, 강물을 먹고 자란 과일은 거대해졌어요.{nl}거대해진 과일 역시 붉은 강물 처럼 먹을 수 없게 되었지요.{nl}
column4: Orang yang meminum air sungai, mengalami sakit yang tidak diketahui dan pohon buah yang tumbuh karena air sungai, menjadi berukuran raksasa.{nl} Buah yang berukuran raksasa itu, ternyata tidak bisa dimakan sama seperti air sungai yang berwarna merah.{nl}

column2: As if that weren't enough, the demons then came and took Goddess Lada.{nl}Just as Laima predicted... chaos took over the village.{nl}
column3: 게다가 마족들까지 마을을 습격하여 라다 여신을 납치해 갔어요.{nl}라이마 여신께서 걱정하신 대로.. 재앙이 마을을 덮친 게지요.{nl}
column4: Ditambah lagi para demon menyerang desa, dan menculik Goddess Lada.{nl} Sesuai dengan kekhawatiran Goddess Laima.. Bencana itu melanda desa.{nl}

column2: Leja probably told you... what Goddess Laima said to us.{nl}She said a Revelator would dream of the calamity and come with the light to chase away evil.
column3: 라이마 여신께서 남기신 말씀.. 레야에게도 들었을 겁니다.{nl}재앙의 꿈을 쫓아 온 계시자가 사악한 기운을 물리치고 빛과 함께 마을을 구해 주실거라고 하셨지요.
column4: Kata-kata yang ditinggalkan oleh Goddess Laima.. Mungkin kau juga akan mendengarnya dari Leja.{nl} Savior yang datang mengejar mimpi akan bencana, akan mengalahkan energi jahat, dan menyelamatkan desa dengan cahaya katanya.

column2: We aren't sure what She meant by the light, but...{nl}Our elders used to say that a warm energy filled the village when Goddess Laima was here.{nl}
column3: 그 빛이 정확히 무언지는 모르겠지만..{nl}우리 조상님께선, 라이마 여신께서 마을에 오실 때면 따스한 기운이 온 마을을 감싼다고 하셨어요.{nl}
column4: Entah cahaya apa itu untuk pastinya, tetapi..{nl} Investigator kami, mengatakan jika waktunya Goddess Laima datang ke desa, maka seluruh desa akan dikelilingi dengan energi yang hangat.{nl}

column2: It was all very quick.{nl}The moment that girl came to me, I felt the same warm energy our elders talked about.{nl}
column3: 정말 한 순간이었지요.{nl}그 소녀가 제게 왔을 때, 조상님께서 말씀하신 따뜻한 기운을 느꼈으니까요.{nl}
column4: Sungguh hanya sekejap saja ya.{nl} ketika gadis itu datang kepada saya, aku merasakan energi hangat seperti yang dibicarakan investigator.{nl}

column2: The girl looked me straight in the eyes and, without a word, she nodded.{nl}Then she disappeared towards Zeraha.{nl}
column3: 그 소녀는 제 눈을 똑바로 바라보며 아무 말 없이 고개를 끄덕였어요.{nl}그리곤 제라하 쪽으로 빠르게 사라졌지요.{nl}
column4: Gadis itu, menggelengkan kepala tanpa berbicara apapun, sambil memandang kepada mata saya.{nl} Lalu ia menghilang dengan cepat ke arah Zeraha.{nl}

column2: Go, chase after the light.{nl}It can only have been sent here by Laima to guide you.{nl}
column3: 자, 어서 빛을 쫓아가세요.{nl}분명 라이마 여신께서 당신을 인도하기 위해 보낸 사자일 거예요.{nl}
column4: Nah, cepatlah pergi mengejar cahaya.{nl} Sudah pasti itu adalah petunjuk yang dikirimkan oleh Goddess Laima untuk mengarahkan anda.{nl}

column2: Please, for Goddess Lada... and our village.
column3: 부디 라다 여신을.. 마을을 부탁드립니다.
column4: Mohon bantuannya untuk Goddess Lada.. Dan desa.

column2: That warm energy...{nl}Until the day I return to the goddess I will never be able to forget it.{nl}
column3: 그 따스했던 기운.. {nl}여신의 품으로 돌아가는 날 까지 잊을 수 없을 겁니다.{nl}
column4: Energi yang hangat itu.. {nl} Tidak dapat dilupakan sampai hari kembalinya ke pelukan Goddess.{nl}

column2: Go now.{nl}Follow the light and you will see the girl once again.{nl}
column3: 어서 가보세요.{nl}빛을 따라가다 보면 그 소녀와 다시 만날 수 있을 거예요.{nl}
column4: Bergegaslah pergi.{nl} Jika pergi mengikuti cahaya, maka dapat menemui gadis itu.{nl}

column2: Revelator, you didn't drink the red water, did you?{nl}I mean... If you had you probably wouldn't be here talking to me.{nl}
column3: 계시자님, 혹시 붉은 물을 마셔 보셨나요?{nl}뭐.. 아마 마셨으면 여기서 저와 대화를 나누는 것 조차 불가능했겠죠.{nl}
column4: Tuan Savior, Apakah kamu pernah meminum air berwarna merah?{nl}Hmm.. Kalau sudah pernah, pastinya kamu tidak sedang berada disini berbicara dengan saya ya.{nl}

column2: Just don't drink the red water no matter how thirsty you are.{nl}The pain will kill you.{nl}
column3: 어쨌든 아무리 목이 마르셔도 붉은 물은 마시면 절대 안 돼요.{nl}마시면 죽을 만큼 괴롭거든요.{nl}
column4: Seberapa hausnya kamu pun, jangan pernah coba meminum air berwarna merah itu.{nl} Jika meminumnya, akan terasa sakit seperti akan mati.{nl}

column2: The water is so toxic we can't even eat our fruit.{nl}It's not even the taste. When they first started to grow we were so glad but...{nl}
column3: 얼마나 독한지 저 과일들조차도 먹을 수 없게 되었어요. {nl}맛이 없는건 둘째 치고요. 처음에 거대해졌을 땐 정말 신났었지만.. {nl}
column4: Saking beracunnya, sampai-sampai buah tersebut tidak dapat dimakan. {nl} Rasa tidak enak adalah urusan nomor dua. Awalnya pada saat mereka tumbuh menjadi raksasa, kami pun sangat tercengang, tapi.. {nl}

column2: But then, one day I got lost around the Menacing Lowlands and I was really thirsty. {nl}Then I noticed some fruit juice that belonged to the ferrets.{nl}
column3: 그런데, 예전에 동갈 저지대에서 헤멘 적이 있었는데 너무 목이 마른 거예요.{nl}그 때, 페릿들이 모아 놓은 과즙통을 봤죠.{nl}
column4: Tetapi, saya pernah tersesat di Menacing Lowlands dulu, dan pada saat itu merasa haus sekali.{nl} Waktu itu, saya melihat Juice drum yang dikumpulkan oleh para Ferret.{nl}

column2: I figured whether I died of thirst or at the hands of the ferrets I was doomed either way.{nl}So I drank the ferrets' juice and... I don't know, nothing happened.{nl}
column3: 목이 말라 죽든, 페릿한테 물려 죽든 어차피 죽는 건 마찬가지잖아요.{nl}그래서 페릿 몰래 모아둔 과즙을 마셨는데.. 글쎄, 아무 일도 안일어나잖아요?{nl}
column4: Entah mati kehausan, atau mati diserang ferret, semuanya akan berakhir sama dengan kematian juga.{nl} Maka dari itu saya meminum juice yang dikumpulkan oleh para Ferret.. tetapi, ternyata tidak terjadi apapun?{nl}

column2: I don't know what they did but it looked like a good substitute for water.{nl}The water in the wells is starting to turn red too, you see.{nl}
column3: 도대체 무슨 짓을 했는 진 모르겠지만 식수 대용을 쓸 수 있을 것 같아요.{nl}우물물도 점점 붉게 물들기 시작했거든요.{nl}
column4: Entah apa yang dilakukannya, tetapi sepertinya bisa dipakai sebagai pengganti makanan.{nl} Air sumur pun perlahan-lahan mulai menjadi merah.{nl}

column2: Would you get some of the ferrets' fruit juice?{nl}Please. We can't live with no water.
column3: 페릿들의 거대 과일 과즙을 모아주실 수 있을까요?{nl}꼭 부탁할게요. 물 없이는 살 수 없잖아요.
column4: Bisakah kamu mengumpulkan buah raksasa juice milik para Ferret?{nl} Mohon bantuannya. Kita tidak dapat hidup tanpa air bukan.

column2: I drank it expecting to die but surprisingly I didn't.{nl}It even tasted good.
column3: 죽을 각오로 마셨는데 정말 깜짝 놀랬죠.{nl}맛이 좋았거든요. 상상 이상으로요.
column4: Padahal saya meminumnya untuk bersiap mati, tetapi sungguh mengejutkan.{nl} Rasanya enak. Diluar dugaan.

column2: Wow, thank you.{nl}With this much juice I won't have to worry for quite some time.{nl}
column3: 와, 감사해요. {nl}이 정도 양이면 한 동안 식수 걱정은 없겠어요.{nl}
column4: Wah, terima kasih. {nl} Jika sebanyak ini, maka tidak perlu khawatir selama beberapa waktu ya.{nl}

column2: But, um...{nl}Sigh, those dogged ferrets...
column3: 그런데.. {nl}어휴, 이 끈질긴 페릿들 같으니..
column4: Tetapi.. {nl}Fyuhh, Para Ferret yang menyulitkan ini..

column2: While you were getting the juice, the ferrets came and stole our food again.{nl}We get it back, they steal it... I'm fed up with this!{nl}
column3: 과즙을 구해주시는 사이에 페릿이 마을을 습격해서 또 식량을 털어갔어요.{nl}되찾고, 빼앗아가고, 또 되찾고.. 정말 지긋지긋해요!{nl}
column4: Ketika kamu mencari Juice, kami diserang oleh Ferret dan mereka menjarah persediaan makanan.{nl}Mengambil kembali, Dirampas, Mengambil kembali.. Cukup sudah rasanya!{nl}

column2: This has to stop.{nl}This time we need to put an end to the ferrets' bad habits.{nl}
column3: 이래선 안 되겠어요.{nl}이번 기회에 페릿의 버릇을 단단히 고쳐줘야겠어요.{nl}
column4: Tidak boleh jika begini terus.{nl} Kali ini kebiasaan para ferret harus diperbaiki dengan benar.{nl}

column1: 그걸 먹은 페릿은 다신 식량을 훔치러 오지 않을 걸요?{nl}일단 오염된 붉은 물을 떠다주세요.{nl}오염된 붉은 물은 마을 구석에 있는 오래된 우물에서 뜰 수 있어요.
column4: 마을 주민

column2: We need to find the food and give it some red water "seasoning".{nl}They're all going to be rolling on the floor in pain after they eat it.{nl}
column3: 페릿이 훔쳐간 식량을 찾아서 붉은 물로 약간 양념을 쳐 주는 거예요.{nl}그걸 먹은 페릿은 아파서 데굴데굴 구르겠죠?{nl}
column4: Temukan persediaan makanan yang dicuri Ferret, dan tuangkanlah bumbu dengan air berwarna merah .{nl} Ferret yang memakan itu, akan terguling guling karena sakit kan?{nl}

column2: The water in the old well south from here is particularly red.{nl}Maybe you can spray the food with the water from there.{nl}
column3: 아래쪽의 낡은 우물에 있는 물이 특히나 붉기가 진해요.{nl}그 물을 페릿이 훔쳐간 식량에 마구 뿌려주세요.{nl}
column4: Terutama air yang berada di bagian bawah sumur, sangat kental dan berwarna merah.{nl} Tuangkanlah air itu pada persediaan makanan yang dicuri oleh Ferret.{nl}

column2: Oh, make sure you spray it on the meat jerky hidden in the Banaga Forest Trail.{nl}Ferrets love meat jerky.
column3: 아, 특히 바나가 숲길에 숨겨 놓은 육포에 꼭 뿌려 주세요. {nl}페릿은 육포를 참 좋아한답니다.
column4: Ah, terutama tuangkanlah pada beef jerky yang disembunyikan pada Banaga Forest Trail. {nl} Ferret sangatlah menyukai Beef Jerky.

column2: We can't let them get away with this.{nl}We've put up with it long enough.
column3: 언제까지 당하고만 있을 수는 없죠.{nl}이 정도면 많이 참은 거라고요.
column4: Kita tidak bisa mendiamkan hal ini terus.{nl} Kita sudah terlalu banyak bersabar.

column2: It's darker than the grass around it and has wider leaves.{nl}If you go to Luvda Cliff you'll recognize it right away.
column3: 주변의 풀보다 색이 더 짙고 잎이 넓어요.{nl}르브다 절벽에 가시면 한 눈에 확 알아보실 수 있을 거예요.
column4: Dibandingkan rumput di sekitar warnanya lebih tua dan daunnya lebih lebar.{nl} Jika pergi ke Luvda Cliff, maka kamu pasti dapat mengetahuinya dalam sekejap.

column2: I know it doesn't feel good to pollute the food, but...{nl}That is the best way in the long term.
column3: 식량을 오염시킨다는 게 조금 아깝긴 하지만..{nl}멀리 보면 이게 최선책이에요.
column4: Walaupun sedikit sayang jika mengotori persediaan makanan..{nl} tetapi kalau melihat ke depannya, ini adalah cara yang terbaik.

column2: I sure hope the ferrets won't come to steal our food again after this.{nl}It's a bit of a waste but... I hope they'll just eat it and leave us alone.
column3: 페릿도 머리가 있다면 다신 식량을 훔치러 오진 않겠죠?{nl}식량은 조금 아깝긴 하지만.. 맛있게 먹고 다신 안 왔으면 좋겠네요.
column4: Jika Ferret juga memiliki otak, maka ia tidak akan datang kembali mencuri persediaan makanan bukan?{nl} Walau persediaan makanan itu cukup sayang.. Alangkah baiknya ia tidak datang kembali setelah memakannya.

column2: Are you the Revelator who destroyed the totem?{nl}I wanted to thank you. It made me feel terrible every time I looked at it...{nl}
column3: 마족 토템을 파괴하셨다는 계시자님이시죠?{nl}정말 감사했어요. 그걸 볼 때마다 마족한테 속은 게 생각나서 어찌나 분하던지..{nl}
column4: Kamu adalah Savior yang katanya telah menghancurkan totem Demon kan?{nl} Sungguh terima kasih banyak.  Setiap melihat benda itu menjadi teringat ketika ditipu oleh Demon, dan membuat hati marah rasanya..{nl}

column2: Anyway, I went to check in on the ferrets and they're still vicious.{nl}It looks like the effects of the totem haven't faded yet.{nl}
column3: 어쨌든, 혹시나 해서 페릿들을 보러 갔더니 여전히 난폭하게 굴더라고요.{nl}아무래도 토템의 여파가 남아있는가봐요.{nl}
column4: Omong-omong, sepertinya para Ferret masih saja berlaku buas ya.{nl} Sepertinya efek samping dari totem masih tersisa ya.{nl}

column2: Widas, a man from our village, said he was planning to do something...{nl}He is a talented Dievdirbys after all.{nl}
column3: 우리 마을에 위다스 아저씨가 그걸 어떻게 해보신다고 뭘 만드시던데..{nl}그래도 나름 솜씨 좋은 딥디르비시거든요.{nl}
column4: Paman Widas di desa kami, entah melakukan apa dan ia bermaksud melakukan sesuatu terhadap benda itu..{nl} Walau begitu ia adalah Dievdirbys yang memiliki kemampuan baik .{nl}

column2: Will you ask Widas if the statue is finished?
column3: 조각이 완성됬는지 위다스 아저씨께 여쭤봐 주실 수 없을까요?
column4: Maukah kamu menanyakan kepada pada Widas apakan potongannya sudah selesai atau belum?

column2: The totem is at the Banaga Forest Trail.{nl}If you really are a Revelator here with the light to save our village, getting the ferrets back to normal should be within your power.{nl}
column3: 그 토템은 바나가 숲길에 있어요.{nl}당신이 정말 빛과 함께 마을을 구하러 온 계시자라면 페릿 부족 역시 되돌릴 수 있을 거예요.{nl}
column4: Totem itu ada di Banaga Forest Trail.{nl} Jika kamu adalah seorang Savior yang datang menyelamatkan desa dengan cahaya, pasti kamu bisa mengembalikan para Ferret ke semula.{nl}

column2: If you can prove that you are a Revelator, I will tell you about Leja.
column3: 당신이 계시자라는 것만 확실하게 밝혀지면 레야가 어디로 갔는지 알려주겠어요.
column4: Jika sudah jelas diketahui bahwa kamu adalah Savior, maka akan kuberitahu kemana Leja pergi tadi.

column2: Oh, that? I'm so sorry about that.{nl}It's not the first time it happened, now it seems they're finding other people to bother.{nl}
column3: 아아, 그거요? 이거 참 미안합니다.{nl}고 녀석이 맨날 물어보더니만, 이젠 민망한지 다른 사람까지 귀찮게 하네요.{nl}
column4: Ahh, Hal itu? Sungguh maaf sekali ya.{nl} Ia selalu menanyakan hal itu setiap hari, Sekarang sungguh mulai memalukan dan mengganggu orang ya.{nl}

column2: Just a moment.{nl}I'll give it to you right away.
column3: 잠시만요. {nl}금방 내 드릴게요.
column4: Sebentar ya. {nl} Akan segera kuberikan.

column2: When I was little the ferrets would help us get back to the village whenever we got lost.{nl}But now we've been fooled by the demons... It's a shame.
column3: 어릴 땐 숲에서 길을 잃어도 페릿 부족이 마을까지 데려다 줬었어요.{nl}이게 다 저희가 마족에게 속아서.. 정말 미안하죠.
column4: Pada saat kecil, ketika kehilangan jalan di hutan, para ferret membantu mengarahkan jalan sampai ke desa.{nl} Ini semua karena kami tertipu oleh demon.. Maaf ya.

column2: I made something based on the totem I built for that filthy demon.{nl}I made it so that it radiates good instead of evil energy.{nl}
column3: 안 그래도 예전에 그 몹쓸 마족이 시킨 토템 작업을 토대로 만들어 본 게 있습니다.{nl}사악한 기운 대신 선한 기운을 내뿜도록 설계했지요.{nl}
column4: Walau tidak begitu, dulu kami membuat totem sesuai perintah yang diberikan oleh demon yang jahat.{nl} Maka dari itu aku telah mendesign agar muncul energi yang baik sebagai lawan dari energi jahat.{nl}

column2: It's still only in testing phase, but it'll be worth something.{nl}Place this near the ferrets and watch their reaction.
column3: 아직 실험 단계이긴 하지만, 그래도 시험해 볼 가치는 있어요.{nl}이걸 페릿 근처에 세워 두고 반응을 살펴봐주세요.
column4: Walaupun masih dalam tahap pengetesan, tetapi cukup layak untuk dicoba.{nl} Mari coba amati reaksi Ferret, jika kamu menaruh benda ini di sekitarnya.

column2: This is all our fault.{nl}We should have been more suspicious, but the name of Revelator got us hopeful.{nl}
column3: 이게 다 우리들의 잘못이죠.{nl}한 번 의심을 해봤어야 했는데, 계시자란 이름에 너무 들떴었나봐요.{nl}
column4: Ini semua adalah kesalahan kita semua kan.{nl} Seharusnya kita curiga waktu itu, ia terlalu menggemborkan nama Savior.{nl}

column2: I wish this statue could bring peace between us and the ferrets.
column3: 이 조각상이 페릿과 우리에게 평화를 가져다 주었으면 좋겠습니다.
column4: Alangkah baiknya jika statue ini membawa kedamaian bagi kita dan Ferret.

column2: The ferrets are more violent?{nl}So I failed...?{nl}
column3: 페릿이 더 난폭해졌다고요?{nl}이런, 실패인가..{nl}
column4: Ferret menjadi lebih buas katamu?{nl}Ini, kegagalan kah..{nl}

column2: I'm so sorry. Are you sure you're not hurt?{nl}Ah... But I'm not going to quit.{nl}
column3: 정말 미안합니다. 혹시 다치진 않으셨나요?{nl}아.. 그렇다고 해서 포기하진 않을 겁니다.{nl}
column4: Sungguh maaf sekali. Apakah kamu terluka?{nl}Ah.. Karena kamu berkata begitu, maka saya tidak akan menyerah.{nl}

column2: They're probably still brainwashed by the demons.{nl}We should ask Benes when he comes back from studying the ferrets in Zeraha.
column3: 아직 마족의 세뇌가 풀리지 않아서일 거예요.{nl}아무래도 제라하에서 페릿을 연구하고 있는 베네스가 돌아오면 도움을 좀 받아야겠네요.
column4: Sepertinya pengaruh cuci otak dari Demon masih berpengaruh.{nl} Bagaimanapun sepertinya kita harus mendapatkan bantuan dari Benes yang melakukan penelitian akan Ferret di Zeraha.

column2: Revelator, you're late!
column3: 계시자님, 늦으셨네요!{nl}
column4: Tuan Savior, kamu telah terlambat!{nl}

column2: Oh... I didn't know.{nl}I'm so sorry. I've talked to our village chief about it countless times but...
column3: 아.. 그런 일이 있었군요.{nl}정말 죄송해요. 제가 촌장님께 제발 그러지 말라고 끝까지 당부하고 왔는데..
column4: Ah.. Ada hal yang seperti itu terjadi ya.{nl} Sungguh maaf sekali. Saya sudah meminta tolong kepada mayor agar tidak melakukan itu, dan untuk memintanya sampai akhir..

column2: What?{nl}You mean the girl could have been sent by Goddess Laima?{nl}I saw her running away from the ferrets to the Broken Bridge!{nl}
column3: 네? {nl}그 소녀가 라이마 여신께서 준비한 인도자일지도 모른다고요?{nl}아까 페릿에게 쫓겨서 끊어진 다리 쪽으로 도망갔어요!{nl}
column4: Ya? {nl} Kau berkata tidak tahu apakah gadis itu adalah seorang pemandu yang disiapkan oleh Goddess Laima?{nl} Tadi ia dikejar oleh Ferret, dan melarikan diri ke arah Broken Bridge!{nl}

column2: I wanted to chase after them but...{nl}The ferrets were so many, there was nothing I could do.{nl}
column3: 저도 쫓아가려고 했는데..{nl}페릿들이 극성이라서 따라갈 수가 없었어요.{nl}
column4: Saya juga bermaksud mengejarnya..{nl} Tetapi para Ferret sungguh agresif sehingga saya tidak dapat mengikutinya.{nl}

column2: We have no time to waste.{nl}We can still find the girl if we go after the ferrets now!
column3: 이러고 있을 때가 아니에요.{nl}아직 페릿들을 쫓아가면 소녀를 찾을 수 있을 거예요!
column4: Sekarang bukan saatnya untuk melakukan hal ini.{nl} Jika masih mengejar para ferret, maka kamu juga dapat menemukan gadis itu!

column2: I should have gone after them...{nl}I'm so worried now. I hope she's okay...
column3: 어떻게든 따라갔어야 했는데..{nl}너무 걱정돼요. 무사해야 할 텐데요..
column4: Bagaimana pun seharusnya sudah mengikutinya..{nl} tetapi  terlalu mengkhawatirkan. Ia seharusnya selamat..

column2: Demon Lord Zaura took the girl?{nl}Oh no... Zaura is the one who had Goddess Lada taken away by demons in the past.
column3: 소녀가 마군주 자우라에게 납치되었다고요?{nl}큰일이네.. 자우라는 예전에도 마족들을 이끌고 라다 여신을 납치했었어요.
column4: Gadis itu diculik oleh Demon Lord Zaura katamu?{nl}Sungguh masalah besar ya.. Zaura dulu memimpin para demon dan menculik Goddess Lada.

column2: Be careful when you collect Drowsy Herbs. {nl}There's a reason why they call them that.
column3: 몽롱초를 채집할 땐 조심해야 해요.{nl}이름이 괜히 몽롱초가 아니거든요.
column4: Ketika mengumpulkan drowsy herb, harus berhati-hati.{nl} Nama itu memiliki arti yang sebenarnya.

column2: Oh, right.{nl}When Zaura took the girl, did you see any ferrets around?{nl}
column3: 아, 그렇지.{nl}자우라가 소녀를 납치할 때, 혹시 근처에 페릿들이 있었나요?{nl}
column4: Ah, begitu ya.{nl} Ketika Zaura menculik gadis itu, apakah mungkin ada para ferret di sekitarnya?{nl}

column2: That means the ferrets are keeping the girl.{nl}They know the forest well, you see.{nl}
column3: 그렇다면 분명 페릿에게 소녀를 맡겼을 거예요.{nl}이 숲 속은 페릿이 더 잘 알테니까요.{nl}
column4: Kalau begitu sudah jelas, gadis itu pasti dititipkan kepada Ferret.{nl} Karena Ferret sangat mengenal hutan ini dengan baik.{nl}

column2: I mean, I was born and raised here so I'm not clueless either.{nl}I think... I can guess where they're hiding her.{nl}
column3: 하지만 저도 이 숲에서 나고 자랐기 때문에 페릿만큼 숲을 잘 알죠.{nl}대충 어디에 숨겨놨을지.. 감이 오는 것 같아요.{nl}
column4: Tetapi karena saya juga besar di hutan ini, maka saya tahu akan hutan seperti Ferret juga.{nl} Kira-kira mereka bersembunyi dimana ya.. Sepertinya saya ada gambaran.{nl}

column2: It's too dangerous to just go out to save her without a plan, though.{nl}Things could get ugly if they start attacking.{nl}
column3: 하지만 무작정 구하러 들어가는 건 너무 위험해요.{nl}아무리 페릿들이라도 떼로 몰려오면 위협적이라고요.{nl}
column4: Tetapi terlalu berbahaya jika masuk untuk menyelamatkan secara membabi buta.{nl} Walaupun hanya Ferret, jika mereka menyerang secara berkelompok akan berbahaya.{nl}

column2: Right. I know a scent that makes ferrets lose their minds.{nl}Will you bring me some Drowsy Herbs so I can make some?
column3: 그렇지. 제가 페릿이 정신을 못차리게 하는 향을 만들 줄 알아요.{nl}향을 만들 준비를 할 테니 여기 아래쪽에서 몽롱초를 구해 주시겠어요?
column4: Begitulah. Saya tahu cara untuk membuat wewangian agar Ferret tidak dapat sadarkan diri.{nl} Karena Aku akan bersiap untuk membuat wewangian itu, maka maukah kamu mengumpulkan drowsy herb yang ada di bawah sini?

column2: This should be enough to make the scent.{nl}Hold on a minute.
column3: 이 정도 양이면 향을 만들기에 충분할 거예요.{nl}잠시만 기다려주세요.
column4: Jika sebanyak ini, maka akan cukup untuk membuat wewangian.{nl} Cobalah tunggu sebentar.

column2: Don't worry if you accidentally get a whiff of the herbs.{nl}I made sure it only affects ferrets.
column3: 계시자님이 향을 맡으면 어떡하나 걱정하실 필요는 없어요.{nl}페릿에게만 확실하게 효과가 있도록 만들었으니까요.
